text: This place was horrible. Service was absolutely terrible. Forgot my sons drink, appetizer, salad,.... People around us that got there after us had their food. Told us they lost our ticket. Just paid for the drinks and walked away. Will never be back.

name: Ristorante L
attributes: {'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '3', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BYOBCorkage': "'yes_corkage'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': True, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'HasTV': 'True', 'Corkage': 'True', 'HappyHour': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Food, Italian
text: First impression, great atmosphere and design layout. I love their over sized wavy wood lamps hanging from the ceiling. I had lunch and did their $15 3 course special and it was alright, the salad was very light &plain, the duck confetti gnocchi was excellent and the desert was dry and really tart. Also our service was really slow. I would like to give this place a second chance but only go back when I have some extra money to blow because it is pricey.

name: Ristorante L
attributes: {'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '3', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BYOBCorkage': "'yes_corkage'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': True, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'HasTV': 'True', 'Corkage': 'True', 'HappyHour': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Food, Italian
text:
I've mostly been to happy hour so keep in mind my review will be happy hour leaning. 
The food and drinks are at a great price. Some dishes are definitely on the light side, even for small plate, while others are huge (ahem, pizza). The risotto ball type dish is not to be missed, and is perfectly proportioned given how rich it is. 
Finding seating is the most challenging portion of my happy hour experience but if you are willing to stick it out you will be rewarded. Did I mention that happy hour goes until 7.30 pm 7 days a week?!

text: Skip Laudisio.  While the atmosphere and decor were nice, the hostesses were rude, our waitress did the absolute bare minimum, the food was nothing special and for such a hyped up happy hour, the drink menu was pathetic.   This place was a serious disappointment.

name: Ristorante L
attributes: {'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '3', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BYOBCorkage': "'yes_corkage'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': True, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'HasTV': 'True', 'Corkage': 'True', 'HappyHour': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Food, Italian
text:
My husband and I tried Laudisio for the first time last night.  We probably would have never set foot in it if it weren't for the fact my husband received an $80 gift card from work for this place.  After our meal, we decided he'll be giving any more gift cards for Laudisio away.  The menu reads incredibly well but it would be generous to say the execution is below average.

Overall, the one word I will use to sum up the food is "bland". We ordered the Anitpasti Misti as an appetizer and I honestly feel you can go to any local grocer and purchase better salami and marinated artichoke hearts.  My husband also stated the tomato caprese salad was no where near as good as the one I make at home (and I am just a stay at home mom with no formal culinary training).  It wasn't even a caprese salad, just a slab of tomato on a basil leaf on a slab of mediocre mozzarella.  No oil, vinegar, etc!  

After I tasted the appetizer I followed my usual rules when ordering food at a new restaurant that does not appear to employ chefs who know how to cook (no seafood, meat, and just basic food a 12 year old could make edible).  I went with the gnocchi with cream sauce and vegetables; my husband was not as wise in his decision.  My gnocchi was as expected, totally tasteless.  All you could taste was the starch flavor of the gnocchi.  I had the food runner put a decent amount of parmesan cheese and I added some salt and pepper.  This helped a little.  The vegetables were cooked well; that is the only compliment I can offer this dish.

My husband ordered what I can only describe as a bowl of sea creatures in tomato broth.  Antica Roma on Pearl St has a similar dish and it is exceptional; it happens to be my favorite meal at Antica Roma.  Laudisio's version appeared to use seafood that was on the edge of going bad (I had one bite and it was incredibly fishy).  The good thing was they overcooked the fish so much, you don't have to worry about getting sick from the seafood being bad.  The down side was the scallops and squid were too tough to chew on, imagine pencil eraser.  My husband stopped eating half way through when he ate one more overcooked and expired scallop and felt he was probably going to be sick.

We finished our meal by ordering the mini dessert trio; thinking no one could possible screw up dessert.  Somehow, Laudisio found a way to make tiramisu and chocolate mousse bland.  The mousse was not even a mousse, it was far too dense to be mousse but too light to be a fudge.  It also lacked any real chocolate depth; it managed to be chocolate without the wonderful mouthfeel/richness of chocolate.  The tiramisu was the worst I have ever had.  It was bland custard (I don't even think they added sugar or vanilla to it) with one layer of lady fingers that were soaked in the weakest espresso imaginable.  It also did not help that there was a 1/4 inch layer of bitter cocoa powder on the top.  I know you are supposed to top tiramisu with cocoa powder, but this was too much.  The key lime part of the dessert was average but nothing I would order again; I can't say anything bad about that portion.

Save your money and go spend it at Antica Roma.

categories: Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Food, Italian
text:
4.5 stars for Laudisio Ristorante

When my kids were in young, their school often chose to throw dinner parties at their old location.  Also, my parents liked it and took us all out to dinner there in the other location several times.  And way back then was my last experience of Laudisio until yesterday.

Remembering that several friends had recommended the 3-course prix fix (yes I know I have not succeeded in correctly spelling it!!) lunch I  decided that would be a good thing to try.  So I decided to go there for lunch.  Well, I suppose I run a bit late for lunch these days;  lunch had been over for 30 minutes by the time I arrived.  The staff there was friendly and explained the options..there was a special menu for the time in between lunch and happy hour.   I noticed a few things that might work for me on that menu, so I sat out on their nice cool shady patio with some fresh-brewed ice tea and the menu.

The eggplant parmigiana I ordered was beyond excellent.  If you're not into massive amounts of cheese, though, do let your waitperson know in advance.  They are quite generous with the cheese.  I was in the mood for it, so all was well!   Also, there's an equally generous green salad one can order with a meal for $3.50 that is all locally grown organic veggies and a real treat.   So my lunch was lovely.   

I will be back.  And I wouldn't mind going during their quiet time again.  I've come to like peaceful, quiet times at restaurants.

name: Ristorante L
attributes: {'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '3', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BYOBCorkage': "'yes_corkage'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': True, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'HasTV': 'True', 'Corkage': 'True', 'HappyHour': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Food, Italian
text: While this restaurant has solid happy hour specials and an equally good dinner menu, I can't help but note that Ristorante L has been steadily declining in both quality and ESPECIALLY service in recent months.  When it was named Laudisios, I was always met with both friendly & attentive service. However recent experiences have left much to be desired, especially from one server in particular. During my last experience there this particular server (Victoria) was not only rude, but ignored us most of the night because she was too busy yelling and berating other coworkers right in front of our table, with no "filter" as far as language is concerned.  However when she was done with pouring herself a few drinks and checking her phone she did finally see fit to look in on us... Luckily the other server (who she was berating earlier no less!), was nice and professional enough to pick up the slack and we made sure that SHE was compensated accordingly, not our rude waitress. Alas this is the las time I will be visiting Ristorante L because I don't know if its worth the killer happy hour to put up with service that decides to use the place as their own personal bar and lounge rather than a business and place of work.

name: Ristorante L
attributes: {'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '3', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BYOBCorkage': "'yes_corkage'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': True, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'HasTV': 'True', 'Corkage': 'True', 'HappyHour': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Food, Italian
text:
I'm basing this on a few Happy Hour experiences only.

The prices can't be beat for happy hour.  Lamb sausage, buffalo carpaccio, arancini, are all good and tasty.  The carpaccio $3 was a bit skimpy--3 1/2 dollar sized paper thin slices, but tasty. My favorite is the generous, thin crust Pizza Bianca.  Simple and flavorful, and big enough to share without being stingy. Probably the best priced happy hour item.

I've had the Lemon Drop Martini which was utterly forgettable and not very lemony.

Service is....chaotic and unorganized.  With at least 2, maybe 3 waitresses asking our table of three for our drink orders.  But hey maybe that's just the nature of happy hour.

categories: Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Food, Italian
text: The service spoiled the meal entirely.  We waited almost 15 minutes before the waitress slapped down the specials and took our drink orders.  Then we waited again to place our orders and for the drinks.  The bread served by the bus boy was prompt and refilled, everything else was extremely slow.   The price was too high and the service completely disappointing.

name: Ristorante L
attributes: {'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '3', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BYOBCorkage': "'yes_corkage'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': True, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'HasTV': 'True', 'Corkage': 'True', 'HappyHour': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Food, Italian
text: We were here for a birthday gathering last night. We arrived around 4 pm for happy hour drinks and appetizers. The atmosphere is nice, the decor is upscale/trendy. We sat for several minutes before we were offered water. I ordered the house white wine which was good and my wife had water.  Our companions ordered the house red and it was not bad. If you are vegan don't waste your time at Laudisio.  After reviewing the happy hour menu our options were some slices of tomato or some olives.  I asked what was/could be made vegan and they brought me a "vegan menu" which had literally 5 or 6  things on it but mostly it was pasta with some vegetables for like 16 dollars or a margherita pizza without the cheese, so basically some overdone crust with very little marinara sauce and 10 shreds of basil, it was so dry and hard that our 8 month old daughter used it for teething, no joke. The waitress was rude rude rude.  She treated my wife terribly and we will not be going back.

categories: Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Food, Italian
text: Okay Italian food.  Good deal if you go for the prix-fixe meal at lunch ($15 for 3 courses).  Nice interior and service was good except for the cream that came with the coffee (it was old and coagulated when I put it in the coffee).  Most people seem to be complaining about the yuppie atmosphere.  This is definitely not a college hang-out and for that, I am grateful.  More of a special date night place.  If you want good Italian food, try Radda.

text:
Always fantastic.  I feel like sometimes this restaurant is overlooked because it is located on 29th street instead of Pearl, which is unfair because it is far-and-away better than most of the restaurants on Pearl.

The service is always prompt, and the staff is knowledgable about each and every dish, as well as the drink list.

The menu changes frequently enough that you won't get tired of it, and they are always sure to keep some of the more popular items for the regulars.

text:
The food is Modern Italian with some unique choices, but it's very heavy and rich with a lot of cream sauces. I've never had a bad meal there, but the fact that it's so overpriced deters me from going back there unless I have to. 

The waitstaff is always kind and it's convenient that you can get dinner there before seeing a movie, but overall, nothing special

attributes: {'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '3', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BYOBCorkage': "'yes_corkage'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': True, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'HasTV': 'True', 'Corkage': 'True', 'HappyHour': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Food, Italian
text:
I would prefer to give Laudisio 3.5 stars, but I just can't muster a 4 star rating for this restaurant as I feel it would muddy the other quality 4 star reviews I've given.

I came here with a group of coworkers for a company dinner.  The layout is beautiful.  There's a long, sleek, curving bar area and a nice space in the back of the restaurant for larger parties (including sliding glass doors if you want to drown out the drunken bar crowd).  Our server was new, so he was understandably not as familiar with the menu.  But he tried his best and I certainly wasn't disappointed with the service.

As far as the food goes, it was good, but I can't say I was terribly impressed.  I ordered the filet with lobster tail and a risotto Milanese.  The filet was cooked nicely, but the risotto probably could have used a few additional minutes.  I think what was most disparaging was the sick feeling I got in my stomach after eating the risotto.  As an absolute sucker for the stuff, the experience made me sad.

When I heard this place was owned by the same people who run The Mediterranean Restaurant, I was excited to try it.  But for the price, there is a slight lacking in the quality and technical perfection of the food.  I've certainly experienced better in the world of fine dining.  I think this place might be better suited for a fancy, after work, happy hour.

name: Ristorante L
attributes: {'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '3', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BYOBCorkage': "'yes_corkage'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': True, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'HasTV': 'True', 'Corkage': 'True', 'HappyHour': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Food, Italian
text:
My boyfriend and I stopped at Laudisio for lunch. The place was pretty empty when we first went in (around 12:45 PM), but we had to awkwardly stand by the hostess podium until someone noticed that we wanted to be seated. Once we were seated, a busboy plopped some bread on our table and filled our water glasses without so much as a grunt of acknowledgment.

I ordered the mixed green salad with the balsamic vinaigrette and that was pretty tasty, bright and fresh with a nice dressing. The pasta dishes we ordered (spaghettini pomodoro e basilico and spaghettini puttanesca), however, were a complete disaster. The spaghetti in both my boyfriend and my dishes was swimming in water, rendering the already rather bland tomato sauce even blander. We called our waitress over and asked her if the chef could cook the pasta in the sauce and she replied that she would ask him to "re-toss" the noodles. Another waiter came back with our dishes and brought along some extra tomato sauce on the side. We didn't see our original waitress again until she brought the check at the end of our meal.

At that point, we just ate our very mediocre, still watery pasta, paid the check and left. I don't understand the five star reviews of that others have left for Laudisio. Seriously, what Italian restaurant that bills itself as a "authentic Italian restaurant" doesn't know to cook pasta in the actual sauce?

Even if the food had been a little better, I would never think about going back here again because of the awful service.

attributes: {'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '3', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BYOBCorkage': "'yes_corkage'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': True, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'HasTV': 'True', 'Corkage': 'True', 'HappyHour': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Food, Italian
text:
Went to Laudisio for dinner on Mother's Day 2011.  We sat outside on the patio, which is pretty nice and has a view of the mountains.

We ordered a cheese plate for our appetizer.  It was a selection of 3 local cheeses, all of which were pretty good, even though it was pricey at 13 dollars.

The real issues began after we finished the bread and appetizer.  We waited over an hour for our pasta dishes, without ever being told what the holdup was or being offered anything while we waited.

When we did receive the food, it was pretty average (Spaghettini Carbonara and the Gnochi).  For the price I would have to say the meal was disappointing.

Note:  We did get our meal comped as an apology for waiting so long, which didn't improve our experience much.

name: Ristorante L
attributes: {'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '3', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BYOBCorkage': "'yes_corkage'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': True, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'HasTV': 'True', 'Corkage': 'True', 'HappyHour': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Food, Italian
text: L is a pretty decent Italian restaurant. After three visits nothing I have had here has been exceptional, and nothing has been bad either. The service (like most service in Boulder) is pretty much amateur hour, but they are friendly and have put up with the few special requests I have made. Pretty decent Italian-centric wine list that needs some up to date American offerings to round it out.

name: Ristorante L
attributes: {'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '3', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BYOBCorkage': "'yes_corkage'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': True, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'HasTV': 'True', 'Corkage': 'True', 'HappyHour': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Food, Italian
text: I had a fabulous time at Laudisio on Thursday night.  It was the perfect spot for a second date--causally upscale, not too loud, and with soft lighting and attractive surroundings.  My date and I ordered a fabulous bottle of wine from the extensive wine list and took our time looking through all the yummy options on the menu.  The special gluten-free menu and bread sticks were especially appreciated by my date.  I settled on the grilled scallops which were served over asparagus with mashed potatoes, morel mushrooms, and pieces of a tasty fern.  We were too engaged in good conversation that I didn't ask my date how his pork loin was, but he polished it off so I think it met his satisfaction!  The presentation of both dishes was very nice.  Our server was very knowledgeable about the wine and food and had impeccable timing.  It is a little pricey in the dining room but you get great food and service.

name: Ristorante L
attributes: {'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '3', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BYOBCorkage': "'yes_corkage'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': True, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'HasTV': 'True', 'Corkage': 'True', 'HappyHour': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Food, Italian
text: I went there this week for a business dinner.  The service was lousy.  The guy refilling the waters was more attentive then our young hipped out too cool for school server was.  At a table of 8 people, when you only bring one bread basket with 5 pieces and we ask for more we shouldn't have to ask three times.  When two of us order a second beer and you only bring one we shouldn't have to ask where the second one is.  Oh, and you probably thought you had the tip in the bag since it was obvious we were there on business.  That doesn't mean you can disappear after we get our food and not reappear until we're done.  And what happened to asking if we would like coffee r dessert?  We would have definitely stayed longer and spent more money.  On to the food.  Spinach salad was tasty. My pasta dish was just OK.  The homemade pasta was good.  It was advertised that it came with lobster and shrimp.  That meant that it came with one piece of claw meat, a few other tiny pieces of lobster meat mixed in and the tiniest shrimp I've ever had.  Way overpriced for what was in the dish.  I will not be bringing visiting co-workers there again. because of the horrible service.  Maybe Laudisio's should actually train their wait staff or here's something, hire experienced wait staff.

name: Ristorante L
attributes: {'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '3', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BYOBCorkage': "'yes_corkage'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': True, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'HasTV': 'True', 'Corkage': 'True', 'HappyHour': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Food, Italian
text: The coolest part of Laudisio's is the interior decorating in the bathrooms.  I definitely want that sink in my bathroom at my house (the urinal would be cool too).  Prices for appetizers are good during happy hour, that is if you can find a waitress to serve you.  The staff is pretentious and uninterested in doing their jobs.  Is it really a privilege for me to be served at a lame restaurant?  Food is really mediocre, hence the cheap prices relative to the dough that they ponied up for the decorations and the location.  But, one extra star because they have good, cold beer.

categories: Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Food, Italian
text:
We went here for lunch, all I can say is YAWN.
Mediocre food,
   I had the lamb sandwich, & all I have to say is that it was poorly constructed, with apparently no thought into how the ingredients would compliment the anorexic dry portion of lamb, instead the flavors almost seemed to downplay the flavor of lamb, I keep asking myself why? Does the chef hate lamb? 
    On top of that the fries were so old & dry that my 3 year old daughter, who is a self proclaimed fry princess, gave it a thumbs down and didn't even bother trying to eat any after tasting a couple.
   My wife had the 4 seasons pizza, it was lackluster. 
I could have made a better one out of some store bought tortillas, salt, herbs, olive oil, some bottled sauce, and cheese.
I left thinking "im affamato"

categories: Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Food, Italian
text: I really love going here because it's the only place I can find that comes even close to what you get back home in Europe. Their pizza is super authentic! And coffee too...Not sure why so many people gave bad reviews...I noticed throughout my time that people here tend to review restaurants more by their service than their food....coming from Europe you'd probably never eat anywhere if that's what you went by. But also...I've never had bad service at Laudisio. It's always been a great experience and great food for me.

name: Ristorante L
attributes: {'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '3', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BYOBCorkage': "'yes_corkage'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': True, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'HasTV': 'True', 'Corkage': 'True', 'HappyHour': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Food, Italian
text:
Laudisio is a incredible and wonderful modern Italian Dining Expierence.  It is worth every penny.

Wow, I cannot believe the poor reviews on Laudisio.  I have been dining at Laudisio for years, well before they moved to their new/current location.  Laudisio is in the Peoples Republic of Boulder, and as such you pay a price for the beauty, the decor, the ambiance, and the greenbelt that defines the mixture of cultures that embodies Boulder... 

A lot of people rag on the 29th street mall, it is in a way representative of the rest of America and takes away some of the uniqueness that Boulder shopping once had, it first of all competes with Pearl Street for outdoor shopping, which I don't think is a valid complaint because it can never truly compete with Pearl Street as Pearl Street is what this mall is inherently trying to COPY.   The largest valid complaint is that the area brought Home Depot to town which directly competes with Muguckins.  Ok, i get these complaints about the new mall, but it is such an improvement to the dilapidated junk of a mall that sat there languishing in red legal tape for almost two decades.

On the movie theater front... Boulder hasn't had a decent movie theater ever, now it does! 

Laudisio is up there with Le Cirque and Circo in the Bellagio.  The food is that good.  The wait-staff, many of whom have worked at Laudisio for ten years or more provides outstanding service.

Don't listen to the negative detractions of the other reviewers.

Take your $30, go to Laudisio, and prepare for a memorable dining experience!

name: Boulder Nail
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}"}
categories: Beauty & Spas, Nail Salons
text:
A new state and a new hunt for a nail salon. First stop, Boulder Nails. It's certainly got the name going for it! 

I dropped in yesterday for a much needed pedicure to kick off summer. At this point it's hard to say how it will hold up. I have certain standards for nail work based on price. So at $18 (which doesn't include callas removed - that's another $3) I expect solid cuticle work and color that lasts almost 2 weeks. If this newbie pedi job stands the test of time, it might be worth risking those semi uncleanly salon tools again... but me thinks not.

I've always been a stickler for nail salons that CLEAN THEIR TOOLS. Something about barbicide just helps me sleep at night. So even if they don't do a great job, even if it's not a fresh cuticle cutter straight out of a sterile pack, at least make some effort to clean your tools between customers. In fact, its even acceptable if you attempt to trick me into believing you cleaned the cheddar off that toe pick before you attacked my right foot. *cringes in horror*

Aside from my qualms with the cleanliness of the tools I can say that my technician was pretty aggressive cleaning under my nails (partially my fault because I've been getting dirty outside a lot lately) and they didn't clean the foot tubs between customers (again, please at least attempt to trick me).

I'll pass on this place in my next adventure. I like to get a little nutty, but if I break out with plantar warts I will know who to blame.

So, one star for the name and one star for....... to be honest the second star is for charity. Wait, parking, the other star can be for parking (sorry charity).

name: Boulder Nail
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}"}
categories: Beauty & Spas, Nail Salons
text:
Boulder Nail is definitely the cheapest nail salon in town, but you sure do get what you pay for!  They don't disinfect their tools.  They don't clean out the foot tubs between customers.  All their nail polishes are old and goopy.  They barely give you ANY massage on legs and hands during mani-pedis.  They re-dip the sticks into the same pot of wax when you get waxing services (even brazilian waxes, which is totally gross!).  And while the technicians are all very nice, they don't clean up the polish off your cuticles very well and they don't cover the entire nail with the top coat.  

I'm totally grossed out and am just really hoping they didn't give me some nasty infection or fungus from their lack of cleanliness.  I will not be returning there.

name: Boulder Nail
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}"}

text: It's hard to write a review about this place because I never actually got my nails done.. Without warning I sat for 40 minutes in the pedicure chair with my two sisters in water without being helped. Not only this, but someone else walked in, yes only for a fill in. But she should have to wait just like me! She was immediately helped so that is when we decided to walk out.. We will never be back!! It would have been okay if they would have told me I would be waiting so long! Bad customer service

name: Boulder Nail
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}"}
categories: Beauty & Spas, Nail Salons
text: Went here for a pedicure. I did not have an appointment and there was about a 5 minute wait. No biggie.  My biggest complaint is that I was charged extra for the scrub on the bottom of your feet (isn't that standard when getting a pedicure) and also, the technician did NOT put any lotion on my legs and feet.  She was very distracted on her cell phone and kept leaving me to take her personal calls.  So annoying!  I will not go here ever again for a pedicure.  The only other time that I've had a good experience here is having a gel manicure with "Linda".  She truly is the best and I don't know why she's at this salon.  Overall experience.. meh.  Also, my pedicure was $27.00.  No lotion, no massage... hardly worth it.

text: I think if I found I had one day to live, I would come here.  Everything is incredible.  The German chocolate cake will change your life.  We've had the apple, blueberry, cherry, strawberry / rhubarb pies and each are awesome.  My kids like the cupcakes and cookies and little treats.  We had the chocolate cream pie and the Raspberry cream cheese pie last Saturday and, as expected, they were fantastic.  Staff is always helpful and you definately get a feel of a neighborhood bakery.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text: Reading all the positive reviews is what led me to Sister Honey's. It is a cute little mom and pop type bakery. When I visited they had several pies, a couple cookies, and two cupcakes available to purchase. I picked up some Snickerdoodles and a Cookies and Cream cupcake. The cookies were AMAZING! Some cookies get hard by sitting out, but these cookies were super moist. The cupcake was kinda small, and more frosting than cake, but it was tasty! I paid just over $5 for 4 cookies and a cupcake. I will remember Sister Honey's next time I have a sweet tooth!

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}

text: Everything is deliciously good!!! My favorite is the citrus burst and key lime pie. The German Chocolate cake is moist and rich. Their cupcakes have the perfect sweetness.

name: Sister Honey's

Sooooo dammmmnnn good.  

I originally tried the coconut cake and loved it.  Came back and they didn't have it that day so I ended up getting banana pineapple cake which I wasn't excited about.   It was just as good if not better.  The consistency and flavor is perfect.   

Best I've had in orlando

text: Wonderful, traditional desserts.  I've visited 4 times and gotten something different each time.  You'll be able to tell the difference in the high quality and fresh ingredients used in the desserts that you often don't find from other bakeries.

name: Sister Honey's

text: Award winning bakery indeed!!! I was searching for key lime pie in the Orlando area and read multiple reviews regarding Yvette's story.  Impressed by all the awards she won as a new baker lead me to give her sweets a try.  HANDS DOWN, Her key lime pie is the BEST! Sweet, creamy, zest filled, homemade crust goodness will keep you coming back for more!

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}

text: Found this place by accident. But it was definitely meant to be! It's about time we get something sweet and delicious in our lives. We tried the carrot cake, it was a decent size for $4.99. It was sweet but not cloying, just a perfect balance between the moist cake and the cream cheese frosting with a little bit of crunch from the walnuts. I would definitely go back so I can try her other sweet offerings!

text: There is not enough space to fill with raves about this place.  Best coconut cream pie EVER.  Well, best any-kind-of-pie EVER!  Red velvet cakes rocks too.

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text: When out of town, I always search for local restaurants and bakeries to visit. I found this gem on Yelp. It was about 20 minutes from our resort but definitely worth the drive. We got a cheesecake cupcake, red velvet cupcake, white cupcake with white icing and a yellow cupcake with chocolate icing. We also to the neapolitan cake with strawberry icing, pistachio cake, and chocolate cake with chocolate icing (there were five of us). Everything was delicious. My only criticism is that they didn't have the cupcake holders and put our cupcakes in a plastic container. When in Orlando this is definitely worth a visit.

text:
I used Yelp to find this bakery.  Thank you review writers!

I took home a sampling of what she sold: magic bar, mini-pecan pie, hummingbird cake, pumpkin ginger pound cake, pumpkin harvest pie, and soft gingersnap cookies.  Every dessert is a 5 star dessert.  They were all delicious and fresh.  I highly recommend this place!

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text: Quaint little shop, nestled between shops on a strip plaza off of Michigan. Traffic can be a pain, but it's well worth a visit for the chocolate cream pie that I enjoyed! Would go back just for that, but there are so many other desserts that I did not get to try. Went in to get one slice each for me and my boyfriend, but ended up leaving with at least six things. Love that the quiche and pie crusts are thicker than most pies. Brownie was so yummy and the everything bar was just right. My boyfriend complained that it was a bit too pricey for one slice of anything, but he didn't complain about the taste of everything. :)

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}

text: We bought a Coconut cake here for a holiday dinner. Everyone who tried it agreed, it was probably the most delicious cake we have ever had. Sister Honey delivers in a big way. I can't wait to try some of her other choices.

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text: I feel confident saying this is the best cupcake in Orlando. Fluffy, moist, rich but not too rich. The apple pie is outstanding as well, and I've heard from an expert (in my house) that the coconut cake is too. Can't wait to try everything else.

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text: OMG THIS PLACE IS SOOOOOO GOOD!  I love anything sweet and this is this best bakery in Orlando.  Blows Carlos Bakery and Gigi's out of the water!  Everything here is made from scratch and it really shows in the taste.  We discovered it off of Yelp and decided to give it a try.   So glad we did! We have been three times in the past week to try new stuff.   My favorite so far is the strawberry vanilla birthday cake and coconut cake.  Also absolutely delicious was the strawberry pie, peanut butter pie, pistachio cake, and magic bar.  Super friendly staff too!  And you can see sister honey in the back working her magic... I seriously want a selfie with her next time I go in because she has won my heart over through my stomach.  She even has all of her baking awards up on display inside for all to see.  I can see why she has them.  I will surely be requesting my birthday cake from sister honey come October.  This place rocks!

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}

text: A friend and I went to Sister Honey's on a Saturday afternoon after having lunch at a restaurant that was way below expectations.  We deserved a treat.  We found this place on Yelp and it lived up to its reviews.  We bought 2 different items each and sampled them before driving away.  All 4 were delicious!  A bit pricey but as a treat, they're worth it.

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text:
Discovered this place while searching for a good place to eat in the area. I love baking and let me tell you, this is real baking with real ingredients. Not that fake junk used in the supermarkets or other big bakeries.

I bought a vanilla and chocolate cupcake and a slice of chocolate cake. It was the best bought cake and cupcakes I've ever had.  Tastes like from scratch homemade! 

 if you are going to complain about limited availability, go across the street and buy a cake that's made to last a month on a shelf without refrigeration. Blech. Please Sister Honey, don't ever give into to a higher demand, keep up the great work!

I live on the other side of town but I will be back!!!!

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}

text: Visited here on Saturday and bought a vanilla and a chocolate cupcake!  Both were amazing.  Cake was moist and fresh, the icing was sweet and whipped.  Yum.  I am already dreaming about when I can go back!  A "must try."  They have a ton more on their menu that I will be trying soon: Pies, cakes, cookies, etc.

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text: I work right down the road from Sister Honey's and I had noticed it while on my lunch break. Well about a week ago I became curious and Googled their establishment and all of the reviews were amazing so I knew I had to go check this place out. Well today on my lunch break I had a sweet tooth so I went to Sister Honey's and let me tell you, the bakery is so quaint and clean and when you enter it smells heavenly and just looking at all the wonderful baked goodies on display will have you salivating. After much decision because EVERYTHING looked so good, I decided on a slice of Humming bird cake for me  and a double chocolate cupcake as an after dinner treat for my little girl. The gentleman behind the counter asked me did I want a fork as he was bagging  my goodies (that fork was my downfall). Well, I went back to my office and "thought" I was going to just have a little taste and save the rest for later since the cake slice was so big. OH MY GOODNESS! that first forkful was pure heaven! this cake was so moist and light and fluffy and the custard in the middle nearly made me swoon! before I knew it I had demolished the whole slice in a matter of minutes. This cake was so good! I can never look at my own mother's cake the same way again (I'm shamed) lol but it's all Sister Honey's fault, I am now spoiled and MUST try more of her delicious delicacies on my lunch break. :)

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text: Best Coconut Cream pie ever!!  All their cakes and pies are delicious.  Only thing is if you want to get a whole pie or cake you have to order it 2 days in advance, but believe me, it will be worth it!

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text:
Let's be honest, Sister Honey's doesn't need my review or my stars. However, I am confident I need her desserts! 

After a late lunch last week we drove over to Sister Honey's looking for a sweet treat. What we ended up doing was arguing with ourselves about which treat to get, to share, to not share, to consume before we even made it to the car..!

The shop is tiny and offers no seating, though I have to imagine they need the floor space for the droves of customers that bombard them during the earlier hours & weekends.

Risking a few sideways looks the TWO of us ordered: a slice of strawberry rhubarb pie, ("I've never had it. I should get that"), a slice of lemon meringue pie, ("It's so hot out maybe this will cool me down"), a slice of coconut cake, ("Yelpers said it was the best. I HAVE to!"), and a chocolate cupcake for my daughter. You know when you're placing a counter order and the cashier is SURE you're done ordering but you keep ordering and they give you that look? Yeah, pretty much.

We managed to wait to get home to crack our goodies open (I blame the lack of forks). Here's what I've learned: I am not a huge fan of rhubarb. Not that the pie was bad. I just can't get past the texture. The lemon meringue pie was a lovely tower of silky, smooth meringue and creamy, lemony velvet. Also, the coconut cake is my new best friend. The chocolate cupcake was declared amazing and I was questioned as to, "why was there only one?"

Like many have said, the shop is located in a strip mall and can easily be missed. Take along a navigator to point it out before you drive right passed!

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text: By far the best desserts I've had from any bakery! I got the peanut butter silk pie and it was perfect. It wasn't too sweet and overpowering or too "peanut buttery". I also got the mini cheesecake which was great, also. I like that the desserts are properly made and aren't overly sweet like most bakers tend to do. Everything is fresh and you can expect something different everyday. I'd like to see this business expand because they're doing everything right!

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text: I'm not going to write a long review for this place. If you like cake/pie then come here. Don't think about it for very long. It's that good! They are award winning for a reason. I honestly couldn't believe how good the food here was. The strawberry pie, might be one of the best pies in the world and I'm not joking at all.

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text:
I was excited to see a new bakery in town so I couldn't wait to try out some goodies. I bought a vanilla and double chocolate cupcake. The cupcakes were light and fluffy. The buttercream was very airy and smooth (this is how I make my buttercream so I was obviously thoroughly impressed!) and was perfectly proportioned to the actual cake. I thought the chocolate buttercream was exceptional and I'm not a huge chocolate fan. 

I also bought a chocolate chip cookie. It was buttery and semi-soft. Had a delicious homemade quality to it. 

Although I didn't get any of the pies, I did want to put my face in all of them to get a taste! They look amazing!

I wish Sister Honey's a lot of success and I will definitely be back for some pie.

text: Omg everything is so awesome here, lierally anything you get here i guaranteed you'll be back for more. Some of the most delicious cakes and pies i've ever had. The people are super friendly and nice. the german chocolate cake is greatttt! one of my favorites, its so smooth, rich and not overly sweet like everything here. I love how they know how to use the absolute perfect amount of sugar. Too much sugar can overkill any desserts and i think that is something that the sister has mastered. Bravo! can't wait to be back!

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text: Absolutely the best and most delicious sweets in all of Florida! It was a delightful find when my daughter moved to Orlando and discovered this bakery. Every time we are in town we go and bring delicious treats home. We ordered some items for my daughters baby shower and they were the hit of the celebration. Among the most delectable items are pistachio cake, hummingbird cake and coconut cake! If pies are more your style, the peanut butter and strawberry pie is phenomenal! You must give this Place a try if you love delicious home baked deliciousness!

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text: I was there last week. I ordered a whole coconut cake and a lemon pound cake as well as a sweet potato pie. The cakes were 5 out of 5. Moist and delicious. I enjoyed every bite if those cakes.  I was a little disappointed in the sweet potato pie.  It was more like a pudding inside a pie shell.  I'm wondering if it was baked enough. The favor was just OK.  Would not order the pie again. BUT the cakes, I would order again and again.  It did not bother me, but they charge you when you place the order. I placed my order 2 weeks in advance and was charged at that time. The cakes are good and I have tasted nothing better.

name: Sister Honey's

text: Their cakes are so freaking delicious, I love the red velvet cupcakes, peanut butter and chocolate pie, and the coconut cake(is what I tried so far).Her cakes are very moist,soft,but not to sweet.

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text:
I had never heard of this place when I happened to drive past.  The name intrigued me, and I pulled a quick U-turn so I could stop and investigate.

Boy, am I glad I did.

Although everything in the case looked tempting, I took one look at the huge pie-baking award up on the wall and decided that it could only be pie.

The last remaining pie of the day was peach blueberry.

I ordered a slice, which was served up by the very baker who had won said award.  I took my slice back to the car and had to try it right away.

Ye gods!

Pies DREAM of being this good.  I'm not exaggerating. This pie was one of those Platonic ideals that you only can imagine.  The crust was phenomenal, ethereal, insert your own wild adjective here.

Go there.  Right now if it's open.  Eat some pie for me.

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text: Thank you for the great birthday cake (German chocolate) for my Dad! We were all amazed at the richness and dense chocolate layers. I'm excited to try more from this shop if only to have an excuse to walk in and smell all the enticing confections!

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text:
It's been in the Orlando area for about six months now. Thank you so much to Lisa Wilks for telling me about this place.
After a great lunch with the Lunch Bunch ladies. I was craving some cupcakes (as always). Lisa told me about this place. It is located on Orange Avenue and Michigan.
I ordered the Double Chocolate Cupcake and the Very Vanilla Cupcake.
Their other yumminess is the Hummingbird Cake. It's a banana cake with cream cheese, cinnamon, and nuts. This was my favorite!!

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text: Ordered the coconut cake and the chocolate cream pie for Christmas. They were both excellent. Everybody loved them. Will definitely be ordering from here again.

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text: Cake.  Cake makes everything better.  Sister Honey's cake is outstanding!  I have now found that not only is the chocolate cream pie worth packing in ice and flying with it across country, but now I have discovered that the cake, any cake from Sister Honey's, is worth traveling across the county for.  It is the best.  I got a piece of marble cake and a coconut cream cake.  Although I've never liked flaked coconut in general, this cake is fabulous.  The moistness, coconut cream, and frosting is the complete package.  Number 1 for me is the marble cake, which has the perfect balance of chocolateiness.  Eat chocolate cream pie, cake, cake, and more cake, it's all worth it.  Everything is fresh, moist, and delicious.

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text:
We had heard about Sister Honey's after reading an article on the baking contest she won and decided to see if it was the real deal. Let me tell you that I don't know who the other bakers were but Sister Honey deserved to win. 
My grandfather and uncle were amazing cooks and bakers but they never made anything this good. I think I will coin a new phrase: Homemade, but better.
Small in stature, as far as the storefront goes, but huge in flavor and quality. You can buy large pieces of pies, cakes and assorted goodies. If you want something whole you need to put the order in 48 hours in advance. With that you just know it is fresh. Great taste. The strawberry icing tasted like strawberry ice cream. Sister Honey actually came out from back where you can see her working her genius and she looked like a mom baking in the kitchen;the kind of mom who loves what she is doing like she was baking for her kids. I think I am just gushing right now.
The quality of the ingredients can be tasted in every bite. You know what else you can taste? You can taste the love Sister Honey puts in her baking.

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text:
I purchased a Lemon Merengue pie for  my dinner party recently & it was the star of the night! My guests & family loved it and couldn't stop talking about how delicious it was. I highly recommend Sister Honeys for all your sweet tooth needs. I tried her cookies & bar confections and they are absolutely to die for!. 

Thank you for taking so much pride & professionalism in your craft!

Jim White
Orlando, FL.

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text: Amazing treats! I especially love the chocolate cupcakes with Peanut Butter frosting and a peanut butter cup on top. I'm not a big cake person, but I love these. Not too sugary, but great flavor. Pies and cookies are also very good. I'm always happy when I see the goodies come home from Sister Honey's.

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text: Solid.  5 STARS every time.  I visit Sister Honey's every chance possible.  Peanut Butter pie is one of my favorites.  This visit we had peanut butter pie, vanilla pound cake, carrot cake, coconut pie and thumbprint cookies.  The thumbprint cookies come in a pack of 4, they are well done; not too heavy and sweet with good texture.  Vanilla pound cake was a nice change from lemon pound cake.  Sister Honey's is always friendly and accommodating and always working hard throughout the day to put out fresh baked goods.  They sell whole pies/cakes or slices.  The presentation is always spot on with good quality ingredients.  I hear she is now making tiramisu, woah!

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text:
Oh, Sister Honey's...you did it again!  Recent trip had me enjoying the AMAZING coconut cream pie. Light, creamy and appropriately coconuty but not too sweet and very, very light. I will dream about this sweet treat. (pic) Hubby felt the same way about the peanut butter cup cupcake. Dark chocolate cupcake with a peanut butter buttercream frosting. Wow, great balance of flavors, the frosting was great and the cake was moist and delicious. Once again, Sister Honey's swayed my hubby to the cake side with the apple filled pound cake, apples and spices baked into a delicious butter pound cake. Again, great balance of flavors and not at all too sweet or heavy. 

I picked up some Pecan Tassies (Mini Pecan Pie Tartlets) for the holiday and they were a big hit. The flaky tarts are chocked full of pecans with a smaller amount of sweet filling to bind it, they were a much lighter alternative to a pecan pie, which is mostly sugary filling with some nuts. My family devoured every tartlet while declaring them "spectacular". 

On my trip the friendly owners were busy baking up a storm to fill orders for the Easter holiday. They had so many preorders that  I took mental note to give a week or more notice when I'll be ordering my holiday pies for the fall holidays.

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text: Oh. My. Damn. What just happened??!! This place is the best bakery HANDS DOWN that I have ever been to.  I'm almost glad I don't live here because it would become a problem for me. Super moist and flavorful. When you walk in the smell literally wafts all over you to the point you feel almost intoxicated by the sweet smells!!!! Seriously. Now, I bake....and when I say "bake", I mean on occasion individuals pay me to bake cakes for them....This lady has me beat and my desserts are pretty damn good if I do say so myself (In my Jay-Z voice). We only were in Florida for vacation and the desserts were so good, I found myself telling random people who live here about it.  Run don't walk.

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text:
Being that I was totally broke, I just went in for cookies, and, boy, were they deeelicious. Had a ginger and a snickerdoodle ($0.79 each), can't decide which I liked better. 

The ginger cookie was warm and spicy-ish, the snickerdoodle was, well, snickerdoodletastic-both had perfect cookie texture. Not too crumbly, not too soft. 

Will be back for pie. Or cake. Or both...

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text: The best bakery in all of Orlando...if your into insanely addictive cakes, pies, cupcakes and cookies. I have tried a lot of her treats and they are all delicious. You can see her in the back making everything from scratch daily. Best bakery in Orlando hands down.

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text: First time in. Referred by a client of mine and had to try my mom bakes a lot from scratch so I don't always get to have some of hers with brothers and 30 ish techs that she works with so I. Needed something close to mom's cooking! The snickerdoodle cookies are very good soft and big. A little over priced but worth it when you really want one or two or four ! Lol the German chocolate cake was moist and Delish ! Moms is better but I think I'm a little on the mommas girl side rofl! Haven't tried the red velvet cupcake yet. Over all a nice place if my mom isn't cooking

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
