text: Some of the best cupcakes in the area. Red velvet is one of the best too. Definitely will be coming here more.

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text: Hands down - THE BEST KEY LIME PIE you'll ever taste.  This bakery is everything you could want.  It's small, family owned, and all of their baked goods are made with the best ingredients.  The staff are so nice and friendly.  The owner is in fact a national champion pie maker.  I stop in here and just grab a few items from the display case however I am going to order some pies and cakes for an up coming event.  I find it hard to drive down Michigan and not stop.  Such great family business with fantastic baked goods!

name: Sister Honey's
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'quiet'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Cupcakes
text: I ordered german chocolate cake even though I am not a big fan of chocolate cake. Let me tell you it was just perfect 10. Soft moist and perfect sweetness. Melts in your mouth. I highly recommend this place for all the cake lovers and those who are not a big fan of cakes.

name: Everything POP Shopping & Dining
attributes: {'HasTV': 'False', 'Caters': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'None', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'None'}
categories: Restaurants, American (New), Food Court, Flowers & Gifts, Hotels & Travel, Gift Shops, Resorts, Shopping
text:
HECK NO!! Some of the world's lousiest food exist right here in POP dining. The only thing that's edible is their breakfast platter. Everything else, burger, pizza, pasta, is horrifying. The pizza is the worse pizza on Earth. There's barely any cheese, the pepperoni is hard, and the dough, crust is half baked. You can still see the layer of dough that has not been fully baked. The beverage and condiment stations are always a hot mess and often has flying insects hovering around certain sections of each station. 

The shopping, everything is overpriced. $10 for a small keychain. The prices are just crazy
It's to be expected but even with your Chase Disney debit card, the 10% discount only applies when you spend $50 or more. 

Verdict - Shop at a Disney store outlet. As for food, please avoid if you can. Disney dining is the most overrated crap. Don't listen to those YouTube Disney vloggers. Disney dining is garbage but probably fine cuisine for Southerners and hicks from the burbs. Most quick service meals are hot trash and I expect Disney to do better.

name: Saratoga Resort Villas
attributes: {'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Vacation Rentals, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
I stayed here with my family for the second time this year. I love the space (3 bedroom, 2 bath), and proximity to Disney. The only drawback this trip was coming home after a ten hour day at Epcot, and our key not being active any longer. I was riding with my boyfriend, so I left my ID in the room. When I went to the front desk, I was asked for ID, then chided for driving without my license. When I noted I simply drove from behind the check in area at my room's parking lot, he turned up his lip. When I asked why my key deactivated, he said probably because the person who checked me in did so for only
2 days, and not 3 days as I paid for (he was the one who checked me in). The floors made my feet dirty (either the carpet or the tiles, not sure which). They ran out of washcloths after taking ours earlier in the day. My son's pillow case kept getting removed from his pillow, the pillow we brought from home. The cleaning staff kept putting their pillow case on his pillow. I will probably stay here again, but not if I can find another hotel for the same price with as much space.

name: Saratoga Resort Villas
attributes: {'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Vacation Rentals, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
We really loved staying here and it was perfect for everything we wanted. Even with the weird customer service at the end, I'm giving it a 4 stars, for all the positives and benefits!

We love the set up of the villa especially with it being for 4 adults - Me, my hubby, my mom, and dad! We didn't have to be stuck in one hotel room. We had perfect space where we didn't have to be on top of each other. We had a downstairs open living room, dining area, small kitchen, and a bathroom with shower downstairs. The couch  even has a bed in it if one needs it.

Upstairs is two bedrooms and an adjoining bathroom with bath tub. One bedroom had two double beds and one bedroom has a king sized bed. The beds were very comfy, the sheets and comforter were cozy. Only thing was the pillows were very small.

We had a view of the creek which was nice and nature-y! The pool was nice along with two small hot tubs which were not hot. They have a park and big grassy area for our dog to play. We were not able to walk the boardwalk and gazebo which looked really nice.

At the end, customer service was weird because the person I called to extend my check out an hour didn't know we existed. He said it was because Booking.com and their system did not communicate. Also, I asked for two towels and they brought us two rolls of toilet paper. I was like What?! At least our receipt matched our quote from Booking.com. 

All in all, we loved our clean roomy villa and would recommend staying here.

name: Saratoga Resort Villas
attributes: {'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Vacation Rentals, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
Excellent accommodations! Stayed here the week of January 26th through January 30th.  2bd/2 bath townhouse; 2 levels.  It was only the hubby and myself so it was way too much space for only two people.  The kitchen came fully stocked with cooking and eating utensils and a full size fridge.  Two bedrooms upstairs with a full bath and a sofabed downstairs with another full bath; shower only. The food from the onsite restaurant ... well, it could have been better.  We ordered hot wings and shrimp alfredo.  The wings seemed to be old and were hard.  The pasta was good however. 

I will definitely visit Saratoga Resort Villas again.

name: Saratoga Resort Villas
attributes: {'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Vacation Rentals, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
We stayed here for 5 days in Feb 2016 - 2BR, 2Bath - Q bed in one, K bed in another, with 2 adults and 1 child. It's really nice to have a 2-level hotel - the kids can sleep and you can watch tv and finish dinner downstairs, and sit on the balcony. The bedrooms are spacious, and the beds are decent. The pillows are odd - 1 is not puffy enough, but 2 are too puffy. Not a dealbreaker though. 

Kitchen has set of 6-8 plates/mugs/glasses. (No wine glasses). A pan and a large pot. Utensils and a few knives, cutting board and a corkscrew. No peeler. Kitchen includes sponge, Dawn and dishwasher liquid. Target is right next door, and sells all groceries. SUPER CHEAP. We bought frozen meals to take with us to Disney, heated it up in the AM and ate it for lunch there. We came home in time to make a quick dinner. Saves so much $. 

Nice dining table, and living room. We had no issues with the place, except that the housekeeping was not that great. Towels weren't replaced, nor were toiletries until we asked a third time. Hair was on the floor, and didn't get wiped up. I think they just do a topical cleaning - wipe and vacuum and call it a day. After a day or two, it doesn't feel like you're coming back to a cleaned-up hotel room, but to your own messy home. But all in all, it was still a worthwhile place to say. Just make sure you're on the front desk about them cleaning up your room. 

The location is great. I can't believe people want to stay on the Disney property to save time or whatever. It takes an entire 10 minutes to get to Disney, and a few extra minutes to park. And you get an entire apartment to stay in. Most, if not all, of the Disney property hotels were just 1-roomers, and cost upwards of $350 a night. We found a Groupon for this place, which made it very cheap. So look for that. 

Um, be aware that the "lake" is a big pond, and you're really not going to be walking around it much. It's a nice touch but not anything to write home about. The photos on the hotel website seem accurate. We had carpeting in our living room, not tiles though. We usually like a hotel with a kitchen, and this one had a very decent one. 4 people can stay here comfortably. Maybe 5, if you put 3 kids in the King and the 2 adults in the Queen. The sofa is also firm enough that 1 person can sleep on it, if they don't move around much!

name: Saratoga Resort Villas
attributes: {'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Vacation Rentals, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: We reserved this hotel at the last minute for a one-night stay. We were so pleasantly surprised with the accommodations and amount of space; like an apartment. Also, they did a very good job with cleaning. The outside is a bit dated in appearance but you won't be disappointed. Minor suggestions: keep ice trays or ice maker in freezer so the occupant doesn't have to walk outside at night for ice. There is a lovely lake, but you might want to put up warning signs for liability to avoid snakes, gators, etc. Also a free breakfast would be a nice bonus. Thank you we had a great stay.

name: Saratoga Resort Villas
attributes: {'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Vacation Rentals, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
I wrote the review regarding two days of no housekeeping.  Well, time for an update.  The last two days, we've had housekeeping done the right way.  Everything was done to the highest standards.  The hotel's manager, Jeffrey, was very apologetic about the missed days, and he and his staff have been very nice and accommodating.  He also offered to waive the resort fees because of our inconvenience and I consider this to be very generous. 
The positives of our stay- the resort is very close to all the Disney properties as well as all shopping and eating  establishments.  The grounds are well-kept and the playground and pool a great place for my 4 year old twins to let off some steam.  The safe didn't work upon our arrival but was immediately replaced.  The internet wireless connectivity was consistently available and quick.  The suite setup was perfect for us- each of my twins had their own bed in a separate bedroom and there was a very nice living room/kitchen combination.  Temperature controls worked very well and there was sufficient hot water for two baths and two showers at all times.
When I travel back to the Orlando area in the future, I would have no reservations about staying here again.

name: Saratoga Resort Villas
attributes: {'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Vacation Rentals, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: We got here Monday and they made up the room the next day.  However, on Tuesday and Wednesday, they did not clean the room at all despite our complaining twice to the front desk on Tues and Wed morning.  We also asked them to bring back the "Do not disturb/clean room" sign for the outside door, which disappeared after the first day.  I was told that they took all the signs away.  Instead, they left a sign that said "do not disturb" on one side and "Quiet please" on the other side.  What does that tell housekeeping to do?  I obviously did not use that sign either on Tues or Wed since I found it confusing to me.  When I called the front desk at 8:30pm when I came back to my room to complain, I was told there was no one in housekeeping and no hotel manager on duty either.  I could understand no housekeeping, maybe, but no hotel manager?  I'll speak again to whoever says they are the manager and keep you all informed how this goes.

name: Saratoga Resort Villas
attributes: {'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Vacation Rentals, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: The customer service was phenomenal! All the employees we encountered were courteous professionals that offered salutations and assistance at every encounter. The villas were spacious with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, 1 kitchen, and a living room( no washer and dryer). If you are traveling with a large party the villa is a great value....but bring heavy duty cleaning supplies! The villa looked clean, but we felt dirty the whole time we were there. The pull out sofa was stained with a white substance that looked like it could have been the remnant of body fluids. The furniture was scratched and chipped. The less than polished presentation of the place made it look and feel slightly unsanitary. Once again, the villas was a great value if you are  looking for  fabulous customer service and a place big enough to sleep 6-8 people, maybe 10 if you brought your own air mattress. We paid $200 for 3 nights through "Best Vacations Ever", so we were not too terribly disappointed with the shortcomings of the villas, but we have no future intentions of returning or recommending the villas to family or friends planning inexpensive trips to Disney or Universal Studios.

name: Saratoga Resort Villas
attributes: {'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Vacation Rentals, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
Great service. We arrived to the hotel few hours before check in. My son was feeling sick and the front office accommodated us so he can rest. We ended up going to a clinic later that day.

Thank you for considering kids and checking us early! Truly appreciate your consideration!!

name: Saratoga Resort Villas
attributes: {'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Vacation Rentals, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: Loved it!  Huge villa great for our family of 4. Friendly staff. Located only 10 min from the Magic Kingdom. Only complaint - I wish the bar we're open past 10 - I could've used a drink after returning from a long day at the park!

name: Saratoga Resort Villas
attributes: {'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Vacation Rentals, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:

Wish we would have picked a better place do not stay here

name: Saratoga Resort Villas
attributes: {'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Vacation Rentals, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: Alright so after a six night stay my three star rating is actually a stretch...I'm giving three stars to the facility...the setup is very nice! We had a 2 bedroom, full kitchen, living room with two full baths...reminiscent of a townhouse.  I wish I could leave 0 stars for the service. Everyday we had to call for towels to be delivered because the 'room service/cleaning team' either didn't clean or forgot to leave things they didn't think we would need...things like toilet paper, tissues...you know the small things no one uses...oh wait lets talk about the leak under the carpet that I called about three times...the maintenance man came to look at it on day five..he said oh we will have to have someone come and break up the floor to get to the pipe to see what's going on here so I can't help you today...then there was the case of the fire alarms...two days in a town they would go off intermittently maintenance men came twice changed the batteries and guess what happened on the third time...the man said it's probably a wiring issue so he can't do anything to make it stop so he took all the smoke detectors and we all prayed there wasn't a fire the next two nights or we may die....moral of the story...no we will NOT be staying here again

name: Saratoga Resort Villas
attributes: {'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Vacation Rentals, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
I wanted to give this 4 stars but cant. 

This place is amazing. For the same price as your average hotel, you get double if not triple the space! It's like staying at a townhouse. It was beyond perfect for our group with 3 adults and 2 kids. Having a kitchen (minus an oven) came in handy often! Separate living spaces was our main criteria so when kids were napping we didn't have to tip toe around. For the price and the space on a scale of 1-10 it's a 15. 

When checking in tge front desk was awesome. I asked to check in early... no problem! How would you like to be next to the playground for your kids? Yes! Just absolutely smooth and pleasant all around. 

My only negatives were that the hotel is older and there is some wear and tear. Paint on the walls missing, weird odds and ends not quite clean, etc. Not a deal breaker as i wouldnt call it dirty. My biggest "issue" (which may only be in my room) was the hot water.... did the hot water work in the showers? Yes  upstairs. Not so much down stairs. No biggie. But it still took some maneuvering & would have been an improvement overall.

The area around the hotel has a ton of restaurants, stores, etc. We would absolutely stay here again no questions asked!

name: Saratoga Resort Villas
attributes: {'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Vacation Rentals, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: I stayed for two nights last month and had a fantastic experience. Dasie at the front desk provided exceptional customer service from the moment I arrived. My flight got in much earlier than I anticipated so when I arrived early I asked if it would be possible to get an early check-in. Unfortunately, because of spring break I was told that an early check-in would be difficult. Dasie allowed me to relax by the pool while waiting for my room. Fortunately, a room opened up earlier than expected! The villa was clean and spacious. While this isn't a Four Seasons by any means, you definitely get more than what you pay for from the room to the  accommodations.

text: I drove for 10 hours from Nashville Tennessee and the day before they had just called and confirmed my room available by 3 o'clock. After the 10 hour drive I arrived and they told me that they have no rooms available they charged my card. What kind of business is this.

text: The Staff was not very helpful at all. Only Tammy was great. She was super friendly and welcoming! I called the front desk and asked for a few towels Never received them. I waited an hour for them to arrive before I had to leave the hotel. When i returned, they had no towels for me. No towels at all. They also did not grant me the courtesy of a late checkout. I know its a courtesy but it goes a long way. Hotel room smelled of cigarettes and not from fresh cigarettes....smelled like a home with years of smoking. Other than that, the town home was okay as far as looks and had the convenience I was looking for. But i look for proper customer service first and foremost!

If I can write a review for the restaurant, it will be 1 star. I can understand rarely anyone come to the restaurant, but it's way too bad. The shrimp is cold and the steak is raw (I ordered medium-well). And there is no taste at all... 
Anyway, the resort is good, room is neat and clean. But maid server is a little rude.

name: Saratoga Resort Villas
attributes: {'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Vacation Rentals, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
Great villa in a great location, but this place was filthy.  There is a tile floor, kitchen, living room and bathroom downstairs.  The layout was great, but we were sure to wear our shoes downstairs.  When we came in, the floor was dirty.  I'm not going go go into detail about the downstairs toilet, but suffice it to say whoever used it last was not feeling well and the mess was in the bowl and on the seat.  The floor was covered with hair and brown dirt.  We called and they came by to clean it up, but in the end you could still see the dirt on the downstairs floor.  The difference was that after the cleaning our feet seemed to stick to the floor.  It was completely gross.  I think all they did was smear the dirt around a little.  The upstairs wasn't much better.  Carpets are stained and full of other people's hair and filth.

I gave them a chance to fix this, but they did a half hearted job so I'm assuming this is their cleaning standard.  There are a lot of kids staying here and it would be the perfect place for them if it were clean.  I wouldn't recommend this place and if you have kids I would certainly avoid it.  I hate to think of kids playing on these floors that are filthy with who knows what.

name: Saratoga Resort Villas
attributes: {'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Vacation Rentals, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
Let's be honest: we all know that when I travel, I don't often do hotels. I find them too spacious, too open, and definitely too expensive for my solo traveler budget. Instead, I usually opt for Airbnb rentals because they afford me more freedom and local insight, and less pain on my already-stretched checking account.

I arrived in the politely festive lobby of the Best Western Premier after a rough three days: I had been up at the crack of dawn to tour NASA, sat around in the cold Florida dawn light to watch a 'scrubbed' launch, and finally watched Orion take flight. I had been up at what my body considered prime sleeping time (between 1:00am and 3:00am Seattle time) for three mornings in a row, and done a fair amount of other fun stuff too!  All I really wanted was sleep, but heck, with a quaint lobby like this, who was I to turn down the opportunity for a great interior panorama?

The ladies at the front desk were prompt and helpful; they checked me in, acquainted me with the property via a map, and called my contact in the marketing office to come over and say hello. I gratefully collapsed into a big lounge chair with a glass of water for a quick chat before heading off to my villa. My. Villa.

I've stayed in hotel rooms and I've stayed in suites, but nothing compares to the space you get with a villa. It's basically like having your own townhouse, and you don't even have to clean it after you leave! My two-bedroom king loft villa was immaculate; I wistfully eyed the ground-floor bedroom before taking some photos, and retrieving my belongings from the rental car. I climbed the stairs to the loft, weary, and proceeded to climb straight into bed for a nap.

Waking up an alarmingly short time later, I made my way to the lobby restaurant to try and find  dinner. Over salad and delicious fresh-made pizza, I chatted with the lady bartender and a fellow guest. The restaurant was empty otherwise, so we both sat at the bar. I would imagine, being family focused, most dinners are quiet affairs since families are dining out and about; breakfast on the other hand, is probably a flurry of pre-park fueling.

I returned to my room, re-packed my bags, snuggled back into bed and eventually slipped into a blissful sleep. The bed was barely disturbed when I climbed out in the morning-in part because of my deep sleep, but also because I simply can't take up an entire king-size bed, no matter how hard I try. I showered, packed the car, grabbed a few slices of left-over pizza, and went to explore the rest of the grounds.

One of my favorite things discovered during my morning walk was the beautiful way in which this property has taken advantage of the local ecosystem-while I have no doubt that the lakes which take up major interior portions of the grounds were re-shaped by humans, they allow one to feel the sense of being near the swamps and everglades. Signs on the walkways warn about not feeding alligators, and beautiful flowers bloom on freshly-watered bushes. The morning sun was weak and winter-like, but the temperature was comfortable, and being among the trees was refreshing.

Other things I really appreciated about the Best Western Premier Saratoga Resort Villas:

- The play-park just across the street from my villa which is part of the grounds. This is perfect for families with children who don't get completely exhausted by Disney and Universal Studios.
- The pool and hot tub, which are also handicap accessible. Great detail there, and I'm sure the pool is well-loved during Florida summers.
- The kitchen setup which includes a sponge and dish soap. Too many places I've stayed remember one but not the other. Both are necessary for surviving long stays in a vacation space.

name: Cascade Restaurant
address: Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress, 1 Grand Cypress Blvd
attributes: {'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'HasTV': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': True, 'lot': True, 'valet': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'Caters': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Event Planning & Services, Hotels & Travel
text:
We were not staying at the Hyatt, and just decided to eat at this restaurant for something different.  We were not disappointed.  The restaurant is large and we would consider it to be a fine dining experience.  Our server, Beverly, was lovely and attentive to our table needs.  The entire staff served us well for dinner.

Getting into the Hyatt requires stopping at the guard house, and getting over to either the valet parking or the self parking lot, which is what we did.  Even self parking has a fee, which was waived by the restaurant host when we presented ourselves for a table.  He stamped the parking ticket for validation.

The food was good and portions were ample.  We especially enjoyed the table bread which was fresh out of the oven.  Our meals were properly served and delicious.  We felt like we were dining in luxury.  And we were!  This is certainly not a bargain restaurant, and more like an experience.  With 2 cocktails, 3 salads, and 3 entrees, the total with tax was $125.  We would consider returning for a special occasion.

attributes: {'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'HasTV': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': True, 'lot': True, 'valet': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'Caters': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Event Planning & Services, Hotels & Travel
text:
I met my friend for lunch here yesterday. A great spot to meet friends for a really great lunch.

We started out with the calamari and steak flat bread. They were both awesome. The calamari were like fat stubby french fry size, perfectly cooked, not rubbery with a crunchy coating and a delicious marianara on the side. The flat bread was super crispy and it had great flavor! It had delicious marinated thinly sliced steak with some micro greens tossed in some kind of dressing and cheese too. 

Next we had the tomato soup. It was so good. Not completely pureed but it wasn't chunky either. It was topped with a goat cheese dollop and finely minced green onions. I don't normally like goat cheese but with the tomato soup it was perfect!

For the final course we split a field greens salad and added their crab cake to it! It was mixed greens with thin sliced rainbow carrots long ways, marinated tomatoes, cucumbers. If you haven't had their crab cakes its a must! Lots of jumbo lump crab with hardly any filler. They also have a Crab cake sandwich if you want  just crab and no salad. 

The service was good. It was nice to meet the restaurant manager Jon. He stopped by and chatted with us. I really enjoy that kind of service! It shows they care!

text:
Wanted a nice brunch for the last meal we would eat in Orlando, and we decided to hit up Cascade, which is inside the hotel and tucked into this huge, posh golf resort/equestrian center.

There was a brunch buffet, but we chose to order off the brunch menu.  Since I'm a sucker for corned beef hash AND poached eggs, my meal selection was a no brainer.  Those two items came with asparagus and potatoes.  

Too bad the corned beef hash was mediocre and pasty at best.  The eggs were the weirdest poached eggs I've ever had in my life: funky texture, acidic, and sour.  Tsk tsk.

name: Cascade Restaurant
address: Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress, 1 Grand Cypress Blvd
attributes: {'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'HasTV': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': True, 'lot': True, 'valet': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'Caters': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Event Planning & Services, Hotels & Travel
text:
Went with a colleague for dinner...here is our tale...

We sat down and our server  was more than pleasant! Asking us where we were from and acting interested, it was nice. Throughout the night she was very attentive and gave us great recommendations.

We started with wine (of course!) and had the nachos. The good was that no matter what chip I got, it was LOADED with chili-cheesy goodness...the bad was that about mid way through the chili-cheesy goodness made the chip soggy. 

We then got the...
seaweed salad...great
volcano sushi roll.....freaking amazing
dumpling soup....salty
more wine...amazing
california roll....good

The manager came over to check on us and she was very nice as well. But our entire night 2.5 hours + here was just a great time and experience. And the atmosphere is also just really great!

name: Cascade Restaurant
address: Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress, 1 Grand Cypress Blvd
attributes: {'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'HasTV': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': True, 'lot': True, 'valet': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'Caters': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Event Planning & Services, Hotels & Travel
text:
Cascade on a Saturday morning can best be described as great food with an I-Drive Perkins atmosphere.

The buffet was crazy. I don't fight for food, especially not mellon wedges. Instead, I ordered off of the a la carte menu.

I had the petite filet breakfast steak. It was delicious, and the portion size was respectable. I ordered rare and got medium rare, but it is hard to find anybody in town that doesn't overcook a steak.

Juice and coffee were extremely overpriced.

There was also a pack of feral Brazilian tourist children throwing things around the dining area, including at other patrons. Their parents were louder and more obnoxious than the children, so it was pointless to say anything.

Once they left, you could actually hear the beautiful waterfall inside the restaurant. For the price and location, though, I should be able to get a relaxed (or at least semi-relaxed) dining experience. Instead, I ended up paying premium prices for a budget Disney hotel buffet screamfest environment. Quite a shame. The food was rather good.

name: Cascade Restaurant
address: Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress, 1 Grand Cypress Blvd

text: Love this buffet a lot of choices to choose from the eggs are amazing and so are the pancakes not to mention they make them right in front of you so you know they are fresh and they can make Mickey shape pancakes which makes the kids really happy you can tell everything on their Buffett is fresh yes it is kinda pricey but you get what you pay for great fresh food and great service our server Ray was really nice and accommodating with all of our needs and kept our drinks filled great server thanks.

text: Decent ribeye cooked just how I asked. Loved it smothered. No holding back on the grilled onions and saut√©ed mushrooms. Loved it. They could use a better beer selection. At least one craft beer on tap would be nice.

text:
Food was average.

Prices were average for the food options, but it lacked in quantity.

Long wait and order came out wrong and had to be sent back.

I would only return if I was with someone who really really wanted to go.

text: Oddly enough I came here to celebrate national margarita and let's be real, they have the best in Clermont!!! And for a good price! I paid less than $7 for a big margarita with an extra shot! Not only that, Cole(I believe was her name) was super sweet and connected with every customer at the bar. She even offered me bread, which not places are annoying about giving away stuff if your just there for a drink.

categories: Steakhouses, Restaurants, Salad, Barbeque, American (Traditional), Food
text: If you want to 8 oz steak, pick it out from the window with the person who seats you or you will order an 8oz and get a 6oz. Service is good most of the time. We go here a lot have had bad service with a couple of certain servers a few times but management is always on top of things and ready to help. Food is perfect 95% of the time. Only real food complaint is the blooming onion has been burnt and greasy the last several times so we won't order it again. They are always usually busy and it's extremely loud in this one so I wouldn't go here to have a conversation with anyone.

text: Another chain restaurant that we finally got around to trying. My wife got the grilled chicken salad (she's been on a healthy eating kick lately), and loved it. I had a bacon cheeseburger (it was lunch, and I just don't love steak enough to justify what restaurants charge for it), and my burger was only decent. The dinner rolls, however, were amazing. I also had a cup of chili which was very good as well. We may eventually dine here again, but this is definitely not a place we would go out of our way visit.

text: Called ahead for reservations and they called it something else... but we had no waiting at all. The hostess was friendly and our server was friendly also with a smile. I ordered the special Garlic Tiger Shrimp with a 6oz steak. And three large salads for the others. The salads were large and topped with crispy chicken or sirloin tips. The steak was cooked perfect and the shrimp were hot and quite tasty. The server came back and checked on us a couple of times which was plenty. The peanuts were great also.... had to put them down to eat our dinner. No complaints here... pleasant evening with no restaurant remorse.

text: My first time at any Roadhouse Restaurant and it was fine. Very Basic but good food. The Rolls are excellent and the food about a 3 but overall a good experience. Large Parties and late nighters are a no-no as they need to get you in and get you out. Don't gum up the works. These large chains treat you like cattle so moo along and get out of the way for there next herd....

text: Amazing service !!!! Everyone was on point. The bread maker unknown, the manager Chris, and the bartender Hanna. Also a shout out to the kitchen for the yummy food !!!! One of my favorite places to eat

categories: Steakhouses, Restaurants, Salad, Barbeque, American (Traditional), Food
text:
It's true this is a roadhouse right off the great Hwy 27 in central Florida. A celebratory steak was in order tonight and I offered to buy to ensure it was a real steak. Plenty of choices with hand cut steaks on sale at the meat counter. A pail of peanuts accompanied us to our table and aa empty pail for the shells too. Good Ol'e potato skin
was an appetizer I was surprised to see and almost ordered until I remembered my portion guidelines. I started with a Garden Salad, all fresh and crisp. And dove into my 6z filet with an add on grilled shrimp T-on, add on saut√© mushrooms and steak fries. I ordered no onions chili it was very good even with onions served hot and chef-mate perfect with shredded cheddar on top. 
My steak was great cooked perfect medium the rest of the meal obviously sat in the window waiting for that steak. I mentioned it to the served but declined a redo plate.
Service was quite good and timed well. The vale for the dollar was fair and I'd be back any day I felt like a steak dinner. We passed on the limited desserts and left satisfied.
foodguy-martin

text:
Stopped in for dinner last night. Typical texas Roadhouse with all the old style decor thru out the restaurant, looks good. Had a 20 min wait, gave us a beeper, actually wasn't a 20 min wait it was a shorter wait. Sat us down in nice booth. Restaurant is clean except for the peanut shells on the floor, but that's their staple. 
Waitress was very attentive & friendly. She suggested the special. ... 11oz steak for $11 so we both went with that. It was delicious as usual. Was not a long wait for the food to come. Would come back again.

text:
After a day of moving boxes from storage to my garage I was feeling exhausted and sore and hungry... It was early and I decided I needed a steak.. Texas Roadhouse came through with flying colors! I asked to be seated in the bar area to watch basketball and Bayhill.. Julian was my server extraordinaire! Excellent service! Great food great service and great value! I ordered my favorite, Rib Eye Pittsburgh style and broccoli with extra butter..
My compliments to the Chef! Best Rib Eye perfectly cooked.. The broccoli came out hot, tender and with a side of melted butter! Delicious! I asked who was in the kitchen so I can return when they are there... They said his name was"Wala" Noel.. he definitely takes pride in his work.. every thing was piping hot and perfectly cooked! Even the salad was delicious! Julian even asked if I wanted a water to go.. was he reading my mind...outstanding service! Thank you!
I would highly recommend..

text: This is 5th or 6th time to eat here. Do not order any steak or prime rib medium rare because they cannot get it right. I have ordered the ribeye or prime rib and it never comes back the way I order it. They are incapable of cooking a decent steak. The server was ver apologetic and went the extra mile to make it right but he should not have had to. Get it right the first time.

text: Arrived at 7pm. Seated at 7:10. Ordered right away. 8:04 pm food still not brought. Manager says it'll be 2 more minutes because they said they overcooked last steak. Waitress story contradicts this. 8:20 pm food still not at table, so we walk out and will never return.  Management doesn't care.

text: We went here for 26th anniversary and service was terrible. Plenty of booths open and hostess tried to sit us next to large party that was sticking out in the aisle. When asked if we could sit somewhere else hostess said the where no more tables available. Looking around restaurant there where lots of other tables. Had about 5 hostesses and no waitresses to serve the empty tables? Thank you for ruining our night.

categories: Steakhouses, Restaurants, Salad, Barbeque, American (Traditional), Food
text:
Ugh. I really don't want to give another bad review, but I gave two stars only because we got a $30 voucher for our next visit, which won't be anytime soon. For starters, the cactus blossom was a greasy clump of onion. Literally batter separating from onion clumps when picking it up. Not ok. Maybe it's an off night. 

Next the entrees. Not much better. But thank you to our server for asking us to cut into our steaks when they came out, because my lady ordered med rare and it came out darn near well done. After asking to cooking it again, which was great, we were left to delve into the loaded mashed potatoes and baked potato, which was literally half cooked. Awesome. Dry mashed potatoes and cold toppings? That's what you charge extra for? 

So about 30 mins after the steak was to be refired, it comes out again. At this point we are pretty annoyed and just want to leave. The picture of the "redone" loaded mashed potatoes about sum up this experience. Kinda sad when you send a manager to a table and what they give you looks like a 5th grader cooked it.

categories: Steakhouses, Restaurants, Salad, Barbeque, American (Traditional), Food
text:
Extremely disappointed went this evening on February 28th with my family imagine the feeling of going with two young boys & the restaurants tells you there's No peanuts....wow if that wasn't enough we waited about 15-20 mins for the bread, seriously with two boys sitting there patiently or at least trying, with no peanuts (which we all look forward to that) and top it off no bread!!!! My husband had to get up himself to check on the bread at the front (at this point our youngest) wanted to leave, which I regret, wish we did but my oldest want to eat here. Nevertheless they wouldn't accept our $5 coupon which we got due to the amount of GC's we purchased during the holidays, the restaurant gave several $5 coupons depending on the amount of GC dollar. 
We will not be returning, I'll give the $5 coupon to a co-worker after I tell her & others how  dissatisfying my experience was. Management had a busy evening between the complaints and unsatisfying order. We saw them basically table to table, HOW DO U RUN OUT OF PEANUTS????

text: This was the first time we are here. Greeted and seated quickly. Waitress took our drink and food order then we waited and waited while all the tables around us who had come after got there salads. It was difficult for us to signal our waitress as she was busy chatting. Finally she came over. Got our salad within moments of our entree arriving. Nowhere on the menu did it say there was bacon in the green bean side. Good was okay but experience was poor. There were houseflies and fruit flies buzzing all around.

attributes: {'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "'loud'", 'HasTV': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'RestaurantsTableService': 'True', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'WiFi': "'no'", 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': True, 'latenight': None, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}"}
categories: Steakhouses, Restaurants, Salad, Barbeque, American (Traditional), Food
text:
I haven't been to a Texas Roadhouse in years.  Service was good, all of our servers were nice even if they were a little overwhelmed with the size of our group.  The food came out quickly and we were never without bread or butter.

I had barbecue chicken and green beans and both were very tasty. It was too much food for me and I brought it home and had it for breakfast the following day.  It was still great the day after.

We had reservations for our group and were seated promptly at our reserved time.  While we didn't all get to sit together, we were at least next to one another, but being in two booths back to back made it impossible for us to converse with more than a few people.  Though, I doubt that would have been much different if we were all at one long table.

name: Sam's Club
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'Caters': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}"}
categories: Convenience Stores, Bakeries, Food, Grocery
text:
I have memberships to both Sam's and Costco. My Sam's is a business membership and this location has business hours starting at 7AM, nice to avoid the crowds if you are picking up a few items. Wish Costco did this!

This Sam's is well stocked, gas is always 5-8 cents cheaper than the stations located around it. Doesn't sound like much, but with the price of gas currently at almost $4.00 a gallon, every little bit helps. I've paid for my membership in annual gas savings alone.

When you have the business membership, you get upgraded on your warranties on the electronics, so check this feature out. I bought our Wii though this Sam's and the extended warranty was honored by Nintendo, no problems. I regularly buy garden supplies, bakery items, bottled drinks, frozen goods and paper goods. This location is always well stocked and clean.

Another benefit to Sam's is taking all major credit cards. I'd rather be earning some Discover cash back, so thanks! I love my Costco, but if you price shop- it does pay to have both memberships.

text: Optometrist Dr. Kim is the best. I've seen several optometrists over the years and have now exclusively seen him for 3 years and he's the best. Very personable, knowledgable and thorough. He got my difficult prescription right the first time. 30 years of wearing contacts and had never had an eye infection; he was able to work me in between patients. He was so thorough he diagnosed the infection properly and it cleared up in a few days. If he had just diagnoses the problem as bacterial I don't think it would have healed as quickly. I will not go anywhere else.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'Caters': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}"}
categories: Convenience Stores, Bakeries, Food, Grocery
text:
Sam's club seems to be a place that you either love it or hate it. Honestly, I go here for the basic shopping needs that has a better price when compared to other stores. Sure you end up buying butter that will last you for 4 months and also buying cleaning supplies to stock a janitorial service, but if you're able to have some organization in your household, I think it's worth it and you can stock up and save some money, which goes a long way!

And yes admittedly, certain items are not for me, and certain items that can be found at the other big stores are not found here. Oh well. Would it be convenient to have them all under one roof, sure, but we can't have it all.

name: Crossfit Terminus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Gyms, Active Life, Interval Training Gyms, Fitness & Instruction
text: I came in as a drop in.  Casey Castleberry is a badass coach!  Even though I wasn't a member he took the time to give me some awesome cues on my push jerk that I continue to use every time I do that movement.  Also, the overall vibe there is super relaxed and friendly, but at the same time you can tell they take their crossfitting seriously.  EVERY SINGLE PERSON in the class (about 15) came up to me and shook my hand before the WOD.  I thought that was super cool.  Highly recommend this box.

name: Crossfit Terminus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Gyms, Active Life, Interval Training Gyms, Fitness & Instruction
text:
I'm pretty new to this gym, but I'm writing this review because I think it really needs to be on the map.

Although I'm far from an elite athlete, I've found Crossfit to be an incredibly effective way to improve my fitness and confidence in the past. It's not easy, it's not cheap, and it's not for everyone--but taught effectively, it gives a person tools for improving and measuring physical function across many domains.

Before moving to Atlanta, I worked out at a Crossfit gym with coaches who'd had years of experience in coaching various athletics, and who also had a background in physical therapy and/or exercise science. They knew how to teach people to do the movements safely, and how to motivate people to work hard, even when it hurts. This made them outstanding coaches not just for elite athletes, but also for people like me. My experience at that gym was life-changing.

I'd had trouble finding the same level of knowledge and skill at a Crossfit gym in Atlanta, until now. The two coaches--one male, one female--who run this gym have many years of experience coaching both Crossfit and other sports. Combined, they also have academic background and higher levels of certification that come across in the way they're able to figure out what I'm doing wrong with a certain movement, or how to improve mobility in a certain joint. The programming is created by the coaches, who are consistently attentive and helpful.

Because the place is new, classes are currently small.  On any given day, I work out with people about at my level or less experienced, and with people who could bench-press me with one hand. Parking behind the gym is plentiful. Most patrons are friendly, although one of the owners was downright crusty to me on my first day here, which was a minor downer. I got over it, because the coaching is great, but others might not be so tolerant. I would love if it were easier to put my membership on hold when I travel, and am holding out hope that becomes an option somewhere down the road.

Regardless of some of these bumps, I think this place has what it takes to be an incredible resource to a lot of people at different levels of fitness, and I'm delighted it's in the neighborhood.

name: Crossfit Terminus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}

text: Dropped in while in town from Phoenix.... Dane, the instructor, was super helpful! Everyone was welcoming and supportive. The workout was challenging and was just what we needed! The facility was awesome with more than enough equipment for everyone. I will definitely come back next time I'm in town!

name: Crossfit Terminus

text: Mixed review. The 5:30am people were nice, no doubt...the coach- was not my favorite. He was unfriendly and slightly arrogant. BUT, it was a great WOD and I felt good after. I have been visiting Crossfits as I travel and this one was just "OK" at best. Personality is key. Maybe I am wrong and it was just a tuff morning...

name: Crossfit Terminus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Gyms, Active Life, Interval Training Gyms, Fitness & Instruction
text:
I recently tried out Crossfit Terminus and I was not very impressed. This box has plenty of space to accommodate the small classes, but there are other boxes in the area with better equipment (and a lower monthly rate). 

Crossfit Terminus requires you to take two to four weeks of foundation classes before working out with the rest of the gym at scheduled times. The class I attended was a foundation class (they let you try one for free before joining). Most Crossfit boxes do require you to take a foundation class or two before joining, but 2-4 weeks seems outrageous to me. I have been crossfitting for awhile and I filled out a survey before coming to this box but I felt like none of my previous experience was taken into consideration. Quite frankly the class I attended was a joke. I understand scaling workouts down to accommodate mobility or form issues, but I left this gym feeling unsatisfied. 

Emily is one of the main coaches and taught the class I attended. She was knowledgable and fun. She had a lot of good advice on my form for rowing and pushups, as did Ben (the other main coach). However knowledgable he was, Ben was not friendly at all and he was borderline rude to me, and the box members I worked out with didn't seem very welcoming. Crossfit Terminus definitely has quality coaching, but I could not get past the rude factor as well as the many required foundation classes. 

Part of the reason I do crossfit is because I love the class atmosphere and camaraderie (as well as a grueling workout). I have been to a lot of gyms and if you're looking for a crossfit gym I would absolutely try out other boxes in the area before committing to this one. Perhaps if you're a beginner this is a good place to try, but if you're a more advanced Crossfitter I would take your business elsewhere.

name: Crossfit Terminus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Gyms, Active Life, Interval Training Gyms, Fitness & Instruction
text:
Now I normally don't leave reviews.. Good or bad. I'm going out of my way to do this because I left this place feeling extremely disappointed.

 I walked with the typical questions about joining. First, the "owner" was VERY rude, arrogant, and un-welcoming. The members did not introduce themselves. I was shocked at how at how unprofessional it was. If you are a friendly, family oriented person- this place is not for you. These people are rude. 

I love crossfit, but this gym is definitely NOT getting my money.

name: Crossfit Terminus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Gyms, Active Life, Interval Training Gyms, Fitness & Instruction
text: I absolutely love this gym! Every one of the coaches takes the time to get to know you and help you work on your weaknesses. The foundations class is a great intro to the world of crossfit, and it teaches you everything you need to know to advance to the main classes. The WODs are always challenging but bring the best out of everyone. This is by far the best box in the ATL.

name: Crossfit Terminus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Gyms, Active Life, Interval Training Gyms, Fitness & Instruction
text: First day back to CrossFit! We chose CrossFit Terminus after visiting about 10 different gyms within a 2 day span. This Box by far was the most competitive, cleanest and had the times that would work best for our schedule. The lesson here is to make a well rounded evaluation in life who and what you want to be associated with and then take action. Don't sit around waiting on things to be perfect because they never will be. Now let's go get crunk at 6am! #CrossFit #CrossFitTerminus

name: Crossfit Terminus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Gyms, Active Life, Interval Training Gyms, Fitness & Instruction
text: Terminus is amazing box. Big space with great layout. Coaching is strong. Come ready for challenging WOD programming. You will be pushed at any level you are at as a Crossfiters. Welcoming community that makes you feel part of group from when I walked in. Terminus should be on top list your list when looking for Crossfit in Atlanta.

name: Finish Line Car Wash
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Oil Change Stations, Smog Check Stations, Automotive, Car Wash
text:
ooooh not good.  The price I was given and the price I was charged were different. The manager did not handle it well. I was rung up for 70 instead of the 60 I was told I would be charged. They had already started cleaning my car and I explained this to the manager - that I wouldn't have chosen the package that was 70 and that he could ask the attendant with whom I spoke to verify that I was given the incorrect price. The manager was a jerk and said pretty much "too bad". Keep in mind I was very polite when I spoke to him. I think it was an honest mistake on the part of the attendant but the manager should have checked with him. and didnt. 
THEN it took three days for my carpet to dry. This was a huge problem because I was traveling the next day which is why I wanted my van cleaned. I was told it would only take one day to dry which seemed reasonable. It was awful packing everything on wet carpet! I lined the floors with plastic bags to keep things dry. what a huge pain in the butt. I had a van load of stuff because I was helping my son move to a different state. We were traveling and had to bring everything inside each night along the way so that the carpet would dry at night. THREE DAYS! infuriating! It cost us a lot of time and trouble.

name: Finish Line Car Wash
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Oil Change Stations, Smog Check Stations, Automotive, Car Wash
text: I've been here before but decided to do a review for this visit because as someone said, they never fully clean your car. I got the basic car wash with inside "cleaning" & was there for all of 10 mins b/c my car wasn't washed properly. I'd just come back from a road trip so my grill was dirty & full of dead bugs. When they brought my car around the grill was half cleaned, the windshield had dirty spots left at the bottom from where it'd rained previously and my console or dash wasn't wiped or cleaned! It's cheap but I could have done a better job myself! For free! Then to put the icing on the cake the guy that gave me my car ASKED for a tip! I didn't have any cash but had I did I would not have seen it fit to leave them ANYTHING extra. I mean who ASKS for a tip? Yikes.

name: Finish Line Car Wash
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Oil Change Stations, Smog Check Stations, Automotive, Car Wash
text:
This place is the real deal full service shop! Took my Porsche 911 Turbo here on a Tuesday. They do emissions, car wash and oil change.  They do great work and never had any issues.

Fast service. Good work. Good price. What else can you ask for? Definitely recommend! Soft cloth car wash is a must  if you care about your car. It doesn't put scratches in your paint like the foam rollers at other car washes.

name: Finish Line Car Wash
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Oil Change Stations, Smog Check Stations, Automotive, Car Wash
text: These people don't know how to clean a car. I told them that I wanted it clean enough to trade it in. But, the trunk wasn't vacuumed and the glove box was empty but never touched, the center was wiped and left about 1/4 inch of water, but the department right behind that was left dirty. I don't know how they trade in their cars, but it would have been cleaner then they left our car for sure.

name: Wolf Camera and Image
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Shopping, Photography Stores & Services
text: I learned a valuable lesson today when I visited Wolf Camera to pick up some prints. The manager noticed me from my review and told me that she could take care of my issue; not only going forward, but also for previous orders where I did not get the discount.  The lesson???... Always deal in person with an issue instead of calling "corporate".  This store cares about its customers; I took the easy way out and called a 1-800 number, got frustrated, and immediately posted a one-star review (another lesson... wait a few days before posting a review).  The store manager went out of her way to talk to me and resolve the problem.  As mentioned before, the service and quality at Wolf are great... and their customer service is impeccable.

name: Wolf Camera and Image
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Shopping, Photography Stores & Services
text: Ordered prints from here on multiple occasions and they've always printed very quickly (within the hour). I placed an order today and when I called to see when they would be ready Nate informed me there was no way I would get them today and would not provide a time they would be ready tomorrow. When I inquired as to why, he informed me that it's holiday time and they never provide timing during the holidays. Seems like that's a time of year they should provide timing given that it's likely a gift for someone.  Quality is good, staff is questionable at best.

name: Wolf Camera and Image
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Shopping, Photography Stores & Services
text: They want you to use Lexar Memory cards. I'm a knowledgeable customer but usually prefer Sandisk. The Lexar card I bought from them turned out to be a counterfeit and failed at a major event I was working. I found out it was a fake after. Now Wolf is out of business and I have to deal with Lexar who is also going out of business and says they will "try" to rescue my pictures that their software won't. I know this won't work because the card is a fake. In the end I am screwed because I have I have to ship the card, wait for the returned card and Lexar could care less. If Wolf was open at least they would have some culpability.

name: Wolf Camera and Image
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Shopping, Photography Stores & Services
text:
While service via phone was polite and friendly (although a bit rushed), in person I found the "service" to be quite bland and definitely not helpful. Maybe I just caught someone on a bad day, but the guy that gave me my photos hardly said anything to me. When I looked at the prints (duplicates of 4 photos), one of the images looked like my fiance had been sprayed with a water gun. It seemed to have something to do with the complex pattern of his shirt and hat, but when I pointed it out, the guy didn't say ANYTHING. He didn't offer an excuse, much less offer to reprint them. On top of it all, their parking lot is tiny and it's on a very busy street, so the experience was already stressful before I walked in the door.

Fortunately, I'd happened to get a random "deal" so the prints were already free. I didn't bother complaining because I figured it wouldn't be worth the time for either parties. Instead, I ordered the same photo from Walgreens the next day and received surprisingly excellent prints. I don't believe I'll be visiting this store again. I'd advise either brightening or softening photos before having them printed here, perhaps that would prevent such oddities that I encountered.

name: Wolf Camera and Image
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Shopping, Photography Stores & Services
text:
I would pass on this place and head to Showcase Photo & Video (2323 Cheshire Bridge Road NE, Atlanta, Ga. 30324, (404) 325-7676 www.showcaseinc.com).

Bottom line:  You go to a place like this for customer service, knowledge, and support.  This place is lacking in 2 of those area's (Support and Service - can't speak to knowledge).

I purchased a camera from Wolf Camera (Mall Location), two years ago and was told that if I needed some help to swing in and they would take care of me.  I'm heading out of town in a couple weeks and wanted to get my settings situated on my camera before I left so I called (Over the course of 3 days, got busy signal 4 times, and rang through 6 times), until I finally reached Nick there this afternoon.  Nick let me know that Wolf Camera went out of business and it's a new company.  Specifically, he wouldn't honor that claim.  I am happy to purchase an hour with them (an "explorer" package), for $99.  I let him know that I just had a few questions and he sternly informed me my questions would be capped at 2 of they would charge me.

As I let him know (I was obviously frustrated), that I was glad to know that this was a business that among other things, didn't pick up the phone, Nick got extremely sarcastic.  

Now, I might be crazy, but that's just not the way to do business.

Save yourself the trouble and head to Showcase or go online.  Either way you will get a better deal and a little less sarcasm...

name: Wolf Camera and Image
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BikeParking': 'True'}

text: Great people. Reasonable prices. What's not to like? Staff was very helpful in assisting my daughter crop and print photos including loading from her computer.

name: Wolf Camera and Image
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BikeParking': 'True'}

text:
Had a great experience there in March of 2013. They were able to crop and enlarge a photo with much better results than I was expecting. Prices were reasonable, service was fast, and staff were friendly and knowledgeable. 

Prices on the store merchandise seemed a bit steep, but the service prices seemed reasonable to me.

name: Wolf Camera and Image

text: First and last of its kind offers quick within the day film development. Such an old school gem in an ever growing city. Go here whenever I can

name: Wolf Camera and Image
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BikeParking': 'True'}

text: My experience at this wolf camera was fantastic.  They walked out from behind the desk to immediately help me despite it being a self-help service. They said it should be ready by Saturday, but when I asked for sooner they made it happen and called me this afternoon that it's ready. While I was in there, I witnessed great service and concern for all the customers. Will definitely go here again.

text: Love this place....great staff, strong drinks (depending on the bartender), and fun place for an afternoon cocktail or a night out on the town.

text: Love, love this place. So friendly!!!  I went with a couple of girls (they are partners and me straight). Had such a great time. The gay men were happy to have fun w/us girls and I didn't feel uncomfortable at all. The drag show was good/funny...the music and video screens were a plus...good place to get your dance on after the drag show when people get their drink on!!!  Nice that they have food too!

name: Blake's On The Park

text: File this one under Generic Gay Bar.  Usually attracts a younger crowd of generic gay boys.  I'll go because I live across the street from it.  However, the last time I was there, I got too drunk and FELL.  Oh my gosh.  Falling in a bar is the worst thing you can do...

name: Blake's On The Park
attributes: {'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'HasTV': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'very_loud'", 'GoodForDancing': 'True', 'WiFi': "'free'", 'BestNights': "{'monday': False, 'tuesday': False, 'friday': True, 'wednesday': False, 'thursday': False, 'sunday': True, 'saturday': True}", 'Music': "{'dj': True, 'background_music': False, 'no_music': False, 'jukebox': False, 'live': None, 'video': False, 'karaoke': False}", 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': None, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': None}"}
categories: Nightlife, Bars, Gay Bars, Sports Bars
text:
Third time's the charm (again).  Came here for my friend's bday party (her choice) and had a blast on my 3rd visit.  I went with 8 people, all straight.  First time I lost my Blake's v-card, I was a little nervous (as you can read below) but the booze helped.  The second time I was here, I was so drunk that I forgot multiple times that I was even in a gay bar.  I apparently asked my friends a bunch of times, "hey why are there so many guys here?"

Third time was fun again, went on a friday night.  The drag show is fun as always, and some good entertainment.  I have to say, we wound up talking to a ton of other straight people, so it's definitely friendly to non-gay men.  I would say a good 20% of the people here were straight and just looking to have a fun time.

It was... interesting to finally understand a girl's perspective of dealing with people passing you in a crowded area.  I personally tap the shoulder and squeeze by but i've heard from women that they get flat out molested when someone squeezes by them.  This visit to Blake's, I got all sorts of odd methods for dudes to pass by me.  Anywhere from a slight touch on the shoulder to a whole back rub up and down and finally a little squeeze on both sides of my love handles.

On behalf of all men to all women, I'm sorry.

name: Blake's On The Park
attributes: {'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'HasTV': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'very_loud'", 'GoodForDancing': 'True', 'WiFi': "'free'", 'BestNights': "{'monday': False, 'tuesday': False, 'friday': True, 'wednesday': False, 'thursday': False, 'sunday': True, 'saturday': True}", 'Music': "{'dj': True, 'background_music': False, 'no_music': False, 'jukebox': False, 'live': None, 'video': False, 'karaoke': False}", 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': None, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': None}"}
categories: Nightlife, Bars, Gay Bars, Sports Bars
text:
Are you kidding.. I haven't reviewed this place yet? Shame on me! Perhaps I already thought I had....but after the amount of booze I've consumed there I would have to question myself. Dranks..yes dranks.. are strong! So strong that making out with a gay man wearing a hello kitty tank top almost seems somewhat normal. The Queens are fabulosity defined, and certainly make me question my own cosmetic and fashion choices. Thanks to David K. for introducing me to this wonderfully quirky bar.. I will most certainly be back!

Ps. take heed to Kathleen M.'s review.. most importantly numbers 1 & 5 !!!!

name: Blake's On The Park
attributes: {'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'HasTV': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'very_loud'", 'GoodForDancing': 'True', 'WiFi': "'free'", 'BestNights': "{'monday': False, 'tuesday': False, 'friday': True, 'wednesday': False, 'thursday': False, 'sunday': True, 'saturday': True}", 'Music': "{'dj': True, 'background_music': False, 'no_music': False, 'jukebox': False, 'live': None, 'video': False, 'karaoke': False}", 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': None, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': None}"}
categories: Nightlife, Bars, Gay Bars, Sports Bars
text:
Can't beat the drag show!  In the world of gay bars, there are plenty of annoying things to deal with - but Blake's has always been one of my favorites.  The newly renovated upstairs area is a great place to chill.  

The drinks can be expensive, but that is about par for the industry.  And the drag show floor is simply just a side of the bar - it gets quite crowded.

This has been a mainstay of the Atlanta Gay scene for some time, and I don't see that changing.  You can always come back and it's the same diverse crowd.

text: First time here. Went with a friend. Typical bar and Dance floor. Pretty fun. They had quite a lot of entertainers. Decent drink prices. Pretty crowded on weekends.

text: Brent and Belinda make this place. They are amazing people!!!!! I call Belinda Miranda girl, like from devil wears Prada. Sweat, beautiful, innocent. Brent is strong man, caring; everyone dies to see him shirtless, but his mind is equally beautiful! Been coming here for years. I only leave reviews when people stand the test of time.

name: Blake's On The Park
attributes: {'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'HasTV': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'very_loud'", 'GoodForDancing': 'True', 'WiFi': "'free'", 'BestNights': "{'monday': False, 'tuesday': False, 'friday': True, 'wednesday': False, 'thursday': False, 'sunday': True, 'saturday': True}", 'Music': "{'dj': True, 'background_music': False, 'no_music': False, 'jukebox': False, 'live': None, 'video': False, 'karaoke': False}", 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': None, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': None}"}
categories: Nightlife, Bars, Gay Bars, Sports Bars
text: New to the neighborhood and just in from a long flight, my beautiful wife suggested we get out for a nightcap. Welcome to Blake's, where on a Monday night you can enjoy a full drag show! Not only a drag show but a drag show where one of the queens even played the violin, now that's something special. I have to wonder, do they have drag shows every night? The bartenders were friendly, and the bar reminded me a little of cheers, gay cheers, where everyone knows your name. Well not my name, I just got here.
