text: I LOVE Blake's on the Park! It's the gay bar version of cheers. I've been every day of the week and always had a great time. Recently the crowd has changed to a younger group, but it's still fun. The staff is super great and so are the drinks. I definitely recommend checking this place out.

name: Blake's On The Park
attributes: {'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'HasTV': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'very_loud'", 'GoodForDancing': 'True', 'WiFi': "'free'", 'BestNights': "{'monday': False, 'tuesday': False, 'friday': True, 'wednesday': False, 'thursday': False, 'sunday': True, 'saturday': True}", 'Music': "{'dj': True, 'background_music': False, 'no_music': False, 'jukebox': False, 'live': None, 'video': False, 'karaoke': False}", 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': None, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': None}"}
categories: Nightlife, Bars, Gay Bars, Sports Bars
text:
Definitely my favorite gay bar in Atlanta!!!  I came here last night with my neighbor Robert and we had a great time.  I tried to get both David K and Andre S out with me, but both had pretty exciting Thursday nights and wanted to rest.  

You can't go wrong with Blakes.  It's one of the only original gay bars left in Atlanta that doesn't suck and no cover!!!  It's always packed with the best looking crowd in Atlanta plus you will pretty much run into your friends and a good amount of people you know from the gym, work, friends of friends, yelpers, etc... As Robert said yesterday to perfectly explain the scene..."Everyone is a bit cookie cutter and way too pretty!"  Of course I replied..."What's wrong with that!?"  HA!  Oh and its pretty diverse with male/female, all nationalities and ages.

The bartenders are pretty attentive.  We were able to get drinks pretty quickly although the drinks aren't that great.  I love the redo of the entire 2nd floor.  It's a nice escape if you are like me and not totally into the drag shows.  The only thing I wish they had was more seating and a larger patio.  It was super hot on the 2nd floor and we had to keep moving down to the first floor to cool off.  I swear they keep it hot to have people wear less clothing!

Definitely check it out!  I wouldn't say that anyone there was rude or snobby (c'mon now, its the gays), but people do like to stay in their clicks.  So invite a group of friends, bring a hag or two with you and have a great time!  Say hello if you see me!

categories: Nightlife, Bars, Gay Bars, Sports Bars
text: I LOVE vah vah this place.  Cute boys telling me how gorgeous I am all night.  I am dancing until the wee hours of the morning and making new friends. How could I not have fun? I didn't have to pay for my drinks. I didn't like waiting in line to get in or the fact that I had to park a block away but like the patrons told me when I got inside I would forget about all that and I did.  Upstairs is the bar and patio and downstairs is another bar and the dancing and drag shows.  I did catch the second 1/2 of the show and the performers all did their thing.  I thoroughly enjoyed myself and I will definitely be back.

text: Went there last night.  One of my friends had never been to gay bars so we took her around to a few.  It was exactly how I remembered it.  Expensive drinks, crowded, kind of meat markety.  I probably would have enjoyed it more if we had gotten there in time for the drag show.

name: Blake's On The Park
attributes: {'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'HasTV': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'very_loud'", 'GoodForDancing': 'True', 'WiFi': "'free'", 'BestNights': "{'monday': False, 'tuesday': False, 'friday': True, 'wednesday': False, 'thursday': False, 'sunday': True, 'saturday': True}", 'Music': "{'dj': True, 'background_music': False, 'no_music': False, 'jukebox': False, 'live': None, 'video': False, 'karaoke': False}", 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': None, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': None}"}
categories: Nightlife, Bars, Gay Bars, Sports Bars
text:
Yes, i only gave Blakes 3 stars. 

this place is evidently an Atlanta favorite. It has a nice mix of people in there. no one is pretentious and uptight. the venue seemed so small b/c it was packed! I had so many sausages on my body, it was like a sweet, sweet dream-it's such a waste that they didn't want me.  i finally made my way downstairs for the drag show! this was my first time here. Anytime i think of what a drag show experience will be like, immediately The Birdcage comes to mind. The drag shows at Blakes are the ghetto version of The Birdcage. There is no set stage, the "divas" come out into the crowd in this little circle, that the police had to keep pushing people back to make larger. 
i got many of drinks wasted on my pretty little toes. I got pushed and squished... tall ppl, here's some advice-move your ass to the back! i cant see the queens. 
i loved the show, and would definitely come back, but it was ghetto. 
a lot of the reviews say the drinks were strong. my drink wasn't that strong. 
they serve food, however i don't know where anyone would comfortably sit to eat it

text: Great music. Strong drinks. Fun crowd. Good bar food. Drag Race Friday can be fun too. How I wish they had some sort of stage for the Drag Queens. Always have a lot of fun anyway.

name: Blake's On The Park
attributes: {'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'HasTV': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'very_loud'", 'GoodForDancing': 'True', 'WiFi': "'free'", 'BestNights': "{'monday': False, 'tuesday': False, 'friday': True, 'wednesday': False, 'thursday': False, 'sunday': True, 'saturday': True}", 'Music': "{'dj': True, 'background_music': False, 'no_music': False, 'jukebox': False, 'live': None, 'video': False, 'karaoke': False}", 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': None, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': None}"}
categories: Nightlife, Bars, Gay Bars, Sports Bars
text:
This place was a disaster. I'm not sure I've been to a more poorly designed bar. The bar space takes up a ridiculous portion of the downstairs. It's laid out almost like a perfect square, which pushes everyone out to the perimeter of a good-sized space that backs up pretty close to the wall. If you want to talk to people, you're pretty much restricted to your immediate surroundings, at least on a crowded weekend night. Once you settle on a particular area by the bar, you're pretty much stuck there.

Other reviews seem to indicate that there's an upstairs. If so, the entrance to it isn't easy to find. If we weren't right in front of it, the bathroom would have also been hard to find and almost impossible to access because of how many people were crowded throughout the poorly designed space.    

We were here on Saturday and got a glimpse of the drag show, which I enjoyed until one of the white queens made a pretty racist comment to an Asian guy. He and a group of four or five others were on stage for a dance-off, which the drag queen who was emceeing the show judged based on whose moves drew the most cheers/applause from the crowd. 

The Asian guy was the first to be eliminated from the competition and as he left the stage, the queen said something along the lines of, "Would it be racist if I gave you some rice-a-roni as a parting gift?" Look, I love an edgy, transgressive drag show just as much as the next guy but it was just a lazy, sophomoric attempt at a cheap laugh. It wasn't funny at all -- just a "haha, look, this guy's Asian!" kind of comment that you're more likely to hear from a bully on a middle school playground. 

Also, one of the bartenders apparently gave my friend a hard time for not starting a tab after she ordered a second drink. Being the nice person that she is, she went ahead and opened it but it ended up being completely unnecessary since we left after round two. 

I was here with a group of awesome friends and we still had a good time in spite of this being a bad bar. When I'm back in Atlanta, I'll be sure to suggest a different gay spot!

text: Ass before chaps what can I say for a Monday night? :P

name: Blake's On The Park
attributes: {'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'HasTV': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'very_loud'", 'GoodForDancing': 'True', 'WiFi': "'free'", 'BestNights': "{'monday': False, 'tuesday': False, 'friday': True, 'wednesday': False, 'thursday': False, 'sunday': True, 'saturday': True}", 'Music': "{'dj': True, 'background_music': False, 'no_music': False, 'jukebox': False, 'live': None, 'video': False, 'karaoke': False}", 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': None, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': None}"}
categories: Nightlife, Bars, Gay Bars, Sports Bars
text:
I suggested this location for my friends bachelorette party. First I have to say Juniper street can go kiss my ass. If you miss the parking lot, sucks for you. And the one way street, ha! forget it, just go home. I digress. 

Blakes itself was so jammed packed. We had to make our way down, carefully, especially down those shady ass stairs. The stairs are so narrow, I almost lost my life! 

My bride got up on the stage and dancer her ass off. We were all clapping and this guy helped me up on stage too. Some people there were super sweet, hot, and sweaty! yum. The drag queen that started dancing on stage, Idk if she was drunk or what  but she was rude as shit. She almost pushed me and my bride off the stage. 

Overall the experience was okay, I wouldn't go back unless I was ready to get shit wasted, or was already shit wasted.  

Also the bartenders- By far the nicest group of guys I've came across. Not in a social aspect but in service.

name: Blake's On The Park
attributes: {'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'HasTV': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'very_loud'", 'GoodForDancing': 'True', 'WiFi': "'free'", 'BestNights': "{'monday': False, 'tuesday': False, 'friday': True, 'wednesday': False, 'thursday': False, 'sunday': True, 'saturday': True}", 'Music': "{'dj': True, 'background_music': False, 'no_music': False, 'jukebox': False, 'live': None, 'video': False, 'karaoke': False}", 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': None, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': None}"}
categories: Nightlife, Bars, Gay Bars, Sports Bars
text:
This is a great place to meet a friend for a drink early in the evening, before the pretentiousness sets in. You can't avoid it entirely, though, because the bartenders themselves exude it.

Blaske's used to be hoity-toity, then it got more laid back. they sold & remodeled, & now it's circuit boy time again. Go for some eye candy, if you can stand being around some seriously stuck-up queens.

The drinks are strong - I guess that's something nice to say. If you sit by the sidewalk side, you have a great perch for people-watching. The televisions are usually playing videos to match the music, which is good. 

There's a lot of dark wood & low lighting, so you feel a little sexy just by walking in.

name: Blake's On The Park
attributes: {'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'HasTV': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'very_loud'", 'GoodForDancing': 'True', 'WiFi': "'free'", 'BestNights': "{'monday': False, 'tuesday': False, 'friday': True, 'wednesday': False, 'thursday': False, 'sunday': True, 'saturday': True}", 'Music': "{'dj': True, 'background_music': False, 'no_music': False, 'jukebox': False, 'live': None, 'video': False, 'karaoke': False}", 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': None, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': None}"}
categories: Nightlife, Bars, Gay Bars, Sports Bars
text: Lets see I dont remember what day I went there but I went to see the drag show. Very interesting. The food wasnt up to par and neither was the service. I went with a friend and we sat at the table waiting for the help to atleast bring us some menus and finally after 15 min we got a menu ourselves. When the drag show began an hour later it was like pulling teeth to get a drink. The bartender who was very attractive just wouldnt take my order...after yelling for 2 min he finally look passed some attractive men to a waving angry black woman. I think he was expecting a tip but i was so irritated I rolled my eyes and walked off. The crowd was friendly and I managed to snag a good homo friend...God bless gay men!!

name: Blake's On The Park
attributes: {'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'HasTV': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'very_loud'", 'GoodForDancing': 'True', 'WiFi': "'free'", 'BestNights': "{'monday': False, 'tuesday': False, 'friday': True, 'wednesday': False, 'thursday': False, 'sunday': True, 'saturday': True}", 'Music': "{'dj': True, 'background_music': False, 'no_music': False, 'jukebox': False, 'live': None, 'video': False, 'karaoke': False}", 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': None, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': None}"}
categories: Nightlife, Bars, Gay Bars, Sports Bars
text:
Very relaxing place to have a drink on an afternoon or evening. Fun drag shows. I live in CA now but lived in Atlanta many years and still visit. Enjoy the Flying Biscuit just across the street also for lunch, dinner or a snak. 

To those with negative things to say, some are due to your own personal tastes or if you leave your purse alone while dancing, don't blame the bar for someone stealing something out of it. I would never leave my wallet on the table by itself wtihout someone watching it! I can only surmise you live in Nowhere Idaho or some similiar place !

categories: Nightlife, Bars, Gay Bars, Sports Bars
text:
I don't really have much of a barometer when it comes to comparing gay bars to others, but the last time I went to one I freaking slayed Notorious B.I.G.'s "Hypnotize." (Come at me, bro.) That happened about five years ago. So yeah, I don't know much.

But when your queer homegirl comes into town and wants to check out the ATL's LGBTQ scene, I immediately thought of Blake's. Why? Well, it's literally right across the street from me. Anyways, my humble take:
*****
I. ATMOSPHERE/ DECOR
Upon entering, you'll notice that the crowd, composed of predominately white gay men and straight women celebrating their respective engagements, will probably be gettin' hella crunk to truly awful Brittany Spears remixes that's paired with a rainbow laser light show. The main square room has a large bar in the middle, and it's just... really uncomfortable. And by uncomfortable, I mean that there's lots of craziness going on in a very small space. Examples:

-Dudes being aggressively grabby along the bar and crazily making out and humping one another, without the concern of others nearby.
-That one girl who had too much to drink and can't stay upright in her high-heels, who literally falls into other people and knocks them over. 
-The very tall and strong woman who pushed my friend out of the way while saying, "Uh uh, honey. That's mine," while going after the only chubby Asian dude (me) in the bar.
-Did I mention the Brittany Spears remixes paired with the rainbow laser light show? Yeah, that.

So, what's my advice? Get really hammered before visiting and wear shoes that you don't mind people stepping on. And if you arrive sober, consider taking some shots of truly disgusting apple-flavored Crown Royal because you don't know any better. When in Rome, right? ....RIGHT? (Damn it, Vi. That was awful.) 

But seriously, don't hangout in their main room. Take the ascending stairs in the back--past the bathrooms--to the second floor. It's a lot more chill, has more space, and it doesn't feel like you're heavily tripping on laced acid. There's also a nice enclosed patio with low-hanging lights, too. It's ideal for talking (not shouting), and there's an exit to Blake's parking lot. (That's right, you don't have to walk through the inferno that is the main room.)

II. SERVICE
Regarding theirservice, the bartender didn't roll his eyes when my friend Vi requested apple flavored Crown Royal. But he should have. Seriously, though, he was a very nice guy. 

III. OVERALL
If you're a straight man with a queer friend that's trying to figure out where to bring him or her, then Blake's might serve as an adequate option; however, just know that all your senses will be overloaded, like watching a Japanese anime movie in the dark while drinking Four Loco and munching on shrooms.

Seriously, though, I'm in no rush to return, but I can see how many people have made this their weekend staple.

text: Went to Blake's for my birthday ... Had a blast!  I can't speak on the food because we didn't eat, but everything else was great.  No cover charge, crowd was lively, the music was pumping, and the show was fantastic!  Definitely a place to return to.

text: I'm typically not a fan of Blake's; however, I ended up there last night...... first time I have ever been to Blake's on a week day.  (The things we do for friends!)  The doorman at the back entrance with friendly and chatty.  The bartenders were nice.  And, there was karaoke, which was very entertaining.  I just wish the bar would go smokeless!

text:
its yelp best practice really is to try a place multiple times before writing a review...

yeah, i like blakes.. theres never a cover and always a crowd. the drag shows are always fun and i always have a good time with my friends. the layout of the bar is pretty nice and their drinks are cheap and strong!!..which is very important. occasionally you may even get some free shots on a slow night like tuesday..lol 

the drag shows are always the best on the weekends..but its so crowded you cant even move sometimes. no complaints..

text:
Blake's On The Park is your standard destination LGBT friendly bar over in Midtown. It's easy to find over on 10th and Piedmont with the infamous rainbow crosswalks. 

This place has an upstairs, outdoors patio for smoking and a downstairs. All areas are equipped with a full bar except the outdoor patio, but it's a solid place. There are a few places to snag seating if you need to give your feet a rest, but be ready to be back-to-back packed in this place on your typical Saturday night. 

They also have drag queens come and put on performances as well throughout the night which is fun. This place is a solid time and a decent spot all around.

categories: Nightlife, Bars, Gay Bars, Sports Bars
text:
Yes, for all the reasons listed in the other reviews, Blake's is definitely a very popular destination for many of the folks living in and around midtown. :) 

I went for the first time tonight because they are the newest venue for Full House Holdem, with a Thursday night game. That, and a guy I play poker with at Smith's Olde Bar is the kitchen manager and has been talking it up for weeks. 

I started by ordering a drink. It was $6 which I thought was a little steep considering it was served in a little plastic cup, but it was quite strong, so I didn't mind. The food however was quite reasonably priced and very good! I had a basket of mini-burgers served with hand-made patties on fresh bread. Far superior to other bar food I've had around town (*cough*Smith's*cough*). My friend's wrap looked delicious too. The kitchen manager claims that the employees from the Jason's Deli across the street come to Blake's for sandwiches even though they serve them at their own restaurant. I'd believe that judging from the various sandwiches I saw other people eating.

The service was fantastic, our waiter was constantly coming by the table making sure we were all taken care of, and the bartenders were quick and friendly. The whole staff were very happy to have the poker crowd there, which is a definite contrast to some bars who tend to see them as an annoyance. I only saw the upstairs portion of the bar, which is just tables and a bar, but downstairs is supposed to be more of a nightclub vibe if that's what you are looking for.

categories: Nightlife, Bars, Gay Bars, Sports Bars
text:
I like Blake's.  I almost always have a great time here.  I only say "almost" because I had an altercation with a guy that decided to grab my ass 4 times one night.  He was drunk and it took me giving him a bloody nose for him to finally get the point that I wasn't interested.  Gotta love people that can't handle their alcohol!  SMH...

In my opinion Blake's is everyone's happy medium.  There is no specific race or class of people that dominate the scene here.  From experience I can attest to the fact that the Heretic is frequented mostly by white guys and Bulldogs, mostly black.  Nothing against those two clubs but Blake's attracts all guys; Black, White, Hispanic, Asian and a mixture of anything else out there.

There are two bars.  One upstairs and one downstairs.  The bar upstairs is a little more quiet and laid back.  Usually those disinterested in the drag shows remain on that level.  There is a patio on the top level as well.  The drag shows only take place downstairs and they are GREAT!  LaTisha Chantae Shuntal is my favorite!!!

The music is pretty good.  They play all types.

The drinks are strong and inexpensive.  The atmosphere is inviting.  There is NO cover charge!  

Parking can be a pain.  If you're coming with a large group you may want to carpool.  The parking lot belonging to Blake's is very small and fills quickly.  The alternative is to find parking on side streets or closed establishments with vacant parking lots nearby.

Blake's staff and bartenders are friendly and attentive.  The host or hostess for the night is usually pretty funny, no matter who it is.  I can always look forward to having a good laugh when I'm here.

The people, who are normally a fairly attractive bunch can be a little touchy-feely at times but for the most part it's harmless.  

A good time to be had here!  Enjoy!

text: This place is so much fun! The drag shows are everything. The only issue I have is that the drag shows are done in a rather cramped area because it gets so crowded at  Burkhart's you can watch the show from upstairs but Blake's isn't set up for that. Nevertheless, it's really fun! My gay bf and I (straight chick) come a couple times a month and we always have a good time. Everyone is really nice I haven't had not one issue with a bartender telling me to move or refusing to serve me. I just wish Blake's was bigger. Go you'll have a fun time (especially if you see the drag show!).

text:
I LOVE Blake's!  

The drag shows are awesome!!!  The bartenders are so sweet and always get my drinks right...make 'em strong!  Being a straight girl, or maybe just a girl in general, I never have to pay for drinks here it seems, random people just start offering, which may be weird at a straight bar but here it was the coolest and sweetest thing ever!

I have been here a few times with my cousin and his friends.  It is a nice, chill place with good music.  I love all the people that come here, so fun and friendly.  A good bar to go to if you are in ATL.

Parking can be a pain though, only downfall.

categories: Nightlife, Bars, Gay Bars, Sports Bars
text:
It hurts me to write this, but as the Duke of Blake's on the Park I feel the responsibility to speak up.

It kinda sucks here now. Maybe I'm just having a bad day. Maybe I'm just getting older (I'll be 30 in November). Maybe... well, maybe I'm right.

Anyway, they don't open until 3 PM on weekdays, so it takes that much longer to get things going. Blake's has always been my go-to spot for everything - especially when I want to have a cute time. Where's the first place I turn to when I need to get cheered up on a Monday afternoon? Blake's.

Now it's lost its luster. Nights are still interesting, somewhat... They install a stage for the drag shows now (no more worrying about walking through the show, not that I was ever that disrespectful). I'm not sure that made things better except that now folks in the back can see.

categories: Nightlife, Bars, Gay Bars, Sports Bars
text:
Ah, Blake's.  It's probably the first gay bar visited by a new comer to Atlanta.  And that says a lot about Blake's - it's a mainstay, and it attracts a generic and diverse enough crowd to please anyone before they start branching out to more "specialized" locales like Jungle, Hoedown's, wetBAR, Heretic, and the like.

Blake's recent renovation of their upstairs area has turned the space into a more open lay out, with a nice central square bar, and large picture windows to...well, the parking lot.  But it's a nice feel.  However, it's a stark contrast from the dark wood downstairs, with a neutral paint scheme on drywall and some thoughtfully directed lights.  So Blake's is now a bar with two vibes - a little more "big metro" upstairs, and more "neighborhood" downstairs.

But the drinks are good, the bartenders nice, and the space cozy enough and large enough to accommodate everyone.  Blake's is definitely the spot of choice to either start a wild night or have a more relaxed night out with a few friends.

text: I meet friends here when they want to go. I live next door and after 22 years of being in the neighborhood the bar staff and employees are fantastic. Now let me speak to the gay youth of today. The older gays of our society blazed the way for you to have a great place like Blake's to hangout at without judgement, fear, or shame. Have some respect and pride for ALL the people around you.

text: There's a bartender here by the name of Andrea.  She looks like fresh breathe and tastes like Jesus.  She's Canadian by way of Valhalla.  When she talks to you your abs get tighter, you grow in all the right places, everything sounds better and you're reminded that God indeed has a clue.  She turns the knees to Jelly.  She turns ones words into slurs and basically makes a man, gay or straight, feel like he's in the 7th grade all over again.  I've never been to this place but if Andrea works here then the place kicks f'n Ass!

name: Blake's On The Park
attributes: {'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'HasTV': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'very_loud'", 'GoodForDancing': 'True', 'WiFi': "'free'", 'BestNights': "{'monday': False, 'tuesday': False, 'friday': True, 'wednesday': False, 'thursday': False, 'sunday': True, 'saturday': True}", 'Music': "{'dj': True, 'background_music': False, 'no_music': False, 'jukebox': False, 'live': None, 'video': False, 'karaoke': False}", 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': None, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': None}"}
categories: Nightlife, Bars, Gay Bars, Sports Bars
text:
My favorite bar and always a cute time.  Sometimes I'll go there with friends, or go alone, or go for Happy Hour, or even meet new people.  Lots of cute guys (and women) with a very friendly bar staff.  Forest, Dan, Jason, Doug, and Michael are great (not that I go very often *ahem*) and get through the drink line pretty quickly.

There is always something to do whether it's trivia, a drag show, or Bingo with Bubba on Friday.  For those Yelpers that said that people were rude or that it was too cruisy, try to talk to someone new.  I've never had a problem making a new friend or acquaintance... and somehow managed not to hook up with them.

They have a pretty good menu, too.  I love the cheeseburger. Oh - please don't walk through the stage area during a show.  The entertainers do not appreciate it or think that it is cute. :)

name: Blake's On The Park
attributes: {'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'HasTV': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'very_loud'", 'GoodForDancing': 'True', 'WiFi': "'free'", 'BestNights': "{'monday': False, 'tuesday': False, 'friday': True, 'wednesday': False, 'thursday': False, 'sunday': True, 'saturday': True}", 'Music': "{'dj': True, 'background_music': False, 'no_music': False, 'jukebox': False, 'live': None, 'video': False, 'karaoke': False}", 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': None, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': None}"}
categories: Nightlife, Bars, Gay Bars, Sports Bars
text:
Being a bit of a weho ho in socal (check my list), I had been waiting to check out some gay bars out in the area. Hearing great reviews of the place, we came here this past Friday night for a few drinks after my birthday dinner. Upon arrival, the parking lot was packed! A bit crazy, especially since we thought we were arriving at a pretty decent hour. There's parking on the side streets with a bit of searching.

Loved that there was no cover and the line speeds along pretty quickly. The place gets pretty packed, but luckily for two levels and an outdoor patio, mobility is not really an issue. The bartenders are really nice and you can get your drinks pretty quickly. DON'T be deceived by the size of the plastic cups - that just means the alcohol is highly concentrated. 

Downstairs a drag show was going on which was a bit lackluster than what I had anticipated. Maybe a rough night? tough crowd? too many Rihanna ballads? Who knows? Didn't phase me too much, as I'm sure I'll be back here again in the very near future *cough Kathleen Cough*

BTW, where are the gaysians at? I need friends! =P

categories: Nightlife, Bars, Gay Bars, Sports Bars
text:
I'm straight but I live in Midtown so I thought it'd be a shame if I didn't experience an Atlanta gay bar just once.  I decided to go with 3 of my girl friends so I could claim legitimate heterosexuality on demand.

Didn't work so much, I wound up getting hit on 3 times in 10 minutes even with my buffer girls around.  Perhaps the whole asian fetish thing extends to gay men as well?  Who knew i'd be such a hot commodity (not really).

Anyway the drag show was pretty funny and it was a pretty cool atmosphere.  Drinks were good, bartenders were quick and attentive.  I'd be willing to go again with some of my lesbian friends, although they also need to take me to a lesbian bar so i can see what that's like.

we went here on a Wednesday night, which meant it was a drag queen night. oh how fun it was to see all the diva's workin' it... 

the "stage" is very small, make sure when they tell you to move, you find a nice comfy spot and get ready for a show.

bring lots of dollar bills !!!

name: Blake's On The Park
attributes: {'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'HasTV': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'very_loud'", 'GoodForDancing': 'True', 'WiFi': "'free'", 'BestNights': "{'monday': False, 'tuesday': False, 'friday': True, 'wednesday': False, 'thursday': False, 'sunday': True, 'saturday': True}", 'Music': "{'dj': True, 'background_music': False, 'no_music': False, 'jukebox': False, 'live': None, 'video': False, 'karaoke': False}", 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': None, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': None}"}
categories: Nightlife, Bars, Gay Bars, Sports Bars
text:
Weird how I walk into a gay bar and feel more insecure than I have ever felt anywhere else. Maybe it was the fact that it was a Monday night. Nobody likes Mondays. 

I'm definitely the outcast/minority... especially walking in with a group of four other straight girls. All eyes on us. Burning. "What do THEY think they're doing here?" Sigh. My mind is probably overactive and I am overreacting. 

However as we get settled in and order some drinks I am feeling good and more at home. Have a few conversations here and there, even get in a little dance move or two, take some pictures-- but let's face it-- it's a meat market and I am the grade D cube steak. 

Oops, self esteem drops another 10 points as soon as the drag show gets under way. Why do they all look exponentially better than I do? Why isn't my ass that perky? I want to dance and twirl too. Really, the truth is that I am entranced. I don't want it to end. I love the hood white girl with the big ass. I want to watch her shake it all night long. She let me touch it. I almost got electrocuted. 

In summation... I had a great time at Blake's. Drag show is six days a week, you can't beat that! I will be returning for sure and will aim for a weekend night. Because nobody likes Mondays.

name: Blake's On The Park
attributes: {'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'HasTV': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'very_loud'", 'GoodForDancing': 'True', 'WiFi': "'free'", 'BestNights': "{'monday': False, 'tuesday': False, 'friday': True, 'wednesday': False, 'thursday': False, 'sunday': True, 'saturday': True}", 'Music': "{'dj': True, 'background_music': False, 'no_music': False, 'jukebox': False, 'live': None, 'video': False, 'karaoke': False}", 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': None, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': None}"}
categories: Nightlife, Bars, Gay Bars, Sports Bars
text:
Hmm, well, if you are in the mood to for a little "stand and model" with your drink, do go here!

For those who aren't familiar with the "stand and model" concept, let me break it down for you.  Basically, you stand in the tightest pair of jeans you own, unapproachable of course, nose cocked ever so slightly in the air, and then pretend that your shiz doesn't smell.

The only saving grace of this bar, is the "Cheers" like feel of the bar, the cheap stiff drinks and the nice bartenders who call you baby while they pour.  I would like to say that everyone here knows my name, but truthfully, many of the imbibing patrons could care less.

Bummer.

text: Left my credit card by mistake on Sunday evening, called and spoke with the manager who said I could come get it the next day. Arrived the next day in the evening exhausted after working a double but the manager wasn't there at that time as he was out running an errand. The staff came through for me by getting the owner on the phone and getting me my card out of the safe so I didn't have to make a return trip. Top notch and friendly service every visit, every time. 5 stars! Thanks guys.

name: Pickens, Jewelers
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BikeParking': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'WheelchairAccessible': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False'}
categories: Local Services, Shopping, Jewelry, Jewelry Repair, Watch Repair
text:
Pickens, Inc is a small, family-owned & run business that provides the perfect personal touch when selecting/creating your jewelry. 

I went to Pickens to have them create a stackable ring to go with one I already had and model it after a friend's beautiful Tiffany ring. I already had a piece of jewelry to provide the white gold & diamonds, but needed an expert jeweler to bring the piece to life. He did - it's beautiful and was a gift to myself for completing my MBA.

I also purchased a beautiful diamond & black enamel Hildago ring from them at the same time, which was on sale and extremely reasonably priced! 

I'll be back when I'm ready to commemorate the next big occasion in my life, whatever & whenever that may be!

name: Pickens, Jewelers
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BikeParking': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'WheelchairAccessible': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False'}
categories: Local Services, Shopping, Jewelry, Jewelry Repair, Watch Repair
text: Horrible Customer Service.  I brought my wedding ring in to have the shank repaired a few months back and dealt with Hays.  He told me it could be fixed without putting another shank on it.  I was told I would receive a call when It was ready.  That call did not come so I followed up with them and picked it up.  After a few months, the fit was loose and there was entirely too much play in the shank.  I took it back to Hays and he agreed and said they would fix it again.  I received a call when it was ready; to my dismay, it was exactly in the same condition as when I dropped it off a few days earlier.  When I questioned Walter's wife why it was not checked for a tight fit prior to picking it up, she got defensive with me.  Hays then came out and took full responsibility for the situation and promised they would make it right, which I thanked him for doing.  I then received a call later that day from his father, Walter, who was a total jerk on the phone with me and started to disparage the shank and how it was not done correctly to begin with, etc. He said he would speak to the jeweler and to give him 24 hours. He called and said the ring was ready to be picked up without explaining what was done.  I had to ask and he was very short with me.  Upon picking up the ring,  a blonde lady waited on me and I told her I would probably need to speak with Hays, who saw me, nodded his head, and went back to working on the computer.  I then received an eye roll from the lady when I asked for documentation that there was a warranty of one year from the second time it was fixed.  DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH THESE PEOPLE - THEY ARE CLUELESS ABOUT CUSTOMER SERVICE, NOT TO MENTION THE SHODDY REPAIR WORK.

name: Pickens, Jewelers
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BikeParking': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'WheelchairAccessible': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False'}
categories: Local Services, Shopping, Jewelry, Jewelry Repair, Watch Repair
text: TAKE YOUR JEWELRY REPAIRS ELSEWHERE!  This business is NOT to be trusted.  They will tell you one price when you drop off your jewelry repairs, then when it is time for you to pick up your jewelry the price will be 30-40% higher than the original quote.  If you refuse to pay the higher price, they won't give you back your jewelry!  What a scam!  Do not fall for it like I did.  Walter Pickens is a true scam artist.

name: MARTA - Doraville Station
categories: Train Stations, Trains, Hotels & Travel, Transportation, Public Transportation
text:
"This is the end of the Gold Line..." and everyone rush to the park and ride lots to get their cars to continue their journey home. I am one of them. Apart from all those gas and CO2 reduction talks, parking here and ride MARTA to downtown (in my case, Georgia Tech) saves tons of time in the AM and PM peak hours. That 85/400 merge is a congestion monster. Other than pulling a doll next to my car seat for HOV, MARTA makes the most sense.

The park and ride trend here is fun. There are 2 open lots with about 75-100 spaces in total, and 1 big gated lot and deck with god-knows-how-many spaces. EVERYONE would circle the open lots first to see if there are spaces. Well at least I did that since it is way closer than walking to the deck. My successful percentage is about 75% so it's pretty good. Sometimes even they are full, people just park on the grass. But my caution to you is DO NOT park at those Kiss-and-ride spaces. I saw tickets being given on one day. Yes, one day out of n days.

I did also took the bus up to Duluth once. I took Gwinnett Bus 10 back to Sugarloaf Park and ride. Oh man that took 1 hour and I believe I got charged another $2.50 even though they said free connection. So, never again.

name: MARTA - Doraville Station
categories: Train Stations, Trains, Hotels & Travel, Transportation, Public Transportation
text: Elevator smells funny and there were people wondering around, not sure what to make if that. They have a big car park so that's a plus

name: MARTA - Doraville Station
categories: Train Stations, Trains, Hotels & Travel, Transportation, Public Transportation
text:
I used this MARTA Station all the time when I worked in Atlanta, it was my commute beginning point. While most MARTA stops aren't fantastic, this one really could use some work. 

First, they close the restrooms and some awful time like 7 PM. You would think that a good portion of public transportation users are coming from work, hopping on the train, and going wherever. Wouldn't it make sense in the evenings to have restrooms available to these customers? Well, not at this location. You have to ride to another location and find open restrooms. Silly.

Also, if it is raining, you will not have a pleasant experience. While there is some level of shelter on the platform, it isn't walled at all, and so most rain can get in and drench you while you wait on the train. There are numerous instances where the train is sitting there waiting to depart, but the doors are closed and you can't board. This is also frustrating.

It seems that the stops at the ends of the lines are the worst, and this one isn't very good.

name: MARTA - Doraville Station
categories: Train Stations, Trains, Hotels & Travel, Transportation, Public Transportation
text: This station has plenty of parking and cleaner than the other stations, but mornings can get rough. There is security on site so no need to feel unsafe, but as with all public transportation it's going to smell like urine. On a side note, just make sure security is around because I did find a 9mm hollow point bullet randomly in the parking lot. Of course this is ATL so nothing out of the norm.

name: MARTA - Doraville Station
categories: Train Stations, Trains, Hotels & Travel, Transportation, Public Transportation
text:
When using public transportation you never know if the trains will be on time, will it be dirty, is there anyone to help if there are questions, these are some the things we ask ourselves so let me clear up a few things.

The Station - Is relatively clean and you will see people sweeping or picking up things when needed.

Parking - Two different lots are available a small one directly in front of the station and on the left a large parking area with a deck. Day parking and long term are available as long as your car is parked under 24 hours parking is free otherwise a fee of $ 8.00 a day will be charged, loose that ticket and you could be charged $ 60.00.

Questions - Sadly there is not a person available for questions about schedules or train times, if you can find a person who works there they will tell you to "go to Marta on the go."

Security - A person that shall remain nameless was riding the train this week and happened to be riding in a train with no cameras and was placed in a horrible situation, they dialed 911 the train was stopped before it got to the next station and the man arrested. 

Summary - Keep your eyes open and be aware of your surroundings at all times, remember that there are rules when riding Marta and if you don't follow them they can bounce you off that train and ban you permanently. Ride safely.

name: Great Wraps
attributes: {'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': False}", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': False, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True'}
categories: Food, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks, Sandwiches, Juice Bars & Smoothies
text: Wow!  After perusing the restaurants at the mall, I was happy to run into Great Wraps.  A staff member was standing in front offering free samples.  I had the sample then spotted the menu.  There, I saw the Spicy Chipotle Wrap.  I was pretty hungry and excited to have seen the menu, decided what I wanted, and ordered within a matter of a few minutes.  Shortly afterward, my number was called.  I sat down with the family and thoroughly enjoyed the warm wrap filled with grilled chicken, pepper jack, black bean & corn salsa, grilled onions, lettuce & creamy adobo.  Today, however, I checked the menu online and see that this was 730 calories.  I am okay with this number because the wrap tasted delightful!  When you are taking in calories of this number at one meal, it should make you happy, and it did.

I may try the wraps but I don't think that I'll have their Philly Cheesesteaks again. I've had far better elsewhere.

name: The Posh Spot
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'WheelchairAccessible': 'True', 'AcceptsInsurance': 'False'}
categories: Waxing, Hair Removal, Skin Care, Eyelash Service, Beauty & Spas, Massage, Nail Salons, Day Spas
text:
Man, this place is awesome.

I'm  directionally challenged, so for my fellow "suck at directions" ladies/gents, do not go into the garage to park here, if you can help it. I had the hardest time trying to find The Posh Spot from the garage. LOL! Make sure you turn at the QT, as if you're going into the apartment complex, THEN make a right into the plaza. You can park right in front of Posh Spot there. I listened to my GPS, which told me to make a right before I got to the QT, and... just... no. Don't do that. Make a right at the QT/apartment complex. 

Anywho, did I say this place was awesome? IT IS. I had a gift certificate to come here, and I finally decided to use it on my week off from work. I absolutely love going to nice places on weekdays, because it's not all crowded and dirty. It was very quiet and peaceful. I had Ms. Stephanie, who was running a few minutes late, just like me. So, that was no big deal at all. She got started right away on my "Perfectly Posh Signature Pedi" with added Whipped Shea Masque- which lasted a tad bit over an hour. 

She was very gentle and thorough, not rushy at all. I love how the chairs sit high and elevated above the floor. It's as if you're walking onto a throne of some sort to get your toes done. ;) One of my favorite parts was when Stephanie put some lemony smelling scrub? on my feet and then put them inside of a heating pocket for about 5-10 minutes or so. I'm sure that contributed to my feet feeling like a baby's bootay afterwards. The leg/foot massage was awesome, as well. 

The prices are not too shabby, a little bit above the regular ol nail salons, but it's worth it. Plus they offer so much more here! I'll definitely be coming back on my next off day! 2 weeks later and my color hasn't chipped yet- nice.

name: The Posh Spot
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'WheelchairAccessible': 'True', 'AcceptsInsurance': 'False'}
categories: Waxing, Hair Removal, Skin Care, Eyelash Service, Beauty & Spas, Massage, Nail Salons, Day Spas
text:
My roommate from college and I were on a girls weekend in Atlanta and decided to go to The Posh Spot for a facial and a massage.  WHAT AN EXPERIENCE!!  Everything was amazing.... from the courtesy the receptionist showed for some concerns I had and really put my mind at ease, to accommodating our desire to have appointments together even though we were coming for different services, to our AMAZING service providers, Amy and Prince!

I had never had a facial before and Amy could not have been more wonderful.  She took time to explain how things worked with facials and what each step of the process was going to do for my skin. She recommended things I could do to improve the overall quality of my skin and did not perform unnecessary or costly treatments I didn't need.  I was fairly anxious when the process started but by the end of my treatment, I was completely relaxed and wished it would continue!

Prince was wonderful with my roommate.  He is rated one of the top 25 masseuses in Atlanta and earned every bit of his ranking.  She said she was so relaxed, she actually fell asleep!  He was just what the doctor ordered for her!

Sadly, neither of us lives in Atlanta but if I could figure out a way to bring the equipment and service providers to Philly - I would do it in a heartbeat.  This place is a real gem and prices were reasonable for the services and the area.

name: The Posh Spot
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'WheelchairAccessible': 'True', 'AcceptsInsurance': 'False'}
categories: Waxing, Hair Removal, Skin Care, Eyelash Service, Beauty & Spas, Massage, Nail Salons, Day Spas
text:
Honestly, it was just ok. For a $40 ($48 with tip!) pedi I expected it would be above par and it wasn't any more special than going down the street to one of my local places. 

My tech was running behind and the receptionist kept me updated and offered me water.  She helped me pick a nice spring color after I told her what event I was attending. The tech was super nice and spoke English but I definitely had some concerns.  There was no trimming of cuticles or other skin around the toes. I told her twice it had been 6 months since I had a pedicure due to an injury-pretty sure I needed a complete overhaul. (I later went home and did it myself.) The polish was gummed up and nasty. She tried to smooth it out as best as possible but I knew it would never last. Here I am a week later and polish is chipping and heaped up around the edges of my nail. 

I think the thing that got me the most and should have been a red flag was that they ask you for a credit card up front. Maybe they've had a lot of no-shows and that protects them but really, it's just tacky. I won't be back.

name: The Posh Spot
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'WheelchairAccessible': 'True', 'AcceptsInsurance': 'False'}
categories: Waxing, Hair Removal, Skin Care, Eyelash Service, Beauty & Spas, Massage, Nail Salons, Day Spas
text:
Careful booking online! I had booked online and called them twice the same day I scheduled online to conform but no answer.  Scheduled a basic manicure and was contacted that day to reschedule "I don't know how you got on the schedule but it's screwed up the schedule and I don't think I have anyone" I'm going out if town for a funeral. The lady said she would call me back soon. Took 3-4 hrs to contact me At this point I had already needed to make other plans since I needed to leave out of town. When I told them to forget the appt  since it took hours to contact me; they had the NERVE to say they would charge cancellation fee!!

You do not tell a customer that them booking an appointment "screwed up their day today" and then ask to reschedule only to charge cancellation fee because your business could not accommodate and certainly not in a timely manner. It should not take hours to decide if you can or cannot accommodate a client.

I still would have returned on Friday for a Pedicure had they not charged me a fee for cancellation because of THEIR screw up. Unfortunately I will not recommend this place and will not return. Not that I even got the opportunity to be a new client in the first place.

name: The Posh Spot
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'WheelchairAccessible': 'True', 'AcceptsInsurance': 'False'}
categories: Waxing, Hair Removal, Skin Care, Eyelash Service, Beauty & Spas, Massage, Nail Salons, Day Spas
text:
I have been to The Posh Spot a few times whenever I want to schedule some 'me time'. My first experience was a manicure and pedicure with a facial a few years ago. Today I went to my Brazilian wax appointment and my esthetician was Cameron. 
   Cameron is AWESOME! I agree with one of the other Yelpers who left a review saying that she couldn't recommend her enough. I believe Cameron is the only person who does waxing here, but I've also scheduled facials with her as well. I love how she asks you about your skin and explains which products she's going to use on you and how it'll benefit your skin. Towards the end of your facial, you get a mini neck and shoulder massage that feels great. Every time she does my facials, my skin looks refreshed and rejuvenated. 
   As far as Brazilian waxing , Cameron is the only person I trust to do it. No matter which side of town I live on, I always go back to her. My very first experience at some spot in Marietta a few years ago was horrible, so to have someone like Cameron be thorough and calming is a relief. She's also funny, too, as we talk about everything from reality tv shows to music to sports. Helps you not think too much of the pain of waxing, lol. 
    I've had a manicure and pedicure here before, as well as a massage. Honestly, after a few days the nail polish started chipping. I'll stick to Glam Nails on Paces Ferry near The Posh Spot for manicures and pedicures. As for the massage that I got a few months ago, Rebekah was good. Make sure to tell the masseuse how hard or how soft to go before they get started, though. 
    If I had to give a con, it would be that at times, you can hear the talking of the other patrons in the building while getting massages or facials, etc, in the separate rooms. Nothing annoying or anything that could completely take away from your relaxation, though. 
    I can honestly say that this is a great place to visit. It's affordable, provides a nice atmosphere, and the ladies working there are professional and friendly. 


#Yelp100

text: AMAZING. Shabrika knows her stuff. My mani pedi was flawless. And it is an upscale spa without being snobbish. I will drive for this place, it is my new fave.

name: The Posh Spot
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'WheelchairAccessible': 'True', 'AcceptsInsurance': 'False'}
categories: Waxing, Hair Removal, Skin Care, Eyelash Service, Beauty & Spas, Massage, Nail Salons, Day Spas
text:
Beth was awesome!  This was one of the best mani/pedis I have ever had.  I'm very picky about my manicure, and one of my pet peeves is when the manicurist doesn't polish the sides of my nails.  I have oddly shaped nails, so most people miss the sides.  Beth polished them all the way to the sides without me even pointing it out to her.  She was so precise and made sure every single nail looked perfect.  She's also a lot of fun to talk to.  She made me feel like we were old friends just chatting away.  Will definitely go back and ask for Beth.

Also, I must mention the decor and other little details that made The Posh Spot stand out in my opinion.  When I called to make my appointment, I gave my email address and by the time I got back home, I had received an email thanking me for coming and providing a breakdown of my services and telling me which person did my manicure.  Very personalized!  The space is just beautiful.  It's decorated in warm colors that are relaxing to the senses.  The lighting is nice and calming and not bright and busy-feeling.  The pedicure seats are elevated and very roomy with pretty throw pillows for your back.  Even the bowls where they rinse your feet are pretty and chic.

Anyone can do a good mani/pedi, but my entire experience from the time a called to make an appointment bring the following words to mind . . . upscale, professional, detail-oriented, special, and well "posh".  I agree with the other poster who said it was upscale without being snooty.  And the price is definitely good for the quality of service you get.

This is going to be my new favorite spa!

name: The Posh Spot

text:
I discovered this little gem of a spa thanks to Groupon. I had an aromatherapy mani/pedi and it was great. First off, the decor is lovely--a kind of nouveau Asian. As your feet soak in warm, fragrant water, you are given the option of a warm, lavender-scented neck pillow to help you relax. Take it! Katie was my technician and had lovely, soothing hands. She did my feet first, then my hands, which I appreciated. There is nothing worse then trying to enjoy a pedicure while a manicurist is asking you to contort your body so they can work on your hands. 
I loved the foot and hand scrubs they used. I walked out feeling like a million bucks despite the pouring rain. It's a little pricey, but can you really put a price on pampering?

name: The Posh Spot
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'WheelchairAccessible': 'True', 'AcceptsInsurance': 'False'}

text: Unknowingly, I walked into the salon 25 minutes until closing time and asked for a mani-pedi.  She told me it wasn't possible since they closed at 7:00 (it was 6:35) and could I come back tomorrow.  I told her I was leaving town and could I just get one or the other...whichever one would take the least amount of time.  She said no that wouldn't be possible.  Seriously???  I'm respectful of people's time but when you work in the service industry (as I did for many many years) you don't always punch out exactly when you expect.  They may have had to stay an extra 10 minutes.  That's like going into a restaurant 25 min before they close and being turned away.  BAD BUSINESS period.  I just began working in the area and was hoping this could be my new salon but I definitely won't be back.

text: The Posh Spot is a gem of a spa in The Vinings. It is more of a spa than a nail salon offering a variety of services from mani/pedis to massages and facials to laser hair removal. The atmosphere is very relaxing and they have amazing customer service. When you walk in, the ambiance immediately relaxes you. I've never had to wait more than 5 minutes for my appointment. I primarily go for pedicures and the occasional eyebrow wax and more recently I've started laser hair removal. Amy works magic on my feet - and my feet are not very easy to work with LOL. Vee has been doing my eyebrows lately and she also does the laser hair removal. Both ladies are very professional and take pride in their work. Everyone I encounter at The Posh Spot is very professional and they always address me by name. Yes, I pay a little more than a regular nail salon but it's worth it because I truly feel like I'm pampering myself every time I come here.

text: Definitely check out The Posh Spot!  My best friend found this little gem in Vinings - I'm here about every other week for a manicure with chipless polish.  The staff is friendly and the environment is so relaxing.  They offer a variety of services, such as massages, skincare, makeup, hair removal, etc.  This place is simple but sophisticated, everything is very clean & sanitary.  Typically I have trouble keeping gel polish on for the two week advertised time period, but because of the attention to detail that my nails receive here, I rarely have a nail chip (and when I do, it's because I've done something like biting my nails, etc).  Come check them out!

text: I was on a work trip and desperately needed a mani pedi. I found the Posh Spot on Yelp, made an appointment and that same day received one of the most relaxing and well done mani pedi's I have had in a long time. Thank You Posh Spot for pampering this "girl on the go".

name: The Posh Spot
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'WheelchairAccessible': 'True', 'AcceptsInsurance': 'False'}
categories: Waxing, Hair Removal, Skin Care, Eyelash Service, Beauty & Spas, Massage, Nail Salons, Day Spas
text:
Let me first say that Wendy was very pleasant and patient during the process, but lets be real, this salon is hardly the place if you are looking for quality gel nail service.

This was my first and last visit because their inventory and manicurists are both in need of an upgrade.

When I scheduled my appointment I requested the Gel Nail service which included a manicure and soak off process.  I later called back to inform that I would not need the manicure and that the soak off and polish would be suffice.  The original price was quoted at $30.  They attempted to charge me $15 for the Soak Off alone????  I immediately addressed this and the receptionist tried to offer a very poor excuse that I simply refused to believe.  Even the top Salon and Spa's on both East and West coast charge only $5 - $10 max and me personally, She did reluctantly adjust my bill and did not say thank you nor offer any other piece of conversation once she was not able to justify the price gauge. (Final total $35 which is normal in Atlanta)

The spa was clean and the pedicure chairs were nice, but I need both to be top notch...the service and the interior and unfortunately, The Posh Spot did not live up to its name. Additionally,  prior to my visit, I inquired about their artwork capabilities and the receptionist informed me that they were able to provide the service.  As I was selecting my nail colors with Wendy and showing her a few images of artwork that I was interested in having done, she informed me that other than multiple colors (ombre style) on the nails that the other things could not be done

If you want gel nail service with art work and I mean something as simple as a line  THIS IS NOT THE PLACE.

name: The Posh Spot
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'WheelchairAccessible': 'True', 'AcceptsInsurance': 'False'}
categories: Waxing, Hair Removal, Skin Care, Eyelash Service, Beauty & Spas, Massage, Nail Salons, Day Spas
text: This place is awesome.  Everything is very nicely decorated and clean. They offer you a warm neck pillow and hot tea with your mani pedi. My nail girl did an awesome job. She really paid attention to detail. My only complaints were that when she went to the back area, she was gone wayy too long. She also took longer than an hour, making me late for my massage. My massage was also spectacular, one of the best I've had. Yoshi is awesome. Only complaint there was that the walls are very thin and I could hear staff conversations during my massage. Also, took awhile for the massage to begin once i was shown to the room. it did not run longer than 90 mins to make up for my delayed time from the pedicure taking longer than expected. My 90 min massage was cut atleast 20 mins short. If it weren't for this, I would have given this place 5 stars. I will definitely be back.

name: The Posh Spot
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'WheelchairAccessible': 'True', 'AcceptsInsurance': 'False'}

text: Decided to use my spa finder gift card here and I was extremely pleased. I will definitely be back. I love the decor and my services (mani/pedi) were awesome.

name: The Posh Spot
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'WheelchairAccessible': 'True', 'AcceptsInsurance': 'False'}
categories: Waxing, Hair Removal, Skin Care, Eyelash Service, Beauty & Spas, Massage, Nail Salons, Day Spas
text: 200 dollars and a failed facial/mani/pedi later my face is still bright red, my toenail still hurts and my feet feel more rough that before I walked in.......not to mention the sheer amount of guilt and attitude the receptionist through at my because I had to leave early to pick up my husband. When they sign people up for new services they should perhaps tell you you're going to be there for 4+ hours..........

name: The Posh Spot
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'WheelchairAccessible': 'True', 'AcceptsInsurance': 'False'}
categories: Waxing, Hair Removal, Skin Care, Eyelash Service, Beauty & Spas, Massage, Nail Salons, Day Spas
text: The Posh Spot is so awesome! The customer service was the best.  The nail technicians were awesome and I received the most relaxing (and much needed) massage. The decor is fabulous and I loved the pedicure stations. I got the chipless manicure for the first time and it really lasted longer than a regular manicure without chipping. I thought the prices were suitable for the services rendered and for such a nice place.  If you want the old run of the mill nail salon, the Posh Spot is not for you. If you like a "posh" kind of environment with awesome service then you should definitely try the Posh Spot. The only downside is that they don't have another location in DC/MD/VA where I live...bummer!

name: The Posh Spot
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'WheelchairAccessible': 'True', 'AcceptsInsurance': 'False'}
categories: Waxing, Hair Removal, Skin Care, Eyelash Service, Beauty & Spas, Massage, Nail Salons, Day Spas
text:
After reading so many great reviews on yelp I went to Posh Spot during my lunch break for a chipless manicure. I saw online that this service cost $30, and was excited because that is inline with other stores and it is so convenient to my work! Little did I know that to have my old gel nail removed, the cost was $20, so my bill for a chipless manicure was $50! In my book that is prohibitively expense as the "soak off" of the old gel nail is usually free at other salons. In addition, note that the $50 manicure doesn't even include a massage, or any type of lotion.

While the decor and staff was nice, I will not be returning because of the price.

categories: Automotive, Auto Repair, Oil Change Stations, Gas Stations
text: My truck blew a couple tie rods. Had my truck towed here unannounced. They were professional, and took care of me within the day. I felt the price was reasonable, and will bring my business here again.

name: Camp Automotive
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Automotive, Auto Repair, Oil Change Stations, Gas Stations
text: I drove over a nail and heard a loud burst from my tire. My coworker recommended this shop stating how courtesy and professional they are. I arrived about 11:50 am and they were headed to lunch, however they saw the panic in my face and quickly assisted me and even went to pick my tire up. I now have a new auto shop. Thank God for courtesy and honest mechanics!!!

name: Camp Automotive
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Automotive, Auto Repair, Oil Change Stations, Gas Stations
text: I was in Atlanta this summer and my car started making some really weird noises. My friend recommended I go to Camp's to get it checked out. Jimmy was very helpful, however it took three times and almost $1,000 to fix the problem. Every time I would go pick it up, I'd drive for about five minutes and the sound would come back. While the staff was great, I was without my car for almost a month, nearly the entire time I was in Atlanta... I suppose it's a good spot for routine maintenance, but you really have to be on top of them when it comes to more difficult work.

name: Camp Automotive
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Automotive, Auto Repair, Oil Change Stations, Gas Stations
text:
The worse service I've ever experience.

These guys really truly don't care about the customer at all.

Brent charged me $50 to do an estimate on a new power steering pump. He gave me the estimate and when I brought it back to get the work done, he said that he threw the paperwork away and would need to redo the estimate.

He kept my car all day and never even touched it. it just sat on his lot hile I was being charge $40 per day for a rental.

This place is terrible. I wouldn't say that they are scam artists, they just don't care about the customer at all.

The other guy who works there is Robert. He's a lot more honest than Brent, but I think Brent owns the place. 

The mechanics seem to be good guys. But honestly, I would definitley pay a few dollars more and take your car somewhere else.

categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Italian, Pizza
text: Ordered wings and pizza at 6:30pm, one hour delivery time, self generated times are approximate, understandable. 7:45pm we call to make sure it's on the way. They say it's out for delivery. Wait till 8:30, no food yet. 8:45pm, call again, and we're informed we were called "a bunch of times" and no one answered so the order was canceled. Checked my phone, one missed call, no voicemail. Asked if we'd like to re order, no thank you. Won't be ordering from this location again.

name: Pizza Hut
attributes: {'NoiseLevel': "'quiet'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Caters': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'Alcohol': "u'none'", 'HasTV': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'WiFi': "'no'", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1'}
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Italian, Pizza
text:
This place has to have the worst customer service in Columbus! Ordered pizzas and wings for a birthday party Saturday night, web site stated 60-70 min delivery but after placing the order it was shown with a 2 hour delivery. 
When delivery showed up the order was not complete and we were told by the drive that he would have to go back and get the missing part of the order, after another hour I reached out to the store and asked to speak with a manager and I was hung up on. This for sure didn't make me in a better mood and I called back and was now told that they did make the missing part of the order but unfortunately it was dropped on the floor and they were now out of that particular crust, at this point I asked them not to deliver anything else. 
It was the first time I tried to order from here and for sure the last. We will go back to Marcos's and Donato's as they actually offer you customer service.

attributes: {'NoiseLevel': "'quiet'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Caters': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'Alcohol': "u'none'", 'HasTV': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'WiFi': "'no'", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1'}
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Italian, Pizza
text: Pizza Hut was so good in my youth, what happened? Ordered online, and nothing was right. Well done crust? Nope. Extra cheese? If there are large, naked spots of sauce, then that isn't even the adequate normal cheese topping, let alone extra. And to top it off, we made it for delivery (yes, it was 10ish to be delivered at 11:30, but the business closes at 12midnight) and I get a call: our delivery guy had a family emergency and left early, can you do carry out instead?  My husband goes to pick it up, and the delivery guy, with sign on his car and all, is sitting in his car in the parking lot. Needless to say, we will never order here again.

name: Pizza Hut
attributes: {'NoiseLevel': "'quiet'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Caters': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'Alcohol': "u'none'", 'HasTV': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'WiFi': "'no'", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1'}
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Italian, Pizza
text:
Placed an order online around 7:00. Got the confirmation with a 3 hour delivery window. This being a Saturday night, I understand it might take a bit longer to get food out the door, but three hours is completely excessive. We called to cancel, didn't go through. Called again, it rang and then a creepy robot sound comes through the phone. Repeat with the same result. We literally called 10 times before actually speaking to someone. 

Get. It. Together. Pizza Hut!

text:
I dont usually rate fast food locations but I really, really enjoyed the service here. 

Just to be upfront, my orders usually turn out to be a bit complicated and confusing. So when I placed an order for carryout, my order got a bit mixed up...but the person at the counter who was taking care of me was so apologetic and sincere about making a whole new pie for me.

Didnt have to wait too long for the correct order and will most definitely be ordering from here again! :)

text:
Ordering from this location has been the worst decision we have made in awhile. We ordered a pizza online at 9:15pm and we did not receive it until 11pm. Over 45 mins late from the predicted time. We were told the driver was "on his way" 50 mins before receiving the Pizza.When calling to check, the employee on the road was extremely rude and gave excuses instead of a solution. 

When we finally got the Pizza it wasn't the correct order (didn't give stuffed crust) and was cold. 

I do not write one-star reviews often but this experience with this location was truly awful. Next time I'll try the other westerville location.
