categories: Food, Pizza, Restaurants
text:
Go up route one, get off on Lowell street heading east, get to the first set of lights across from the high school and Temple Beth Shalom into the little strip mall where you'll see Levines and some store that sells ballet shoes and there it is:

The best pizza on the North Shore.
(Santarpio's isn't on the North Shore so don't start)

They have been here for like 20 years and the pizza is awesome.
It's NY style . The service is also NY style but even if these guys are gruff they are still pretty cool. I order from here almost weekly.

It's take out or delivery and when your middle name is "pizza eating animal" like mine you know good Peetsa. 

Say Hi to Mr. G.   The G is for Gamboni or maybe Good or Great or
Gabbalabba. (I have no idea what the G is for. Ask them.)
Good Stuff,  oh the steak bomb rocks too.
over and out.

text: Tonight was the first and last time we will order from here. I called and ordered a large pepperoni and garlic pizza and a French fry. When I asked the girl the total she said yeah I will call you back!( with attitude) Yeah she never called me back with a total. The food gets here and the kid says $21.90 I was a little surprised at this but I was like whatever heard the food is good! Boy did I hear wrong the fries where barley cooked! They were hot but complete mush! The pizza was barley cooked! I must say that was not at worth my money and I will never order from here again!

text: My office ordered from Mr.G's and it took almost 2 hours for only 5 orders. We called about an hour in advance before lunch hour. All the hot food was cold and we had to call twice to see where our order was. I could not eat the salad because it was past my lunch time but i did eat later that day. I got a chef salad that was delishious. They were rude on the phone and said we could reject the order when it got there if we wanted... Im sorry but we wont order from this place anymore.

text: OK my wife stumbled across this place after my sons baseball game. The pizza was fantastic !  Why you ask ?  because it had taste. They must use a cheese blend with Cheddar and Mozzarella because this pizza was really tasty.  It tasted similar to a papa ginos sauce/ny style but with more taste. name: Salter School
categories: Specialty Schools, Massage Schools, Middle Schools & High Schools, Vocational & Technical School, Adult Education, Education, Elementary Schools
text:
I honestly had the worst experience of my life with massages tonight as did my friend. Not only did they not tell us to come early to fill out papers but we couldn't pay with a debit card either? (Which I was later informed, you could if u paid downstairs) beyond that fact the massage rooms were cold.. I had chills all over for the whole hour and not once did she offer to turn on the heating blanket. I ALSO spoke to a person earlier saying I like deep massages in my back only so I'm not sure if I should do a deep tissue or Swedish. They insisted deep. Due to that a hole was burned into both my arms and thighs. She would've noticed me trying to jump away from her fingers or tensing up if she wasn't talking EVERY SECOND IN THE ROOM. I truthfully know everything about this person. She honestly sounded nice but I should NOT be hearing about deaths and Aweful things about her life while I'm trying to RELAX. I barely spoke back and somehow the conversation just never stopped. I also verbally stated and physically wrote on my request sheet the MY BACK was my major concern and priority. She stated she wanted to save my back for last since I wanted it so bad. 45 minutes breaking my arms and legs and a little pressure on my back for 10 minutes. It was aweful. I could she was trying to avoid showing me I still had knots by lightly sliding up my back at the end when in reality I left in pain and more sore then ever. 

And if that wasn't enough... At the end of the session where you fill out the review of how they did it wasn't even in privacy. The secretary went home so it was our own personal massage person breathing in our ears watching us fill it out. Obviously I'm not going to write what I truly felt right to her face. It was just the worse experience. I left more stressed, shocked and in pain. I can truthfully say me and my friend HATED EVERY PART. And you can tell others feeling the same since they threw brothers in our face begging to get people to come. Thanks but no thanks. Never again.

name: Salter School
categories: Specialty Schools, Massage Schools, Middle Schools & High Schools, Vocational & Technical School, Adult Education, Education, Elementary Schools
text: I went there in 2009/2010  for Medical Billing. I was the oldest in my class, was never absent, was always early, got a 3.97GPA and when graduated was told "oh don't expect them to contribute to your FAMILY insurance you might get lucky and they pay for yours but not a family plan" .  WTH?  "OH and don't forget your base pay will be minimum till your experience goes up".  NOT what I was told when I applied.   BAD news was that I paid out of my savings in cash....WORST $15K I ever spent. Yes I did well in class but on interviews it was "oh you don't have the necessary experience, or how long do you think you will stay with this line of work?  (another way to ask how long to retirement).  I was so frustrated that I went back to my previous line of work as an Administrator for a construction company and while I am not making as much as I was prior to my layoff in 2009 at least I have a job and enjoy going to work every day.  Others I know are STILL out of work 4 years later.

name: Longwood Galleria
attributes: {'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': False, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'None', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'None', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'"}
categories: Restaurants, Shopping, Shopping Centers
text: The Longwood Galleria isn't much of a mall. It's mainly a food court with a few additional shops -- a CVS, a hair salon, a clothing store, etc. -- attached to it, with offices below and apartments above. However, the food court does offer several decent lunch options for those working in the Longwood Medical area, including Sami's and a DAIRY QUEEN. I've been known to go "run some errands" at work and stop off for a Blizzard on my way back, because hey, I've earned it.

name: Longwood Galleria
attributes: {'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': False, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'None', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'None', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'"}
categories: Restaurants, Shopping, Shopping Centers
text:
The food court can get a bit crowded during lunch, but mostly with hospital staff rushing a lunch in, so just wait a few minutes to find a table. The food selection is pretty vast, so you should find something you would like. The place is kept pretty clean, so it really works out to a great place to get lunch.
It is sort of like eating in a mall food court without the mall.

name: Longwood Galleria
attributes: {'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': False, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'None', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'None', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'"}
categories: Restaurants, Shopping, Shopping Centers
text: I'll give 5 stars to this cozy, cute and shiny place. Didn't expect nothing much. Just ordered some turkey burger and two salads. Honestly, the kale salad was unbelievably delicious. I love eating healthy food and kale is not easy even to cook. They had toasted almond, Brussel sprouts and apple in it. So far the best kale salad I tried in my whole life.

name: Longwood Galleria
attributes: {'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': False, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'None', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'None', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'"}
categories: Restaurants, Shopping, Shopping Centers
text:
This is a nice food court/mini mall located in the middle of Boston's Longwood Medical Area.  There is a McDonald's, burrito place, Subway, Asian place, newsstand, Dunkin Donuts, and CVS.  Since we were staying very nearby, the McDonald's provided a convenient location to grab a quick breakfast and coffee.

There was plenty of seating (it never really got full, I guess because it was during the weekend) and I saw a lady going around cleaning the tables so that was a welcome sight.  The decorations on the walls and ceiling were very eclectic and captivating.

You can reach this from the street or from an elevator (if you are staying at the Inn next door).

name: Longwood Galleria
attributes: {'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': False, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'None', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'None', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'"}
categories: Restaurants, Shopping, Shopping Centers
text: I come here maybe once every 2 years...it's basically where all the people from the hospital or surrounding business offices grab lunch. There's a CVS which is handy, but line can be long, good thing there's 3 cashiers. The Dunkins is aite, but if you come after lunch..everythings pretty much gone! The teriyaki place is chill---can never go wrong there... except the price is higher than average malls....there's a McD and a sushi place...and a subways and some other places i don't really care about. Go for the chicken teriyaki and rice, i love that ish.

name: Longwood Galleria
attributes: {'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': False, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'None', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'None', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'"}
categories: Restaurants, Shopping, Shopping Centers
text:
The food court gets the job done in that it provides a greater, more appetizing variety compared to the cafeteria at Mass Art but let's be real, it's just your typical American food court. 

I do have to say though that with my occasional visits for the past 4 years, I am disappointed they removed Dairy Queen and replaced it with Subway. That's not to say that I don't like Subway...I do...but I came to dairy queen during my summers or after class just to get my fix of their oreo blizzard. McDonald's just doesn't cut it..watered down and less creamy. 

"Free sample, try our free sample"- Dragon bowl girls will shout during lunch time and people from Sakura Japan will also hand out samples of their teriyaki as well during peak hour. 

I'm also sad that Sbarro is gone after going bankrupt. Where will I get my Italian fix during lunch now? Lollicup is gone too.  

I think Beantown Burrito place is the least popular stall out of the lot...never see people there and the strategic location of it is unattractive itself. Dairy queen, come back and replace Beantown Burrito! :P

It's really clean for a food court. Props to the cleaning management.

name: Longwood Galleria
attributes: {'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': False, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'None', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'None', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'"}
categories: Restaurants, Shopping, Shopping Centers
text:
If you work in the area, you've probably been recommended to check out the food court here. It's not the best food court you've ever stepped foot in but it's also not the worst.

Go at "off peak" hours, like before or after the 12-1 rush lunch crowd is through.  I've seen lines 20+ people deep at places like Sarku and McDonalds.  You'll potentially struggle to find a table after you get your food or spend more than half of your lunch break just waiting to get your meal. 

My favorites were the two Chinese locations next to each other, one being more authentic than the other, like having ma po tofu and Chinese vegetables as offerings vs. your standard mall food court Americanized dishes.  They seem to have had trouble keeping tenants, as my FAVORITE location of Middle Eastern food went out of business, I believe an Indian place is about to take its place.  

The prices here are a bit higher than what you might be used to for almost all of the locations, I'm guessing because the landlords charge a high premium rent to be here.  Hence why some don't seem to last.  

The space is adequate, it's just average in terms of the offerings and can get super crowded if you aren't careful.  There are some better options out at street level like Clover and Boloco but as you can see, I was here many times when working in the area and it did its job for the most part.

name: Longwood Galleria
attributes: {'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': False, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'None', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'None', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'"}

text: Good place for a quick bite...nice change from hospital food at nearby Children's Hospital...the Sushi and Japanese soba stands are especially tasty...

text: It always amazes me that in an area surrounded by healthcare professional the only food selections are fast food and convenience stores. I swear there's a conspiracy in there someplace, but I couldn't prove it. This place is a dive by every definition, though I've heard the new Mediterranean place isn't bad...

name: Longwood Galleria
attributes: {'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Alcohol': "'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': False, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'None', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'None', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'"}
categories: Restaurants, Shopping, Shopping Centers
text:
As a whole, not so great, but there are some diamonds in the very very rough.

Like Laura M. says, Sami's is great - cheap and yummy. The falafel wrap, salads and rice are all good. And the cashiers are v. nice. The sushi place has kind of a dismal selection but if you get there before everyone takes the spicy tuna it's decent. The chinese place gives you a RIDICULOUS amount of food for your money  (the egg rolls are kind of crap, but the scallion pancakes are surprisingly awesome.)

McDonalds is McDonalds. Hardly anyone speaks English there, too. Sbarro, Dairy Queen, Subway and Dunkin's are all pretty standard, but tend to have the longest lines. Do not under any circumstances eat at the Beantown Burrito. This is for your own good.

text:
Never in years of Legal Seafood dedication have I had a bad meal here, EVER. A crab roll comes on a buttered & grilled roll so light it's almost ethereal. Really it's an amazing roll and just amplifies the quality of the crabmeat. 

The salads are terrific but the best part might be the servers. Warm, attentive and helpful, just trust me- you'll eat here every chance you get!

text:
What a trip! On the way back from Cape Cod my sweetheart and I were faced with that great airport check-in question: "The fight's been over-sold. Are there any volunteers to fly out tomorrow?"

Our schedules were clear and they were offering the night's lodging and dinner money, plus 2 free airline tickets. You bet we said "yes." So now we're in the airport and want to choose the best restaurant there. We find just what we're looking for in Terminal B before you have to go through security.

The Legal C Bar run by Legal Seafoods.

Look: Most airport restaurants suck. That's the way the world mostly works these days. But not the Legal C Bar. It's serves legitimate 4 star seafood and couldn't have been a better find. It's simply the best airport food I've found, literally in the entire world (not counting the airport hotel restaurants you'll find in  places like Singapore, etc.). 

So I'm asking' ya, please tell me if you know of some place better, 'cause I want to nominate these guys for some kind of award or something, given the miserable nature of most airport eats.

text: Food was pretty good, service was good, and the music was very relaxing (the Shins, Ray LaMontagne, etc.). Can be a little tight when you sit at the bar, but overall a good option if you're in this section of this frustrating airport.

text: Great lobster roll, crap service. The stars are for the quality of the lobster in the roll, and nothing else.  It's one thing to wait for service in a busy place, but LTK just wasn't busy at 3:30 pm on Tuesday 6/18/13.   I was promptly seated and it was a reasonable wait between placing my order and the food's arrival.  For everything else I waited too long -  too long to be greeted by the server,  too long to have my order taken, too long for a check back after food was served, and too long for the check.   About  half the seats were occupied and there appeared to be ample waitstaff on duty and not busy, as evidenced by the several servers milling about at the back.  Luckily I had plenty of time before my flight.   At any price point, a diner deserves good service. At Legal prices, I expect more.  Won't be back.

text:
This is the place to go when your flight is delayed at Terminal B. Hoof it over there quick as there are a limited number of tables. Really the only food option in terminal B if you are on Virginamerica.

Favorites

Steamed Shrimp Wontons with Seaweed Salad. Always puts me in a better mood. Now Discontinued. Hope they bring it back. 

Lobster Roll - Legal does a a great lobster roll. Toasted buttered bun with a ton of lobster.

Spicy gumbo - good

text:
Mmm clam chowder.

I don't think you can go wrong with a Legal Sea Foods establishment. 

My mom and I had sometime before her flight and we decided to get a bowl of clam chowder and share the calamari. I always like Legal's clam chowder, it has nice chunks of clam (as it should! I've had watery ones with hardly any clam at other places..ew). I liked the calamari and the sauce it came with - tasty and added a more robust flavor with the calamari.

Service was great, no complaints!

Oh and must mention, it's standard Legal prices, but I'd rather pay then eat the other not so great airport food options.

text:
Airport food gets a bad rap (most of the time, rightfully so).  The environment of most airports, combined with the hassle of travel, sucks the fun out of most dining experiences.

I'm happy to report that this is NOT the case with Legal Seafoods in the C concourse of Boston Logan.  I've eaten here on several occasions as I'm passing through Boston and actually look forward to the experience.

I typically get a cup of the clam chowder and the salad with grilled shrimp.  Tasty stuff!  The chowder is creamy and delicious and the shrimp are flavorful.  

Since the dining area is not enclosed, you don't feel particularly cramped, and it's a good venue for people watching, especially if you take a seat at the stools overlooking the main foot traffic.

Needless to say, this place is pretty popular and, as a result, can get crowded.  You may need to wait for a table, which isn't always possible given your flight schedule.  If you have a layover or get to the airport early, and want to avoid below-average airport grub, make a bee-line to Legal.

text:
As a small child we used to go to the old Inman Square location that I believe burned down in the early 80's. Back in the day it was more of a seafood "joint", no tablecloths, just big long communal tables and you had to pay when you ordered and they just brought out the food when it was ready - no waiting for everyone at the table's order to be ready.  It had a fish market on the side. As kids we always loved going there. 

Many years later it is now a chain, and I try not to go to chains, but when I am back in Boston - nothing makes me happier than some fried scallops. And nothing is more disappointing than ordering them somewhere unknown, and them being dicey. Here's what I will say about legal seafood, they are damn consistent. The scallops were perfectly fried and juicy, yum and Yum, I always substitute the French fries for their skinny onion rings. I would say I would love if they offered a fried scallop roll, and a clam cake (a weird Providence RI concoction of bready clammy goodness)...But they do not. I sure miss the fried swordfish they used to served back in the 70 - think fish and chips, but the fish is swordfish - it was awesome - maybe bring that back?

Legal seafood is a great place to get your (not-inexpensive) New England fish dish on.

text:
Service was quick and friendly. Lobster bisque was excellent.

Next time I plan to get a full meal.  This place was open later than other restaurants in the terminal

text:
This joint has become part of my Logan ritual. I get done with work on a Friday afternoon, take a car to Logan, double check and see how badly we'll be delayed thanks to San Francisco's fog and then sit down for a drink and some food.

The bisque is always tasty, the salads are likewise. I finally dipped into the raw bar the last time I was there, the oyster selection was limited but tasty, however I was underwhelmed by the cherrystone clams. I've come to the conclusion that unless clams are really really fresh just avoid them all together. 

Overall this is probably one of the better stops in an airport, beats any fast food, but doesn't come cheap for sure. The friendliness of the staff goes a long way, but I get a little creeped out when they ask for my name and address me like they know me.

name: Legal Sea Foods
attributes: {'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BikeParking': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'False', 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'HasTV': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'Music': "{'dj': False, 'background_music': False, 'no_music': False, 'jukebox': False, 'live': False, 'video': False, 'karaoke': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'GoodForDancing': 'False', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BestNights': "{'monday': False, 'tuesday': False, 'friday': False, 'wednesday': False, 'thursday': False, 'sunday': False, 'saturday': False}", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsTableService': 'True', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': None}", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'True', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': True, 'casual': True}"}
categories: Sandwiches, Food, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Cocktail Bars, Gluten-Free, Nightlife, Bars, Salad
text: Holy crap, what do I even say about this place?  Who would have thought you could get amazing seafood in an airport?  I had a 3 hour wait before my flight and am so excited to have stumbled onto this place and I will definitely drop in every time I fly through Logan.  I ordered a mix of oysters on a half shell and littleneck clams.  I got 2 each of 3 different regional oysters with the Canadian ones being the best.  Both the clams and oysters were fresh and tasty.  I also had a few Sam Adams to go with my seafood.  I was in heaven!  I was very impressed with the wait staff as they asked whether we were in a rush to catch a flight.  My group told our waitress we were not but the service was still attentive and prompt.  I watched other patrons who said they were in a rush and they were served very quickly.  Apparently, if you are flying United, you can use the first class line to get through security if you eat here.  This place rocked, who says you can't get great food at the airport?

text: Had an outstanding lunch here with the family while awaiting our flight.  One of my kids had an accident with the salt shaker and the Legal Sea Foods chef brought him (and his brother) ice cream for the incident, (which wasn't even Legal's fault).  Highly recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for authentic and yummy Boston fare in a place with great customer service.

text:
I was (not) surprisingly skeptical when I decided to try the Legal Seafoods at the Boston airport. I mean, it's the airport. The McDonalds fries are stale here. So what could expect from the raw oysters?? But Yelp said "go forth" and as a true YB (yelp believer*) I plopped down and ordered. Deliciousness. Fresh. Great service. If it weren't in the backdrop of the airport epidemic Hudson News shops I would have given it the Yelp High Five*.



*term coined by Di. not official--judge me not Yelp!

categories: Sandwiches, Food, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Cocktail Bars, Gluten-Free, Nightlife, Bars, Salad
text:
I agree with others who say that this Legal Seafood is a cut above most airport dining options.  The food I got was pretty darn comparable to what you'd get at any other Legal Seafood's outlet, which is a good thing in the life of a frequent traveler.

I'm all about the fried clams, and Legals does a decent enough job with them.  My plate had plenty of them, and they were tender and not greasy.  Not the best I've ever eaten, but certainly very well done.  The guys next to me were raving about their lobster rolls, but I was on my way out of Boston and had to go with my clams.

It's not cheap, but for that price you get good food, and my service was prompt, friendly and professional.

I almost escaped New England this trip without eating fried clams, which would have been a minor tragedy.  Thank Poseidon I had time to have a semi-relaxing meal at LS before departing.

text: We ate here before a recent plane flight. The food was good. I'm unhappy because after checking our receipt against the credit card statement, I realized the waitress added an additional tip to the 20% we gave her. I called the restaurant to report the situation and was assured a manager would call me back within 15 minutes. It's been over a week, and I still haven't been contacted.

text:
Love their New England Clam Chowder.  It is one of the best I've ever had.  The crab cake was too salty for my taste.

The service was very friendly and attentive, despite how busy they are.

text: Not typically a huge fan of Legal Seafood when I'm in NJ but random that I enjoyed it tonight at the airport! The Rhode Island clam chowder had just the right amount of spice and had a good amount of clam. Also got the shrimp wontons and they were pretty great too. Not sure if I was just hungry but I enjoyed!! Good spot at the airport! Lost a star for SALTY!

text:
I had lunch here in the airport terminal and it was overall pretty good, but not great. I had a cup of the white chowder, very average. Sort of like mediocre pizza, decent clam chowder is always just okay, but this was far from great. I had a salad with shrimp and this was pretty good too. I wanted the Lobster but $28 for a Lobster salad was more than I wanted to put into my expense account for lunch.

Overall this is not a bad choice in the airport, but you should have an expense account to go here.

We got a house whiskey and club soda and an Allagash White beer. 

All in all good, was able to watch the game and see my gate while my flight was delayed.

text:
When you're in Boston and haven't gotten your lobster roll or seafood fix yet, this place will do the trick & much more! It's probably one of the best cups of clam chowder and best lobster rolls that you'll find in the area. Yes, you'll pay a pretty penny to eat here, but if you're traveling for work and you can expense your meal, you should definitely eat here. If not, you should just treat yourself and save yourself from eating soggy salads or mediocre sandwiches.

Average prices are probably 20-30% more than if you were not in the airport, but that's usually the way it goes when you eat in an airport and want a decent, fresh, hot meal.

The clam chowder in a cup ($6.95) is delicious, rich, and super filling - you could probably just have this for dinner and be okay. There are a lot of chunks of clam in there, and it's some of the best clam chowder I've had.

The lobster roll is also delicious, served on a proper buttered white bread lobster roll, with big chunks of lobster. The lobster is served in a light mayo sauce with fresh celery, and it's not too heavy on the mayo. I loved it and wish I could have had more. It comes with Cape Cod kettle chips and coleslaw.

I've eaten here twice and will definitely come back again. The food comes relatively quickly, so you could sit down and be done eating in 20-30 min. There are also power outlets underneath each seat at the bar, and lots of TVs to keep yourself entertained. Expensive, but worth the price.

text:
THIS REVIEW IS FOR THE RESTAURANT/BAR INSIDE SECURITY AT TERMINAL B. 

I sat at the bar and was greeted quickly. The staff was nice and attentive. The bar seems to be the only place to get service. 

I ordered the chowder and three oysters. 

The chowder was bland, needing salt and even a dash of Tabasco, which I don't normally do. It was filled with clams, which was great and I ended up picking out most of the potatoes with a fork. 

The oysters were tasty but I couldn't shake the feeling that they bought them in bulk and saved the shells to re-serve. The oysters didn't lay in the shell or even look the right size. Each shell had the telltale murky liquid filled to the brim. They also weren't connected to the shell in any way. I guess you can get away with that when you're so close to the ocean. Damn shame though. At $3 an oyster, I'm sure they're making a killing. 

I ordered a crabmeat roll to go. I have a long flight ahead of me. I'll report back on it.

UPDATE: The crab roll was PHENOMABALLS. Really, really good. Fresh crab, perfect, buttery roll. Sooooo good. They get an extra star.

text:
Last stop before heading home.. Thankful that the security gave me the heads-up on the virgin terminal not having a real selection for food/drinks and told me this was here down the way.  Bartender service started slow, but once they got around it was excellent.  Didn't have any benadril with me so I got the Portuguese fisherman's stew.  It was deelish, but I could have done without the sand in the clams.  Beer was good, harpoon's UFO..

Given that it is the only food joint near the Virgin America Terminal, I sorta lucked out on this one. 

3.5 stars.

text:
Forget the crap food that's been sitting around in stainless steel vats all day at those airport pseudo-restaurants. If you get stuck at Boston's Logan Airport for any reason -- say, your flight is delayed for THREE HOURS -- the Legal C Bar in Terminal B is worth the trip. 

There are apparently two Legal Seafood restaurants in Terminal B: one is behind security near Gate 8. The Legal C Bar is outside security in the public access area of the terminal. It took me about 10 minutes to walk from the furthest gate in Terminal A to Terminal B (there are also shuttle buses between the terminals if you don't feel like walking). 

The food was fresh -- and by fresh, I mean the lettuce in the wedge salad was crunchy, the bacon was real and not some nasty bacon-like substance, and the lobster bisque was hot and had actual chunks of lobster in it. I also ordered the sangria, which was one of the best I've had in recent memory. 

The atmosphere is very bar-like and cozy. There are tables, booths, and a long bar along the window with room to set up your laptop and plenty of outlets for charging up.

Service was great despite the fact that numerous flights had been canceled and the place was packed. Soup, salad and sangria all arrived within 10 minutes of ordering. Chris at the bar made a point of asking my name and then using it to check up on me. The extra effort earned him a nice 30% tip.

Prices were reasonable, considering the fact that you pay $8 for a Happy Meal at an airport McDonalds. Total bill was $32, which included tip. Drinks are the pricest menu items. 

Great place to meet up with friends who aren't traveling, since the Legal C Bar isn't behind security. But remember that you will have to re-check through security on your way back to your gate, so be sure to allow yourself enough time.

text: Had dinner here during a long layover. I was very pleasantly surprised. Shared the Rhode Island Calamari and then had a Caesar salad while my wife had a Greek salad. Salad dressings appeared to be homemade and were very flavorful. My wife mentioned to our waitress that yesterday was my birthday and the waitress had happy birthday written in chocolate on the plate of our Boston cream pie desert. Nice touch. BTW Angelica was an amazing waitress.

text:
I am a great fan of Legal Sea Foods and try to go to one of their locations every time I go to Boston. Having not been there for a number of years, I was very hopeful that I would be able to go to one on this visit. Sadly, the visit was short and I walked by their location by the Seaport but could not stop.

But I was pleased to see they had a location right across my gate at the airport. While they had a limited menu (and a full bar), I did find something to get. Their Lobster Roll was on special but did not seem worth the cost. I ended up getting a Crabmeat Roll which came with chips and slaw. First of all, the slaw was outrageous. It had a slight sweetness to it, but a variety of crisp vegetables that made it unique. The bag of chips was rather small and I would have preferred potato salad or even fries. But the roll was really good - as I would expect from Legal.

The bar was very nice - crowded. I sat on a stool at the bar. While the seating was very tight - in fact anytime anyone moved all of the bar stools knocked together, the patrons were great. We all talked to each other and generally had a good time.

name: Legal Sea Foods

text: Legal Sea Foods is on point! From the Chunky New England Clam Chowder to the Steamed Crab legs the meals are mouth watering! Other dishes I highly recommend are the garlic mussels and oysters! It's another no-brainer! Check it out while you are in Boston!

text: Good friendly service, my waitress wasn't very knowledgable regarding beers or items on the menu but she did try to help and asked other staff for assistance. Food was ok, rather bland but I did order the fish and chip... Greasy :/

text: Legal Seafoods was a bright spot when our red eye  flight from LAX to pHL got cancelled and we had to reroute thru BOS. On my birthday. I had an outstanding, thick cuppa chowda-- filled with tender clams infused with rich seafood flavor-- and fantastic crisp fried clams (about $20+ for the platter, which our server said came with more clams than the cheaper appetizer).  These were light years better from the frozen Arthur Treacher rubbery strips I grew up with; breaded fresh large clams, tender and so plump beneath the thin crispy coating, that some could've been mistaken for fried oysters.  The place is on the pricier side for my  typical airport meal, but seemed justified for the quality and portion sizes.  When your stuck in BOS airport and need some quality food, this place has it.  We were happily filled for our short flight home.

text:
Was back on Friday, August 7th.  Only had a Sam Summer Ale....but the service and beer were excellent!

And for a 22 oz draft to only be $6.50 AT AN AIRPORT!  Very nice!

I'll be back again when I fly home in 2 weeks.

This is in Terminal B.

text:
Some foods are best eaten regionally. For example, jambalaya in Louisiana, pizza in New York (sorry Chicago), BBQ brisket in Texas and a lobster roll in New England. Even though this was an airport restaurant, the lobster roll was top notch. They didn't skimp on the lobster and the roll was fresh and crusty. Excellent!

Now the service on the other hand, not so excellent. My waitress all but ignored me after taking my order. Good thing I wasn't in a hurry.

text:
Food was great for being a quick in-and-out airport restaurant, but 3 cheers for Alfredo our server. They should pay him more. Great demeanor. He also turned us on to the idea of having seaweed salad as a side when I said I wanted something green. After I ordered, 2 other couples saw what I had and ordered some too. Great idea Alfredo.

From now on I will make it a point to come here to eat when time permits.

text:
Stopped for a quick appetizer and drink before boarding. Five crisp wonderful shrimp and an awesome martini served quickly. Very attentive friendly service . The.manager stopped by as well to inquire how I was doing. Very impressed. Makes it worth while to spend time in the airport.
Sue P.

text:
The waitress recommended the Tuna Burger, and it was spectacular.  So much flavor.  Not a typical burger (though the texture was surprisingly typical).  

You get two sides.  I had the jalapeno/cheddar polento.  How original! And amazing!

FYI- it's outside of security.  If you are going to Virgin, I would suggest eating here first because there is only a snack stand in the 2 Virgin terminals.

text: I bought the Cordon Blue sandwich from the little Legal Sea Foods kiosk and it was absolutely disgusting. The lettuce and tomatoes were wilted and almost rotten. The ham, chicken and cheese were dry and hard to chew. I thought that Legal's having a good brand name will mean their airport kiosk food is decent but boy was I wrong. AWFUL. Eat at the restaurant if you have time, not the crappy little sandwich kiosk. Yuck!!

categories: Sandwiches, Food, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Cocktail Bars, Gluten-Free, Nightlife, Bars, Salad
text:
One star for the steamy toasted bread. The butter was pathetic. Why would you pair your perfect bread with prepacked boring butter? Would you use this kind of butter in your seafood dishes?

Problem: I only had half an hour to spend on dinner before the flight and asked the hostess if it was possible to get the food quickly enough. 

Hostess: Said yes, and tried to take us to a table, but slowly wandered around confused and unsure which table to seat us in. I asked for a booth and she seemed relieved to have this conundrum solved. She told us the server would be with us shortly. 

Server: We waited for 5 minutes before the server showed up with the menus. I excitedly picked out a few items to try, and then flagged down the nearest server to take our menu.

Bus Boy: Turns out he was just a bus boy and told us the server should be with us shortly. We asked for water and he nodded his head.

Silverware: I looked at my silverware, imagining the delicious food that our friends had told us about. And then I saw a brown 4 mm x 3 mm piece of food stuck to my knife. My friend flagged down the bus boy and asked for a replacement. The busser looked worried and hurriedly replaced the knife. Never got the water.

Dinner: We waited for the server to come. She came when we had 15 minutes left and we knew the cooks, no matter how good, could not possibly make the food fast enough for us to enjoy before our departure. We asked for a drink and 2 Kumamoto oysters and some water. The server smiled, nodded, and left.  

We waited and waited and stared into space with no water and only unhappiness. I mean, how long does it take to mix one drink and shuck two oysters? 

We had had enough and decided to leave in search of quicker service and actual food and water. While leaving, the server smiled at us as if she had done a good job. When she realized that we hadn't even eaten, she ran after us and asked what was wrong. We explained that we'd told her about our time constraints and had been promised speedy service and that we unfortunately could not wait for their slow service any longer. She apologized and we left. 



LEGAL SEAFOOD why do you  have so many incompetent FOH workers? They all look the same. Same uniform and apparently the servers don't know how to pour water. They just kept giving us napkins instead. Do you have some sort of idiotic policy to give napkins instead of water? 

We flagged down one FOH worker and asked to order. He said he was the bus boy, so we asked for water. It never came. We flagged down your server for water and she said the bus boy would get it. It never came. We flagged down the server to order. She took our orders and forgot about us. 

Your silverware is deplorable and your service is even worse. I'm sorry I missed out on "the best seafood in Boston." Unfortunately, this experience was so taxing that I doubt I'll ever find the desire to step foot into any of your establishments.

name: Legal Sea Foods

text:
How how we miss LEGAL at DCA. But flying the shuttle to Logan means we can arrive at the ariport a little early and end the trip with with a quality dinner before a less than special flight. 
   Note, that Legal is way down by B8, so if your shuttling, you need to walk about 5 minutes to find it. It's worth the trip and the quick service means 30 minutes is plenty for a decent meal. Wine selection is awesome as is the pour. We enjoyed the calamari Rhode Island style, Tuna and belly clam appetisers. All was perfect but I could have easily enjoyed a second serviing of tartar with the clams. Cheap? No|! But there is a food court nearby if your counting coins. I rather count the clams.

text: Has been over 12 years since I lived in Boston and ate at Legal Seafood, but I'm flying to Portugal and feeling festive. Stopped in and the service was excellent despite the crowds. The sashimi delightful and the calamari RI-style oily, but delish. If you have to eat at Terminal C, and you like seafood, you won't be disappointed in how things taste.

text: I'm not 1 for negative reviews unless bad service and food are the combination.  I've been a Legal Seafood fan for over 20 years.   I've tried Route 9, Cambridge, Waterfront, North Shore Mall, LTK with numerous visits at most locations.  This was the 1st airport visit and will probably be the last.  I ordered a fishermans platter and my wife had a burger.  Our waitress was less attentive and less informed than is the norm at other Legal locations.  I'm not used to having to ask and wait for soda refills.  This is the 1st time that the guests at an adjoining table had to borrow our ketchup because their waiter was nowhere to be found.  These items would have been forgiven by Legals high quality of food but not this time.   My fishermans platter was deep fried with varying degrees of brown, some cooked to a beautiful golden brown and some over cooked.  The topper was the layer of grease on the bottom of the plate which had saturated all of the seafood and rings which were on the bottom.  I am still a Legal Fan but this will probably be my last trip to the Airport Location and provides Legal with fair warning that 1 more greasy mix will mean one less client.

text:
After chasing the elusive lobster roll all over the first half of my week in the area I finally got my hands on one in a small local place with a pretty good reputation.  It was quite yummy but it was missing something.  You see, they served it on a hoagie roll that was just a plain roll.  Not buttered, not toasted, nothing but plain.

And that, my friends, brings me to why I ate an airport lobster roll.  Legal Seafoods is known for serving up a great lobster roll.  The biggest difference as far as I could tell was in the bread component of the dish.  They butter and griddle their bread to the point where it adds a certain sweetness in addition to the snap associated with the consistency of the toasted bread.  And that was what made this the better lobster roll of the two...by a long shot.

Clam chowder is also damn good.

Yes, the place is expensive but the next time I find myself in the area I will probably be eating my lobster roll at one of the Legal Seafood locations and enjoying plenty of other local cuisine elsewhere.

text:
Excellent place to grab a meal before heading through security.

The husband and I shared a clam chowder which was delicious.  I went with a lobster roll, he went with a crab roll.  Add a couple of Sam Adams, and we had a perfect meal to get us ready to sit on the plane for a good 6 hours.

We were seated quickly, and our hostess was sweet.  Roller bags fit PERFECTLY under the elevated booths along the wall.  Very thoughtful.

text:
I travel in and out of Boston about once a quarter and typically have some time to kill before my flight.  I hit up the Legal Sea Foods in Terminal B pretty much every time I'm here.  The service is fast, the place is clean and they always have plenty of people working to keep things moving and grooving.
     As a vegan, there is pretty much nothing but fries I can have off their menu, however, if you ask them to - they will make a salad for you with no meat or seafood.  That is pretty much the extent of what I have eaten.  I give them four stars for that.  If you are like me I don't come here to eat - I come to grab a quick drink or two before my flight.  Everyone is always very friendly and for the most part I have always been able to pony up to the bar and grab a stool even though it is always crowded in here.  They have a very nicely stocked bar and again - they are fast, so whether you have a lot of time or no time at all, this is a good choice if you are in Terminal B.

text: I usually enjoy Legals but this meal at Logan airport was a surprise.  The corn on the cob had rotten kernels (the waitress also screwed up her face when I showed it to her) and the Asian "box" stir fry for $25 was no better than a $12 meal at a cheaper restaurant. I can't even say the shrimp tasted fresh. My rating isn't lower than a three because I've eaten at this same restaurant before and had no complaints, and because it's an airport terminal and you can't expect good food when planes are involved. The staff was friendly at least.

name: Legal Sea Foods

text:
A Legal Sea Foods in the airport is exactly what you'd expect a Legal Sea Foods in the airport to be like. Slightly overpriced but standard fare that tastes and served exactly the same as a Legal Sea Foods anywhere. 

My husband and I each got a mug of the Clam Chowder and we also split the Greek Salad. Both were very good, and not unreasonably high priced for an airport location.

The bartender (we sat at the bar) was very friendly and checked in on us frequently even though we weren't ordering alcohol (and therefore he knew he wouldn't get a ton of money off of us). At other bars I've gone to, I've received a lower quality of service if I'm only ordering food. But this was not the case. 

Next time I'm in this area of Logan, I'd eat here again.

text: Stopped by for some boston clam chowder at the car. The clam chowder took longer than I thought, even the bartender was unsure why i had not received mine yet. Bartender was friendly. Clam chowder was creamy, but not as chucky as I expected especially for an $8 a bowl price tab. I like that your luggage can fit under the bar chairs.

categories: Sandwiches, Food, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Cocktail Bars, Gluten-Free, Nightlife, Bars, Salad
text:
The Short and Simple
- Nice big selection of seafood
- Great bar area with lots of different beers to choose from and TVs to watch the games
- Great attentive servers

The Long Detailed Version:

Food: 4*
I've been here many, many times, since I travel to Boston a lot for work and this is my go-to for dinner before flying back out. For the most part, the food's been great. I've had the raw oysters, lobster rolls and clam chowder and they've always been good. Unfortunately, I'm writing this after my visit yesterday and the lobster roll wasn't as good as I remember it being. It didn't taste AS fresh so that knocked it down a star. But that was just one experience out of 15+ trips and their food is usually above standard. Their clam chowder is also really good. As for booze, it's exactly what you'd expect from a bar, with a nice wide selection.

Customer Service: 5*
Great customer service. The hosts are good about taking down your name and seating you quickly. The servers were pretty attentive when you're not at the bar. But when you're at the bar, the service is very, very good; which is a bit surprising given how extremely busy it is, but I was never kept waiting to get my order in or get my check.

Atmosphere: 4*
It's sort of what you expect of a bar/restaurant at an airport and not much to say here.

text: Thanks to cancelled flights, I was able to make my way to Legal Seafoods, and get something, besides recycled peanuts. Montauk Calamari (spicy) was nice, and not greasy, or dreadful rubbery. I'm a spicy food fan, and there was enough of a hit of spice from the batter, for me to notice, and that made me wish I had ordered two orders of calamari. The guys were friendly, and service was prompt. Next time I'm in Boston, I won't mind a cancelled flight as long as Legal is close by.

The basic omlet was a great meal I loved it. The toast wasn't up to par and was dry and cold when I got it but compared to the rest I was very happy and wouldn't complain.

text:
Flight got delayed so what the heck I thought "Treat yo self!"

Looked up good places to eat in the airport and since I'm in Boston of course I'm gonna get some lobster.

Fresh steam lobster at market price was $26, WITH your choice of 2 sides (what a steal!) -- I got the broccoli (which was soggy) and onion strings (which are thin onion rings and super good). Of course I dug out every last bit of meat out of that lobster. YUM!

Service was slow, probably because they were closing. The waitress kept hinting at me that they were closing soon, not very attentive.

text: Finally the end of our epic east coast trip was nearing.  We had to drop off our rental early so we had a bunch of time to kill before our flight.  After perusing the usual fast food type places, we settled here for a little lunch before our flight.  I was impressed with the classiness of the establishment considering we were inside and airport.  The bar was spacious and with a nice selection of brews on tap.  I ordered the fish and chips and a cup of chowder along with a pint of the Boston staple, Sam Adams.  The fish and chips were solid, nice flaky fish, fried up perfectly, crispy fries, and a cold SA to wash it all down.  The chowder was similarly good.  Nothing super spectacular, but absolutely solid.  Wait staff was friendly without being overbearing.  Checked up on us at good intervals without interrupting our watching the game.  This was probably a 3.5 star experience, but I'll round up in this case.

text: Had a few hours before boarding so I decided to eat somewhere nice. The aroma from this restaurant was overwhelming. I always ask the servers recommendation; so I started with the Clam Chowder, it was so good never had any chowder better than this. Then I had the Crab Cake Sandwich, taste like they just caught the carb and made it. I still had time to have desert so while in Boston mine as well have the Boston Cream Pie, off my diet but hey you only live once; I must have died and went to heaven. Thank you Kim who recommended everything. It was fantastic. Oh this was in Terminal B

text:
It is always nice when you are stuck in an airport for several hours to have some really good food to eat

Legal seafood at the Boston airport is one of these really good places

Situated directly at my gate I sat down at the bar and ordered

A nice glass of Pinot Noir

A cup of New England clam chowder that was awesome

A lobster roll that was buttery and cooked perfectly 

What a nice way to eat before a long plane ride home

I will be back

text: Had an amazing experience and lunch here today. Wife and I split a lobster bisque and crab cake sandwich. It was amazing. They split the items for us. Food was warm and fresh. Staff was polite and on their game.

text:
I've visited different Legal Sea Foods in Boston before, but this was my first time dining in the airport terminal location. I was short on time, with only 30 minutes until my flight began boarding, and decided to dine-in for a quick dinner. 

I seated myself and the server promptly came to take my order - a Mai Tai, Calamari, and a Classic Caesar Salad. About 5 minutes later, my entire meal was in front of me (without even having to rush my waitress). 
The Mai Tai was traditional, as was the Caesar salad. But the Calamari was exquisite! The squids were salty and fried to a perfect crisp. They were mixed with hot peppers and garlic, and paired with an aioli tarter sauce. 

Though it was 5pm on Sunday (football spectators everywhere), the bar wasn't too noisy and the servers didn't seem rushed. Overall, the food, service, and experience were above average for airport dining.
Definitely recommend.

text:
The place is not cheap.  But, the food is pretty good.  I appreciate that their first question was how was I doing on time, flight-wise.  This is a good place to drop by for a drink or a meal while in the Logan airport.

I had a bowl of clam chowder and it was excellent.  If I had not hit two pieces of clam with a little sand in them, it would have been near perfect.  I also had a wedge salad with a some grilled scallops added on.  The blue cheese vinaigrette was very tasty, and went perfectly with the salad.  The scallops had nice sear marks and solid flavor.  The manager was friendly.

text: I find it funny that this one in Terminal B is literally the highest rated Legal in all of Boston. I would have to agree. Normally dining out in Boston, Legal wouldn't be a consideration at all (unless some out of town guests request it specifically). But if I need to eat before a flight, a good lobster roll or crab cake or chowder just sounds absolutely divine! The new United terminal with the open airy space is beautiful as well.

text: Perfect pre-boarding meal or post-landing meal.  This was the first food place we saw in the Jet Blue terminal when we arrived in Boston.  We made a good decision stopping there.  Excellent food and service.  Cold beer.  It was a great way to start our trip!  It was also the last place we ate before our departing flight.  Highly recommended!!!

text:
The Fried food was not good. In fact is was terrible and way over priced. I paid $40 for a plate of greasy terrible tasting fried clams. I could ring the grease out of the fries. I left half my plate. I still can't get the bad greasy taste out of my mouth.

They need to change the oil more often. The fried clams and fries were terrible. Clam chowder is the best. Get it, you can't go wrong. Avoid the rest of the greasy slop. I've had better Cole slaw at hot dog stands.

categories: Sandwiches, Food, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Cocktail Bars, Gluten-Free, Nightlife, Bars, Salad
text:
No more lobster?!!? The manager was on the phone dialing around for a two pounder in an instant. Meanwhile the bartender let the customer sample different wines. Great efficient service is what you need at an airport. They do have that at this Legal. A flight attendant had ordered her tuna burger at a Legal in one of the other terminals... no problem. We'll whip you up a new one. 

I had fried clams, lobster bisque and key lime pie while dangling off a bar stool watching insipid girly golf on the sports channel, and trying to drown out some of the noise pollution crashing through my head. Whateva. That was as pricey half hour.

text: A little crowded, but that's because it's completely delicious.  If you get a window seat, it's really nice to watch flights take off and land while tucking into a great lobster roll.  I try to get to the airport early to hit this place, not even kidding.

text:
So it was the bittersweet ending to an amazing trip!
My last meal with my "boston" b4 i had 2 leave and go back 2 reality in CA :( 
We thought why not for the last time eat seafood one last time. . .
We found a table and as we sat down a waiter approached us and took our drink orders. . . looked over the menu and deciding on what 2 eat. . .
we ordered the shrimp gumbo, calamari and lobster bisque soup.
The soup was oh kay, calamari was great and had a spicy after kick 2 it, gumbo was good also.
Our waiter was prompt and friendly

text: In terminal B at Logan , best to have something other than breakfast. It was simply awful. Cold and bland, would normally understand since its breakfast at an airport in a seafood restaurant but the prices were very high and the food VERY bad,,, if your looking for breakfast, I would skip this place.

text:
Look - if you have to eat at an airport restaurant this is one of the better ones. Pricy? You bet. But the overall quality  is far above standard airport fare.

Update: had the crab cake entree. Wow. Two jumbo lump crabcakes with little filler served with a wonderful cranberry walnut apple mixed green salad. Pricey? Yes. Worth it? Definitely.

text:
Flight at Logan was delayed...we were hungry and thirsty.  Went in for oysters, appetizers and drinks.
Food was great!
Drinks were great!
Service was good.
A little tight as far as room....but hey...it was the airport and there were a lot of delayed flights.  So we were not the only people with the idea at 6pm.

Good job Legal Sea Foods for offering some tired, hungry and thirsty travelers something to smile about!!!

categories: Sandwiches, Food, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Cocktail Bars, Gluten-Free, Nightlife, Bars, Salad
text:
We ate here while waiting for our flight and here's what we think:

FOOD: hubby ordered the "seafood sampler"? i think it's what it was called. It's a dish with grilled crab meat, shrimp, and crab cakes. Based from his feedback, his order was excellent in taste and serving. I'm not a big fan of crab so when i tried it, it tasted bland for me but i trust my hubby's judgement so his order is a 5-star.

I ordered clam chowder in a mug and thank goodness it's only in a mug since it was full of "clam meat" it made me so full afterwards. It was very tasty and i love the fact that it has lesser potatoes. My order is also a 5-star

The reason why i gave our over all experience a 3-star is because of the service. Our server does not smile, does not have facial expressions (poker face) even though we smile at him for the entire duration of our stay. Maybe he's having a bad day? If only we have a server with a pleasant atmosphere, my review would've been a 5-star.

categories: Sandwiches, Food, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Cocktail Bars, Gluten-Free, Nightlife, Bars, Salad
text:
This was an outstanding stop on our way out for frigid Boston en route
to Ft. Lauderdale.  Well worth arriving at the airport extra early to visit this terminal C gem.  The signature mug of New England Clam Chowder was awesome as usual.  My Wife had Baked Haddock which was flaky and cooked to perfection, even the cole slaw was excellent.  I had the Seared Scallops with some of the lightest fried onion stops I've ever had.  
Who needs an inflight meal when you can dine like this hop on an escape pod (JetBlue) and jet out of town.  Like I said, with budgeting a little extra time to dine and kick off your vacation on a delicious note.

name: Legal Sea Foods

categories: Sandwiches, Food, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Cocktail Bars, Gluten-Free, Nightlife, Bars, Salad
text:
Whoa, good food in an airport? I must be dreaming.  While I'm not quite as high on this restaurant as others, I understand how their ratings may be skewed based on the availability of halfway edible food at an airport.  So, if I was to judge it against another airport restaurant, it would get 5 stars.  Outside of that, it gets 3.  

They have your typical "Legal SeaFood" menu, which is solid and fresh.  Drink menu is expansive and really helps to take the edge off of flying.  The decor is nice and comfortable, and the staff is very attentive and friendly.  All in all, a nice place to hang out and have a good meal before the typical friendly airline service that awaits you.

text: This is the best place to get your last seafood indulgence before leaving Boston.  We go to Legal Seafood for the highest quality seafood you can find in the Boaton area and this small restaurant at the airport upholds that same Legal Seafood standard.  I personally love the crabcakes at Legal and of course the clam chowdah is top notch, loaded with clams and flavor.

text:
I've been here twice and ordered the swordfish and shrimp combo each time. During my latest trip, the fish was cooked well, but it could've used more seasoning. The shrimp tasted good so no complaints there. 

The waiter's service was attentive and quick and we managed to talk a little red sox baseball. I will definitely visit this place every time I'm at logan airport.

text:
My bar for airport restaurants is pretty low but this was disappointing. Came in for a Bloody Mary and a beer in the morning. It took more than 20 minutes to be served despite an only moderate crowd. Finally got the bill and they charged an extra $3 for a shrimp with my Bloody Mary that never came.

For what it's worth, when we pointed this out to the waitress she then took the charge off the bill and offered me a shrimp for free but I was too annoyed to take it.

text:
My mom and I were starving while waiting in the Logan Airport for our flight. We decided to come to Legal Sea Foods to get our last dose of Boston seafood while we could. We were seated right away. At first glance of the menu, everything looked delicious. It is mostly seafood, but they do have a chicken sandwich and a couple of burgers to choose from if you're not a fan of seafood. Also at first glance we noticed how expensive everything was (understandable being as it is a seafood restaurant). Right away I knew I wanted their "famous" clam chowder. But then I was stuck between the lobster roll, crab roll, and the raw shellfish sampler. I narrowed it down between the two rolls and ended up going with the crab roll because I had so many lobster rolls the few days before that. 

After our food came out and we had our first few bites I was very please with the chowder. There were a decent amount of clams in the soup, which is great. The crab roll on the other hand I was very disappointed in. It was not what I was expecting at all. I was picturing a roll with lump crabmeat in it, but instead this was like shredded crabmeat. I can't really explain it, but it was very bizarre and the crabmeat had a weird texture. It also was so bland and tasteless. My mom got a cheeseburger and she said that was ok. Maybe I didn't order the right thing, but I don't think i'll be coming back. Too expensive of a place for food to just be "ok."

text: Omg!  This place is great.   I wish I could remember the waitresses name- she was fabulous and everything she recommended was stellar!   The hot crab dip is a must (with the rolls)!  Seafood casserole is amazing!  More like chunks of seafood in an amazing sauce than what you may think of when you hear the word casserole.  Also lobster roll and crab cakes were very good.  Great place to stop and enjoy a fantastic meal.

text:
I was pleasantly surprised by everything here. I was expecting mid range/ just okay airport food. I got the crab and avocado salad and an old fashioned to drink. 

The drink was way better than I was expecting and the salad came out quickly, was very fresh, and had a great flavor profile. 

The bartenders were friendly and service was really fast. Def recommend if you are in the airport and need something fresh.

text: I cannot believe this is a while-at-the-airport-grab-a-quick-bite place! The service and the food quality blows me away. Make sure you get the clam chowder and the seafood trio roll. Kudos to Legal C Bar.

text:
Wow! This place is great!

I was flying out of Virgin Air and hadn't eaten lunch yet, so I decided to give this place a shot. 

The service that I received was excellent, and all the workers were super friendly. The special that they had was half a crab-stuffed lobster with mushroom and spinach ravioli for $13.95. The dish was absolutely delicious, and it was definitely worth every penny!

I sat near the bar and was amazed at how well the bartender remembered everyone's names. He never addressed a single person as sir or ma'am but would say their first names instead.

This is definitely the best airport meal I've ever had!

text:
Guess who's got two thumbs and lost baggage. THIS girl.

I sidled up to the bar extremely unhappy and disgruntled. I think the bartender got the message--he didn't really say much. Just left me with a menu. I've dined at legal's enough to notice a couple of items weren't on the menu, but legal's usually has solid options any which direction you choose to go. I ordered a crab roll with onion strings and a seaweed salad (ADDICTING).

The food came out pretty quickly and I'd cooled down considerably at this point. There was just one other person on the other side of the bar, but I had a lot of trouble spotting the bartender for small things such as ketchup and refills. I ended up flagging down a random server. 

I didn't expect a heck of a lot since it's airport dining, but legal's is always satisfactory food. Service was so-so, but hey I was in a terrible mood and it could've gone A LOT worse

text:
Went in and back out through security just so I could get to Legal C Bar in Terminal B haha :x

Came here with the gf for an early dinner before our flights.

+ Clam chowder: excellent, excellent flavor. Did not have sand in the clams as another reviewer mentioned. Could have had a thicker consistency though
+ Fried clams on cornbread: nom nom. The fried clams were so fresh and juicy that I had to ask the waitress if they were oysters due to their seafood-y punch. I was assured that they were without a doubt, clams.

There a was a good IPA on tap which is always welcome with seafood. Waitress was nice and attentive.

$45 for all the food listed, chicken club sandwich, drinks, tax, and tip.

Come here for a nice, clean, quiet rest and fill up before your flight!

text:
I ate here again and it was packed as usual. I must have been in a great mood the first time, because I definitely was not impressed the second go-round. 

I basically had the same cajun shrimp because I really wasn't in the mood for anything else. But this meal was definitely not worth the $20+ that I paid for it. Granted, I feel like I must add, I was here on business so the meal was paid for, but if i personally had to pay for this myself I would have had to speak to someone about it.

categories: Sandwiches, Food, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Cocktail Bars, Gluten-Free, Nightlife, Bars, Salad
text: This is a great addition to my Traveling Joy. Legal Seafoods now includes most items as Gluten Free. You must ask for the gluten free bread on most sandwiches like the fried clam rolls. The fried clams themselves are made with a gluten free batter and are quite delicious.  The breakfast choices are not as numerous but they will allow you to order lunch or dinner for breakfast. Make sure your flight is not coming up to soon though, that takes a while. The food is fresh and delicious. You can get gluten free french Fries along with the coleslaw. The breakfast juices are said to be fresh squeezed. The grapefruit and orange juice sure taste like it. The price is a bit high but it is at an airport. If you are flying American it is very convenient as it sits in the middle of the American gates. Seafood is not notorious for being cheap. Try and avoid the rush as service can take a while when the place fills up. I hate eating good food in a hurry. Enjoy.

text: Look - if you have to eat at an airport restaurant this is one of the better ones. Pricy? You bet. But the overall quality  is far above standard airport fare.

text:
Housed in Terminal C pre-security, Legal C Bar is far less insane than Jerry Remy's, your other pre-security higher end food and drink option.  It's a darker option in terms of ambiance, and offers wares you would normally want in a Legal's:  Seafood and beer!  I wasn't hungry at the time, but I did get my hands on some good ol' Sam Adams.  The prices aren't bad for airline beer ($7.75 for a 23-oz, not nearly as bad as many places), and the atmosphere is perfect for watching the Pats beat up on some team that is not the Pats.  

All in all, a nice place to wait and have a beer before you go through security.

text: Legals is my favorite seafood place for the infamous lobster roll. Not sure what happened today - but me thinks I might have overpaid for my favorite sandwich.  My lobster roll looked like a Captain Hook speciality. I have never seen so many claws jammed into a sandwich - I lost count at eight after I cut the sandwich in half.  Truth be told, Legals provides a decent amount of meat each time and so it could be just the fact that the one at Logan American Airlines terminal ended up getting the left over pieces from their central hub.  The kitchen did confirm that all they had were claws today.   (Personally, I think the one at Logan's United Terminal may be better / have more volume business.  Try to make your way over there if you have time to spare).  Both are located outside the security checkpoint.   Sorry, Legal at Logan AA Terminal - you did me wrong today.

text: Nothing quite takes the edge off of driving throughBoston traffic to he airport, stripping down to your undewear at security and anticipating 6 hours of flying in a carmped tube like slurping fresh oysters and downing some potent cocktails.

text:
I am a United Frequent Flyer, and as a result, I frequent Terminal B. When dining in an airport, timeliness and service are of key importance to the experience. Unfortunately, the Legal Seafood at Terminal B has neither punctuality or attentiveness to service. They regularly overlook new diners, fail to prepare food in a timely manner or forget orders, and if you are having breakfast, prepare to be completely ignored at 8 am when the antiquated Boston liquor laws will finally allow them to serve Bloody Mary's and Mimosas. The staff simply does not seem to care that customer after customer gets up and leaves because they are simply unable to order. 

At the end of the day, there are few full service dining options in B, so we are captive hostages. The food at Legal is consistently good, but I wish they would try to make the service consistently good too.

text:
Wow, I was on a search for something decent to eat for dinner before my flight home and didn't want McDonald's. Who woulda thunk that I would stumble upon Legal Sea Foods inside terminal B of Boston Logan International Airport? I actually made it a point to try a crab cake before leaving Boston and was lucky that Legal Sea Foods was in my terminal so I was able to make their signature crab cake entree my last meal in Boston. All the seats are surrounding the bar. You find your own seat, you sit down and peruse the menu that's already left at the empty seats and a bartender/server will come over to take your order. Simple enough.

Settled on Legal's Signature Crab Cake which came with a seasonal salad. The salad was light and fresh with a slightly tart dressing which I loved. Their crab cake is described as "jumbo lump crab" and looked exactly like it. I don't have much experience with crab cakes and all the crab cakes I have had in the past were circular, fried and crispy. There is literally a lump of crab on your plate that does not look like much but is divine. I didn't expect something that looked so "lumpy" to taste so delicious. The crab you can tell is fresh and came with a complimenting mustard sauce.

Of course since Legal Sea Foods is in an airport...I expected airport pricing. Sure the price I paid for one crab cake and a salad was pretty steep but it beats overpaying at McDonald's. Service is great and the food comes out quick. Definitely a great place to grab a quick bite if your flight takes off soon OR a great place to sit around and chill.

text: I was very excited to try sea food while in Boston for work. Everyone seems to rave about New England sea food so I had to try some. This place had great reviews and I had a delayed flight, so I thought why not. I ordered the Spicy Fish and chips. I love fish and chips and the waitress recommended the spicy. The flavor was pretty dang good, but the fish was mushy and the batter on the outside was soggy. Yuck! The service was good and quick, for that I give 3 stars. If it was based off what I ate, it would be a one star.

text:
When in Boston grab a lobster roll. It's a must! 

If waiting for your flight and your stomach grumbles. Make a stop at Legal Sea Foods. 

The bread was warm and toasted. The lobster was piled high, however it was cold and slightly chewy. I wish there was an option to have it without the mayo consistency. I was not amazed and I left wished it was better.

It came with Cape Cod Kettle chips and a side of Cole Slaw. The Cole slaw was nothing extraordinary. It was simple and basic.

Pretty pricey anywhere between ~$25 to ~$35 for the lobster roll. It is based on the market price. I opted for my lobster roll to go. Service is relatively fast. Although it was not busy when I visited.

text:
Pretty much all Legal Seafood restaurants are great and you might think that the airport locations are subpar but no. This one in Logan is very good with a great location.

Compared to a full blown Legal's, this location has a limited menu but it is executed well.  I tend to stick to the sandwiches of various sorts.  

Service is really very efficient.  I sat down today and told my server I had 30 min.  My order of the crab cake sandwich was on my table, literally, in 4 minutes and it was great.  She also brought out the check without me having to ask for it.
