text: I wasn't super impressed by Legal Seafood. It was definitely not as bad as normal airport food, but it wasn't up to par with other seafood restaurants in Boston. I had the tuna burger, which wasn't bad, and my boyfriend had the crab roll, which was lacking a lot of flavor. However everything is somewhat expensive. The service was really good and friendly though!

categories: Sandwiches, Food, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Cocktail Bars, Gluten-Free, Nightlife, Bars, Salad
text:
First, if you have the opportunity to go to regular Legal Seafoods location definitely go!  The only reason for visiting this Legal C Bar location is if you're stuck flying out of Terminal B (American Airlines).

The Legal C Bar has a pared down menu in comparison to regular Legal Seafoods.  It has good enough offerings:  fried clams, salads, oysters, etc  However, be warned:  the portions are 'bar sized' so you get 1/3 the amount of clams you'd receive at the regular location.

I also tried their oysters.  Definitely not the best I've had (despite selecting the ones from the Cape).  When you go to any of the other Legal locations you are able to select from a handful of varieties (at the airport there were only 2!)

I am happy to report the the Legal C Bar does offer Dark and Stormies on their drink menu (my favorite cocktail)

The waitress my friend and I had was TERRIBLE.  We had to summon her every time we wanted to order (she didn't check in on us periodically).  This was particularly bad because I was there from 5:45 until 8:15.

If I were rating Legal C Bar on their service they would only receive a 1 star rating.  I gave them 3 because of their food and drinks.

text:
Best option for airport food. I had a really good crab meat and lobster omelet. It is $23 after tip+tax so a bit pricy. They also have a cheaper breakfast sandwich option with just eggs and bacon for $7. Will try that next time. The food comes quite fast.

It also comes with 2 slices of toast but it was room temperature. The fruits that came with it was sad.

text:
Isn't the airport supposed to have extra delicious cocktails....
My Bloody Mary tasted like shrimp cocktail.
Although the food was quit delicious for the most part besides a few snags here and there. 
The lobster bisque was delicious!! Wish I could say the same about the Bloody Mary. 
My sister got the chicken quesadilla, it was almost flavorless. 
The fish and chips were on point, really good!
The waiter was adorable. He had the best Boston accent I heard my whole trip! ;)

text:
You wouldn't think a restaurant at the airport offer cheaper fresh, raw oysters than the ones in the city but that's what I found here at Legal C Bar.

We ordered half dozen raw oysters and it was only $13.95, great great choices, and cheaper than the Neptune or Old Union Oyster in downtown.

Other menu items are also very reasonable priced and exceeded our expectation of airport restaurant dishes.
 
The hostess was very considerate and helpful!  She asked if we were in a rush to catch our plane or have some time to kill when we were seated.  (Good impression to start!)

If you are at Terminal C at BOS and have some time before departure, try this place out, you won't be regretting.

text: Ohh Legal Sea Foods. How you were a lifesaver to us on our most recent trip to Boston. Nevermind it was about 8:00 in the morning and we were flying back to DC and we had not YET had clam chowder. (I mean clam chowder alone is part of why I keep coming back). My boyfriend and I were determined to find clam chowder and we thought maybe Legal is serving it this early in the morning. We were not expecting anything but we were pleasantly...no REALLY happy that the waiter said they actually had Clam Chowder at 8 in the morning. It was worth it too. Best breakfast!!!

text:
* Complete my out of town tourist street cred circuit *

Ok, so when you come from out of town to Boston there are the touristy things you are "supposed" to have (at least 3 from the following list):

- Lobster roll.
- Clam chowder.
- Drunken fist fight.  
- Fried clam platter.

I took care of the first two at a classically touristy spot:  http://www.yelp.com/biz/boston-chowda-boston-2#hrid:KqFvLJMr5hHa5vFweTNoug and really didn't want to get into a drunken fist fight, so I was left with the fried clam platter as my task for the circuit completion.  

I almost screwed up as I didn't have time before heading out to the airport, but thankfully there was an option during the delay for my outbound flight.  Hooray!

Restaurants in airports usually focus on quick service as most people are in a bit of a rush.  Not so much at this location. It took about 35 minutes for my platter to arrive.  Perhaps they were trying to encourage out of towners to drink and get into a drunken fist fight before leaving?!?!?!  I opted to stay true to my goal of the clams though.  

The timing was surprisingly slow considering there were only 3 other tables filled in the restaurant.  The manager did apologize at least.  

The clams were whole belly, plump and creamy.  They were very nicely prepared without being overly greasy.  They were also served in a very generous portion.  Very nice clams.  The fries and coleslaw left me underwhelmed though.  Photo of platter:  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/_O6us7HKpURgYhDcTAK7dQ?select=9b_OVJmgGYaexStx5n9WyA

So overall 4 stars for the clams, 2 stars for everything else (including the wait) for a solid 3 star performance.  Not bad for airport dining I suppose - and thankfully I left Boston safely without anyone picking a fight!

text: I was disappointed that I didn't get a chance to try Legal Seafood while in Boston  ... until I noticed one at the airport. I had a very early lunch (11:00) with no wait at the bar. The crab roll was amazing. Service was friendly and quick. I hope to try the "real" restaurant next time I'm in town.

text: As a college student I was employed by Legal Seafoods for exactly six weeks. There was a fish-market and wine store attached to their downtown Boston location, and their fish-cutter Mr. Woo was planning a two-week vacation. For four weeks he introduced me to his regulars and taught me just how they preferred their tuna sliced, or how close to the skin they preferred their salmon. Then for two weeks I did my best, representing the quiet master fish-cutter and chatting with the 6am prostitutes stopping in to end their night with a half-bottle of wine. After the two weeks, Mr. Woo returned and my time was up. This morning the airport Legal's isn't open yet, chairs stacked upside down along the bar, leaving me with nothing to chew on but memories.

text: We came in to have a Bloody Mary before our flight left for a much needed vacation. We went in because of the reputation of Legal  Seafoods but I must say we were very disappointed. The drinks lacked flavor, bartenders were dismissive of us,  and we were subjected to their derogatory comments in regards to other staff members and customers. Even if we had been offered a second drink in a timely manner we would have refused. Sitting at our gate was a far more pleasant experience.

text:
POS is directly adjacent to bar. If you happen to be seated in that area. Made for an uncomfortable experience as there a people counting cash, entering orders and just discussing the day directly over your meal.

Order a lobster roll with a salad and mug o chowdah. The stew was awesome as usual. The salad passable and the roll was disappointing.  It lacked flavor and came with mire lobster than needed. Greatly over powering that delicate  balance of buttered toasted bread and sweet succulent crustacean flesh. Also had a tad bit too much tarragon.

The service itself was very good and management was out to assist with any problems in expediting tables.

categories: Sandwiches, Food, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Cocktail Bars, Gluten-Free, Nightlife, Bars, Salad
text:
Came here on Christmas Day while traveling by myself. 

I ordered the swordfish and shrimp. The shrimp was overcooked - rubbery and dry. 

The swordfish was well cooked and well seasoned, although it was quite petite for over $20, especially considering there were only a few shrimpy shrimps on the plate. 

The best part - the butternut squash was good, but just regular good, nothing more, which isn't saying much. 

Also, my server took forever to greet me. She forgot to bring my water. I waited 10 minutes and then asked someone else to get it for me - they had it back in less than a minute as the tap was very close to where I was sitting near the bar. 

My waitress didn't bring me my food, or visit me once it arrived or during the course of the meal. She came well after I was finished - more than 5 minutes after someone else cleared my plate - and said "did your food ever come?"

I though to myself, "maybe it's because this place is packed." But then I took a sec to look around and make an assessment. In my section, only about 60% of tables had customers seated - and that's over generous.

Not a wonderful experience. Expensive, mediocre food in meager portions. Bad service.

text:
Shared 
Small Strawberry Sangria (watered down)
Small Fun Punch (was expecting straight punch but there's a weird flavor and aftertaste to it, sort of like cinnamon), weird mixture, Not recommended

Nice view of the water front, where the boats dock and fishermans wharf.

text: Got there at 7 pm when I was informed of last call.  This has to do with flight schedule but still annoying.  The fish stew was reasonable but for a place that's known for fish, sub par.  It is at the airport and if that's where you are staying not a bad option.

text:
So, there are many reviews already so I don't have a lot to add.  Stopped in here on my way back home from Boston to get a lobster roll.  Husband said they were really good;  don't tell him, but he was right!

Pile of lightly dressed lobster salad on a buttery, toasty bun - just what I was there for.  Got great service at the bar and really enjoyed my food.

What do you expect when you order lobster in an airport - a punch in the wallet, that's what! Paid almost $40 with tip for a lobster roll, fries, and cole slaw.  Priciest meal I had on this trip, but also the best so I guess it works out.  I plan to visit this place every time I get the chance.

text: This is the only option where one can grab a bite if you are in this terminal (there is a Dunkin Donuts as well). The service is slow which can be a problem if you are trying to catch a flight. I ordered a salad and the sirloin steak. The steak was extremely overcooked, rubbery, and dry. The salad was delicious; however, it was drenched in dressing so if you want a salad as a light option ask for the dressing on the side. I had a sweet waitress but she would pay a visit to my table every 15 minutes. Perhaps this is the kind of place that one should stick to ordering seafood.

text:
I literally had lunch at Legal C just 30 minutes ago and already dreaming about my perfectly cooked medium rare Niman Ranch cheeseburger.

Yes, you heard right, MEDIUM RARE.

When our waitperson (Carol) asked how I wanted my burger cooked I thought there was no way in hades that my burger would come out medium rare. I was hoping for medium well and semi-dry. What came out was one of the best burgers I have ever tasted. AND THIS IS WAS IN AN AIRPORT!!!

My wife had the fried clams and since I am not a seafood eater, can only reiterate what she said which was "mmmmmmm!" I take that as being a good sign.

Great service and an awesome wine list that had no significant markup on any of their bottles (i.e. $75 for a bottle of Alexander Valley Silver Oak). The best airport eatery I have ever been to!

text: Sadly I eat here quite frequently. The food is usually ok but the service is not so good. I asked for a small table, and was told 10-15m wait. I arrive at the high top to find 4 small tables open across the divider. Needless to say I walked out. In general I have also found service to be less than attentive the other dozen or so times I have eaten here, and greeter attitudes poor at best. Boston is my home base and Delta is the carrier I fly - so sad Not to get a weekly dose of seafood here.

name: Legal Sea Foods

text:
Chowder chowder chowder.

Pretty darn good chowder, just needed a little bit of salt and pepper (my personal tastes).

Service was quick and friendly.

The prices weren't gouging.

Lots of TVs in the bar.

Legal C is outside of security, which means some last minute quality time with people you like.

I'm a fan!

text:
I was just here for their oysters. Took awhile for the oysters to arrive after we ordered. Oysters were pretty good! I prefer that explained the differences in flavor/size/texture of the oyster types rather than just where they were from. 

What is great about this location is that it is right across from boston harbor cruises. Perfect for a pre or post cruise meal!

text: While waiting at the airport, we decided to get lunch here. We inquired about the chowders and the server gave us samples of the Legal Clam Chowder vs. Rhode Island Red Clam Chowder. So very nice of her! We ended getting the Legal Clam Chowder. I ordered the Crab cakes combo with scallops and shrimp, which was good but the highlight was the Legal Clam Chowder! Although it was a chowder, it still wasn't too heavy and it was full of seafood-goodness flavors. Definitely try some while you're here!!

text:
Vindication!

For starters, if you happen to be upwards of ninety minutes early for your Virgin America flight, don't bother with security, come here first.

Now on with the review:

Let's present a hypothetical (yet realistic) situation.  You're hungry and you're at the airport.  You take a seat at *insert lame cheesy generic airport restaurant name* and peruse the menu.  You settle on an over priced burger or some other food item and when it arrives, it appears smaller and less appetizing than a Big Mac.  From then on you loathe airport food and become convinced all airport restaurants are crap.

I meditated this situation while seated at the bar at Legal C.  The very polite and helpful bartender had just served me a Sam Adams and I pondered the food.  I figured I was going to get jobbed anyway so I decided on the seafood trio roll.  I figured it was going to be terrible so I might as well see how bad they could do on something like this.

I was pleasantly proven wrong.

The roll was an opulent overflowing submarine of fresh seafood.  The crab meat was discernible from the lobster meat instead of being one giant mix.  The bartender let me know I could have any of the sides listed on the menu.  While the broccoli and polenta were sparingly served, they were tasty and a nice change from the same ol' bland slaw n' fries combo.  I tried not to wolf it down like some seadog but it seemed inevitable.  Combine this with the fresh Sam Adams and Harpoon on draught and free Wi-Fi in Logan Airport and I wasn't too disappointed that I'd arrived two and a half hours early for my flight.

Bartenders were friendly and loquacious.  Besides their good nature they were completely on top of keeping both my water and beer glasses full. 

Legal C Bar:  Airport food done right.

text:
Great lobster salad and clam chowder. convenient location to the B gates. 

Got the seafood trio over salad (they customize!) and it was delicious! Fresh and really generous portions of seafood (~$21). The clam chowder is also creamy and full of flavor yet not overly salty. 

On the pricey side but considering we are at an airport, very high caliber food. 

Staff is nice and courteous. I love sitting at the bar and enjoying the runway view before a flight.

Took 10 minutes to receive an order of 2 bloody Mary's.

Thy came not even full, with what tasted like no vodka, and celery that had CLEARLY gone bad.

Price was fine but service was subpar as were the drinks.

I expect so much more from Legal than this. Not good.

text:
Had a few hour layover and we stopped in here for a bite. Some of the best airport I've had. We had the clam chowder, thick and delicious! We also split the surf and turf burger which was very good. Our waitress even went the extra step and split the burger for us on separate plates and gave us double the fries and coleslaw on the side. 

Next time I'm in the Boston airport I will be sure to stop by this place.

text:
After the C Ocean at JFK's JetBlue's terminal, this might be my next favorite airport restaurant. 

Beer is cheaper here than some restaurants downtown and the seafood is just as fresh as one could expect on the Cape.

I have had the pleasure eating breakfast and lunch here. Two separate occasions I might add.

For breakfast, I had the lobster omelette which was perfectly light. A good way to start the day.

Recently I had the lobster roll for lunch. Although some place downtown are trying to skimp on the size, they don't do that here. A full 6-inch buttered roll with almost a full lobster in it.

I enjoy coming here and I don't mind being stuck here. Legal Seafood makes it worth to fly in and out of Boston.

The only reason why I deducted a star is because of service. If you are not a frequent flyer and you have only one hour before your flight, go somewhere else.
Food comes out within 10 minutes but it might take you a while to flag down a server.
Tip for the restaurant: get a hostess

text: I'm sorry. I feel the place was over rated. The calm  chowder was tasteless.  The potatoes were grainy.  The fish and chips are  salty.  I will admit the service was good and the view was breath taking. I know I will not be trying this place again. But, for Boston known best place... I wasn't impressed. plus I never was offered a wine list. No suggestions on what to eat. No asking if it was our first time. had they asked and we said yes. they would have been able to tell us what meal and signature drinks they are known for and maybe I would have been impressed with that.

text: I had a couple of hours to spare, so I stopped by this mini Legal's in Terminal C for a cocktail and a bite to eat prior to boarding.  The Portuguese fisherman's stew is one of my favorite items on the menu and it did not disappoint at this location.  There was a tiny bit of sand in the oysters and clams, but the freshness and tenderness of the seafood made up for it.  The service was professional and my meal was totally satisfying.

text:
My very first trip to Boston 25 years ago (1986) was to obtain parental consent for marriage (call me old fashion).  It was also the first time I was exposed to the Legal Seafood restaurant.  I made a pig out of myself by order the Fisherman Platter (or was it the Lobster Bake?).  Since then I never had the opportunity to return until this last trip to drop my youngest son off to college.  I never expected to see Legal at the airport.

I remembered the last few times I was at the airport that the food was just mediocre.  But now I see upscaled restaurants....Legal C Bar being one of them.  The ony problem I have with my experience at Legal C Bar is the price.  Sure, this is an upscale establishment and yes the service was nearly second to none (the person who waited was exceptional and I should have jotted down her name for this review), but I just can't see paying restaurant prices for their "satellite" located in an airport.

Regards to the food, if it weren't for the fact that their Lobster Bake would have cost $35, I might have feasted and suffered (being bloated/stuffed) on the way back to The City. So instead I settled for the special of the day - a very nicely prepared grilled salmon (see photo). with a cup of their signature chowder.  Needless to say the grilled salmon (I was not about to eat a landlubber meal) was the most tender slab of salmon I have ever eaten.  Accompanied by a couple of prawns over a bed of rice and asparagus (perfectly cooked), the meal was light, but enough before the flight home.  It was a fitting way to end my vacation.

Maybe next time I will tackle the Lobster Bake, but at their restaruant away from the airport.

text:
lobster roll... do it. you will thank me later.

really, i've had sandwiches all over the world... and this is probably one of the best sandwiches i've ever ever eaten. yes, i know it's the vaunted legal seafood, but it's in an airport you say... believe me you... it's good.

the sweetness of the lobster, the tangyness of the dressing, the softness of the bread, it's a perfect sandwich. there really isn't a whole lot more that i can say... eat it and love every bite.

final word? wicked.

text: Got the clam chowder and blt. Chowder was good, but not special. Blt was too oily, and bacon not great. Overall, if you need to stop at the airport it is good place to get food. Service good.

text: I love me some Legal Sea Foods so while passing through my old hometown's airport (Logan), it was a no brainer to go there for some lunch.  No one does New England Clam Chowder like Legal so I got a cup while my mom got the Lobster Bisque (also a favorite of mine).  We decided to split the crab cake sandwich that came with fries and coleslaw.  It was all awesome but when we noticed the table next to us with the same crab cake but served on a plate with fresh greens, we were envious.  We'll get that next time rather than the heavier sandwich.  You can't beat the crab cakes which are 99% crab meat.  The reason for 3 stars?  We weren't given (or offered) the crunchy, addictive rolls that are required when having the chowder and/or bisque.  We never saw our server again to even ask for them after our food was served.  The place is only but so big and watching the servers congregate at the entrance shooting the breeze was just frustrating.  I saw other tables actually getting up and going over to them to ask for items.  Food is good, service, not so much.

text: I was early to the airport, which is normally a good thing but I didn't know that Virgin America's security checkpoint was not going to be open for another hour. I missed that memo.  Oh how I hate to wait especially on airport chairs, so I came here.   Set down my bags and endeavored to waste as much time as possible.  I ordered an iced tea and a cup of chowder. The chowder was better than I expected, peppered with whole clams.  I decided to top that off with a piece of apple cake with cinnamon ice cream.  The cake also has some bitter apple sauce that went nicely with the sweetness of the cake.  By far this is the best meal I have had at an airport and my bill was mere $15 plus tip.

text:
The manager is on top of his game at this location helping shuffle people and move it along. The food is standard very good seafood fare that I expect from this chain. When purchasing seafood, always go for what is local. Lobster, oysters, and some of the clams are local, so I recommend sticking to those, they've never disappointed at this or other Logan and Boston Legal Seafood locations. Crab is not really local in new england, I never order it at Legal, and I have been unimpressed when tasting dining partner crab dishes. 

Back to this location - they've got all the standards (chowdah, clams, lobstah) down pat, with a good airport service speed. The tables are SMOOSHED together - they really could use a bigger space, but they seem to make it work.

text:
I travel and it was funny that when i asked where the best seafood resto was in Boston the taxi took me to the airport ! WHAT ! REALLY ! Nooo !

Yup so I reluctantly went with a few of my friends and looked around at the terminal for Legal Seafood. Hmmmm so is there Illegal seafood in Boston now im curious.

We found it and it had a nice view of the tarmac not my choice of views but ok im down to try the food.

In short its not the best ive had I wouldnt reccomend it but for a quick place to fill up before or after a flight yes by all means eat at Legal seafood.

text: Waiting in Terminal B between flights we indulged in the fisherman's platter -- deepfried shrimp, scallops, clams, calamari, fish and french fries.  The portion was enough to share and the server very helpfully had the platter divided into two servings and added coleslaw for each of us. I thought the food was over-fried -- too brown and just on the edge of burned and/or that the grease hadn't been changed lately; it had a strong taste.  The cup of lobster bisque was a large portion and had good-sized chunks of lobster in the bottom.

text:
If I have to be stuck at an airport, I might as well have a giant plate of lobster and a giant cup of booze while I wait.

Whenever I leave Boston, I eat here.  Not only is it yummy, it's about 100 feet from the Virgin gates.  Win-Win!

It's a little more expensive than a regular Legal C, but, duh, airport!  And considering the other options at Logan, I don't think I will need to deviate from this plan.

The service is always excellent and they are sensitive to the fact that you are in an airport and are probably cranky.

Pro tip: the Elderflower White Sangria is one of the best cocktails I have ever had at an airport.  Hell, I'd drink it anywhere!  It's stiff but incredibly flavorful.

text: Yes, you can get an excellent meal at the airport.  I get the crab cakes or the crab cake platter.  The crab cakes are top notch...again am I really getting this in an airport?  I always top the meal off with Boston cream pie....perfect.  The staff is always polite and make sure you are on your way in a timely manner.

name: Legal Sea Foods

text:
What a great airport dining experience. Actually just a great dining experience - period. Really fresh food and excellent service, drinks and wine. It's not cheap (especially if you must have lobster - which is so scarce in San Francisco) but it's soooo good and did I mention fresh? 

It really helped me get through yet another miserable United Airlines flight.

text: I know the chowder is delicious.  However the service is horrible.  The servers don't even acknowledge your presence so you have a high probability of not being served.  They are more interested in gossiping and acting busy than helping customers.

categories: Sandwiches, Food, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Cocktail Bars, Gluten-Free, Nightlife, Bars, Salad
text:
I have so many wonderful things to say about this restaurant:

1. The waitress was extremely helpful and knew about what the chef cooked, which is a big deal for me. I have Celiac, so I generally err on the side of caution with food: no dressing, no crumbs, no bread, no pasta, no sauces, etc.  But she was able to tell me what was made in house and what was safe, so I was able to enjoy EVERYTHING

2. They surprised me with gf bread rolls.  I just don't even know what to say, it was so lovely! No one has gf bread rolls!

3. The seafood was absolutely amazing.  I ordered the seafood casserole, and it had gf bread crumbs on top.  I was so happy I could cry.

4. They have a gf menu that explains that they wash and dry the pans and utensils before cooking gf dishes, so meals are not contaminated.  This was the icing for me. They honestly understand how hard it is to cook gf, and contamination is just as bad as eating gluten.

These people are amazing.  Thank you.

text: Legal Seafoods owns the Boston area -- well, the Boston area owns seafood in this country in general, so I knew the Legal C Bar was going to be tasty.  All I ordered was a clam chowder, but it was delicious.  The ambiance of the location too makes you temporarily forget that you're in an airport, which is a welcome reprieve.  Should check it out!

name: Legal Sea Foods

categories: Sandwiches, Food, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Cocktail Bars, Gluten-Free, Nightlife, Bars, Salad
text:
I haven't tried a Legal Sea Foods for years.  After walking 6 miles through the airport for work I craved some clam chowder.  The hostesses are incredibly friendly and seat you as soon as you walk in.  I saw at least 3 helping to seat customers.  My waitress was efficient and cordial enough.  

I felt very mixed about my meal - a mug of New England clam chowder and the Jasmine Shrimp.  I incorrectly supposed I was splurging on the soup and going light on the entree.  Oh so wrong.  Their chowder fully deserves its reputation.  Rich, creamy and bursting with sweet tender clams served with a packet of Legal's own oyster crackers.  I wondered that they only offered it in one size - a mug for $6.95.  Turns out that's all you need.  I was filling up before I reached the bottom of the cup with only half of the crackers.  It also gets saltier the more spoonfuls you eat.  Very satisfying on an empty stomach all by itself!  The shrimp on the other hand proved a rather disappointing choice. They layer tons of mozzarella cheese and some tartar like sauce (I hate tartar sauce) over 4 otherwise great jumbo shrimp and a cup or two of jasmine rice lined with broccoli florets.  I scraped as much as I could from the broccoli and shrimp for an astonishing $17.95.  I should have gone with the market priced fried clams - but for $18.95??  

They lose a star for the epic pricing but get two for service with a Bostonian flair.  Do yourself a favor and stick with the chowder either in or to go.

name: Legal Sea Foods
attributes: {'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BikeParking': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Caters': 'False', 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'HasTV': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'Music': "{'dj': False, 'background_music': False, 'no_music': False, 'jukebox': False, 'live': False, 'video': False, 'karaoke': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'GoodForDancing': 'False', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BestNights': "{'monday': False, 'tuesday': False, 'friday': False, 'wednesday': False, 'thursday': False, 'sunday': False, 'saturday': False}", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsTableService': 'True', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': None}", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'True', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': True, 'casual': True}"}

text:
This was a fantastic addition to the terminal! My concern going into the meal was that Legal is not exactly the most efficient meal to be having before hoping on a plane but the server was great. He still recognized that its not cheap food and the whole experience should not be rushed but he asked us when our flight was leaving and was very prompt once we were ready the order. 

All the food met the standards of the other Legal Seafood locations, and despite the fact that it sits right next to the security line it was actually a pretty relaxing and enjoyable meal. 

Thanks for improving my airport experience!

name: Nancy Wilde, LMT
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True'}
categories: Health & Medical, Beauty & Spas, Massage Therapy, Massage, Chiropractors
text: I saw Nancy for massage therapy a few times during my pregnancy and wish I had come to her sooner! She is extremely knowledgable about prenatal massage, and offers many comfortable props and pillows to allow for relaxation and relief from all the aches and pains pregnancy can bring. I would highly recommend her to anyone who is pregnant or a new mom for some much needed R&R.

name: Nancy Wilde, LMT
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True'}
categories: Health & Medical, Beauty & Spas, Massage Therapy, Massage, Chiropractors
text: Nancy gave me a head, neck, and shoulder massage for an ongoing migraine that had pretty much crippled me for the better part of a week. She provided exactly the relief that was needed - she located particularly tight areas very quickly, and worked them until they loosened up. It was MUCH, MUCH needed relief, and VERY much appreciated. I would go again in a heartbeat.

name: Nancy Wilde, LMT
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True'}
categories: Health & Medical, Beauty & Spas, Massage Therapy, Massage, Chiropractors
text: I went in for a more extensive massage because the migraines have become more debilitating. I should have gone back in sooner. Nancy is the epitome of professional, and very much treats massage as a dialogue between client and massage therapist. She asks for feedback during the massage to help her know where to focus, is very sensitive and responsive to issues that might affect comfort with massage, and explains what she is doing as she proceeds (in ways that are clearly understandable). I plan to start going in on a regular basis, she is that wonderful. HIGHLY recommended.

name: Brewer/Burroughs Tot Lot
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Playgrounds, Active Life
text:
If you have a kid between the ages of "pulling up" and "old enough for organized sports," the Tot Lot is for you. Technically aimed at the under 5 crowd, this place is a godsend for parents and caregivers who just. cannot. be. inside. any. more. The structures are fine, but the real appeal is the massive quantity of push toys, ride-on toys, dump trucks, etc. There are even some activity seats for the really young crowd. The community seems to value having these items, so when some disappear after weather and children have taken their toll, new ones periodically appear. Watch your children "practice" sharing over the very best ones!

Grab some coffee at JP Licks and head over here first thing in the morning. Or bring pizza from The Same Old Place for a lunch time gathering. Or head out around 11 am to hit the lunch buffet at Bukhara. All in all, this place is a critical part of the rotation of life in JP with kids.

name: Brewer/Burroughs Tot Lot
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Playgrounds, Active Life
text:
I took the kids here. The kids were really live this place. It has a lots of toy and people to come here. 

I would recommend if you have kid age 1-6years old, you should take them here :)

name: Brewer/Burroughs Tot Lot
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Playgrounds, Active Life
text:
Nice playground with lots of used toys for kids to play with. My 14 month old enjoyed it and spent a fair amount of time playing in the sandbox, on the baby swing (there are two), and on the slides area. Some of the stuff is a little run down/dirty but considering it's free you really can't complain. There are many repeat toys in case it's crowded there should be something for everyone. 

Fair amount of shade makes this a nice place to hang out even on a hot day. I like the benches and tables for families as well as the water fountains.

name: Brewer/Burroughs Tot Lot
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BikeParking': 'True'}
categories: Playgrounds, Active Life
text:
We've been going to the tot lot for four years now. My older daughter is four and outgrowing it, and my younger daughter is two and loves it and uses all that this small lot has to offer.

There's a good amount of shade, especially around the edges. Any parent knows this is a rare, good thing in a playground. The structures are fun, well build, and well maintained.

There's a large sandbox, a seesaw that looks like it's designed to make kids lose all their teeth, but I've yet to see any injuries. The only swings are little baby swings hung from the now-useless monkey bars.

The lot is completely fenced in. It's one block over from Centre street and a two minute walk to JP Licks. If you didn't know where this playground was, you'd never even know it existed, but it doesn't stay a secret from any parent for long.

name: Espresso Minute
attributes: {'NoiseLevel': "'quiet'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'WheelchairAccessible': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'Caters': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'Alcohol': "'none'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': False, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}", 'RestaurantsTableService': 'False'}
categories: Creperies, Restaurants, Food, Coffee & Tea, Breakfast & Brunch
text: Very good coffee and solid crepes. I would admit the branding of this store is a bit confusing but once you get over that you will find good coffee and crepes, the products and services are what mattered in my opinion!

name: The Daily Stroll
categories: Pet Services, Pet Groomers, Pet Stores, Pet Sitting, Pets, Dog Walkers
text: As a goldendoodle owner I admittedly tend to be picky about my pup's cut.  (No poodle cut please!)  I've now taken him here at least three or four times and we both always leave happy. Katie listens to what I'm looking for and does just that. The first time we went, there was some matting on his tail and they gave me a call to discuss our options which I appreciated.  Each time I can't believe how quick it is. It's typically taken a half a day at other groomers, and I get a call that Walter is ready in just two hours (or less)!  Lastly,I love that he's not crated when finished and gets to run around a bit and depending on the day happily play with other pups until I arrive to pick him up.

name: The Daily Stroll
categories: Pet Services, Pet Groomers, Pet Stores, Pet Sitting, Pets, Dog Walkers
text:
My 4- legged daughter Mia has been coming for daycare ever since TDS opened in Brookline and she goes in with her tail wagging!
Safe place for the love of your life and Bryn is extremely responsive!
Need I say more?
Meera

name: The Daily Stroll
categories: Pet Services, Pet Groomers, Pet Stores, Pet Sitting, Pets, Dog Walkers
text: Took my dog for grooming there which we love!! So after a couple of times decided  to give the daycare a try. They are wonderful at the daycare. They have so much patience with my hyperactive puppy!! Very happy we found this place

name: The Daily Stroll
categories: Pet Services, Pet Groomers, Pet Stores, Pet Sitting, Pets, Dog Walkers
text: I have taken my dog here several times for grooming and daycare and have always been pleased.  Their grooming is first-rate. Dogs have a comfortable, bright space to move around, and it always makes me smile to see all sizes and shapes chilling on the sofas. Really glad to have such a quality service in the neighborhood.

name: The Daily Stroll
categories: Pet Services, Pet Groomers, Pet Stores, Pet Sitting, Pets, Dog Walkers
text:
Love The Daily Stroll. If your looking for a no-fuss, reliable and friendly dog walking service in the Brookline/Allston/Brighton area then look no further. The daily stroll is basically a one stop shop. They walk my dog twice a week and groom her when she needs it. They also have other services like doggie daycare, but I do not use this. I can tell they actually care about their customers and their pets. They are very professional and rates are reasonable. Will be keeping my business here for as long as I am in the area.

Thanks Bryn and The Daily Stroll for making my doggie care needs easy & convenient.

name: The Daily Stroll
categories: Pet Services, Pet Groomers, Pet Stores, Pet Sitting, Pets, Dog Walkers
text:
My dog will not go to any other daycare, and I can understand why. Their space is large and open for playtime--and well air conditioned, which is important on hot days!--and the comfy couches are great for naps. The dogs I've met here are *great*, playful and fun, and my pup comes home tired and happy at the end of the day.

Unlike every other daycare place I've seen in the Boston area, dogs here get to go outside several times a day to relieve themselves. This is important for my dog, who won't go indoors. It also just seems more humane not to force a dog to pee and poop where they play.

Most importantly, the staff are all fabulous. We are infrequent customers, since I work from home most days--but whenever we come, they all know my pooch and welcome her with affection and care! These are great folks and major dog lovers. :)

name: The Daily Stroll
categories: Pet Services, Pet Groomers, Pet Stores, Pet Sitting, Pets, Dog Walkers
text: The Daily Stroll, formerly Durty Harry, is where we have been taking our Bichon Frise for grooming for several years.  We're always happy with the ease of scheduling appointments with Bryn the owner and Katie's ability to make Stewie feel comfortable while she bathes and cuts his hair.  Check them out!

name: The Daily Stroll
categories: Pet Services, Pet Groomers, Pet Stores, Pet Sitting, Pets, Dog Walkers
text: Lydia did a great job grooming my boy. Very accommodating and professional! Good grooming and the dogs seem happy. Love this business and hope it sticks around forever

name: The Daily Stroll
categories: Pet Services, Pet Groomers, Pet Stores, Pet Sitting, Pets, Dog Walkers
text: We are so happy that we started going to the Daily Stroll for their grooming services. Our dog gets really excited when he realizes that we're going there, and they are always thorough, courteous and prompt. We couldn't recommend them more highly!

name: The Daily Stroll
categories: Pet Services, Pet Groomers, Pet Stores, Pet Sitting, Pets, Dog Walkers
text:
Have been taking our little girl Bella to The Daily Stroll for a few years now and haven't been disappointed. They know her by name and know the haircut we like her to have!

Bella gets scared of bigger dogs and is apprehensive on going into the store but its no different than me going to the dentist, I don't want to go - but I am glad I went afterwards! I notice the staff caring for the other dogs getting groomed and are confident they are treat every dog with respect. Nothing but positive things to say about the entire staff at The Daily Stroll, thanks so much!

name: The Daily Stroll
categories: Pet Services, Pet Groomers, Pet Stores, Pet Sitting, Pets, Dog Walkers
text: Awesome service! Very satisfied with our dogs groom. Most places we've taken our dog are afraid to trim her black nails and end up not trimming them. But they did it and they did an excellent job. Her cut was super even and exactly what we wanted. They were careful not to cut a big mole she has and a wart on her paw. I am so happy we found our place! Highly recommended!

name: The Daily Stroll
categories: Pet Services, Pet Groomers, Pet Stores, Pet Sitting, Pets, Dog Walkers
text: I just recently moved into Brookline and was a little skeptical at first to bring my dog into a different groomer, considering he is 7 and doesn't do very well with strangers but after reading so many great reviews I decided to give the Daily Stroll a try. The receptionist was friendly and attentive, this place is also a dog daycare and I was happy to see all the lovely dogs bonding and playing with each other. I felt comfortable leaving Louis for his first groom with Brenda who was incredibly caring and competent, it felt as if she was caring for her own dog and the moment I walked out I knew Louis was safe. When he was ready to be picked up I was amazed at how beautiful he looked, the cut was perfect much better than my prior groomer. Louis looked younger and every detail was seamless, he appeared stoked to be sporting out the new haircut! I am happy to have found a new groomer I can trust I even plan on taking Louis in to play with all the friends he made

name: Gigi's Roast Beef & Pizza
attributes: {'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'Alcohol': "u'none'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'HasTV': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, Sandwiches, Pizza
text: On May 3rd I was meeting family at Burlington Common for some prom photos, my bus from Boston arrived early so I decided to grab a slice before they got there. As I walked up to the store a kid sitting out front smoking got up and entered before me. I ordered my slice and soda from a person standing at the cash register. The kid who was out front smoking moments ago, walks over to the carosel , on the counter, no gloves on, grabs my slice and literally tosses it in the oven. Stunned I asked, you wash your hands in that 5 seconds you just walked in. Both he and the guy at the register just stand there mouths open, no response. I told the guy at the register to just give me back my money. The smoker reaches into the oven, pulls the slice out and puts it back in the carosel. The guy at the register then offers the pizza, no cost??? I told him the kid just put the slice back in the carosel, I don't think you get it. I left, a different person, (manager/owner) came outside and offered me 2 free pizzas, I left.

name: Gigi's Roast Beef & Pizza
attributes: {'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'Alcohol': "u'none'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'HasTV': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True'}
categories: Restaurants, Sandwiches, Pizza
text:
The one thing this place is missing is a menu item that blows you away. There is nothing inherently bad that I've had, but nothing to really cement me into being a loyal customer. 

The ultimate roast beef sandwich on the onion roll (with onion and bbq) is probably my favorite, as I'm not a big pizza fan. My family does enjoy the pizza. I will say that the rolls are really good here --- I accidentally ordered a roast beef sub instead of the ultimate roast beef, and the roll had a great texture.

I had a hankering for some tiramisu, and decided to try it here. Theirs is not homemade --- which is a bummer because good tiramisu can be a huge seller. In fact, when it was delivered (very promptly I might add), the cake was still frozen (it had ice crystals still in it). I didn't mind it -- but aside from being frozen, the flavor was bland (I like the authentic rich liquored tiramisu)

The people here are very nice,and we have gotten delivery twice now. Both times, the driver was prompt and very nice.

name: Gigi's Roast Beef & Pizza

text: Just ordered delivery from Gigi's.  Everything was pretty good.  The garlic bread was great, little pieces of garlic on the bread instead of a fake garlic spread was really good.  The fried pickles were tasty.  i am more of a spear fan but the pickles chips and the sauce they came with were good.  The chicken parm sub was good size the seeded roll was very good and perfectly toasted.  My only problem was the lack of sauce and cheese on the sub. Luckily the garlic bread came with sauce so i dipped away.  All in all everything was good.

text: I was waiting for a meeting.  It was in between meals.  My waistline shouted "restraint" but my mouth hungered.  I parked in the lot in front of this place and my mouth won.  The pizza was hot, cheese gooey, dough crisp, service prompt, and price reasonable.  I enjoyed my 20 minutes of respite from the responsible world of restraint.  I'll gladly return and do it again the next time my mouth overrules my better judgement.

name: Goodyear Auto Service
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False'}
categories: Oil Change Stations, Tires, Auto Repair, Automotive
text: These guys could care less about your car. Just very poor work quality. I was thankful they could get me in to the shop in very short notice but now I regret it. Wanted to get my problematic tires road force balanced. Now that is surely no fun to do, but that's why it cost me $120. That's said they did a terrible job. The balance was not very good and even though the paper says "lifetime balance" I'm hesitant to ever step foot in there again. They scraped the heck out of all my wheels. Not just the lug recesses, but all over the face of the rims!!?? The guy must have been drunk! Then to top it off, they zipped the lugs down as tight as their little impact gun could manage. Pitiful.

name: Goodyear Auto Service
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False'}
categories: Oil Change Stations, Tires, Auto Repair, Automotive
text: I would've given this location a better rating since my purchase of tires was good, but a couple of weeks after that, I went back to them because the brakes were making a strange noise. They pulled them apart, brought me back there and showed me where there was damage. They wanted to charge $1200 to fix my brakes! My wife's cousin is a former mechanic in the Marines who wanted to check them out for us. He verified that there was NOTHING wrong with them!! I can surmise that Goodyear did something while my tires were installed to make it look like the brakes were in bad shape, but that is conjecture only and I have no proof, so I won't make that claim. I will say that it's been over a year since that incident and my brakes are working fine!! It's situations like this that give auto repair businesses a bad name. Be very wary of using this location. I contacted Goodyear's HQ and they were no help. It seems that a rip off averted means to them that there was "no harm, no foul." Yeah...right! I will never use them again, even for an oil change.

name: Goodyear Auto Service
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False'}
categories: Oil Change Stations, Tires, Auto Repair, Automotive
text: Stopped in to discuss the check tire pressure alert on dash and the flat right rear tire. As I suspected it is due to the aluminum rims. Jeremy was really on top of it. Same advice as popular mechanics and the GM service bulletin. Knew exactly what was going on. Trusted him. So scheduled an appointment for Monday afternoon.  But, wait it gets better.  Show up for the appointment and they tell me that they will do a dunk test first on the formerly flat tire.  Guess what?  There is still a nail in the tire!  They fix it and when I go to pay?  Right!  No charge!  Just keep us in mind--the check pressure is due to the slowly leaking tire. Cheaper that new rims or a repair to them!  Love this place!  Thanks again guys!

name: Goodyear Auto Service
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False'}
categories: Oil Change Stations, Tires, Auto Repair, Automotive
text: This particular location has a special collection of gentlemen who know how to do their jobs and treat their customers the right way. I couldn't be more pleased with the thoroughness and respect they have shown me. I've been coming here for a couple years now, and since I've moved to Columbus, these guys have been second to none. Aaron who works up front is ACES and one of the nicest guys you will ever meet. I highly recommend this Goodyear for any needs that you could ever have on your vehicle.

name: Goodyear Auto Service
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False'}
categories: Oil Change Stations, Tires, Auto Repair, Automotive
text:
I hate getting my oil changed.  I'll admit, I'm a girl who knows absolutely nothing about my car... so I dread getting my oil changed because they always tell me I need the most expensive oil they have, when really- I'm sure the cheaper oil will do just fine.  (Maybe I'm wrong? Again, I know nothing about cars).

I was very happy with this location because 
1) I called a few hours before to make an appointment during my lunch break and they had availability
2) I noticed they are open on Sundays- always helpful! 
3) He did not try and tell me I needed a $45 oil change

Also found a coupon in my Valpak so the oil change was under $20! 

Plus- if you have Goodyear tires- tire rotation is FREE! (I like that!) 

I'm giving them 4 stars only because he had said the appointment would take 45 minutes... and it was over an hour- I realize that is not a huge deal, but I was on my lunch break and only get an hour.

Will definitely be coming back here- the staff was very friendly too!

name: Goodyear Auto Service
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False'}

text: Gone there for years, and they've earned my loyalty with honest, helpful service AND some fantastic detective work.  My 2012 Hyundai had a random rattle that was driving me crazy.  I was sure it was an expensive brakes-related issue.  Nope.  They scoured my car and found it was a loose rear spoiler. Three cheers for R. Duffy and team for their patience and diligence!

name: Goodyear Auto Service
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False'}
categories: Oil Change Stations, Tires, Auto Repair, Automotive
text:
The fuel pump in my wife's car went bad so we had it towed here. First, I gave them my number and told them to call ME when they figured out what was wrong. They called my wife. They told her she needed the new fuel pump and a whole bunch of other stuff, totaling up to $1300. Blue Book value on the car (an '04 Olds Alero) in its current condition is $2500. For the fuel pump with cleaning and filter at Goodyear its $890. No way am I spending that much on a car I intend to get rid of soon.

Anyway, they tell my wife they can't get to it until tomorrow. She says ok then tells me about it. I think it sounds ridiculous so I call around. Going rate for a fuel pump with installation is $600 WITH a new fuel filter and cleaning. Goodyear wants to charge an extra $60 for the filter. Extra $100 for the cleaning. I tell them I'm bringing a tow truck and we're taking the car elsewhere because I'm going to save myself $300 by going somewhere else. 

But wait! they say. We're already halfway into it. We've already got the fuel tank off, they say. Excuse me? You said you couldn't even get to it until tomorrow. But she authorized the repairs and we got started right away, Doug (the manager) says. I hate being forced into paying these crooks but if they're really halfway in, what am I going to do? So I get him to agree to just put on the pump and nothing else which knocks the price down to around $675. 

Now, I don't believe they're really working on the car already, so I get in my car and drive over there. Not only are they actually working on it, they're done! This was maybe 25 minutes after I called. What a miracle that a car they couldn't get to until tomorrow is suddenly done in 25 minutes when I call and threaten to take it elsewhere. Still feel like I got ripped off on that fuel pump. Don't believe those reviews that say these guys are honest. They're anything but that.

name: Bee Line Alignment
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False'}
categories: Automotive, Auto Repair, Wheel & Rim Repair, Tires, Auto Parts & Supplies
text: Not a great experience with this shop.  I brought them an unusual car, a 1974 Bradley gt (vw beetle kit car), but they said they could handle it when I made the appointment.  I thought I should get it aligned after changing out the tie rods. In short, they "aligned it" but now it drifts to the right.  The steering wheel visibly turns right if you let go.  I took it back in for them to look at again, especially since I didn't think it did that before we started aligning it.  They took a quick look then a mechanic came out to basically tell me there is nothing wrong with.  I told him its pulling to the right.  He condescendingly told me that they drive these cars before they work on them and that it was pulling to the right before I brought it in.  He was really rude and unhelpful.  He seemed to think I was trying to cheat the shop by asking that my car drive straight down the street after being aligned by professionals.  This is an ALIGNMENT shop.... I guess if you want your car "aligned" but still pulling to one side, these are your guys...

name: Bee Line Alignment
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False'}
categories: Automotive, Auto Repair, Wheel & Rim Repair, Tires, Auto Parts & Supplies
text: I've had Bee Line work on my cars and trucks since 1985. I've never had any problems with any of the work they've done. When it comes to alignment and tire service, this is where I go. Today, I had a balance, rotation, and alignment done on my 2008 GMC Sierra 2500 HD. I hadn't had these services done to it in about a year and a half. The steering was just a little sloppy, so I had them align it. I picked it up, and it drives and handles great! So much better! I'm happy with the many years of previous work I've had done at Bee Line, and I'm very happy with the work they did today. I feel that the price is reasonable, and the work is done right. Myself, I'd recommend Bee Line. Thanks Alex, and the crew, for making my truck nice to drive again.

categories: Chinese, Restaurants
text: Hunan Lion is good, but seems overrated to me.  The menu is large and I doubt you'd dislike anything you might order, but talk of it being "the best Chinese food in Columbus" makes me feel sort of cheated every time I go there.  I expect miracles, but the food here is definitely of an earthly variety.  That said, Hunan Lion is enjoyable and definitely suitable for a more "upscale" occasion or clientele.  The atmosphere is a notch above usual "Chinese restaurant" style, the restaurant can accomodate large groups, there is a full bar and large menu of tropical drinks, and the service is good - but my loyalties lie elsewhere.  3.5 stars.

text: Hands down BEST Chinese restaurant out there!! Been a faithful patron for 10 plus years.....never been disappointed! The food portions are very generous and so many yummy choices!! Some of my favorites are the Minced Chicken App, Curry Chix, Sesame Chix, all of their soups and best dish is their Peking Duck. Service is always friendly and on top of it.

name: Hunan Lion
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'HasTV': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsTableService': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': True, 'casual': False}", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}"}
categories: Chinese, Restaurants
text:
So I've been here a couple more times since my last post and I've got to say that I really do like it here.  It's good quality food and on top of that, it's close to home!

I've gotten take out here once as well and they are really on top of getting things ready! It only took 15 minutes for my order to be ready.  While I probably ordered more than enough for my wife and I, I am sad to report that they gave us 3 fortune cookies.  Time for this guy to get on that New Year's diet!

To update on the wonton soup, I really like it and perhaps it was just our first time, but the second and third time we had the soup the wontons were more plentiful. so either they read my review and upped it, or we were just unlucky the first time.

I've also had their Hunan Fried Rice, which is basically their combination fried rice as well as their beef and broccoli and their Szechuan Beef (which has really spicy peppers, so watch out!).  It's all quality and good food. While a little higher than most on price point, I think they deliver on the quality for the price.

name: Hunan Lion
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'HasTV': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsTableService': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': True, 'casual': False}", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}"}
categories: Chinese, Restaurants
text: The restaurant has a nice setup and was pretty busy. But we felt pretty awkward being the only Asian customers in the entire restaurant. You know it's a bad sign if you're an Asian lol.. but we wanted to give it a try. So we ordered Mala lamb and Szechuan chicken. We were pretty disappointed with the food. They were cooked with a lot of soy sauce. Despite being dishes from Szechuan region, there was no dried chili peppers or szechuan peppercorns in their cooking. If you're looking for an authentic Chinese food, this is not a place.

text: Absolutely so bad we left after a drink and apps.  Firstly, the server couldn't understand English and we had to point to menu items on THEIR OWN menus.  Shouldn't you know the names of your own dishes??  Nothing was outstanding, very mediocre food, poor service, definitely caters to the over 65 crowd!  This was the second time we tried it and the other was carry out that was terrible, but figured it was because of carryout (wrong food in order and cold).

name: Hunan Lion
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'HasTV': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsTableService': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': True, 'casual': False}", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}"}
categories: Chinese, Restaurants
text:
I have to say that this place was everything we hoped it would be. P.F. it is NOT, and for that, we thank the fine folks at Hunan Lion! We were in the area, and were really craving Sun Tong Luck, but alas, they are closed on Sunday and Monday. We clickly jumped on our Yelp apps to see what else was near, and Hunan Lion roared with some good reviews. We had to try it. It was only about three blocks away, but during the ride over, we were hoping for a giant fish tank, overly friendly/attentive service, and a totally non-ironic mood set by dim lights, gawdy decor, and a paper liner protecting the table cloth. They delivered on all accounts!
Our server, Emma, was super nice! She made our lettuce wraps table-side, and put them all together before she left. I have to say that they were the best ones we've ever had. I'd go back just for them, and you get four really big ones for like $7. 
The General Tso's chicken (yeah, so what) was outstanding. Not too spicy and not too sweet, the pieces were just the right size. Sometimes you get a bunch of way-too-big pieces from some places.
The beef lo mein was very good too. Lots of fresh crispy vegies, and small but whole mushrooms accompanied nice tender beef strips and a savory gravy. Again, a simple dish that's served everywhere, but often the beef is way over cooked. Not here though. It was perfect.
As with most Chinese-American places, the portions were huge (yeah, we were hungry an hour later), so you'll definitely have some leftovers which they'll box up for you (a dying trend at a lot of places). 
The place was pretty packed for a Sunday night at 8pm too. Everyone from the blue hairs to the hipsters to a family of Middle-Easterners having a birthday party. Awesome. It's just what we wanted!

text:
This place is great! I'm new to Columbus and I love Chinese food. I've lived in many major cities and I know the importance of finding one that you love... 

This place has a great clean atmosphere. A very upscale feel. I would definitely recommend bringing a date here. The menu is extensive. I've tried the General Tso's chicken, Mongolian Beef, Sweet & Sour pork and an awesome Tiger Prawns and Scallops dish. ALL cooked to perfection! 

Service was tremendous and NOT bothersome. Which I like. Whatever I asked for came quickly and didn't interrupt conversations. 

I highly recommend this joint and believe its Dublin's best kept secrete. 

I sure hope it doesn't stay that way...

I've only been for dinner and the place always seems to have plenty of seating.

Visited: 10+

text:
Although the entr√©e I ordered was insanely sweet (Sesame Chicken) I'm definitely up for trying this place again because of the nice atmosphere and super friendly service. 

A good egg roll is hard to find in Columbus and I thought these were probably the best I've had locally, obviously cooked fresh to order and not lying around like most places. Portions are generous. This is a nice place to go if you want to actually talk too, nice quiet background music, no blaring music or TVs.

text:
Ok, maybe I am spoiled with good food (Jeff L, I'm with you, bro!), but when I moved to Columbus they promised at least one good Pad Thai place in town. After searching for a while, someone suggested Hunan Lion. They told me that's where I'd find the best Pad Thai in town. I couldn't drive there fast enough. Who wouldn't want good Pad Thai? Ok, maybe 'good' means something else here, but I was not only disappointed, I was sick after I ate it. Why is it so damn sweet and red? Good Pad Thai is nothing like that!!! I can make it better myself and I never claimed to be a good Pad Thai chef.

I got a few more dishes along with that evil Pad Thai and ALL of them were pretty horrible. I give up. I will have to cook or move out of here OR go to fancier places like the "M" once in a while for 'good' food. 

So far Wholefoods is better than any casual place I've tried here. Everyone keeps telling me to consider a few joints in Short North. I'll try, once I recover from the 'good' stuff I got an Hunan Lion!

name: Hunan Lion
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'HasTV': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsTableService': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': True, 'casual': False}", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}"}
categories: Chinese, Restaurants
text:
I just went yesterday around 3 pm and was hugely impressed.  Hunan Lion is in a crappy looking strip mall next door to a dollar tree so I from first glance outside it looks like any cheap chinese food restaurant. Don't let the outside appearance fool you though, it is not your typical chinese food place that serves $5 dollar lunch specials. 

Inside it was very elegant.  Music was sort of jazz/classical and not that stereotypical generic chinese music.  It was soft enough for conversation, dim overall in the restaurant but with just enough lighting the table from a hanging light.  The walls are mirrored with painted bamboo plants and a lot of elaborate vases and other decorations.  Hunan Lion seems like a very intimate place that would be great to impress a date.  It also had a HUGE bar area that looked awesome.  Service was also phenomenal.  My water was always full and our waitress was very polite and our food came out very quickly. There were only two tables of people to serve at the time so it wasn't busy but she really helped make the experience solid.

The food was great.  I went with a friend and we decided we had to try a typical chinese restaurant dish a long with something different.  We split a general tso's chicken to compare to the type of chinese we were used to.  It was delicious.  The sauce had a bit more garlic hint to it and the chicken chunks seemed a lot less "mysterious" than the typical general tso's that I am used to.  The breading had an unmatched crispiness that I really enjoyed.  The portion was large too but significantly more expensive at $11.95 than a cheap chinese restaurant's version for less than $5. I also tried the Thai red curry beef. It was very sweet with just the right kind of spice. Sweet at first, from the coconut milk and then spicy taste but never leaving a burning in my mouth. The vegetables were cooked just right to crispiness/crunch and didn't seem slopped together in a sauce all at once. The curry was $12.95.  

Before Hunan Lion I honestly didn't know that "fine" or high quality chinese food existed in Ohio. This restaurant showed me that chinese food around these parts are not just cheap, quick, lower quality but tasty. Hunan Lion is a great place to try out some delicious cut above the rest chinese food if you are willing to spend a bit more money and impress some guests.

The chicken lettuce wraps were tasty and there were lots of lower carb options so I was very impressed..The service seemed ok considering I was with a party of 30..I'm not sure how I've never discovered this place before but I'm sure to be back..

name: Hunan Lion
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'HasTV': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsTableService': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': True, 'casual': False}", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}"}
categories: Chinese, Restaurants
text:
You know what brought me in to Hunan Lion? 

A billboard right before Columbus Gold. Somewhere on it they claimed to be the best in Columbus, and my reply to that is... so-so. 

You enter Hunan Lion through two huge wooden doors, and for some reason I was expecting hoakiness everywhere, but I was surprised. Go figure. I was also expecting a buffet. What? Can't a fat chick dream of buffet goodness? 

The ambiance is somewhere between romantic, and edges a tad close to formal. I felt a bit out of place with my hoodie covered in buttons and safety pins, dawning pig tails, and blue jeans, but my fears were laid to rest after a group of greasy nerds came in. 
We were seated after a ten minute wait in the center of one of the side rooms. I hate being a human spectacle, but I guess that will do since it was dinner rush. 

Despite the interesting conversation between a group of yuppies laughing about how their friend died while trying to climb through a window, it was nice... the ambiance and all. 
Our waitress is something the hubby and I still joke about from time to time. She was one of the most sassiest, surly, salty, Asian women I ever met. The lady says "Yes?" after every sentence, and if you don't reply Lord Cuthulu save your soul, because she got snippy. 

We got our food in a timely manner. The appetizers were... well, actually they weren't good. I ordered an egg roll, which came out in two minutes. Microwave? I believe GOOD Asian food should never be pre prepped and should be cooked to order. 

My Pad Thai was boring, but the boy's sesame chicken was to die for. If you go to Hunan Lion for anything, TRY THE SESAME CHICKEN!!! 

The bill was received, and it was typical for pricey Chinese food. My husband asked the waitress out of curiosity if they sold Almond cookies, or made them. And of course the salty, surly, waitress misinterpreted what we were asking, and thus she said in an evil demonic tone, which snatching my husband's credit card to pay the bill, "NO! No- ALMOND cookie.ONLY fortune COOKIE!" and walked away. I think the hubby and I both had a "wtf?" look on our faces, but joked about it off and on for the rest of the night. 

Thanks for the entertainment, Hunan Lion, but you're not really worth it unless you're trying to impress someone with ambiance and dark lighting. 

Cranky Asian waitress, You do your thang, gurl. Someone's gotta keep everyone in line.

text: Not going to tell you this is totally authentic Chinese ...because it isn't.....what it is in reality is authentic "Chinese-American" cuisine....and that is not a bad thing. The sizzling rice soup is simply the best I've ever had. And the basics tailored to the Ohio palate such as General Tsos Chicken, Kung Pao shrimp, and the combination pan fried noodles are all first in class for what they are. No complaints at all.....plus, a really nice little Mai Tai!...
