categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
I only came to get cream puffs because I read that they were huge. They are indeed really big, but too expensive. They are not worth over 5 dollars. I tried an orange creamsicle one, and my friend had a chocolate one. I was very disappointed in the taste. The orange creamsicle one tasted completely artificial. It was also not very sugary...which I guess some people like, but it is a dessert. The chocolate cream was done better. It had a sort of richness to it. The puff itself was a letdown. It was not at all sugary...it also tasted kind of dry. It seemed like the focus was purely on the cream...which wasn't done well in the orange creamsicle case. 
I've had better cream puffs elsewhere in Columbus. 

The place was pretty busy when we came by so it was hard to tell where to order everything too.

text: Had lunch there today (Saturday).  It was very busy with a 45 minute wait.  We got around that by sitting and eating at the bar.  Lunch was very good and the service was great. I had a corned beef and sauerkraut sandwich with German potato salad.  Lots of beer selections. I enjoyed a Schmidt's dark.  Great!

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
A tourist destination, sure, but Schmidt's is pretty good at what it does. If you get there before 4pm, you can get the Autobahn buffet for $9.99. After that I believe it goes up to $14. It's not a huge buffet, but the food is pretty tasty and worth the money. My vegetarian friend had no problem finding food to fill up on. Small salad bar, soup, rolls, green beans, a few different types of sausage, German potato salad (vinegar dressing, not creamy - a plus for me as I dislike mayo based salads), mac and cheese, sauerkraut, cabbage, yams, and a few other items. My favorites are the potato soup (top it with a little bit of bacon from salad bar), mac and cheese (it's creamy and saucy, the way mac should be), green beans with spaetzel (canned green beans and balls of dough, no, I'm not being sarcastic when I say I love it), and the sausage and pasta dish that is basically doused in BBQ sauce (the name is escaping me).

Their cream puffs are huge and pretty delicious, I think the chocolate one is actually my favorite over the original vanilla. There will likely be a little wait, so if you're on the verge of hangry maybe pick up some sweets from the Fudge Haus next door to hold you over.

While you're down there, you might as well wander around German Village for a bit as it has plenty to offer and can easily fill up your day.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
I had my doubts when my buddy said, "we are going to a place that serves sausage."  I must have looked at him weird because it was followed with, "it is really good, just wait."  "Good" was an understatement.  It was great!.  

We all got the buffet - as much sausage, mac and cheese, kraut, cabbage, salad, ham and beans, apple sauce, chicken, potatoes, you can eat.  And the sausage - there were 6 or seven types to select from (I had them all).  I thoroughly enjoyed every bite of every thing I tried.

For a drink, I had the beer sampler - six 4oz pours - 3 house beers and 3 German imports.   I would suggest this.  But if you know what you like, then I would suggest getting a liter mug!  (yes, a liter!)

I went to the buffet twice, small portions and had my beer.   I would have been fine, but then ... just one more trip to the buffet... fat and happy comes to mind...

It is nestled away in the middle of the German Village in Columbus.  It could not be more picturesque.  If you are near this area, you gotta go!

(With the Yelp! app, you can check in ahead of time and reduce your wait - they don't take reservations, so try it out!)

text:
I ordered the cabbage rolls for the first time & I will, without a doubt be getting them again!!  Fantastic!
Cooked to perfection, tender, hot, fresh & DELICIOUS!
I would have loved an option of plain mashed potatoes, however they do offer smashed red skin potatoes.  I chose the German potato salad, it was yummy, but definitely not a "compliment" to cabbage rolls. My bad.
I've never ordered cabbage rolls out.  Ever.  I was a little concerned that I might not like the tomato sauce, but I was wrong.  It was yummy too!
If you like cabbage rolls you will not be disappointed at all in the fantastic job they do with their entree!

text: Saw this place passing through Columbus a few days ago and decided to try it on the way back today.  Should have kept driving.  I was expecting a buffet with German dishes, but not so much.  They had sausages, but I can't figure out how a Bahama Mama sausage is German.  Other than the sauerkraut, red cabbage and hot potato salad, there was literally nothing remotely German on the menu.  The food was average at best, if you want real German food drive to Indy and go the Rathskeller!

The garlic sausage was the best sausage in my opinion. The buffet was very nice. 

I was let down with the cream puff. The cream was very good but the shell was a let down. It tastes as if they bake them a day or two ahead and pull them out as needed. I may be wrong about this but I know it wasn't as good as I've had elsewhere.

text: Schmidt's is a staple in the Columbus area. I'd been dreaming about their cream puffs and sausages for a while, so I had to stop in. Obviously, the sausage is great. I hadn't been here in a few years and it tasted better than I remember. The potato pancakes are the best side option in my opinion. Absolutely delicious. The cream puffs are beyond words. Delectable, delicious, and out of this world. Well worth the 90 minute wait at 4 pm on a weekday! Schmidt's is still rocking it in Columbus.

Was in town for business and my German grandmother said I HAD to go here. It was great! Fun and casual environment and pretty good German food. I can't speak to authenticity but I do know that the spaetzle and warm German potato salad were a bit different from how my nana makes them.

Definitely get the cream puff! Huge and so delicious.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
I'm torn about this review because I love Schmidt's and I always will. I had my wedding rehearsal dinner here and it was spectacular for that. I still hoard bahama mamas (their spicy sausages) whenever I visit Columbus so that I have a supply to grill when I leave. That all being said, the actual dining experience has recently been less amazing.

First, the setup. This is the oldest restaurant in Columbus and is famous for their german sausages. Typically when you come, you get the all-you can eat buffet which includes few sides (and good ones) along with access to all the different kinds of sausage. They also have cream puffs bigger than your fist that are to die for. My wife is from Columbus and this was one of the places we *always* went whenever we visited.

We had our wedding rehearsal dinner here and found out they have an amazing private event space upstairs with two room set up off a hallway made to look like a cobblestone street complete with street lamps. The set up the buffet in "street" and your guests can go help themselves as they see fit. It was amazing.

That all being said, the last few times we've been I've felt like the sausages in the buffet, while good, aren't as good as they are when I grill them at home. I don't know if they're boiling them instead of grilling them, or grilling on a metal hot plate instead of over fire, but it's just disappointing. Not that they aren't good--they still are--but they are not as good as they could and should be.

Still, the ambiance is great, the sausages are good, the sides are great, there's even some local craft beer on tap now. So, you won't be disappointed, but it's no longer the shining star in our food out in Columbus that it once was.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Schmidt's would have gotten 2 more stars if the service were more stellar.  THe quality of the food gave it the third star.  Granted I was there for the buffet and didn't expect the kind of service had I ordered off the menu.  What I got however, was lacking.

After walking in the door, the first thing I was met with when I went to the hostess' stand was the hostess with her back to me talking on and on to another employee about something personal going on in her love life.  When she finally turned around, she wasn't apologetic or acted particularly interested in seating me. 

Once seated I waited for an inordinately long time before a waitress came over to take my order.  I didn't find the buffet on the menu and had to ask her about it.  So I'm getting and refilling my food, no big deal; however, my drink was never re-filled nor did she ever come over to ask if everything was alright.

Then the waitress gets my dessert order wrong.  On the way to get the correct dessert, she stops and talks to the table next to me filled with three clamorous older women who were having issues....meanwhile, my dessert was melting.

Then after getting some take-out from the front counter, the clerk couldn't make change correctly for a simple order.

I attribute this all to hiring inexperienced staff and not training them properly.  Like I said, my meal at Schmidt's would have been much better with better service.

The food was good, and I'll be back.  I saw more experienced wait staff there so I'm sure my second trip there will be better.

A side note about the three clamorous older women......While gorging themselves on the buffet, I heard all about their medicare problems, hip replacements, and vision insurance.  Once they finished with the main course(s), they ordered desserts and had them put in to-go containers, telling our waitress that they'd only eat half of them in the restaurant and take the rest home.  Ok, no problem.....until they ate the whole dessert and then filled up their to-go containers with food from the buffet.

It was certainly a memorable meal!

text:
Saw this place on Man Vs Food, and my friends who live in Columbus took us there during our visit. It was a fun place! 
The food was yummy, esp. the bahama mama!!! 
We had the PBJ cream puff, it was ok though. The cream puff was a bit on the soggy side. It's more of PB than jam taste since they drizzled the jam for decoration on the PB cream.

I guess the service was ok for a bar/causal dining, the waitress was friendly, so I am sure she didn't mean it when she literally just "dropped" off the glasses/mugs on the table.

text: Apparently this place is very famous, but we never heard of it prior to tonight. Just passing through on business, we thought We'd give it a shot. We both had the sausage buffet, which featured a little bit of everything; several kinds of sausage, potatoes, German potato salad, Mac and cheese, etc.  We both are too much, but still took home the vanilla cream puff and german chocolate cake. Can't wait to try to fit that in.

text:
This is the best German Restaurant I've ever eaten at!!!!
That says it all! From the excellent Wiener schnitzel to the Hugh original cream puff and the 32 oz mug of Warsteiner. Prices are reasonable. We will be back here for sure!!

We ate there again on Friday. Once again the food was great as the pics show. The service was good although it started a little rough when we were picking out a beer to drink. But good after. The place was full at 3 in the afternoon so we sat at the bar. Appetizer came quickly of Bavarian pretzels. They were excellent. I had the schnitzel again with potatoe pancakes and beans and spatzle. She or The bratwurst dinner also with two sides sauerkraut and a vegetable.
Finished the dinner with those lovely cream puffs and took five home with us.

text: Was in Columbus on business and decided to visit Schmidt's after a recommendation. It was a great choice. I had the weiner schnitzel. Delicious. I topped it off with a piece of german chocolate cake. Pretty good too. It was super busy on a Thursday night. Get there early, around 6.  Highly recommended.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text: Worth a visit just to enjoy the German Village area. Charming streets actually do feel like Germany. You best plan to avoid peak meal times as the place appears to swarm with tourists and blue hairs whose walkers clog up the small entry making the wait a bit awkward. I went for lunch just after 1p on a Wednesday and had no problem getting a table right away. The server was cute and friendly dressed in her dirndle. I knew I wanted the Autobahn Buffet ($10.50) and got right to it. Start with a salad just to make yourself feel better, but then focus on the protein and cabbage. It'll be hard to pass up the potato salad, rice and mac & cheese but these starches will take up too much room in your stomach that should be reserved for the delicious sausages. Sample each one saving just enough space for saurkraut and red cabbage. The garlic Knockwurst and their famous Bahama Mama (weird name) are awesome as is the sausage stew. I found the traditional bratwurst to be my least favorite. For the price, the buffet can't be beat. The history and the charming surroundings of the restaurant itself are simply bonuses...

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus

text: An incredible, authentic German food experience.  Bring your appetite as you won't go away hungry.  I had the Bahama mama and it was delicious.  Potato salad, roll and apple sauce included.  This also does not break the bank.  We shared the German chocolate cake.  Once again, delicious.  Thank you Schmidt's for a great dining experience.

text: went for the 1st time this past weekend .. worth the 2 hour drive from Cleveland .. had their brat once at the state fair & was inspired to try the restaurant offerings .. had to go w/the buffet to sample it all .. the corned beef + cabbage was a shock to see on a German buffet & it was not all that tasty but then again I was there for the German offerings more than anything else .. hands down the best kraut around! .. could not save room for the chocolate cream puff which was the size of a softball but it was my dinner that evening having enjoyed a full buffet for lunch .. worth the drive & worth the wait .. I heard they have pumpkin cream puffs in October .. say no more .. I will be back to try that for sure!

text:
Never been to a place quite like it. Busy, all the time. Doesn't take reservations. We didn't have to wait, but if we did, it would be worth it. Bakery inside too! I tried the buffet and sampled all the sausages and meatloaf. Red cabbage was great, pickled well. My favorite of the sausage was the garlic knockwurst. Tried the beer flight too, no complaints (only 1 IPA, mainly German beers, which is my ideal flight). If you have room, try the giant cream puff. 
Once the accordion and trumpet start it is hard to carry a conversation, but man does it make for an experience.

text: It is located at German Village,which has great bratwursts and cream puffs.Servers are enthusiastic, good for both families and friends. If you want to experience authentic German culture, there is no better way than eating in a German restaurant.

attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}

text:
A Columbus institution. 

I get the buffet because, well, its all you can eat sausage. This place is great. The sausage is awesome, all the varieties. The sides were good, but nothing spectacular. Who needs sides when you have all you can eat sausage though? 

In a really cool part of the city (German Village), and a really cool place. Oh, and the cream puff for dessert is out of control. 

I wish I went to this place more often, a definite stop when you are in Columbus.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text: O.k., let's call it what it is...a tourist trap!  A German restaurant in German Village.  My bad for ordering a grilled chicken salad when they specialize in German cuisine.  Other people in my party ordered German specialties which they liked.  They have crammed too many tables into the space to maximize business, which I get, but you feel somewhat claustrophobic!  In addition, my friend and I who ordered the same salad both got the wrong salad delivered which had to be sent back.  I rather visit their food truck when it comes to my work place!  I would say pass and go to Katzinger's or Lindey's for a cuisine experience in German Village.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
I would really like to give this place a 3.5 or 4 Star review, but the service killed it... Seriously! I was excited about all the hype I've been hearing about this German Restaurant in German Village, Columbus OH. The food was very good. Simple, original, traditional german food... 

We went on a Monday night. According to Yelp and Google this place was supposed to be open till 10pm. We arrived at 8pm and were seated right away! The server was very "cold" and had somewhat of an attitude from the beginning: she was really "in a hurry" to take our order, didn't take time to explain the menu or anything at all, although we did mention it was our first time there... In a few minutes the place kind of filled up, and her attitude just continued to be bad or even worse...

After some good recommendations from the people sitting next to us, we ordered our food and it came pretty fast. I had the German Sausage Sample Plate with 4 kinds of house made sausage including their famous Bahama Mama, sauerkraut, german potato salad, chunky apple sauce and toast. Food was delicious. My girlfriend had the German Meatloaf plate which was also delicious!

The Cream Puff had to be "To Go" since we were stuffed, but that was a Bad Ass 1/2 pound Cream Puff! 

Again, the server then stated in a somewhat apologetic way at the end that they were "short staffed since it was a Monday night and it was cold out and they sent some staff home early since they didn't expect it to get busy that night"... Again, this is a popular, well-known place in German Village, with good reviews and plenty of good advertised food on numerous Food channels and websites. So how exactly did you "not expect to be so busy!?"  And again, it wasn't crazy busy, it was steady and she was just not very friendly. 

Do go try the food though!

text: I have been to Schmidt's many times in the 8 years since I moved to Columbus and it is a classic German Village spot. Sometimes it is a little too crowded for my taste but that's definitely got to be good for business. They have a great buffet and the desserts are fantastic!

text: I recently visited my daughter at OSU.  We decided to go to the German Village in downtown Columbus and visit Schmidt ' s Sausage Haus. It did not disappoint.  The sausage selections are made from old family recipes dating back to the late 18oo's.  The sauerbraten was not what I am used to, but was  delicious just the same.  There are many sides to choose from.  For dessert we had to have one of their softball sized cream puffs.  We shared as it really is too big for one person. Schmidt ' s is definitely worth a return visit.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Schmidt's is an institution in Columbus, and especially in German Village. The upside is that you can almost be assured of a good meal. The downside is of course the wait, which can be extremely long.

Of course, there are worse things than having to kill time in German Village, especially as there are other bars nearby. Once you get seated, the servers are good about bringing food quickly. The inner decor is a little touristy, which is probably inevitable given the popularity of this restaurant. If it's sometimes kitschy, it can also be charming, especially with the live music they sometimes have.

I'm a sucker for good schnitzel veal, and Schmidt's does not disappoint. That isn't to say that other choices are bad, and the sausages all looked good. If you can manage to fit any more food in your stomach, go for the cream puff. Whatever else can be said about it, you get your money's worth.

text: Best all you can eat sausage bar in Columbus--or anywhere for that matter.  The condiments and sides were awesome too (the purple kraut was curiously delicious).  The cream puff dessert was to die for.  I somehow managed to save room for it even tho I stuffed myself on dinner.  Hey, I'm from California--we're not used to this type of food.  But damn, was it good.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
In 2014, the City of Columbus actually named Schmidt's Bahama Mama the "Official Food" of Columbus. 

And yes, it's pretty good. So are their bratwursts and garlic knockwursts. Their cream puffs are really good too. (and gigantic) But I really can't shake the feeling that Schmidt's is overrated. For something to be so hyped and popular, it really should be mind blowing. The hand-made Czech sausages that I had at the Westside Market in Cleveland... now those were mind blowing. Schmidt's Bahama Mama on the other hand... they're good. But not mind blowing. 

The Autobahn buffet is delicious and super filling, but does suffer from a relative lack of variety. (This type of sausage, that type of sausage, or maybe that other type of sausage?)

With that said, since they're so popular, the wait time at Schmidt's restaurant can be horrible. Over an hour on the weekends. The parking situation in German Village is also brutal. I hate waiting, and if I'm going to wait that long, I think I would rather wait down the street at Thurmans Cafe.  

I also feel that the Schmidt's sausage truck is becoming too ubiquitous. Despite being a German restaurant based out of German Village, I've seen them at The Taste of Upper Arlington, The Columbus Italian Festival, and The Jazz & Ribs Fest, to name a few places. You know, events that have nothing to do with the German Village or sausages. It feels overcommercialized, and it takes away from the charm of a family owned restaurant.

text: I usually LOVE Schmidt's, but not today.  I ordered pretzel bites which were nothing more than friend bread chunks with salt.  They tasted like old grease and the texture was awful.  I also ordered the potato soup, which was bland and also had a hint of a turned oil taste to it.  I just spent $20 on inedible food to go.

text:
One work....Audubon.

The buffet of sausage and fixin's is amazing.  I must have eaten three plates...as well as two big German Beers. I had the Dark Oktoberfest and it was AWESOME! 

The wait was pretty long when we got there...but there were a few open seats at the bar.  So, that's where we sat...which worked out as there's only a few seats so the service is great because you have the bartender right there.

The different sausage was great...and their Bahama Mama is damn good...and the sauerkraut is very good.  It took everything I had to not overfill on those wonderful German potatoes.

text: Stopped in and ordered the buffet. The meats and sides were all delicious, and surprisingly, the mac and cheese was very flavorful and some of the best I've tasted. Beer choices were great, and the German band playing was a great backdrop to a nice meal. Very friendly staff as well. Will be coming back the next time I'm in Columbus!

text: Schmidt's has really good German style food. You cannot go without getting a cream puff! For someone who has been to Germany multiple times and has studied the country... I find it very frustrating that our waiter... and many others upon discovery did not know about the food on the menu or German history. Shame.

text:
I'm very impressed with this great restaurant. My food and German beer were excellent! I enjoyed the Warsteiner from the tap and it tasted crisp and refreshing. 
I also enjoyed the sauerbraten with red cabbage and mashed potatoes. Amazing gravy! 
The waiter was excellent! The hostesses are very friendly and helpful. 
I'm very impressed!!!
Prost!

text: Very good German Food but waitress was horrible. She would take her time coming back to the table, had to ask for water with our beer and pop. She would stand back by the kitchen door and visit with other staff while we tried to get her attention and when she knew we were waiting for her to come pick up our bill and payment she stopped to wait on another table. If we ever came again we would make sure we had a different server.

text: Wow their bratwursts are amazing and delicious! I heard about this place before coming to Columbus, Ohio and how they were famous for their bratwursts. I wanted to see what the rave and hype was all about and it definitely lives up to it! We tried the bratwurst and bahama mama with fries. They serve them in hotdog buns and provide horseradish sauce and mustard. We ordered on the side sauerkraut and fries (served as waffle fries). The bahama mama was really good, but definitely prefer the original bratwurst. Each bite was so savory and juicy. I really regretted not trying their wide assortment of desserts, which all looked tasty. The restaurant is located in German Village, which is a cute and pretty neighborhood to check out in Columbus, Ohio so it gets packed and super busy on the weekends. We walked in around 3 and still had to wait 45 min to an hour, but there is a take out option if you don't want to wait.

text: We showed up during prime dinner time so the place was really crowded.  But, even as the evening progressed the people kept coming. Our wait was about 70 minutes.  We lucked out on parking.  It looks like parking would really SUCK most of the time.  The last time I was here was about 30 years ago as a kid and seem to remember liking it a lot.  Nothing has changed.  The food was wonderful.  The service was good too.  Our server had a lot of menu knowledge.  He was a little weak on the beer menu but we got by.  The cream puffs and german chocolate cake were awesome.  I took off a star due to having to wait (standing) in a crowed lobby for an hour.

text: Be prepared to wait. There is ALWAYS a line at Schmidts. But the outdoors is fun to wander while you wait, so on a nice day it isn't too much of a sacrifice.  I would not recommend the buffet. The sausage is often dried out.  The Bahama Mamas are remarkable and probably the best choice on the menu. Leave room for the cream puffs.  They are the reason we keep returning. I would eat here just to have one of these.  They are huge-- but you still won't want to share.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Since I live in Central Texas, and have the luxury of German food year round with a trip to Fredericksburg, I wanted to see what Ohio Germans had to say about their "food of native origin".  I knew that Schmidt's was famous for sausage, so I focused my attention on the buffet.  4 types of sausage and a sausage stew.  My favorites were the Bahama Mama and the Garlic Knockwurst.  I found the Bratwurst to be a bit dry and not to my taste.  I also had the buffet for the German sides.  The Kraut and Red Cabbage were very good, but the hot German potato salad alone was worth the trip.  The traditional ham and white bean soup was also a real treat.

Being a beer fan, I tried the 6 (2 oz) sampler with 3 local beers and 3 German.  Sorry Columbus, I was not impressed with your local micro brewed beer.  However, the 3 German selections went perfectly with the food.  They were a hearty flavor that brought out all of the greatness of beer and food pairing.  2 Warsteiner (Premium & Dunkel) 1 Paulaner Octoberfest Marzen.  

The giant cream puffs...beautiful to look at.  I'm holding my vote for another time.  It could have been that I indulged and enjoyed the dinner food and beverages too much and didn't leave enough room or discernment for dessert.  They were average on this day.

text:
Went back for another family meal during German Village Christmas Lights - Awesome!!!   The whole family was in attendance and ze Autobahn buffet did not disappoint!   Sausage Stew, Bahama Mamas, Garlic Knockwurst, potato salad, red cabbage, sauerkraut - the hits just keep coming.  

Topped off by the usual - a Schidmt's cream puff!!! 

Had a couple of liters of Paulaner and saw a very special Yelper there!!   It was all good!!

text:
I come to Columbus about every 5 years or so and always make the trip to Schmidt's. The service is always a step above other establishments in the area and the food has never failed to impress. You have to have a taste for German food to enjoy, but anyone on the planet would have to enjoy the cream puffs. 

The buffet is always the choice for me as you get a tour of German food that is always fresh and never the worn out taste of most buffets. I am partial to the bratwurst, it is sausage perfection. I have recently become a vegetarian, but there was no way that I could not eat that piece of pork heaven.  The red cabbage and sour kraut never fail to give you the sweet and sour contrast that makes your mouth salivate with each and ever bite. 

Eat the cream puffs! Some may make better at home, but if you miss the chance to place this magical taste adventure in your mouth you have made a huge mistake. Keep in mind, if you work the buffet over, have someone to split the cream puff with.

text:
The food was good and the servers quick. That's always top on my rating considerations. The restaurant does tend to be filled up quick as it's a popular place.

The buffet is a good idea to get if you want to a sampling of the different sausages. Or just go ala-carte if you want some of their specials.

I recommend any of the spiced sausages and the meat stuffed cabbages. The pickled red cabbage is a good side and so are the potatoe pancakes with apple sauce. Plus, portions are large and filling, and I'm basing this on a regular person's stomach instead of mine for a fair evaluation LOL.

Holiday drinks are great and they sure don't skimp on the alcohol in your whisky cider or cinnamon rum.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
If you want a German sausage...this is your place!

Who doesn't like German food? This place is one of a kind and a must whether you are new in town, have family visiting or just simply want some good old German food.

I hear good things about the autobahn...and yes I have actually been to the real autobahn in Germany but still have yet to try the Schmidt's version =). I have tried many of their sausage selections and can't say anything bad about them. But, my most favorite is of course a good fried schnitzel, which is absolutely an option here.  In fact, Schmidt's food is better than the first Hofbrauhaus in Munich I visited a few months back...and I am not exaggerating when I say this because I come from a European family and grew up eating homemade schnitzels and sausages. Not to mention this place has such a fun atmosphere with live music and is nestled in the heart of beautiful German Village.

You will love it, give this place a try!

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
I know you're touristy and kitschy. People are down on you all the time as NOT being authentic. This is not German food. Well, I beg their pardon...but you are very German food. 

Having been to Germany, I am no authority, but I do know that there are many types of German restaurants that offer different types of German food. And you are every bit as authentic as that bar in Dusseldorf along the Rhine selling pig's knuckles with kraut......Yes Folks, it's not German FINE dining but it is German pub grub. 

It's a great place for a work lunch or when you need to kick back for a brew or two. Schmidt's specialty brews are tasty and Warsteineron tap is like being in the old country. 

I personally can not imagine eating here without ordering the buffet. It is your best value and it is the best way to eat what they do best. The SAUSAGE. Founded as a meat packer, this place knows its bratwurst, knockwurst and its bahama mama spicy sausages. They are quality meat and delicious. Plus you can buy some bulk and take them home if you want to grill some or if you want to make your own sausage dishes. 

The next best thing on the buffet is the Potato Soup. Always available, they will serve you a cup with the buffet even if it's not the "featured" soup on the buffet. Velvety and smooth - just like Oma (Grandma) made...make it even better with some real bacon and cheddar cheese from the salad bar. 

Other things on the buffet are good as well - mac and cheese is better than any bbq joint's mac and cheese I've eaten. The red cabbage may be canned but is enhanced with spices and Jonathan apples. The kraut is canned, yet spiked with caraway in every bite and is appropriately sour to the tongue, not watered down. The German Potato Salad is home made and the German Sweet Kraut on the salad bar is a classic sweet Sauerkraut Salad. Corned beef and cabbage on the buffet is always freshly made. Not authentic? Well, I'd say there are plenty of restaurants in Germany that use canned, commercially processed kraut and cabbage......Have you not seen the jars and cans in the German section of your grocer or World Market? 

The desserts are ok. The cream puffs are raved about - I personally avoid them because of the use of some unknown whipped topping" kind of filling. I'd prefer pastry cream. The German Chocolate cake appears authentic - meaning made with German's brand Sweet Chocolate since  the authentic dessert of the country would probably be a Black Forrest Cake with real whipped cream. 

So anyway, I am a fan. People who belittle its authenticity have likely never visited the country to appreciate the bar/pub side of Germany, which is a shame because the German's know their bier and their sausage.

text: Holy Schmidt's. That's all I have to say. Cream puffs bigger than your hand. Kraut yummier than all get out. Pretzel buns like whoa. Mustard is too good, purple cabbage out of this world. Smashed potatoes no gravy needed. The service is so great, family owned and able to feed a table of 18, no hassle. Beautiful people, beautiful food, in a beautiful neighborhood. Everyone MUST come.

text: We always enjoy eating here each year when we pass through Columbus.  However, I don't know if May 23 was a problem day for them or not, but we were both disappointed with our entrees and did not finish them.  My sauerbraten was over done and not very tasty.  My wife's wiener schnitzel had too much breading and was extremely dry.  The pretzel appetizer and the cream puffs were as good as usual.

text:
This is one of my favorite places in Columbus. My parents and I used to go here for the buffet. I still remember when there was a location in Reynoldsburg and we were so sad when they left. I would recommend the buffet to anyone who has never been here because you can try a little bit of all the bratwurst. Don't leave without your cream puff!

The only thing you guys need to add to your menu is a curry-wurst. That would make the place perfect!

text: My wife and I used to go to this place when we were in school at Ohio State back in the '60's.  We had the opportunity to try Schmidt's a couple of weeks ago and I must say they were great in the '60's but they have improved with age.  We split a huge Reuben with a side of German potato salad. Most people were enjoying the daily buffet which looked and smelled delicious.  We were just not that hungry. Located in historic German Village, its an adventure that everyone should try. (There are now other locations in Columbus)

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text: Ok so I even to Germany several times and I'm here to tell you that if I didn't know I would think I'm back there when eating here. I can't begin to even tell you how good the food was and combined with excellent service this place it off the charts. It's nestled in the German Village in Columbus which is a super cool place to walk around to explore. I had the reuben with a side of German potato salad. Don't forget the cream puff! There's also a buffet which looked really good however I'm not a fan of eating food others sneeze and cough on lol. They also have a small bar downstairs and a large banquet room and bar upstairs. Don't forget to visit their candy shop across the street which has great fudge.

Creampuffs bigger than your head, really it's either sausage or a creampuff, both is too much.

attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text: Should have known better, took some friends here at 6pm on a saturday night, 2 hour and forty five minute wait, I like Schmidts but not quite that much. We did come back the next day at 11am for lunch and were seated right away. Schmidts is really popular and I know they try to pack people in, but the table they seated us at was just too cramped and I felt like I was sitting in the person's lap at the next table. The "Autobahn" is always good, lots of Bahama Mamas, brats, kraut, red cabbage, yum! Of course a cream puff to top everything off can't be passed up, it's all very good! I'm sure we'll be back, next time I may pass on the Autobahn and order something different from the menu though.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Stepping into Schmidt's was like stepping back into my German grandma's kitchen, sweet with sauerkraut, caraway, and sausages aromas, and cheery with oompah (polka) music in the background. The meat counter at the entrance-exit is an unusual decor choice, but it gives you the chance to take home any of the restaurant's fresh sausages. 

Although there are numerous entree options, the Autobahn Buffet is a fine deal. For $14.95 you get a warm potato salad (fine), macaroni and cheese (golden, gooey, but sorta Kraft-ish), corned beef and cabbage (deeelicious), sauerkraut (nice and fragrant with caraway, but I didn't come across any of those annoying caraway seeds!), Bahama Mama and Bahama Mama mild sausages (both niiiice, with a pop when you bite them), bratwurst (fine), knockwurst (yum), sausage stew (sausage so-so, but the brown gravy was really flavorful), cooked red cabbage (fine), smashed red potatoes (nicely smashed, but not memorable), meatloaf (already forgot it), a small salad bar with typical ingredients plus a soup, and green beens (no typo). The large beer selection includes the very good and locally brewed Haus brew German Village Gold. As a Wisconsin State Fair veteran, I didn't think the cream puffs were unusually large, but the blueberry whipped cream center (one of several flavor choices for an additional $3) would hold its own in any competition. The Apple Strudel was another fine choice. All in all, a fine experience.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Come to Schmidt's for the experience, food (I guess), and most importantly the CREAM PUFFS.

I am part German, so I grew up on German food - and actually loved it to a point.  My grandmother's recipes knock Schmidt's out of the park in my opinion.  Maybe it should be called "Grandma Alice's" instead.  :)  I don't know, the food is just really heavy and either too strong or too bland, and there is ALOT of it.  Seriously.  Take some Beano or whatever helps you with, erm....you know...because you will have it after you leave Schmidt's.  And be prepared to pay a pretty penny.

Everyone know's about Schmidt's and wants to bring their out of town guests here, so plan to arrive at least an hour early.  They don't take reservations, so put your name in ASAP and enjoy walking around the adorable German Village while you wait.  The gift shop down the street offers free coffee and tea which is so hospitable!  They also have cute gifts from local Ohio artisans. Schiller park is beautiful and just a few blocks away.

Sorry, back to Schmidt's  - the highlight?  Most definitely the cream puffs, specifically the chocolate one.  Also, get your picture taken in the lederhosen picture board.  And you'll get a laugh if you go the restroom - German translations for popular movie quotes on the loud speaker.  :)

Oh and PS - if you are in Columbus, agree with me, that the cream puffs are the best (and if you're crazy for their brats and sauerkraut) - they have food truck!  The one in Clintonville visits the Crimson Cup parking lot on Wednesdays!

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Schmidt's.

If you haven't been there, you either hate cream puffs and sausage - or you're a vegetarian. We arrived close to opening on a Saturday for lunch before a downtown matinee show. Tip: get there around opening unless you enjoy hanging out for 45 minutes to an hour to be seated. My niece is working on becoming vegetarian, and I agreed to stand in solidarity with her for lunch.

Folks, struggle is REAL at Schmidt's if you are attempting to forego meat and/or meat products. There are no vegetarian items on the menu. They do offer green salad, red cabbage, and sauerkraut on the buffet, so you'll get your daily allotment of green veggies. Soup of the day - ham and bean. They do have pretzel bites as an appetizer. I got my fill of sides, no problem.

But really, we all know Schmidt's has awesome sausage, and the spouse ordered a chicken schnitzel that was covered with garlic cloves. Looked delicious, but I stayed strong and grabbed another round of salad.

(Disclaimer: Not a fan of cream puffs. But they have a BUNCH of other treats - the cherry cheesecake and the coconut cream pie were fantastic. No need to hold back on those for health reasons, right?)

text: I love this place!  The food is real authentic German.  Get the buffet for the best value and especially if you love sausage.  The buffet also includes salad, german potato salad, saurkraut, beets and rolls.  Their regular menu also includes the weiner schnitzels and other german favorites.   Desert is to die for.  I always get the giant cream puff but your mouth will water as you are waiting to be seated and see all the amazing pastries displayed in the front.  Usually on Fridays and Saturdays they have live German music.  The staff is friendly and all the women wear traditional German outfits.  Highly recommend.

text: Went to Columbus to visit the science museum,but I've always wanted to try this place since I saw it on the food network.Very happy we got to go ,the prices were a bonus ,Very affordable.We got the buffet and along with that you get half off your cream puff .So ummm happy face ! Salad bar and kraut,4 different kinds of sausages (delicious) ,brown mustard and horseradish on the table ..loved it .Then the cream puff huge ..So big you will need a to go box for sure .Its only two hours away ,not a far drive to have this food again .We will definitely be visiting again

text: It is my families favorite place to eat! We have been patrons for over 20 years! I even had my rehearsal dinner here. The food and staff are consistently the best in the area. If you love German food and entertainment stop in on a night that the polka band is playing! Enjoy and use yelp to reserve your place in line.

text: I have driven through Columbus twice within the past 6 months and was more than fortunate enough to eat dinner twice at Schmidt's. I am German (not to mention that my last name also happens to be Schmidt) and am very familiar with authentic German food and beer. You will get that PLUS an amazing atmosphere and service at this restaurant. For me, I like to keep a German meal simple: bratwurst with sauerkraut, apple sauce, and potato salad. Schmidt's got that plus so much more to offer but I'll tell you I enjoyed this meal so much. With a great Hefeweizen off the tap, dinner was even better and not to mention their awesome pretzel appetizer with cheddar dip. The live music at night is amazing and will cheer anybody up. My second time at Schmidt's, I was driving through the city heading to the west coast. I was bummed that my ETA was just past their closing. I gave them a call to see if I can place an order for pick-up and was fortunate enough to chat with Trey (Manager). He was so kind and accommodating to say that he would place my order and keep the doors open an extra 20-30 minutes in order for me and my family pick up the food. What a class act. Thank you for an excellent two visits. I will definitely drive out of my way to eat a meal here.. and so should you! Danke und Prost!

Definitely go for the sausage, it's the best thing in the menu. The pretzel bites are yummy with beer and don't be scared to try the smaller sized beers so you can have a few different types!

text:
When I travel I really try to avoid the chain restaurants I can get at home.  Did a little research prior to my business trip and decided to come here for dinner after seeing it on different shows on TV.

I was dining alone and told waitress I was from out of town and she was friendly and suggested the buffet so I can try alot of items.  How can you say no to a buffet???  Had 4 varieties of different sausages and different sides plus salad bar, soup, sausage stew and the entree that day was meatloaf.  I'm not a sausage expert but they were very good.  Meatloaf was nothing special.

Now came dessert.  They are know for their cream puff so I got one to-go as I was stuffed.  The cream filling was excellent but thought the puff itself was a little doughy and not the best I've had.

text:
We decided to visit this wonderful restaurant in German Village on a Sunday afternoon before returning home. They have a small parking lot or you can find a space on the street.
The place looked packed but to our surprise the wait was only about 15 minutes. We passed the buffet on our way to our table and quickly decided that it was the best deal. For $15 a person we were able to help ourselves to several different types of sausages, side-dishes, salad, and chili.
Afterwards we ordered a chocolate cream puff that was absolutely amazing. I recommend getting one after every meal.

text: This is our "go to" place while visiting Columbus.  Great food and beer,  cozy atmosphere,  staff wears traditional german attire, etc.  Expect a wait, but it's well worth it.   I love the traditional bratwurst and german potato salad (which tastes just like potato salad i had in east berlin over 20 years ago!)  Cream puffs are sinful too!

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}

text: This appears to be a Columbus institution -- a sign on the table announced the first new menu item in 25 years, and there were photos on the walls of celebrities who have eaten there. It was something of a vegetarian food desert, but I got a hearty potato soup and donut-like pretzels which filled me. The rest of the group had the buffet, and were pleased with it. The spicy red cabbage was an especially big hit. If German food is a passion for you, I'm sure you'd enjoy it, and even if it's not, it's the kind of place you can go just to say you've been.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
In town for a conference and my friends wanted to come here.  I'm going to preface this by saying that I am a vegetarian and normally would have picked literally any other cuisine.  

First impressions: The neighborhood its in is cute, we parked a ways away because we were exploring and had a nice little walk down brick paths.

The menu said to ask about vegetarian options - they didn't seem bad, they mostly were just replacing the meat with extra grilled peppers and onions on the sandwiches. But I wasn't very hungry so I just ordered a house salad and a side of potato pancakes with applesauce.  The salad was the typical iceberg lettuce with a few shreds of carrots and tomato that you'd expect, nothing fancy.  Potato pancakes with applesauce tasted fine, and the portion seemed like the appropriate amount for the $3 I was charged (I think it was 5 or 6 mini pancakes).

The place seemed a little tourist-y and stuck in the past - one of the menu items had a note next to it saying "first new menu item in 25 years!".  There was a two-man band playing accordion and tuba, which was kind of cool.  But mostly it was just very loud and populated with families.

text:
Pros: Amazing food! Best German potato salad I've ever had mix it with the sauerkraut for an extra. Sausages are great, cream puffs are the best. 
We had a great table. The atmosphere is jovial and all the employees seem happy and friendly. Lots of interesting art in the restaurant. 
Excellent service. Jordan was our waitress and even though she was very busy she stayed on top of our needs.

Cons: The wait was very, very long. About an hour for a party of two. We did come at 7:30 so for a busy ,historic restaurant on a Saturday night it's expected. There is very little room to wait considering the size of the crowd and parking can be hard to come by. 

Overall, definitely worth the wait and we will return.,

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Being half German, I was thrilled to discover this place through "Man vs. Food" a few years back.  However, I was pretty unimpressed.  The first time I went, I got the buffet to try everything, but there wasn't a whole lot of German food to choose from.  Honestly, it looked like any other buffet, just with bigger sausage selection.  You know... Mac 'N Cheese, beans, salad, mashed potatoes...  The basic Ponderosa line-up.  It was all pretty bland, but not bad.  

They are known for the Bahama Mama Sausage, which is definitely worth trying.  I'd order it with a meal over the buffet though.  The sausages at the buffet were a bit dried out from sitting in the warmer for an extended period of time.  Also, save room for their famous Cream Puff.  It's not just hype from national exposure, it's the real deal.

The service was pretty good, nothing to complain about really.  However, I think the staff is working around a difficult environment.  For example, the ceiling was leaking behind the bar and plumbing seemed to be an existing problem.  The staff seemed like a dripping ceiling was just another day at the office.  

Overall, it's definitely worth checking out.  I guess I was just expecting something more "German-y".  While it's a pretty good restaurant, it doesn't come close to giving you the experience of German culture like other Deutsch places in the area... *cough* *cough* Hofbrauhaus *cough* *cough*.

text: Hey gang, please promise not to make any jokes when I tell you that sausage is the thing I like to put in my mouth more than anything else.  Schmidt's is awesome; so awesome that the only downside is the fact that you will have to wait for a table in a place which is pretty cramped.  It's worth it though, so just do it; get the buffet and get those LDL levels hyped, son.  Get the cream puff too; take it home though, because you need that space in your gut for sausages.  I'd also recommend sausaging the sausage, and then sausage sausage sausage sausage.  Sausage sausage sausage, sausages.

text: If Adam from Man vs Food and George Bush 43 have been here, don't you think it's worth you giving it a try? The 'autobahn' buffet is a pricey way to sample everything, I'm thinking you're better off picking something from the menu after getting suggestions from the waiter. Caution: Most everything is spicy. Suggestion: Get the cream puffs at the take-out counter after paying for your dinner at the table, and save the waiter's tip %.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text: Thanks again to Yelp for finding the most amazing food!  Yelp allowed us to check in and hold our spot as this is quite the busy place.  We had a short time frame in which we had to physically check in at the location.  Thanks goodness we did this because this place can have quite the wait.  We were notified via text our table was ready.  We had already looked over the menu so after a few questions were answered off to the buffet we went.  The applesauce is to die for!  Every piece of sausage, brat, meatloaf etc. was delish!  Our ice tea classes were refilled promptly the whole time and we were constantly checked on which we truly appreciated.  When it came time for dessert...we just couldn't decide.  We went with 2 items to eat there and one to go.  The cream puff of the month, pistachio,  was amazing.  The pie was amazing as well.  We finally dove into the peanut butter cream puff before heading home the next day and it was to die for.  We were shocked at the price!  A meal like this back home would be well over $100 but it wasn't.  If we ever go back to OH, we will be coming back here.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Schmidt's is decent homestyle German cuisine.
Every five years I stop in for lunch to gorge myself into a state of misery.  The buffet really is a very good value.  It's cheap and you can eat a ton.  The Bahama Mama's are what you want.  Most of the offerings on the buffet are similar and very traditional German American.  
     The restaurant can get very very busy at lunch and getting a table can be a long wait.  
     The deli case in the front is a good option for buying sausages to take home and cook.  And the cream puffs are just outstandingly gluttonous.  
     You really have to try this place at least once its worth the novelty.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Traditional German food prepared well. If you like German cuisine you'll like Schmidt's. 
The wait staff wear traditional German clothes, the background music is traditional German and the 19th Century building feels very authentic. In many ways it reminds me of the Germany section at Epcot. 
I enjoyed the meal but, for my money, the Sunday brunch at der Rheinlander (in Portland, Oregon) is better. Of course, I was in Columbus so Schmidt's is the place. 
By the way, if you're a fan of fudge, Schmidt's Fudge Haus is just s few steps up the street.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Finally visited the actual Schmidt's and I must say, it's worth the hype. Come early to put your name in because there will be a wait. I was a bit disappointed with the beer list - I thought they would have more German beers and more beer in general. 

The have a buffet, which my husband enjoyed. I am not a huge fan of buffets, so I opted for a sausage sampler, which was delicious. The Bahama Mama is not to be missed! Oh, and get the green beans - best I've ever had!

Of course, you come here for the cream puffs, which are huge and delicious. 

The decor is cute and decorated for the season, which fits right in with the German Village vibe. Overall, things were good and it was definitely an experience to remember.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
I was in Ohio visiting a friend and forced her to go to the Ohio State Fair with me. Since we were in Columbus already, we decided to stop by German Town. She had heard that they had really good cream puff's here so we made the trek through the picturesque town to Schmidt's. When we went inside, I saw a picture of Adam Richman, and I realized that I had seen this place before (foodie in me was fangirling). I was stuff full of lemonade and french fries and fried peanut butter sandwiches from the fair, but I couldn't resist getting a cream puff and a sausage. I'm on vacation; don't hate. 
The cream puff is HUGE. It was quite good as well. I mean how can you go wrong with a cream puff. (No one answer that. I'm sure terrible ones exist somewhere in the world and I just don't want to know.) The sausage I didn't eat until the next day on my way back to Los Angeles, but it was still delicious. You can't go wrong with meat. (Once again, I don't want to know how I can go wrong.)
I would definitely recommend a stop here. :)

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
I see reading through these reviews that a lot of people don't like the Schmidt's cream puffs.  I thought I was the only one, really I did.  They look delicious, but they're totally devoid of flavor.  Like a big, creamy piece of cardboard.  

That said, there isn't a whole lot else I dislike about Schmidt's.  The atmosphere, for one, can't be topped, although you should prepare to bump elbows with the guy at the next table, as this place is small and in demand.  I always start with the pretzel nuggets, which are the highlight of the entire menu, in my opinion, and put ballpark pretzels to shame -- especially when you slather them with the pungent mustard on the table.  The Bahama Burger Special is my favorite entree... just a big ol' slice of sausage on a bun.  It's supposedly "hot-n-spicy" but I don't get any heat; no matter, it's still delicious and goes perfectly with potato pancakes "und" applesauce.

Schmidt's is a great place to take your visitors if you want to impress them without taking out a second mortgage.  Just being in German Village is an experience they'll remember, and the food here will seal the deal.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
First of all, let's get the good out of the way. The food is excellent, provided you are looking for something that will fill your stomach and then some. Their bratwurst, mashed red potatoes, kraut...I haven't eaten anything there that was less than excellent, and I'm apparently not alone in that opinion, since Schmidt's has always been packed to capacity every time I've visited.

Before you even enter, the ambiance is part-old world charm, part kitsch, but overall the place has a charming exterior and interior. It's a good thing that there's so much to catch the eye, because this brings us to the few negative aspects of Schmidt's.

First, expect to wait a while for a table. The shortest wait I ever had at Schmidt's was half an hour, and it's my understanding that they do not accept reservations. Granted, I've only visited Schmidt's on weekends, so I can't speak to how long you'd expect to wait other days of the week.

Second, once our meal was over, we had to wait forever for our check. I love a restaurant that doesn't hustle you out, but in this case, it was pretty clear we were ready to leave. Getting our check took around fifteen to twenty minutes. I suspect this might be a function of the server we had, as this is the first time that has happened.

Overall, I'd definitely recommend Schmidt's for the excellent, affordable food and the atmosphere. I would not recommend it as a spot for a first date; Schmidt's is typically fairly noisy and it's definitely not the most intimate dining environment you'll encounter. I would definitely recommend it as a place you visit after you've known someone a while or with a group of friends or family members.

I hope to visit again around Christmas, as I have to imagine that the charm of the place would be increased around the holidays, particularly with a fresh blanket of snow on the ground.

The sausage spicy stew on the buffet is great. 
Save room for the must have original cream puff.

That says it all! From the excellent Wiener schnitzel to the Hugh original cream puff and the 32 oz mug of Warsteiner. Prices are reasonable. We will be back here for sure!!

text: We went on a Sunday for buffet. It was worth the 25 minute wait as they don't take reservations. If you are going to go, go early on Sunday ! It's great German home cooking.  My dad grew up with a very German grandmother and loves this place ! The waiters are attentive and the gimmick of them dressing up in traditional German Garb is endearing. I enjoyed their universal dishes for those shy about trying new things. My personal favorites were the mild Bahama Mama sausage and their meatloaf.

text:
Bit of a wait (they don't take reservations). Good recommendation in the Double Bock. The pretzel nuggets and honey mustard cheese sauce was tasty.
The Wiener schnitzel reminded my of those my mother used to make. Not much sp√§tzle in the green beans and sp√§tzle. Sweet sauerkraut was tasty.
The chocolate cream puff (they are apparently known for their cream puffs) was not good. It tasted very mass produced (and durable). Pastry was heavy not light and airy. The cream was also much too dense.
Service was slow.
Overall, the food was good but I've had better German food at Schmidt's Deli in San Francisco.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
I'll try to keep this short. 

Schmidt's is a must if you're in the Columbus German Village area. You'll have to wait for a seat and it's awfully crowded (heaven forbid there's ever a fire, half of the city is packed into the place) but the food is so good. Last week we went in for lunch. We didn't get dessert this time but last time i had a cherry tart and Danielle had one of their famous cream puffs. Definitely recommended if you've got room after your meal. the tart was delicious. 

I had the Old World Sausage sampler w/ peas, German potato salad and saurkraut. Danielle had the pork schnitzel. I hit a wall real quickly so i took most of mine (and hers) home and ate it for lunch the next day. :) The German potato salad is the best I've ever tasted.

text: Who wouldn't love a place that has great food on a buffet and great drinks topped off with great service? Schmidt's is a staple in Cbus and huge supporters of the community. I see their logo on most events/causes as well as a food truck or cart or something at the event. The only downside, which is because they are so damn popular, is that there is usually a long wait. But again, totally worth the wait.

text: Read all the reviews before going here and was not sure if it was going to be good, but was pleasantly surprised.  Took a cab from Nationwide plaza and it was a little farther than I thought.  Glad I didn't walk....especially at night!  Anyway, I sat at the bar at about 9 pm on a Tuesday night and had a wonderful Schmidt's dark beer.  The description said that it was a hoppy, nutty dark....not really....not much hops there, but a good dark nutty beer nonetheless.  THIS WAS THE FASTEST I HAVE EVER GOTTEN MY FOOD AT ANY RESTAURANT IN 8 YEARS OF TRAVELING THE U.S.  Food was fantastic.  Authentic bratwurst, great hot potato salad with not too much vinegar in it.  They even had the spicy brown mustard.  Vunderbar!

text: Drove from Indianapolis, IN for the world famous 1/2 pound cream puff.  It was well worth the drive.  Arrived and had about an hour wait to get in the door, the place was packed.  Ate a great, yet heavy meal and then came the dessert.  My opinion is to eat the cream puff with a cup of coffee.  It was delicious.  Well worth the experience!!

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
This is an institution, and it seems like people feel pretty strongly about it one way or the other. I'm in the camp that ...um, loves the camp-factor. It can feel tourist-y, if that's possible in Columbus. Lots of crowds. Polka music. My mom likes to bring the older relatives here when we're looking for a place to go. They seem to like that, and we always have fun. 

Schmidt's used to have multiple locations in Columbus (or, at least two), but now it's just the original German Village site. The restaurant will usually show up with a stand at the local festivals in the summer. When that opportunity arises, I'm always in for the Bahama Mama, sauerkraut, and maybe a cream puff if someone is willing to share (too big for me alone).

When I'm in-haus, I like to partake in the buffet. The red cabbage is seriously good-- bright and vibrant, not mushy, and I can't get enough of the warm german potato salad. Schmidt's gets knocked a little bit for "bland" food-- but I don't think it's off-point from most German food I've had. Those krauts aren't known for their spices. But, see, it makes the perfect spot to take a relative. I dunno about you but most of my elderly relatives aren't particularly adventurous with their food. 

I suppose with the crowds and the buffet option, the food can seem a bit mass produced. Eh. I'll take it. Schmidt's is comfort food to this Columbus girl. And now I live just down the block, so bring your friends down and we'll share a cream puff.

text: I have been to Columbus several times and never was able to eat here until this visit.  I used the Yelp app to reserve seating in advance and it worked out well.  We started with the pretzel app and it was wonderful - although I didn't care for the beer cheese.  My hubby got the Buffett and came back with a plethora of cased meats, sauerkraut and potatoes.  I got the Pork Shank and it was Huge!  Skipping forward to the best and most memorable part - the CREAM PUFF.  Oh my heavens.  This was the best part of the meal by far - that cream was amazing!  I think if I ever go back I will just eat cream puffs.  Yep, it was that good!
