name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
I've been here so many times and I've never experienced anything less than stellar from the food or the staff. One of my favorite items is the Bavarian Ham & Cheese Sandwich, which comes served on a soft pretzel bun. I always slather the bun with their Spicy Mustard (this is fantastic and I recommend putting this on almost every dish they serve). I like to get an order of their mashed potatoes as my side because they're buttery and garlicky, which is what makes this pair so well with the sandwich.

My other go-to is the original Bahama Mama. It has some great spice and bold flavors that you taste with every bite. This is one of the best sausage platters I've had from any restaurant and it has such a truly authentic German taste.

The only downside to dining here is during the weekends. You need to be prepared to wait for a very long time. It's a popular place and they do their best to turn around the tables as quickly as possible. So just be patient with them and stroll the surrounding German Village neighborhood, because the food is definitely worth the wait.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus

text:
I came here on Feb. 11th for dinner. I have tried the sausage buffet ($15/person)

Atmosphere: Noisy, but somehow, it made me think it should be this noisy. ^^

Food: Sausages are tasty. Deep Fried Chicken Thighs and Legs are ok. German style potato is OUTSTANDING!

Cream Puffs: worth to try at least once.

Service: Our Waitress was awesome. But the guy supplying the buffet table was not ok. (Maybe he had a bad day?!)

Beer: It is beer! Of course, it's good. 

I will definitely go back, but I will not go for the sausage buffet though. My body can't handle this much sodium!

text:
Every time I have to be in or around Columbus:  Schmidt's is a MUST!   On this particular Saturday, my wife and I had just finished a two+ hour commute down from the Akron/Canton area, and I said "what a fitting treat for marking the journey's-end with a Cream Puff" -- the cherry one was amazing!
We wanted to keep it light, because in just a few hours we were to dine with my sister/bro'-in-law and needed to be hungry. WELL---as fate would have it, the dinner plans sort of evaporated, so the 4 of us ended up BACK AT SCHMIDT's for dinner, and the buffet did NOT DISAPPOINT!

text: Sausages and schnitzel were great.  Cream puffs are the size of a large man's fist, but frankly, the pastry shell was mediocre.  The buffet is heavy on sausages, but I agree with others that the selection is not great -- and buffet customers must pay extra if they want dessert.  Potato pancakes are dry and lacking flavor.  We went during a heat wave when the outdoor temperature was 95 F.  The place was warm and packed because of a large convention nearby, which may explain the curt service.  I would return, however.

text:
This place is very good. The sausages is what put this place on the map. The Bahama Mama is really good. What was good was the sausage stew in a spicy sauce. Truely an experience. Take extra time when you visit this place. Average weight on this place is at least 30-45 minutes to get in. The cream puff is amazing. 

The only thing set me from giving 5-star is service. I guess when the place is jammed packed, you feel that you getting rushed out. The Hostess refused to sit us while we were waiting on one more person to arrive. She gave us a hard time when the last guest arrived just to add an extra chair.

Would I go back again to this place? Not on the weekend when a massive people like myself flocked to this place to be part of the history where "Man Vs Food" visited this place pilgramage.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
At Schmidt's, I had to go with the Autobahn Buffet ($14), where I could basically sample (and eat) as much sausage and side dishes as I wanted. From their signature Bahama Mama sausage to German potato salad, Schmidt's offers an array of dishes to try!

My personal favorite would have to be the sausage stew. It was rich, hearty, and full of flavor. Pairing that with the light, sweet apple-and-yam dish gave that blissful yin-yang treatment. All the sausages were wonderful, but the Bahama Mama was my clear favorite (the Knockwurst was second). Just the right balance of seasonings here. The natural  casing on each sausage provided a good snap. To me, the sauerkraut and the red cabbage are the two sides that best complement the sausage. The mac and cheese was cheesy and gooey, although it really lacked that gourmet pizzazz (wouldn't have expected that from a German buffet anyway, though). I also really liked the German potato salad. The zing from that vinegar and the saltiness of the bacon nearly made me do a happy dance at the bar counter.

Finally, I couldn't leave without trying one of Schmidt's signature steroidal cream puffs...half-pound monstrosities!

The cream was a bit on the rich side (not the lightest I've had), but perfect in taste because it wasn't overly sweet. Some guy playfully wanted me to take it down in three bites or less. Maybe if I could inhale and digest food like a python, I'd have seriously tried to do it.

Schmidt's is an amazing place for German food and great desserts. You won't be leaving here hungry!

text: Not pretentious, it is what it says it is--a sausage house.  Everything there is done very well.  Got the buffet and the sausage was excellent, the sides were good--2 kinds of sauerkraut!.  The dessert was good solid midwestern fare which we appreciate, being from New England.  The beer selection was good as well.  Chicken salad was excellent.

text: Overly awesome. Ethnic food quality is on par with the university inn (aka Sokolowskis for Polish fare) in Cleveland. Highly recommended. Wife and I had the buffet, our son ordered the pretzel bites which he still talks about in every other sentence. Good experience. Will be back again.

text: I actually was a little underwhelmed. If you go GET THE BUFFET. I wish I was more aware of that, but for 15 dollars you are getting unlimteid food (all sausage options) and an assort of other sides and dishes. I just got the Mama specialty sausage and because it was supposed to be famous and spicy, I did not feel it deserved either of those terms. The Cream Puff is a 5 star food that you should go for even if it is a little expensive. The place has a nice atmosphere, but seemed to be touristy to me, which I personally am a little biased against. People were nice, huge pintsof beer, but for 8 dollars. I do recommend if looking to get a meal in Germantown, because the polka band is very delightful.

text: The secret is out. I have been to Schmidt's. My fiancee was craving it since he had the Schmidt's food cart at his work. He loved it so much he was craving a Bahama Mama every night and that meant tagging me along to the restaurant to eat it.  I just liked the Bahama Mama itself I didn't really care for everything else on the platter. I guess it's because I have had the same thing in Germany and enjoyed it more there than at Schmidt's.

text: I'm not an expert on German food, but this place is great! I was skeptical after so many reviews stated there is better food to be had elsewhere, but I'm glad we didn't listen. I had the Rueben on a pretzel bun with the green beans, and my boyfriend had the brat sandwich with apple sauce. We both had the chicken soup & split a cream puff (with 6 to go for family). We will definitely be back the next time in Columbus.

text: I was visiting Columbus and wanted to see German Village and have some authentic german food. This restaurant did not disappoint. The bahama mama sausage was great, I did the lunch special for $10.50 at the suggestion of my server who was amazing. I finished my meal with the chocolate puff which was was delicious without being to heavy. I would definitely recommend this place

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
ENVIRONMENT: The restaurant was clean and I was shocked that they had a small parking lot. I'm accustomed to having problems finding parking in German Village, but I didn't have to worry about that here.

STAFF: Our waiter was excellent.

FOOD: This is where I have mixed reviews. I was a big fan of the Bahama mama sandwich that I got, but my wife was not a fan of her dish. The menu stated there was a gingersnap gravy on it, and they weren't kidding! The beef basically tasted like Christmas cookies and was very hard to continue eating. We shared a cream puff, which we split in half. It was pretty good, but I think the pastry suffered because of its size. It was a little more chewy than I would have wanted, but the filling was delicious.

Overall, our meal wasn't bad and wasn't amazing, hence the three stars.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
This place is a Columbus gem.  The food is pretty simple, but visiting the German Village, going to the gift shop next door, waiting in line for an hour, and listening to the polka music is all part of the experience.

The giant cream puffs are a staple, not only at the restaurant, but also at every major summer festival in Columbus.  I've tried them all, but my personal fave is the basic vanilla cream.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text: So glad we came here for our first visit to German Village! When we came here there were people pouring out the door & the hosts told us there'd be an hour wait. We decided to put our names on the wait list & walk around to visit some shops around the area. When our table was ready they sent us a text & we were seated right away. There were 4 of us and we all ordered something different so we could share/taste each other's food. We got the pretzel appetizer with mustard dip, hoffbrau schnitzel, sausage platter, alpine chicken spaetzel, and cabbage rolls. Omg. Everything was so good. Out of all the sides my fave was probably the german potato salad- yum! Everyone also got some beer, ofcourse, and since I can't drink alcohol, I tried their peach fizz, which was delicious. Our server was great & overall we had a great experience!

text: Lived here for a year now and have wanted to try out the famous German sausage house and was only disappointed. Our server was rude and not very attentive to our table. I don't know if it's because we had children or what. The food was okay and not much flavor at all. It was a neat experience but probably not be back.

text: I've had a lot of food in Germany and can say that the food at Schmidt's was quite comparable to authentic German food (from a non-German's perspective!). The waitresses' unfriendly attitude and the overall service, however, were disappointing compared to what we are used to seeing in the US.

text: I grew up hearing and seeing Schmidt's sausages named Bahama Mama and it didn't add up to it being a German restaurant like the name implies.  It definitely is a German, but I'm still confused about he name. The restaurant is ideally located in German village and takes up a decent bit of real estate.  It's a fun old building where they play oompah music with dinner.  I ordered the pork shank with mashed potatoes and sauerkraut.  It was a bit Americanized, but overall it was very good.

text: We stop here now and then when in the area for the amazing. Huge cream puffs. We usually get the regular but this time got both the regular and chocolate. .. personally I prefer the original. Either way they are huge and enough to share .. about the size of my head. They do make mini cream puffs but you have to order ahead for those .. my husband prefers the mini one .. I would rather have the huge messy real deal cream puff.  Have never dined here and  perhaps some day .. they are always busy on the weekends when we stop by to get our dessert fix.

-Service: ok at best, don't think the guy likes his job

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
If you've ever had "real" German food like actually IN Germany, this was not so good. I've been to Germany several times and love German food so I was excited to try this place out.

Our server was a nice lady, but not totally with it. Had to repeat our order several times, and she still managed to screw it up. Ordered pork schnitzel, ended up with veal. It was dry, overly greasy and mostly breading. The potato pancakes were good, a bit bland but still tasty. The sausages were just ok. The bratwurst was too mushy. Most of the sausages were not traditional. Can you imagine ordering a nice juicy plate of "Bahama mama sausages" in Munich? Sauerkraut was too mushy too. The hot potato salad & red cabbage was good. That's about it. We tried a vanilla cream puff as well. Dough was too heavy but the cream was very good.

text: I always order the bahama mama, a sure bet, but Sunday I had the cabbage rolls.  Just like my mother use to make. If its crowded and you don't like to wait, find a stool at the bar and order your dinner there.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text: Flew in to Columbus from La Guardia on a Sunday for the 3rd round of the NCAA tournament.  Watched NC State and Michigan State win then proceeded to Schmidt's.  The place was insanely packed.  Ordered an Oktoberfest from the bar and waited about 20 minutes for a stool to open up.  Took a look at the menu, and opted for the all you can eat Autobahn buffet.  While looking through the menu I heard someone tell their friend that the buffet was expensive.  The menu did not have the price of the buffet, so I inquired as to the price from the bartender prior to placing the order. When the bartender stated it was $14.00, it was all I could do to keep the Oktoberfest I had just drank from flying out of my mouth.  I guess it is all relative.  The buffet was awesome.  My favorite was the Bahama Mama sausage.  I learned of Schmidt's while watching Man Vs Food and will definitely return when in Columbus.  On this visit I did not try the cream puffs (got stuffed on sausage) which adds a couple bucks to the price of the buffet, but will definitely be back.  Watch the Oktoberfest they pack a wallop. This is one of the must do restaurants when in Columbus.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}

text:
I've went a few time now, tried both the buffet (lunch, it was ~$15, not sure how the other review got the $9 deal) and normal menu (dinner). It wasn't anything special. It was good, though. There are about 4-5 kinds of sausages at the buffet, and you do get full (at least I did after 2 plates =]). Out of all the different sausages, I like the Bahama Mama the most, and it was a bit spicy. I don't like the sour kraut; it's too sour for me. =|

Waitress didn't tell us about the buffet, we had to ask for is. =/ Friend had the beer sample (~7-8 of the shot cups) and said the house dark beer was the best of the sample.

If you order from the normal menu, it would keep you full (at least with an average appetite ;]).

text:

Thay also Have German Beir on draft. Atmosphere is fun and you feel like your sitting in an authentic German restaurant. If you come to Columbus this a must on your list of things to do!!!!!

text: Recently went here over the 4th of July. If you like German food this is a must go to. It has great food (especially the Bahama mama with German potato salad) and also a good selection of beer. With all that they also have the biggest and best cream puffs!

text: If there was a 10 star option, I would give Schmidt's Sausage Haus 15. This meal was phenomenal from beginning to end: Sauerkraut-bratwurst balls with beer cheese, hoffbrau schnitzel, haus sauerbraten with ginger snap gravy over noodles, warm potato salad and kraut, Hefeweizen and a 1/2 pound cream puff with coffee for dessert. Total price: $60 plus tip. The atmosphere was authentic and cozy. I cannot wait to go back and try the buffet.

text: The absolute worst German food I've ever had!  We lived 4 years in Germany and visited the country twice after that and we've lived in 6 states since the 4 years in Germany.  We've eaten at many German restaurants in this country and the food was so much better than this place.  We live in the Cincinnati area and made a special trip today to try Schmidt's since we love German food.  The schnitzel was horrible--totally tasteless, dry, and perhaps not more than 1/8 inch thick at best.  The sauce was clearly a mix and, again, tasteless.  The spaetzle was dry and tasteless.  The green beans were frozen, not fresh.  Do not waste your money.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Schmidt's does not live up to the fame. Compared to other well known establishments, this restaurant is not worth your time/money. If you are looking for a quality meal worth the price you pay, I would look elsewhere. As for the review and things you need to know about this place:

1.) Atmosphere- Inside Schmidt's the music and wait staff is dressed to theme. This is the one and only reason to visit. Did not have to wait long for waiter to arrive and go over menu.  

2.) Food- Our group of four adults (20-25 year olds) was extremely disappointed. We had been talking this place up for years and how good it would be, yet we were shocked by the turn out. The menu had plenty of options most ranging in the $13-$20 range. Since price is never our main concern, it made the most sense to pay a few extra bucks for the buffet in order to sample all of the options they had. Unfortunately, the choices were quite limited. Most of us guys enjoy sausages grilled with nice char marks, however their meat selection was all boiled and lacked taste. Our group expected the Bhama Mama to have a lot of spices and heat behind it, but we found the meat to be bland and comparable to all of the other selections. As for sides, the buffet had a few limited options but mostly you are buying it for a few links of boiled sausage. 

3.) Dessert and Beer- Beer selection is different but pricey. Selections come in large sizes, which is great, but overall the beer could be much better. Dessert is all about the cream puffs. They are large and good, but NOT GREAT. They are an add on to the buffet so make sure to account for the additional pricing. They come in a variety of flavors, but for the most part their are better options elsewhere.

text: Great portions!  I had the sauerbraten and it was delicious.  The German potato salad and red cabbage were equally as tasty.  We arrived on an OSU game day and the place was packed.  Fortunately we found seats at the bar and didn't have to wait for a table.  The staff was friendly and not intrusive, so we enjoyed our experience.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
If you're planning on being in Columbus for any length of time, you'll want to stop into Schmidt's. If the unique sausages and obligatory sp√§tzle weren't enough, then you'd be hard-pressed to find a better German Restaurant + Fudge Haus in town.

Schmidt's offers both buffet and off-menu grazing. I say "grazing" because the easygoing atmosphere and cornucopia of carbs come together in such a deliciously perfect matrimony. 

The staff appears to be half-american and half-European; but everyone is friendly, knowledgeable, and spirited. A hallmark of German dining is cheer and wit, and the massive dining rooms are anything but silent or morose.

Don't let anyone force you into the Bahama Mama. While exotic and flavorful, the other, more classic sausages are not to be passed up, in my humble opinion. The wine and beer selection is respectable, and anyone should be able to find a good pairing for whatever they've ordered.

Fill up on beer, sausage, wine, and cream puffs; then lock arms with someone wonderful and enjoy German Village the way it was meant to be experienced -- mit Fr√∂hlichkeit!

text: Super friendly staff, especially enjoyed the servers' attires :) We opted for the lunch buffet and we did not regret the decision at all! For $10/person -- offered their staple side orders of potatoes, green beans, rice to name a few and their staple sausages -- the bratwurst, mild and regular bahama mama - YUMMY IN THE TUMMY! Along with the history that you cannot pass up, being in the German Village, the atmosphere is nice and family-friendly! Last but not the least, if you go for the buffet option, you get a discount on dessert...and their desserts were a nice way to seal the deal -- WIN WIN!

text: Read the reviews, seen the TV spots from when Man Vs. Food visited and seen them a the State Fair and finally I decided to give it a try. We arrived today around noon, was seated in about 10 minutes and we looked over the menu and ordered our drinks and food. First impression was service was slow, took about 15 minutes after ordering to get drinks and we both just had soda. I had the buffet and my son had the Bahama momma burger. I found the buffet food to be lacking in flavor, I expected a bit of a bite with the bahama momma considering they had a mild version but in reality i could not tell the difference. My son said his food was ok, but there is nothing there to bring us back. We wanted to order a dessert but she promptly brought our check before we had the chance and at that point I was through and annoyed at the lack of service.

The cream puff was easily the best thing we ate -- not because the food wasn't great, but because the cream puff was just that amazing.

text: A group of us were in Columbus supporting the Blackhawks and went to Schmidt's Sausage Hause for dinner. Food is delicious, atmosphere with 2 piece band was fun. Their home brew beer is very tasty and comes in 12oz, 22oz and 32oz. We skipped the buffet and ordered from the menu. My friends meatloaf was the best I've had in ages. I ordered the sauerbraten, my guy the weinerschnitzel, both were delicious, but the green beans were not fresh and tasted bagged and frozen, that was the only disappointment.   We ordered the giant cream puff, it was huge! The cream was fluffy, the pastry light and fluffy. Yes, we will go next time we're in Columbus, Ohio.

text: Nice little restaurant tucked into a cute little neighborhood in Columbus.  Stopped in from out of town and was pleasantly surprised.  Buffet was nothing outstanding - sausages (of course) but tasty and the authenticity seemed there.  Good cream puffs for dessert and for the money seemed quite the bargain.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
This place is AUSGEZEICHNET (in German, this means awesome).

To put it best, I simply live and breathe anything and everything German. I am not kidding. I am 100% German, have degree in German, and have visited numerous times, and Schmidt's is one of the best German restaurants I have been to. 

First off, they have a killer buffet with every type of sausage imaginable. The Bahama Mama is my personal favorite, but you really can't go wrong with any of them. Along with the wide variety of sausage, they have the best, most delicious mac and cheese to ever hit this earth. So gooey and practically melts in your mouth. 

The schnitzel there is the best! I usually don't eat a lot of meat when I go out to eat (didn't mean to rhyme there..haha) but I almost always order this when I'm there. It's a huge pork patty, with a light breaded coating, making it irresistible.

For dessert, they have MASSIVE cream puffs. I'm pretty sure this cream puff is famous in Columbus (and I heard that it also has a Facebook page). I have friends that go to Schmidt's just to get the cream puff, it's that good. 

I think Schmidt's is one of those places in Columbus that simply makes Columbus unique and different from any other city. It's a little taste of Germany right in our own backyard.

I just can't get over how busy they are while being at the end of a cobble brick road.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Cute German place in the even cuter German village 

Ambiance
Classic German inside and out. German flags and German decor and memorabilia throughout give it a very European feel. Even the servers are wearing traditional German clothes! Gives it a very authentic feel 

Service
Got scolded by the hostess (very rudely) for not having our whole party present, but it got better after that. The server was so friendly and outgoing. Looking around to other tables all the servers seemed to have the same positive attitude. 

Food
Pretty yummy overall. Check out the huge dessert display when you enter to make sure you save some appetite. The pretzel nuggets starter was interesting.   Not too greasy or salty and interesting and different texture. They do have a buffet, but the selections were pretty limited. For the price it seemed a better deal to order and entree from the menu, and I tried the schnitzel with a mushroom sauce. Very good, and this is not coming from a huge schnitzel fan. Crispy, fried, and juicy with the rich sauce a perfect accompaniment. The potato pancakes were good and such a unique and truly German side dish. For dessert had to try both the chocolate cream pie and the German chocolate cake. Both were very good!  The pie was a little better with a deliciously silky chocolate filling. The cake (unlike many restaurant cakes) was truly moist!  Next time we might tackle the half pound cream puff - !!!

Mojo
A cool and fun and tasty taste of Germany in Columbus!

It had a lot of flavor and was very filling. My grandparents had different types of sausages. This is a great place to go if you're hungry.. but expect a wait!

Split a cream puff at the end.. delish.

text: I have loved this place ever since I was a kid! I love their German potato salad and their cream puffs are da bomb.  Even a couple of times when I was trying to eat "light", I tried their turkey Rueben and it was even amazing.  We don't get here very often but the food and service has always been very good!

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Decided to try the Autobahn buffet today at Schmidt's and made it my mission to try at least a small sample of everything they had out. This is what I thought of everything:
Salad Bar: very standard salad bar but greens and tomatoes were fresh. They had macaroni salad that was very good and some sauerkraut-pickle mixture that was decent as well.
Potato Soup: located right next to the salad bar and man this was excellent! Very creamy, without the large chunks of potatoes that usually end up in these soups which I dislike, very flavorful and went perfect with the rolls.
Sausage Stew: Not really a stew but rather a dish of sausage, beef, pasta, onions, and a few peppers. This stew was very flavorful with strong hints of the meats and black pepper. The meats themselves were very tender and went well with the gravy sauce/broth. 
Bahama Mama: This is their signature sausage for a reason..it's perfectly spicy, has great snap, simply an amazing wurst. 
Milder Bahama Mama: similar to above but without the spice, so why?
Bratwurst: Nothing special here to be honest
Sauerkraut: standard side to go with your sausages, nothing special as far as sauerkraut is concerned though.
Red Cabbage: Schmidt's red cabbage is amazing. Diced apples give it just a touch of sweetness to go with the red cabbage and vinegar flavor, perfect flavor balance overall.
Potato Salad: Another excellent side. Their potato salad has a great, slightly vinegary flavor with finely diced bacon and onions added in to make it just perfect.
Green Beans And Spaetzle: Very little spaetzle here unfortunately. The green beans were pretty average but the small pieces of bacon cooked in were appreciated. 
Corned Beef and Cabbage: The corned beef gave the cabbage nice flavor but without making this taste like a meat side dish, and the cabbage was just on the verge between softness/crispness which I enjoyed. 
Yams and Apples: This was pretty mediocre, not very sweet or flavorful in any way as you might expect. 
Macaroni & Cheese: Your standard mac & cheese.
Chicken and Rice: Average tasting rice with small chunks of chicken, nothing special.
Jumbo Creampuff: For only $3.50 extra on the buffet you can get a creampuff, so I ordered a pumpkin creampuff to-go since I was stuffed after three decent trips to the buffet (what a breakfast to start the next morning with). The creampuff was good but not really my thing. It lacked much pumpkin flavor that I expected, but it was huge and I think it would have been better fresh as well. 

Overall, a lot of the buffet selections were outstanding with a few that I would consider "just average"- mainly the non-German specialties. With a price tag of $9.99 for the lunch buffet and the amount of food you get, this is hard to beat, especially when you can add a half-pound cream puff for only $3.50 more. The service was friendly, and every time I returned from the buffet my plate had been cleared in the 30-45 seconds I was gone. The authentic atmosphere and historic location just add to the experience.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
While home-cooked is always better, Schmidt's gets it close enough for government work as far as I'm concerned. The two times I have had the pleasure of dining at Schmidt's I have left overly full, completely satisfied, and ready for a return trip. Truly this is one of my favorite places to overindulge in Columbus!

I really need to go back some time just for the Autobahn buffet. Considering it has a little bit of almost everything on the menu, I can't see many good arguments against said tactic. The buffet remains a goal, though; I've settled on two big dinners when I've been, the Wiener Schnitzel and the Bavarian Cabbage Rolls and, oh my gosh, they were both winners. Delicious, huge, and served with a smile- bring it on!

I like Schmidt's best when it's a bit crowded, a little noisy- boisterous, even. It really gets you in the spirit for a German feast, which should always be approached in a mood of high spirits and good humor. Let the beer flow, let the jokes run too long, and let your belt out a few notches: these are the best tips I can offer.

If you can manage to walk after whatever amazing dinner you managed to fit down your gullet, try to waddle in to Schmidt's Fudge Haus. I haven't interacted enough with it for a full review just yet, but even just browsing there is fun if there is a single bone in your body that likes cute little gift shops- and by God, there should be at least the lone one.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
I am an admitted Germanophile. I took German in high school and college and had the pleasure of going to Germany when I was 16. Ich liebe all things German, I love speaking German (albeit somewhat poorly), I love German culture, I love German people, I love Germany, I love German music, I love German folklore and I love German food. I am kind of a loser and always claim to be German, although I'm not sure that's actually true.

Unfortunately, as most German restaurants in America are want to do, this is a bastardized version of what German food should be. German food is the ultimate comfort and soul food. Sausage, spaetzle, fried cutlets, potato salad, good bier. This place is a gimmick and an offense to what delicious German food really should be. It's not bad food, it just isn't good food. The green beans mit spaetzle was definitely the highlight. The pork schnitzel was flavorless and depressing. It just didn't taste homemade, it didn't taste like comfort food.

Yes, the CREAM in the cream puffs is delicious (note: the pastry itself is underwhelming at best), the service was great, the Oompah Band was fun and even knew "Ein Prosit" when I requested it. He was singing "Schnitzelbank" when I got there, too, but other than that he was just singing English songs in the style of an Oompah band. The bier selection was great, as it should be. I would absolutely come back here, just without the expectation of getting authentic, homemade German food. Maybe the sausages are really good and homemade?

text: This place is incredible.   The pretzel bite appetizer is fantastic.  They are light on the inside and crispy on the outside with the perfect amount of salt.   The traditional rueben is delicious.  The corned beef is perfectly seasoned and the sauerkraut is incredible.  They are known for their creampuffs, be sure to try one, they're amazing.  The entire staff was pleasant and helpful.   Our server was cheerful and attentive.  The  restaurant was very clean and the atmosphere was pleasant and inviting. We will definitely visit again when we are in the area.

text: A nice restaurant with a good theme, friendly staff, nice decorations, and definitely capitalizing on the German Village. Prices were OK and food was pretty good. Nothing too spectacular to say though. Went during lunch on a weekday and it was busy.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Five years ago I and some of my family went the 60 mile trip to Schmidt's to celebrate our anniversary and we were blown away with all the food on the buffet.  

Last week just hubby and I went and were excited to make the trip. I cannot say how disappointed we were. The buffet was very mediocre to be kind. 
The "warm"  food was cold. All the sausages tasted the same and had the same soft texture. I kept not finishing what I sampled and trying something else.

 It was a $50 dollar meal of BLAH.?? Finally I ordered the German chocolate cake and a glass of milk to get the buffet taste out of my mouth. Cake was OK.

text: The atmosphere here is unlike anything else you'd find in Columbus. The music is lively, the waiters are kind, and the food is about as dependable as it gets. I came here to sit at the bar and enjoy the imported German beers, I had the St.Pauli Girl and my boyfriend had a delightful smoked beer that tasted like bacon! I believe it was the Aecht Schlenkerla Rauchbier Urbock

text: To be fair, I never ate here. We waited for over two hours and my stomach just couldn't hold out so some in our party walked up the street to another place. Other friends stuck it out and said it was good but not worth the wait. I went inside to check the place out and saw those cream puffs. I hate missing out on those but glad I passed on the sausage. Schmidt's chocolate haus next door is well worth the trip though. Glad we checked that out while waiting.

text: I know Schmidt's is the happening place for most people in German Village, but you have to really like authentic German food to enjoy this restaurant. There are no other choices on the menu for those who don't. The server we had didn't really seem to have very much knowledge of the food either because when we asked questions he gave very basic answers that were no help at all. We ended our meal with taking a chocolate cream puff home. This was a huge waste of money as it ended up being mostly a blah chocolate cream with a very thin shell. Not much to the puff at all. I have definitely had better elsewhere.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
I have to take a star off because they don't make some things, like, their potato salads, in-house anymore, but I'm still giving it a high rating because of its rich history and longevity here in Columbus. It's still owned by the same family, and that's what makes it the institution that it is. Oh, and it's the only butcher shop to have stayed in German Village; Schumann's Meats moved to 3-C, and Thurn's moved to Greenlawn Avenue.

Even if you're ordering for carryout, you are treated like family here. Usually all we come in for are the cream puffs (I've gotten so many friends from out of town hooked on these things), but we'll occasionally get some bratwursts and bahama mamas. I'm also madly in love with their German chocolate cake and their pies. It might even cause problems in my relationship, I love them so much! (Just kidding; my girlfriend loves them just as much as I do.)

The atmosphere is second-to-none. I know Olive Garden's whole thing is "when you're here, you're family," but their hospitality pales in comparison to Schmidt's. This place is amazing. The servers and the folks behind the counter take care of you, and with exception to the stuff they're not making in-house anymore (if you're not sure, you can ask), the food is well-prepared and so tasty you might cry.

Should I mention that they have a stand at the Ohio State Fair every year? That's right! If you're at the Fair and you need a Schmidt's fix, look for their tent and you're good to go. They were at Equine Affaire last time I went. I know you're obligated to eat "fair fare" at the fair, but how could you honestly pass up the best brats in the city? How can you live with yourself? I can't. I feel like I'm disrespecting the food gods if I walk by without getting something. Not to mention the public shaming courtesy of my family. Yeah. Schmidt's is a family affair.

If you're going to sit down (at the restaurant itself, sillies!) go for the buffet. Don't ask why, just do it. Never order the same thing twice in a row. It's sacrilege to do so because there are so many amazing things on the menu. I'm a huge fan of their cabbage rolls. I don't know what it is about them, but I'm addicted.

And then there's the cream puff. You've seen them on Food Network. You've seen them on Man vs. Food. We're talking about a POUND of puff pastry and cream filling. The tiny 4in x 4in x 4in to-go boxes? One cream puff takes up the entire thing. It takes up an entire salad plate. I'm not joking. I still can't finish one in one go because it's so rich and sweet and good and...oh crap I'm drooling. I get a stomach ache after eating half of one, but it's so worth it. I love the original vanilla, but they also have chocolate, peanut butter, and several other flavors. Try them all, just not at once or you'll be in a sugar coma for days afterward.

I'm going to be dreaming about cream puffs tonight. Sweet dreams, indeed.

text:
Schmidt's was a-ok. There is really nothing that stands out as AMAZING, but the Autobahn buffet, although limited in selection, is pretty tasty and has mounds of whatever's available. I generally leave with an excessively full belly.

Servers here haven't been very engaging, and usually only show up after you need a refill, not before.

text: Just had a birthday lunch there and it was delicious! It's in such a quaint part of town with brick streets and beautiful homes nearby. The service was great but the meal was fabulous! We started with the pretzel bites with beer cheese dip (yum!) followed by stuffed cabbage with German potato salad, green beans with Spatzle and red cabbage. It was the best I've ever had. My husband got their special Mamas Reuben sandwich which is made with a patty of Bahama Mama sausage. It was quite interesting with a tasty sauce. The German Chocolate cake was very dense and rich.

text: Only reason I am giving them 4 stars vs 5 is I am 6'4 and their seating arrangement is somewhat uncomfortable for me. They are always busy and once you taste their food you will know why. They don't rest on their reputation to bring customers in. Their food is amazing. I'd recommend the sausage stew at the buffet. It's amazing.

text: Can not speak for the food service in the Schmidt's Sausage Haus but there are tour buses of people coming and going from this place. That is what makes them the perfect place to purchase you sausage from. With the high volume of people there is always fresh sausage being made. We got a couple pounds each of the garlic, spicy and traditional brats - excellent.

text:
Food review:
The food was good. We ordered the Bahama  Mama platter and it was not disappointed at all. My boyfriend and me shared it because we wanna save room for the signature Jumbo cream puff for dessert. We got the original vanilla flavor and it was HUGE. The cake was a bit dry but the cream was delicious. Overall, i would def recommend this place for a must when you come to German Village. Also, remember to order the sauerkraut balls because they were phenomenon.

Service:
Service was good. The food came out fast so that's nice. The restaurant was a little bit small  other than that, i have no other complaints.

text: Had the buffet. Bahamas mama, bratwurst and sausage stew were the best sausage options. Be forewarned the sauerkraut and red cabbage are high on vinegar. I liked it but others might not. The green beans were good as well.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Before I say anything else, I must tell you to get a cream puff. Yes, the giant cream puff that is over filed with the most delicious cream I have ever had with a little powdered sugar on top, that one. It is amazing and prefect, a must have. 

Now everything else. Schmidt's is a great Columbus experience. It's not just a restaurant but an outing. First off, it's located in German Village, a cute little neighborhood that's perfect for walking around. Second it's exactly what you can expect of a real German restaurant. The hustle and bustle, decor, live music(sometimes) and general atmosphere is awesome. 

Here's the deal about the food. Some is great, some is ok but it is all kind of heavy. Just remember that it is German food and some of their best offerings are sausages. It's not going to be a light meal. Now speaking of sausages, get some. Whether you go for the buffet (recommended) or the sampler platter, or just for the delicious Bahama Mamas, all are good. I will say that I'm not always a fan of potato salad (too sweet)or some of the other offerings in the buffet, you have decent options there.

They also have some pretty good and unique beers. They have good recommendations is you ask for one. Also, have I mentioned the cream puff? Get it. Personally I get one to myself and don't like to share. You may not finish it, but taking the cream puff home and having it later is a treat. You deserve it.

text: This restaurant is a must try. We ordered a sausage sampler plate and a slow cooked pork shank. Both are very good. The pork shank is a new item. The outside is crispy while the inside is very tender. The mushroom sauce provides extra richness. We loved every kind of sausage. But the highlight is the warm potato salad, which is amazing! We have been to several German restaurants in Leavenworth, WA, which are considered quite authentic. I would say this place is on par with those places but cheaper. Service is also great!

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Wow! I didn't know that German food had influenced so much of the American staples that we place on the dinner table.

I came here with two other friends on a Wednesday around 3, and it wasn't busy at all. Sooo many tables open. There were a few folks here and there, mostly grandparents. This is probably the best time to come since it can get really packed on weekends and evenings.

We decided to share an appetizer, so we got Schmidt's pretzel nuggets. So yum! They were warm and fresh and absolutely delightful! I'd come here again and again only to eat those! They came with honey mustard and then we added beer cheese. Oh, man! That beer cheese was the best decision ever! Boy, it was so good. Even better than the honey mustard.

They do buffet here, but eh! We weren't gonna do that. I ordered the German meatloaf, which was under the dinner section, I believe. It comes with sides, so I had applesauce, potato cakes (?), peas, and of course, they give you a roll. The meatloaf was so easy to eat and moist. The mushroom sauce on top gave it such a nice flavor too. My only complaint is the roll. Do people in Germany care for it? Cuz I don't. It was the most useless afterthought. I took one bite and that was the end of my meal. It's nothing special and didn't need to be there. Schmidt's could save a little more money and not serve any more rolls.

My friends got schnitzel and the sausage sampler. The schnitzel also had the mushroom sauce and was the star of my friend's plate! Oh, so good! She also had that obnoxious roll (which she also didn't finish, a clear reason why Schmidt's should stop serving them), green beans with spaetzle, and mashed potatoes. My friend's sausage sampler came with 4 halves of sausage, a different kind of bread which was buttered and looked much more appetizing, potato salad (she didn't care for), apple sauce, and sauerkraut. 

The apple sauce blew me away. They make it themselves! It was chunky and really, really enjoyable. 

As for the sauerkraut? My friend thought it was too much. Someone I met in the bathroom from London told me it was too vinegary LOL. I think people come visit from all over just to try this place out. It's cool! 

The workers all dress up, making for as German of an experience as you can get in Columbus.

I also tried the vanilla cream puff, something that they are also well-known for. It was absolutely amazing! So good and easy to eat in one sitting with another friend. 

Parking isn't that bad either. Again, we came at a good time so it wasn't busy. There's parking all around the side and back of the building.

text: I want to start out by saying I had great expectations for the food. Place had good reviews and all but I ate their Friday night and it was very average. Also since eating there I have gotten terrible food poisoning and have currently been in the hospital for the past two days due to my meal at this restaurant. I will never be returning to this establishment.

text:
This is the real deal. Yes they always have a line and trust me these people waiting are locals. 
This is as close to Germany as many including me will ever get. 
The buffet is $15 and worth every penny. 
It has an assortment of sausage and they are glorious. 
The bar is the best bet for solo or couples. 
The cream puffs and German chocolate cake are delicious.

text: Based on the YELP reviews I had to try while visiting Ohio. I was not disappointed . Try the pretzel bites as an appetizer - they were delicious. I had the sausage sampler and such a reasonable price. You can tell the applesauce is homemade as well as the German potato salad. Would highly recommend this restaurant - they also have a lunch buffet for only $10.00!

text: Haven't been in Schmidt's for 7 plus years and man it's good to be home! I couldn't imagine my welcome back to GV festivities to not include a yummy cream puff Not to mention the awesome bartender Michael that went well out of his way to help a new neighbor lady find a phone charger. Thanks again! This place feels like home when you dine here A must visit if you want to feel the warmth of German Village.

text: This was another bookmarked place that didn't disappoint!! We had a really fun time drinking beer and listening to the live band and eating authentic German food. I will say we ordered a ton of food and it was only 63 dollars good value for what u get. The restaurant and the neighborhood is super cute and cobblestone roads. This is a must see if you are in Columbus for work.

text: If you are from Columbus you know Schmidt's for the sausages and the Cream Puffs both are worthy CBus icons and rather tasty so if you are in German Village and you are really hungry go here. They have their buffet and as far as an all you can eat buffet it is one of the best in town. It will not break the bank and it is more kitschy then trendy place to go. Good place to bring a  crew of hungry carnivores for lunch or dinner.

text: Yes, it's a place for tourists. Yes, it is the equivalent of German fast food. But seriously, every meal I have had here has been absolutely delicious. Schnitzel  to die for. Fantastic service. Nice atmosphere.

text: We started with sauerkraut balls that came with a mild mustard mayo sauce, the kids smashed them. The Bahama mama was great, it was juicy with a nice snap. I topped it with grilled onion and sauerkraut, I added some spicy mustard to give it a kick. The kids got grilled cheese and soup, the cut the crust off the grilled cheese and the kids LOVED it. The location is great and we walked over to the candy store to check it out. The reason I came was the cream puff, it's fantastic and is the reason I leave a 4 star and not 3. It's a thick and tasty cream inside a perfectly prepared puff pastry, very delicious!! Nice spot for lunch.

text: Authentic right down to the music and lederhosen. Chose the Bahama Mama which was very tender and perfectly seasoned. Wonderful accompaniment to a beer. Loved the cream puff as well.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
I've only been here a handful of times in my life, and only once since I started on Yelp.

The food has never been bad. I mean, I've never been to Germany, but in comparison with the other German  (or German inspired, or German based) foods I've had, it's really damn good. From the buffets to ordering, from grabbing their food at festivals to being at a wedding rehearsal dinner... it's been great.

It's always been busy. Parking is a *bitch*. Let me emphasize: *B*I*T*C*H* - my friend somehow got two parking tickets in what she thought was a great spot. Good luck with that, German Village!

But the food-always grand. The staff, friendly. The crowds? Always there.

If you like German food (or want the dessert...) go at least once. It's worth the adventure (and the parking).

text:
Full disclosure - Here is my rating system
1. Awful - don't bother  2. So-so  3. Average (what I expected) 4. Something above the usual  5. Outstanding.
My wife grew up south of Columbus, but had never been to German Town, so we decided to check it out. After walking the streets and making a stop at the Book Loft, we were ready for a good meal and beer. We had read about Schmidt's on Yelp and TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed. We each had the sausage/brat sampler with german potato salad. Both were excellent (We bought several links to take home from their deli). The atmosphere is typical German Brewhaus. Good for families and groups. Friendly, attentive service. I only gave it 3 stars because there was nothing "special" about it - it was just wholesome goodness.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus

text: This place put a smile on my face! The atmosphere feels very authentic and the food is good too. The best part was the cream puff and German coffee I had for desert. Yum! I also got to enjoy a few minutes of an accordion and tuba duo who were very lively and skilled. I came to Columbus from California for an interview and wanted to check out German Village, and I'm happy I went to Schmidt's!

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text: I am giving this place 4 stars only for the sausage. Went to this place on a week day for lunch. It was packed but the bar was open. You can either eat at the buffet or order off the menu. I decided to go with the bahama mama from the menu and ordered the regular sides that come with the sausage, thinking that if I am trying it, it should better be original. The bartender was surprised when I ordered the original sides with the sausage but I didn't understand his reaction until I tried everything. The sausage, the bun and the mustard were amazing. The seasoning gave the sausage extremely unique flavor. The potato salad side was also good. However the cabbage side was extremely vinegary and almost inedible. The last original side that comes with it was apricot. It was too sweet and didn't match anything on the plate. It wasn't bad mixing with the sausage but the sausage is soo unique that it is not worth it to ruin even one bite with apricot lol. And you can definitely try mixing the apricot with the vinegary cabbage mix. Good luck with that. I would love to come back just for the sausage and might try the desserts as they looked great.

text: This place is great.  I know it's a cultural icon in Columbus, and the service is wonderful.  Although don't try to just walk in - definitely make reservations or you won't get a table.  I gave it four stars because I don't love German food - I don't do bratwurst, etc.  But those cream puffs were really good!

text: Schmidt's was terrific. So busy that I sat at the bar for lunch. Had the bratwurst sandwich, which was really tasty with sauerkraut and green beans with spaetzel, a definite favorite. Couldn't resist the German Chocolate Cake, which finished me off nicely. The service was very good and the food even better. If you're in town for lunch or dinner, make this a stop on your list. And check out their fudge shop across the street for stuff to take home.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
I am huge on atmosphere. Schmidt's has it.
Considering it is located in the heart of gorgeous German Village, they cannot ever let this place close down. Ever. It would be like burning down city hall.
It is a landmark, and if you go for no other reason, get a gigantic cream puff. 
Yep. Big as a salad plate. These babies are not joking around.
If you don't want to go to the restaurant, hit up their food truck locations when they appear. It isn't the homespot, but their sausages are great no matter what.

I can say this: I know a few of their servers.  Make fun of the corsety dresses and lederhosen all you want but these people bust their butts. If you do go, don't be a cheap tipper.  They sing, dance, and do their best to give you a great time.

text: Had to stop here on our drive through Columbus after hearing so much about it.  In a charming little neighborhood, right off the highway so it's easy to find!  Definitely worth the stop!  Food was delicious.  I had the sauerbraten and it was so tender and flavorful.  My boyfriend had the autobahn and loved every bite.  We were absolutely stuffed - so got the cream puff and German chocolate cake to go.  They were so yummy!  Need to find an excuse to drive through Columbus again so we can go back!

text: Love this place. Great atmosphere. The food is amazing, like the sausage. The cream puffs are to die for. I am usually no a fan of cream puffs but these are amazing. The service is also good. This place is packed every time I go but worth the wait!

text:
Pretty good German food, at least at the buffet options.

Did it blow me away? No, but it was pretty solid, although I personally would skip the more vinegary potato salad and stay with the mashed potatoes.

One of the wursts was in a peppery sauce with some pasta-- that struck me as a little more unique than most, and strangely I actually liked the pasta more than the wurst in that dish!

Packed place, long wait that went somewhat faster than expected, decent service.

Unfortunately it didn't stand out enough to keep me enthused, and the rather ordinary, very bready cream puff, even with a massive amount of cream on top, did not bring victory (err, a 4th star).

text: Potato salad and creme puffs are not to be missed! The rest of the food is okay (I know I know everyone is mad im brushing off the neighborhood staple) but lets be honest if you're a columbus foodie valters is more your speed. Its a great traditional spot in the village, it is kid friendly and it has a fun atmosphere...again those creme puffs.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
This place is as German as it gets, so prepare your belts for bursting.

Schmidt's is a traditional German restaurant that has a long history in Columbus.  The decor and layout is very German, and even the waitresses are dressed the part, but the feeling is still distinctly casual.  Prices are dirt cheap, though I'm used to higher prices in other cities.  Service is superb.

I tried the Alpine Chicken Spatzel, which was delicious.  The potato cakes and hot kraut - which I tried as a side dish - were equally delicious.  The food is incredibly hearty and savory, which is the exact kind of German cuisine you'd expect at a place like this. I had a hard time finishing my plate due to the volume and weight of the food, but that's not exactly an issue - just speaks to how much you get.

I also tried the Peanut Butter Cream Puff, which was HUGE and absolutely ridiculously tasty.  It was, however, a bit crazily sweet, and definitely not something I could finish on my own.  I'd recommend sharing one between two people.

This place is going to be exactly as good as your love for German food.  If you're in the mood for a really carb-y, meat-y, sweet experience, this place delivers, and hard.  On the other hand, this is not a diet place, and diners looking for lighter fare may not be served well.

text:
If you're thinking German food, go to Schmidt's.

I must say, the options available for me at Schmidt's have decreased dramatically since becoming a vegetarian, but my memories of delicious wurst haven't disappeared. Bahama Mamas add the perfect amount of spice for a delicious sausage. But as that's in the past now, my favorite is the fried pretzel bits, which have a great light crunch to them. For dinner, I still count on their smashed potatoes and sauerkraut as a wonderful delight. You can pretty much find all their staple foods on their Autobahn buffet, so make sure to try that if you don' t know where to begin. Their German beer selection is great, and you can take growlers home as well. But the most important thing to remember is the almighty cream puff. Order the cream puff. Eat the cream puff. Hell, take home another one. Who knows when the next time you'll be able to enjoy its fried sweetness.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
The food is amazing! The atmosphere is pretty cool, especially when they have live music. The service is their only weak spot and I was not impressed with it in any way.

I've been to Schmidt's twice now. On the first visit I ordered cabbage rolls. They were delicious but rather pricey. There was a live German band and the atmosphere was warm and cozy. I tried a peanut butter cream puff because I was told that I can't to go Schmidt's without trying one. It was alright, but then again I don't really like sweets and there was just so much of it. The service was just okay.

On my second visit I opted to try the buffet after reading so much about it here. I was not disappointed. Almost everything on the buffet was great. I especially loved the potato salad and that really surprised me because I'd never eaten potato salad that I liked until then. I would definitely recommend the buffet simply because of the price. It will cost you approximately the same amount as a singular dish from the menu. The service was pretty bad this time. It seemed as if we were just an annoyance to our waiter. He even stopped coming around half way through our visit and was replaced by someone else. I thought maybe he had gone home for the day but I continued to see him throughout the restaurant. There was no band playing this time but the atmosphere once again was warm and cozy. 

I would like to note that the atmosphere feeling so welcoming to me could likely be due to both visits occurring in winter. Coming in from the blustery cold to enjoy greasy comfort food just feels right. I don't think I would enjoy this quite as much in warmer weather. I'll save my next visit for summertime to find out.

And for people at DSCC/DFAS for training- it's not too far from the base or the airport hotels.  I also got the cream puff which was a meal in itself.  I will be back here with bells on next trip out here in a month!

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
So, had an early morning meeting in Columbus this am and my SO was hell bent to try Schmidt's. As I had read through many reviews of Schmidt's here and elsewhere, I was hesitant to go there. But, as anyone with a long time spouse or SO, you pick your battles and this one wasn't worth it.

We arrived just prior to their opening so we decided to do the "Autobahn Buffet." I'm not a fan of buffets but, since they had just opened and were among the first seated, I considered it "safe" enough.

The good: tossed green salad - good and fresh with a nice selection of optional toppings.
Oh, and the service. Server was exceptional.

The bad: nearly everything else. My SO talked me into trying a cup of their chili - which, just by it's appearance was not appetizing to me. I was right. Tasted like tomato juice with beans and a scant hint of beef. On the salad bar was "regular" not German potato salad. Being a huge fan and also a self admitted potato salad snob, I gave it a try. It had no flavor except sweet. I hate American style potato salad that is sweet. I later discovered the German potato salad elsewhere in the buffet setup. Instead of having that nice balance of sweet and tart as it should, it was as sour as the warm sauerkraut on the buffet - which was also to be avoided.

The buffet offered three of Schmidt's "famous" sausages - Bahama Mama, Garlic and Bratwurst. Honestly, I didn't care for any of them. All were extremely fatty and I found nothing exciting about any of them. The green beans offering were cooked to death; a red cabbage and apples dish was OK, macaroni and cheese (I assume for children who aren't fans of a German buffet) was soupy, tasteless and not even a close second to boxed macaroni and cheese.

Probably the offering I disliked the most was "Sausage Stew" - a very odd blend of one of their "famous" sausages, long, curled Cavatapi style noodles and some very odd spices/seasonings. It was not edible.

Ordered a Schmidt's "Gold" lager to go with lunch. My glass of water was more enjoyable.

My SO wasn't leaving without taking some of Schmidt's (again - "famous") cream puffs home. As good as they looked, by this time I was so disappointed by the entire Schmidt's food experience that the thought of actually eating one nauseated me.

In conclusion, if you are a fan of mostly tasteless, heavy, gloppy food and want to absolutely stuff yourself - go for it. 

For me, next visit, I think I'll check out one of the lighter fare gastro pubs in the Brewery District.

The food is very tasty.  My favorite is the buffet which has mild sausage, hot sausage (Bahama momma), sausage stew, meat loaf Mac and cheese, kraut, and more.

Atmosphere is fun.

Best is dessert.  From cream puffs to banana cream pie.

text: They have some good recipes, but tradition and hype doesn't make a great restaurant. Their recipes have fallen over the years and they are still a great place to go, but it doesn't quite live up to the hype.  Just one more minor thing....they won't seat you until ALL of your party is there, so if you're meeting people there, and your one person or one couple shy, you'll stand outside until they all get there. I can understand that rule from the restaurant's perspective, but it's a little harsh occasionally. We had 7 people waiting on an 8th and they refused to seat us. What table seats 7 and not 8? If 7 was all we had, then we would be wasting a seat, but if we tell them an 8th is on the way then we can't sit at the same table we would be at anyway. Instead they gave it away and  we waited.  They may be busy, and they are popular, but the food does not justify such strict rules.

text:
Decided to stop by while in town after hearing about Schmidts sausages. Definitely was not disappointed.  We decided to take advantage of the buffet and dessert. 

The buffet included multiple sausages, salad bar, and multiple sides like macaroni and cheese as well as other German favorites. Also decided to get the 1/2 pound cream puff, which, simply put, was amazing.

Service was quite good as well, but make sure to get in early, before the lunch rush hits, because it becomes quite hard to find a place to sit as it gets very busy.

Overall, very good value and awesome food.
