text: OK so we went for  my best friends bithday dinner.  We are both of German ancestory so we ve had german food before but never really had any good places to go out to eat.  This place is tops. If you like sausage ull love it. We got the buffet cuz thats what we do and plus we wanted to try everything.  My favs were the brats, cabbage and beans.   I know really simple right.  Thats what good food is about keeping it simple.  Best meal ive had in a while.  Our server was great the music was so fun and the food and beer was great and it only cost me like 40 bucks for me and my girlfriend, thats not bad for an actual good place to eat. Id spend more than that on some crappy steak at Ocharleys or Outback  (im not a big fan of chains).  Any way to sum up u gotta get here at least once its always busy so ur gonna have to wait.  Oh and i almost forgot u gotta get a creme puff we had the peanut butter one.  It ruled!

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Schmidt's was a place I loved before I lived in Cbus and when I first moved here, but have enjoyed less since I've been here.

The positives:  The food is pretty tasty.  The cream puffs are the best dessert in town in my experience.  All of the flavors are delicious, although the peanut butter is my favorite.  The entrees are good too--try the Bahama Mama.  The beer is pretty decent (I'm not a huge German beer fan and, predictably, that's all they carry).  The Schmidt's Dark is made by Elevator and is my favorite.

The negatives:  The atmosphere wouldn't be bad on a less crowded night, but all too often it is PACKED when I go there, with long waits and too many people crowded into too small a waiting area.  Probably not a problem on a Tuesday evening, but I usually go there at out-of-towners' request, and they are typically in over the weekend.  I wish they'd find a way to expand their waiting area to accommodate throngs of tourists (like Thurman Cafe has).  Also, the items on the menu don't have much diversity.  The same ingredients are in most meals, so if someone in your group is not a big fan of those things, they might be in trouble.  The buffet is nice, but it's expensive enough that you have to really stuff yourself to sickness to get your money's worth.

All in all, not bad, but I'll never be a regular.  It's worth checking out at least once, especially if you can get there during the week.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
I was underwhelmed.  The restaurant is clean, and well decorated.  The service was good, the food was unimpressive.

We had the buffet, which consisted of applesauce, German potato salad, the Bahama Mama, bratwurst, sauerkraut, Green Beans Und Spatzel, fried chicken, a salad, and a mini cream puff.

The potato salad tasted strongly of onion and was under seasoned, the Green Beans and spatzel was mediocre with little flavor. The bahama mama was alright, the brat was average.  The fried chicken was alright as well, and the mini cream puff was great.

The food was alright, nothing terrible, I just expected it to be above average for an authentic German restaurant, and it wasn't anything special or worth returning to have again.

text: Never disappoints when I come here. It's been a couple of years since I have made it back here but it well worth the wait. We met some family members here and were told 30-35 minutes. Not bad for dinner hour. Seated right in the time frame. Our waitress was great and very friendly and helpful.  Chicken Spaetzle, Weiner Schnitzel, and cabbage rolls were among our dish orders. Delicious and I definitely like Schmidt's over the other newer German place(who I won't name). Make room for a cream puff or other decadent dessert or take it to go. Photo is of the chicken spaetzle

text:
Ate here with work friends. We walked about 25min from our hotel . It was well worth the walk!  (We ubered back to Hotel). The food and atmosphere arevvery German. We enjoyed some beers, sausage, snitzel, and cabbage as well as some pretzels and strudel! All the items were great, the bill, for the 3 of us, was less than $100 with beers and tip included.  
  As a side note,  I saw that they ship stuff around the country/continent.  It was a good thing because I left my favorite ball cap at our table and did not realize until the next day!  I called them and by the next week I had my hat!  I definitely recommend this place for the food, atmosphere, and service!!

text: A real tourist trap.  The buffet Is basically like eating from a 2 small stations at Golden Corral.  The sausage didn't strike me as all that great, either. Those celebrated cream puffs?  Stale.  Green beans?  Clearly from a can with bacon tossed in.  What gives?  Buffet, plus 22 oz paulaner, plus cream puff comes to  $29 before tip.  What a waste.

text:
If you know what you want, you could probably save a few bucks and get a platter because they are HUGE!  We didn't know so we got the buffet and they gave me my kids plate for free (he is like 1, so it wasn't THAT big of a gift, but it is a step that my restaurants don't bother with).

I thought is was pretty good.  The buffet was $15, and everything on it was either good or great.  The potato salad (German) was quite good and my kid liked the green beans the best.

Worth the wait?  Sure, what else is there to do in Columbus?

text: We brought family from out of town to do the traditional "you have to eat here and have a creme puff if you're in Columbus" thing. Saturday evening. 1 hour wait. But the food and service was wonderful. We ordered pretzel nuggets appetizer, Alpine Chicken Spatzel, Double hamburger, sausage platter, and buffet. Every choice was delicious. The chocolate silk pie was amazing, the traditional creme puff and the pistachio creme puff was delicious. Try not to bring your family and friends on a weekend night from 5pm on though. Extremely crowded, no room to move and only 2 bathroom stalls for women. The crowd makes it uncomfortable from beginning to end. The seating is too cramped.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Schmidt's is an ostensibly German restaurant.  Because It has been thriving in Central Ohio for so long, however, it shouldn't be surprising that the cuisine is tailored to a more midwestern palate.  The signature menu items are, after all, the creme puff and the bahama mama.  So leave your effete notions of refinement and "true German cuisine" for another day and belly up to Schmidt's buffet for an authentic Columbus experience.  

(This review has expanded somewhat from my original concept, which follows in its entirety:

"Sausage.  Buffet.")

text: There's is nothing great about this place, I don't know what it is about people in ohio and their reviews for food places buy it seems like they don't really know what good food is. We even broke some of our rules just to try this place because of all the ooohhhhhh, and ahhhhhsss, we heard about it. Definitely not worth  breaking our rules. It was terrible, very long wait but the service is great that's why I gave it 2 stars.

text: As always....this place never disappoints. Beat the crowds and go for lunch. The buffet is great because you can try everything. Plus it's pretty inexpensive compared to a lot of buffets. Potato salad and mac and cheese is excellent. Service was fabulous as well.

text: Got the sausage sampler and I wish they gave more than just half of each type of sausage. The reviews make it sound like it's a lot of food but really its just a lot of sauerkraut and bread, and not really much sausage at all. Despite the unsatisfactory portions, I have to say the sausages were pretty bomb, and they each had very different flavors. I did also get a chocolate cream puff, which was yummy, and the mini cream puffs, which were just okay. I assumed incorrectly that they were just mini versions of the popular jumbo vanilla puff.

text:
This is a very cool spot.  Great atmosphere, great beer, and great food.  A Columbus,Ohio institution.

A line out the yin-yang at 6:30pm on a Thursday night so . . . head's up.

I went with the popular Bahama Mama and it was very tasty.  Potato salad everybody raves about was very mediocre (according to my taste buds) but I found the applesauce to be outstanding.  

Went with a seasonal draught beer and I was ready to chicken dance. 

Took a cream puff the size of a toddler's head with me for the drive home.  It was a two-hander so it was difficult to drive and gnaw pieces from the gargantuan puff at the same time but I made it work. 

I'll go back.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text: I've heard many good things about this place in German Village. A friend of ours had told us it was close to the real authentic German food you could get in Ohio. I was excited to see a buffet although it didn't have Schnitzel which is my absolute favorite so I passed. I ordered the Schnitzel with mushrooms with Spaetzel on the side and sauerkraut. The sauerkraut was delicious and I couldn't resist but I snuck some apple sauce off the boyfriend's plate from the buffet and it was amazing!! I was shocked that my Schnitzel was so small but it was in fact stacked! Score!!!! It's a great intimate German environment and it is quite a sight. Wish we could have checked out the chocolates across the street but it was too late when we left.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
It is really difficult to evaluate Schmidt's on their merit because it is one of those iconic places that has been around for decades, upon decades, upon decades which leads up to some sort of hallowed, almost mythical following. Everyone rates them five stars because they are the place that has a food recipe dating back like 150 years. 

I am thankful that for everything I had heard about Schmidt's, I had not had the opportunity to try them for at least a decade after having lived in Columbus. I was a bit trepidatious at first because of all of the stories surrounding the place, but let me tell you, they live up to it. 

Okay, so the wait staff having to wear the lederhosen in 2018 is kind of cheesy. I get that. But, their food is so spot on if you've never experienced real German style cuisine. 

Coming from a second generation German family, I grew up with foods like Bratwurst, Kielbasa, potatoes, and an abundance of bread. There is no place... literally NO PLACE in Columbus that has an authentic German taste in their food. 

This restaurant lives up to all of the great reviews it receives, and there is no better place in the area to taste foods of the 19th century.

text: It stuck in a hard locstion  by car but if if walk or bike in Germantown ..not so bad.  It packs up not only 1 locals but also w tourists.  We went on a Tuesday at 8pm..still a 30 min wait.  Better to eat at bar.  I had the saurbraten and my son had the bratwurst sandwich...that was a big wurst!! Beers were good .. the apple strudel wasn't like my grandmother's but it was very good.  Worth the trip.  PROBST!!!!

text:
They do a nice job on their buffet but it cost more then I would like for the volume of options.  The food is good but heavy so I cannot go up more then twice  for a plate that is not packed.  

I enjoy the quality of the food and service but price is why I took a star.

text: Currently my favorite restaurant!  If you love German food, you must come here.  We waited 40 minutes on Friday night which I thought was a good sign. The seating is crowded. The food was mediocre. But   the service was excellent. I usually get the buffet so I can have a little of everything.  On the way out grab a cream puff the size of your head and some bahama mama sausage to take home.

text: I absolutely love this place and go here whenever we end up in Columbus for games.  I always get the sausage combo platter with 4 different sausages samplings, apple sauce, German potato salad, and sauerkraut.  It is awesome!  The beer selection is great and so are the desserts.  We had the German Chocolate Cake last time and it was great.  I also had the cream puff and also recommend it.  The restaurant itself is very clean and the staff is entertaining and knowledgeable regarding their menu.   There is ALWAYS a line so you know it is good, and well worth the wait.  Try this place, you will not be disappointed!

text: Came in for lunch and enjoyed everything. We started off with german draft beer and pretzel bites with the beer cheese. The pretzel bites were hot and fresh. I had the sausage sampler each type was really good. The sides were great too, the potato salad was very tasty.  Afterwards I shared the chocolate cream puff and it was nice with really rich chocolate cream. We will certainly return for another trip.

text:
I waited & gave Schmidt's a second chance before writing the review.  On the plus side, it was consistent.  It just isn't that good.  

To their credit, the cream puffs are AMAZING.  Seriously, if I didn't want to become morbidly obese, I'd eat one a day for the rest of my life.  If I return, it'll be only for dessert.

The dinner portion, I could absolutely live without.  If you've got a craving for potato pancakes, try Betty's in the Short North.  Mine were tiny, not well seasoned, and too crunchy.  I don't like my potato pancakes deep-fried thank you.  If you're hungry for authentic German sausage, I'm not sure where you should go in Columbus, but this is not the place.  I found both the Bahama Mama & bratwurst overcooked and not at all like what I enjoyed in Germany.

text: Authentic German cuisine in German Village, would recommend the $9.99 buffet at lunch time. You can have all kinds of sausages, salad, and sepcial soup. The food is so good. Also, pork shank is something that you cannot miss, but it is served only after 5pm in weekdays, and all day on weekends. The restaurant might get a little crowded before holidays, but if you get there earlier, it will not be a problem for you.

text: My husband had previously been before and begged me to stop on our way passing through Columbus. If you are up for a late lunch, go between 1:30-3:30. They were not even half full. The restaurant has lots of charm and character reminiscent of a biergarten. We waited at the hostess table for probably 10-15 minutes though before anyone paid attention to us. We had several servers and hosts walk right by us. The buffet is the best deal. It's $10 for a very good sampling of what they offer.  Everything was delicious except the Mac and cheese and sausage stew. Mac and cheese was very bland. The sausage stew was very cold. Everything else was absolutely delicious. My one major concern was that it seemed like no one was in charge. Our waitress seem less than thrilled to be there and rarely checked on us. This seemed to be similar with the other servers as well. Maybe it was a tough day. Most of the staff seemed inattentive. One young man was setting tables in the back while five or six other employees sat in the governors room listening to music and gossiping. Just a little odd.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text: I am a born-Columbusian who now resides in the noveau riche neighborhood of Chicago called Golden Boy's Coast Park (a secret neighborhood that was gentrified by the bisexutives - bisexual exectuves) recently).  Now, on my vacation back to Columbus from the Big Apple (local's nickname for Chicago) i decided to try some local favorites that i missed when i grew up here, schmidt's was the first mentioned.  Their buffet offered a smorgasbourg (lol) of german offerings that was more than satisfying for the price and honored the local german heritage.  However, I cannot recommend this place if you have any tongue for Haute Cuisine.  Look, I am from Chicago. I am a *true* foodie that creates *quality* content and have tried the most *esoteric* foods known to man.  I've had escargot with truffle.  I've had truffle falafal. I've had brunch so many ways and with so much truffle you don't even know.  I am so underground on the food scene that I only eat foods found underground (like truffles).  There was no truffle in any of the dishes offered here so if you are a real foodie like me and enjoy quality presentation and diverse food options you may want to try a more underground spot like Dirt Bar in Short North.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
I went with two other people and we had the autobahn buffet.  The buffet costs 9.99 and the desserts are discounted once you purchase the buffet so I got a creme puff to go and my bill was under $15.00.  

The buffet has a small salad bar, a chili-like soup, and sausage/pasta stew that is spicy and yummy, knock wurst, bahama mama, and garlic sausage . There is Macnand cheese, rice, cabbage, green beans, pickled red cabbage, sauerkraut, and a variety of rolls, applesauce, and German potato salad.

I don't really like sausages, that characteristic "pop" really grosses me out but I tried them all and actually had seconds on the bahama mama.  There is a nice variety and the food was hot and tasty, I have nothing to complain about regarding the food.

Service was super slow, it took our waitress a long time to bring our drinks and even longer to process our payment.  We found it easy to park and our wait to sit was about 10 minutes during he typical weekday lunch hour.  The place was packed but by the time we finished eating around 2pm the restaurant was pretty  empty.  

I will definitely go back, this is a great place to take out-of-town visitors.

text: Schmidt's has been on my to do list since I arrived in Columbus two years ago. I finally got to experience the craze for myself yesterday. I indulged in the buffet Schmidt's offers. If you LOVE bratwurst and sauerkraut, this is definitely the place for you. But if your not a huge meat eater, the buffet does not offer much of a variety. The food was good, the famous cream puff was amazing. This is definitely a tourist attraction. Not somewhere I would eat on a regular basis.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus

text: Currently my favorite restaurant!  If you love German food, you must come here.  The cabbage rolls are the best I have ever eaten and the red cabbage is fantastic.  I usually get the buffet so I can have a little of everything.  On the way out grab a cream puff the size of your head and some bahama mama sausage to take home.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}

text:
You can't beat the buffet, and the beers are large, cold, tasty, and reasonably priced. Always great service. The main room can be a little too raucous with the live band but I usually ask for a seat in the back room closer to the buffet. 

The buffet is a little pricey at ~$15 for dinner, but definitely worth it for the variety.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text: Well back to Columbus for a second go round with this legendary German restaurant. The environment is so authentic and just awesome. From the staffs apparel to the decor in restaurant it's simply one of a kind. I tried the much touted Bahama Mama which is one of their spicy links on a split top bun. Also included are a few potato pancakes and some apple sauce. That spicy sausage was absolutely worth of being its own food group. I like the fact that they didn't put anything on it and let the sausage shine. The potato cakes were good although I put Izzy's in Cincinnati ahead on that. The applesauce was tremendous as well. Of course you can't finish a meal here without one their cream puffs. As big as the planet Jupiter and cream straight from heaven. A must for any tourist of Columbus and worth traveling many miles for. On a side note I missed seeing Alton Brown here by one day!! Grr!

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text: After one visit to Schmidt's I must say it is an absolute must visit restaurant in Columbus. The food was out of this world good. I ordered the sausage sampler with potato salad and red cabbage, and every part of the dish was phenomenal. All 4 types of sausage were perfectly flavored- my favorite being a tie between the knackwurst and the famous bahama mama, but the bratwurst and milder mama were very good as well. The sauerkraut was excellent with flavorful morsels of pork speckled in, the German potato salad was the best potato salad I've ever had by far, the red cabbage had the perfect balance of sweet and savory, and even the bread roll was fluffy but still nicely toasted on the outside. The food quality can't be beat, the staff was friendly, and the atmosphere is very cozy. Highly recommend!

text: I am not one for German food but everyone I've taken here has loved it. On the weekends there is a live bad which is super fun. The cream puffs are to die for! We stop in for to-go cream puffs more often than I'd like to admit...

text: Overrated. Seriously. Ordered the wiener schnitzel and it was so gross. The veal was tough and the breading peeled off in one big layer. My cousin got the jager schnitzel or whatever with pork cutlets and that seemed to  look a little better than my wiener schnitzel. Won't be back. Don't believe the hype.

text:
A little hard to find but definitely well worth it. My wife and I wanted to try it since been televised on the Travel Channel and it was our first visit to the German Village.
It had fun casual atmosphere, great service. One of the best brats and sausages we ever had, to top it of they had an excellent selection of beer...of course can't forget their giant cream puffs that my wife adored.

text: Small and old....but I like it, it screams history to me! Get the sausage buffet. Cream puffs are huge. The cream is good, but the actual pastry part of the cream puff is flat and tasteless.

text:
So cute!  I loved the look of this place. Definitely on the touristy side. We did the Autobahn buffet so we could try a little bit of everything. The Bahama Mama was a spicier sausage, but we also enjoyed the garlic and the bratwurst. We loved the mustard and the horseradish at the table.  

We did get two cream puffs to take home which look amazing! 

My only negative is that the food on the buffet was closer to cold than hot. We got there fairly early to avoid this and that was the most disappointing part.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text: I love Schmidt's and I love their Bahama Mamas but most of all I love their cream puffs. They playing cream puffs with just powdered sugar on top. You. Give me chocolate cream puffs do not get me strawberry cream puffs just give me the regular and wonderful vanilla cream puffs. I only gave four stars because the seating is so close together you have trouble moving about. My 93 year old elderly mother uses a cane and cannot walk a straight line no matter what period getting to a table or a booth is challenging otherwise everything is wonderful. Oh one more thing - - I like my German potato salad much better. I make warm potato salad with bacon and I wish Schmidt's would the same thing. However if they made my kind of potato salad my potato salad wouldn't be better it would just be an equal level. Haha. I never get anything else other than a mild Bahama Mama and occasionally I will do the buffet. But the main reason for going there is the cream puff. Thank you.

text:
Wow! $10.00 for a buffet with 4 kinds of amazingly tasty sausage, several authentic German side dishes, soup and salad. 
We went on a Monday about noon. No line. Maybe later in the week it's busier. 
The creme puffs are also some of the best I've ever had. 

I've had similar fare in Germany. Schmidt's is as good or better than the same dishes served there. 

Great job Schmidt's!

text: I love coming here! I lived in Germany for 12 years and this place is a great taste of "home"!

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}

text:
I can't not be a fan of an all you can eat german sausage buffet. And those cream puffs? out of this world.

This place is a victim of it's own success, because it's always busy. Always.

Expect a wait that goes up exponentially with larger groups. But make it a point to come here at least once in a while!

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text: We went to Schmidt's on a Sunday afternoon.  Clearly a very busy spot, we were able to waitlist on Yelp when we were five miles out and  bypassed  a long line at the door.  I had "The Original" Bahama Mama, their famous beef and pork hickory-smoked sausage..  Wonderfully spicy with a nice snap to the bite.  Three sides came with the platter.  I chose the German potato salad, braised red cabbage and applesauce, all delicious. I tasted my daughter's potato pancakes, crisp and very flavorful.  An cold Oktobefest beer added to our terrific foray into the world of Schmidt's. We could not resist dessert.  While the pies looked divine, we decided to share one of their jumbo chocolate cream puffs. They say it's a half pound, but so cloud-like.  Our server David was on point, Lederhosen and all.  Do make your way over to the German Village and enjoy.  'Prost'

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Schmidt's is legendary.  German food, German music, German traditional clothes and LOTS of ambiance in the heart of German Village.I have visited this restaurant on and off since the late 80s. It has been great every time I have eaten there. They have their autobahn buffet. Almost everything on the buffet is incredible. Unfortunately it highly encourages you to overeat to a terrible degree.  They have their best signature sausages on the buffet. You can eat the Bahama mama mild or hot, garlic knockwurst, and bratwurst.  Mild Bahama mamas are my favorite. If you stuff yourself horribly, you could eat 5 lbs of Bahama mamas from the buffet at one sitting.  While this would certainly be a very good deal, it is not recommended. This is great food...in moderation!  It may be hard to stop yourself...you've been warned.

There are so many other incredible options. There is an adequate salad bar. There is at least one type of soup. There is meatloaf, mac & cheese in the German potato salad and many other things that I can't remember off the top my head. The price for the buffet is very good. It is not that much more than getting a regular meal.

Recently, i have been eating their every week or two since i have appointments downtown.  Had the buffet once...incredible.  Had the cabbage roll dinner once.  Excellent.  K had the reuben.  For the record, i have to be jn the mood for reuben.  She gave me a bite...wow.  Best reuben ever.  I WILL be getting the reuben myself.  She agreed that it was the one of, if not THE ABSOLUTE best, most flavor balanced and quality reuben she has ever had.  If you love reubens, or even like them occasionally...try it. Oh, and they have a fudge haus across the street.  Its very good too.  You'll be too stuffed to want sweets.

Godspeed, Scmidts.  May you never leave this town.  It would be a travesty.

text: Quite busy, hot and crowded. I got a chance to sit at the bar, which eliminated the 40 minute wait time. I spent the rest of the evening watching these HUGE beer pours going out to the tables. Super friendly staff, the food was tasty and well seasoned. The cream puffs are as described - big, light, delicious!

text:
I went here with my parents-- we had a lot of leftovers, but I couldn't even finish them.  I LOVE leftovers-- it's a really bad sign when I don't eat them.  I've had authentic German food, and I don't understand how this is it.  Admittedly, I didn't order the sausage (my downfall, perhaps?), but the traditional German dish I did get was a greasy soupy mess.  
The wait was 2 hours--not worth it.  I would be willing to go again to try some sausage, though, since the servers were friendly and I enjoyed the atmosphere.

text: I had one of my worst restaurant experiences here. We waited two hours just to get a table on a Thursday night.  Then it took another hour from the time we ordered to get our food. I finally went to the manager and said, "We are from out of town, and we are exhausted and hungry . . . . What can you do to get our food to us?"  The food was okay, but nothing memorable. They gave us free desserts to compensate for the poor service, but it was not enough to make me want to go back there.  Perhaps they take reservations; if so, I would not go there without one.  By the way, they have a Fudge and Candy shop next door, and I found the merchandise overpriced. The fudge I bought there tasted terrible and my sister agreed.

text: I like Schmidt's a lot, however it is more of a German-American style eatery vs. Hofbrauhaus which is a German eatery.  Their food is great and I get it at work as well.  I usually stick with Bratwurst and Saurkraut here.

text: I didn't know what to expect from this restaurant.....but It was surprisingly really good.  For starters I had the chicken Und noodle soup (it was spectacular nice bold taste with fresh noodles) after My husband and I shared the old world sausage sampler (four sausage combo, German potatoes, kraut, applesauce and a bun). It was perfect to split in half because both of us wouldn't of been able to finish one whole order. We still had a little room to share a vanilla cream puff. (Again it was humongous so we took half of it home).  Then we walked out and noticed a fudge store part of the restaurant so we walked in and walked out with three pounds of chocolate and a fat belly. It's a must if your around the Columbus area. Ideal trip for us after we visited the Columbus zoo. Overall all both placed were really good and the staff was very friendly. We will be back soon.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus

text:
The bratwurst really is the best I've had this side of the Atlantic, although I felt as though the Bahama Mamas were a bit overhyped. The real plus to all their food is it's homemade quality - especially the sides. Try the mashed potatoes, the German potato salad, or the chunky applesauce (add a dash of horseradish!) as perfect complements to whatever wurst you like best!

I refrained from giving it five stars because I don't think the food justifies a 90+ minute wait, which is how long it took for them to seat our party of two. Avoid going on the weekends if you can. The service was courteous but often felt a little inattentive, although it was really busy. Also the live music might overpower your conversation if you're seated too close to the accordion player!

I recommend the lunch buffet to try an assortment of sausages, rice, soup, and boiled cabbage (which I didn't even know I liked until I visited!)

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
I'm Hungry Just Typing About Schmidts: My clothes won't let me eat at Schmidt's all the time, but the lure of all the delicious brats, Bahama Mamas, knock wurst, kraut, etc makes it a struggle not to. To top it all off the creme puffs are simply sinful. They can be had for an extra $1.50 with the buffet, and they usually need to be boxed, as the buffet leaves little room for such giant decadent deserts. They make a great midnight snack.

Is Schmidt's gourmet German food, nope.  Does Schmidt's use the finest of ingredients, likely not.  Is it the best restaurant in the German Village, you can do better.  So why Schmidt's--its good German/American comfort food.  Like many Italian restaurants, Mexican restaurants, or Chinese restaurants, it's not exactly the best of what you'd find in the old country (I've eaten similar in Deutschland).  That's not the point.

text:

 So, take your lederhosen out of your ass crack and have a great time.
 P.S. try the peanut butter fudge cream puff. OMG!

text:
Darn good sausage

  Schmidt's has a food truck and it was in my area today so I checked it out.  The staff manning it was very helpful and explained the menu items to me.  I decided on the Bahama Mama with grilled onions since they said it is the "favorite."  I also grabbed a cream puff since I'm a sucker for sweets.  The bahama mama had lots of flavor and a slight kick of heat to add another dimension.  The cream puff hit that sweet tooth spot as well.  Great texture and the pastry was not too hard or too soft.  Will definitely try again

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Not a really respectful manager! Be careful when you order buffet at this place. No matter how many you order, they will charge you based on the number of people sitting at your table. I went there with two other friends. We ordered 2 buffet and a beer pitcher. One friend tried small piece of my food to see if she likes and she did not like the food and decided to have a drink only! She did not go to the buffet at all. And The waitress did not tell us they are going to charge 3 buffets for no reason!! When we called the manager he was not really friendly and told us :" I was watching you all the time and your friend was eating from your dish all the time". Which is Disgusting statement. i felt very uncomfortable at this place. I have been to many places all over the states and Had never seen such behavior with a customer.
Will never go back.
I told him you just earned $15 more tonight but i could come back many times and bring many friends with me but i won't ever show up here and the only thing being damaged here is your business' reputation.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
I've been going to Schmidt's for years and love the lunch buffet.  It's also great if you have kids.

While stuffing your face with a buffet full of sausage (I love the spicy cups of sausage chili) might seem unhealthy, the place is usually so packed with people in their 80's and 90's that it must be ok.  After all, they've probably been eating it my whole life and they're still around.

The desserts are so wonderful that I end up thinking about it for my whole meal, but usually end up with German Chocolate cake or the Chocolate Cream Pie which I think is a little lighter and less rich.

Can't wait to get back, and I love that they have a food truck so I can bump into the deliciousness at random spots around town.

text: Late review been several weeks... but overall the food here is awesome!! Huge variety and great taste.. this is a must visit if you like German food!! Highly recommend any of the sausages. If you walk away hungry well actually that impossible more like roll away fat and happy!!

text: If you're looking for good, stick to your ribs German food.  Look no further.  Can't go wrong with a brat or a Bahama Mama. And well if you leave without a cr√®me puff, you're missing out.  Their chocolate cr√®me puffs can't be beat.  Definitely not some place to go every week unless you work out like a mad fiend, but if you're in for a celebration.  Come on down.

text: Entertaining relatives from Germany & they said it was pretty authentic, especially the schnitzel.  Been there many times myself & it's always good.  We got the buffet so they could sample everything.  Ate way too much, so we had to take our cream puffs home.  Had them for breakfast the next day.  What an awesome breakfast.  I had never had the 'buckeye' cream puff (peanut butter cream, chocolate icing) but it will not be my last.  Delicious!

text: Don't come here on the weekend. If you for some reason really like German cuisine, then this place is pretty good. It's somewhat authentic. The atmosphere is cool the staff is great. They don't add their own touch on the cuisine though they just do a good job replicating it.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text: We came here on Saturday night. Most certainly popular as we had to wait about 45 minutes to get in and that was around 8:00 PM. They take your name and then call each party over speakers set up inside, outside, and in the gift shop across the street. We were seated in the main room and got to watch the two-man band consisting of an accordion and tuba. The buffet is okay, but there was no way we could eat what we would have paid. I got the four sausage selection that came with potato salad, sauerkraut, a bun, and apple sauce. Too much food so I had enough for lunch the next day. A small, but great beer selection. The location is great too. Right in the middle of a residential neighborhood. The desserts looked so good, but again too much food and beer to already enjoy.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}

text:
Maybe I'm not the best judge of this place because I'm not a huge sausage fan so I'll just have to consider everything else in my review.  

We started with the sauerkraut balls which were delicious. Proof that anything is good when you deep fry it.  Since I don't like sausage I had the turkey Reuben which was actually pretty good. Not your typical sandwich with sauerkraut and rye. Maybe I am a sauerkraut fan and I didn't even know it.  The chocolate cream pie was great but I thought the cream puffs were overrated. 

Service was average as I had an empty water glass most times but she was friendly and offered good suggestions.  Atmosphere was average but you can't really expect much out of a "sausage haus". Glad I tried it once but probably not on my list to go back.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}

text:
It was fun!The Bahama Mamas were yummy as were the schnitzels. Sides were also good (red cabbage, kraut, green beans and spatzle, the potato pancakes were unusual but good.

Our waiter, however, was crap. He started off nice enough, but then disappeared. He'd walk by and look right at us and look away, we were obviously done with dinner and wanted to move on to the cream puff. (he got stiffed on the tip) 

The band was great, they sang happy birthday to my 6 year old and she LOVED IT!!! 

Totally touristy, but that's what we were there for. Worth a try and decent prices.

text: Visited here when I was on vacation with my family. They have a buffet for lunch which is reasonably priced. You can try all the different sausages. The place was packed when we went for lunch. And all the waiters and waitresses were in costume. I would also recommend trying their dessert. The original cream puff is light yet still filling.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}

text: We enjoyed our dinner at Schmidt's very much. We used the Yelp check-in feature, but there was still a 25 minute wait. We both ordered schnitzel...I had the Hoffbrau and my friend had Weiner; both were delicious.  The chicken noodle soup was delicious.  The hot kraut with pork was very tart and was complimented nicely by the German potato salad.  We skipped dessert as our meals were very filling.  It was a very delightful experience.

text: The place is cozy and the food was delicious. We had the Buffett and I recommend it if it's your first visit. And don't forget the cream puff!

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Finally made it to Schmidt's after all these years. Of course I had high expectations in terms of their famous Bahama Mama's, and it did not fall short! Everything was delicious!

We went on a warm and sunny Saturday afternoon. First picked up some dessert at Pistacia Vera, yay for dessert before dinner. German Village is definitely lovely on a nice spring day with all the flowers blooming and interesting plants along the side walks. The buildings look more lively as well with all the spring colors. My boyfriend was complaining about walking from Pistacia Vera to Schmidt's, which is only like a short 5 minute walk if you need that information, such a baby :(

On to the Food! I had the Bahama Mama platter and it was so worth it! I especially like the potato salad. I never liked mushy potatoes but their German potato salad was chunky and has a great acidity to it, oh and some bacon bits too. Bf ate the apple sauce and he liked it. The sausage has a great spicy kick! It's kind of garlicky and spicy but definitely not greasy. The sauerkraut was fantastic too! They mixed it with just a little bit of pork and that balanced the sourness. It reminded me of my grandmother's homemade sauerkraut stew with pork belly. And yes she's Chinese and yes I don't know why people from of two cultures eat the same thing.

Last but not least the notorious cream puff! ehhh this is a hard one because anyone who's been to Asia knows we make western desserts tastier and prettier. I've had better cream puffs sorry Schmidt's :p But I ate half of it when I got home with some strawberries and it was also delightful. 

Bf ducked and had a chicken salad. Not recommended :(

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
It's hard for me to believe that I've been eating Schmidt's for years but only recently made it to the Sausage Haus. Seriously? What took me so long?!

We went with a rather large group for my mom's birthday and I was pleasantly surprised with how fast we were seated and how efficiently our waitstaff handled our group. Almost everyone got the buffet because it was the best way to try the most food at one time. My mom, however, opted for a plate meal but it still came out in almost the same amount of time it took us to get through the buffet. Very pleased. 

Everyone ordered cream puffs for desserts because you kind of have to and they were served very quickly as well. The highlight of the evening was making my mom hold up a silly cutout while we sang Happy Birthday to her and made her get her photo taken. hehe.

I may not want to do the whole sit down meal with Schmidt's often because it is a several hour long affair, but I really did enjoy the evening we spent with them.

text:
Gotta love the buffet...all you can eat sausages...what can go wrong right? and the bahama mamas...hmm....i can eat those things everday.. eat it with mustards..eat it with ketchups..eat it with the cabbages...or eat it on its own...it's all good!!!
the one thing that didn't bowl me over is the cream puffs...am i the only person in columbus who is not crazy about their cream puffs??? is it my taste buds?? i know it's huge and well....usually.any sweat cream and dough is a good combo.. but the cold "puff" just didn't do get me...maybe a freshly baked "puff" when it's still nice and warm with the right amount of crispiness to it......maybe....but as for the last puff i had....nahhh..i think i'll stick to the sausages.....more bahama mamacitas pleaseeee...

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
I am totally happy to make a side-trip to Schmidt's after a meeting in downtown Columbus for their awesome turkey reuben sandwich. Let me paint the picture, please; this glorious sandwich is made on perfectly-toasted pumpernickel, and is filled with turkey, swiss cheese and the best (really) sauerkraut ever made! While some prefer thousand island as their condiment of choice, to me the only way to show full appreciation for this sandwich is with spicy mustard.

This marvel, along with potato pancakes (small, crispy, delicious) and chunky applesauce, is one of my all-time favorite meals (I'm simple, people!). I am serious when I say that I have tried a lot of potato pancakes and these are the best. Unfortunately I witnessed someone dipping his in ketchup, which should be illegal - I am certain to have nightmares. 

You can't write a review on this restaurant without mentioning the desserts. We did bring home a world-famous cream puff and slice of devi'ls food cake.  They almost made it to Cincinnati, but we decided to stop at the Washington Court House exit for a bottle of water and two forks.....writing it makes it seems so sad and pathetic, but it was a happy occasion.  They were both really good!

P.S. I am headed to the gym!

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Disclaimer: I have a lot to say about Schmidt's.

I've been here a handful of times and every time has been delicious. Mind you, there will ALWAYS be a wait for dinner, and they do not take reservations. But really, the 1-2 hour waits do not bother me.. if the weather is nice you can walk around the cute neighborhood or spend time in the fudge shop across the street. Parking can be difficult if you aren't lucky enough to get a spot in the small lot by the restaurant, but usually you can find street spots a block or so away.

On to the food. I usually get the bahama burger special, the old world sausage platter combination, or the buffet. I've found the buffet is wayyy too much for me, and just sticking to the menu item dishes is plenty of food. The bahama burger special is good because the bahama mama is my favorite sausage, and the pretzel bun is delish. All of the sides I've had are good - green beans and spatzel, potato pancakes and applesauce, potato salad, and redskin potatoes. I would say the world sampler is my favorite, you can even split it with someone if you are not feeling incredibly hungry. You get to try four of the sausage types and you get two sides. It's the perfect amount of food and flavor.

I took my parents here once, and my dad loved the kraut. Maybe every other thing on the menu is americanized german food, but apparently the kraut is legit. He loved loved loved it. I, myself, hate the taste of kraut. But my father is polish and my mother is german.... my dad grew up eating authentic polish food from a polish mother and he kept raving and raving about how it actually tasted like real kraut - he even used the phrase "just like my mom used to make". And then proceeded to explain to me HOW to make it... but that's neither here nor there. 

The only two things that are not out of this world: the beer and the cream puffs. Everyone keeps going on and on about the huge cream puffs. Yes, they are huge. But I just am not a fan! I guess it's just a little too bland for me. I could eat a tub of cool whip and probably feel the same satisfaction... as for the beers, when my parents and I went my dad and I both got the beer flight. Unfortunately, he was not impressed! I did like a few, but he didn't like ANY. They simply were not strong enough for him and he felt every single one was super bland. It was almost a waste since he didn't want to drink any, but he knows better than to leave beer on the table. So I guess if you are a real beer lover with a strong taste and tolerance, steer clear. If you're like me and am not a fan of IPAs and am used to bud light? Then you might enjoy them.

On some nights they have live music, which is entertaining enough. I thought they were really cute, since just like the staff, they dress up. They try to play old school german songs (I had no idea what they were, but my mom did). It got a little too loud for me though, and I kind of wished the place were bigger with an actual stage for those guys to go on, since they were practically screaming in our ears. From then on conversation ceased and we just listened and smiled until we got the check. 

Overall: entertainment gets an A for effort and food gets an A+++ which more than makes up for the weak beer and crowdedness.

text: Schmidt's is a favorite in my family.  Excellent buffet with a wide selection of their most known selections including green beans, 2 types of kraut, the hot German Potato Salad, Bahama Mammas & other sausages, and more.  Of course no trip is complete without grabbing a Giant Cream Puff!

text:
Is this a total tourist trap? Yes.
Could you stumble upon it without immediately knowing that? No.
Is it still decently tasty? Yes.

I was also shocked that multiple reviewers mentioned how pricey they thought it was. My party of two included two of the Autobahn buffets plus two glasses of wine and a beer for $45. In my book, that's pretty standard/reasonable for city fare (touristy or not). I don't normally eat pork, so I'm hardly a sausage connoisseur, but I left full & satisfied.

Standouts were the meatloaf, the sausages, and the red cabbage.  Creampuffs are wonderful. The best I can say is it's OK for the type of restaurant it is.

attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
I almost followed other yelpers' advice and skipped the buffet... which would have been foolish!  While it's not a massive, table-creaking buffet, they pack a heck of a lot of good food into that small space.

We arrived at 10:50am Sunday, and there was already a line at the still-locked door.  By 11:15am, every table in this large restaurant was full.  Half the customers appeared to be doing the buffet, and the other half ordered from the menu.  We perused the buffet before being seated, and it hit all of our needs.

Four types of sausage (all delicious, especially when smeared with the horseradish and/or mustard provided at the table), meatloaf and baked breaded chicken were the meats.  Two types of warm cabbage, rice, green beans, German potato salad, mashed potatoes with gravy, and macaroni and cheese were the sides.  Full salad bar, complete with chunky applesauce and cold pickled cabbage salad.  Oh, there was chili and rolls too.  For $14 per person, all you can eat.

Waitstaff was dressed in traditional looking clothes you'd expect at an Oktoberfest celebration - our waiter Thomas was helpful and friendly (with just a hint of 'tude, which I loved).

Of course I got the creampuff!!  They were out of Chocolate Peanut Butter (noooo!), so I went straight chocolate.  While it IS as big as your head, I still managed to stuff it all in (I'd be lying if I said the chocolate filling was light, but it was super delicious).

Glad we did it!

text: I went to this place for the first time while we we were in the area for the AMAZING yard sale extravaganza they have. My wife and I both tried the Audobon (buffet) so that we could try a little bit of everything and I had a great time. My wife didn't have as much fun as I did since she is boring with her sausages but I loved the variations. I tried every single thing on the bar and then finished it off with a cream puff. This is where it got amazing. If you are just looking for a place for dessert, I would recommend this stop. I would like to see a little more variety on the Audobon but overall the experience was a ton of fun.

text:
The service, the music, the beer, the food - all top notch. Get the cream puffs. 

Got the autobahn buffet, tons of sausage, meatloaf, sides. Sauerkraut, gravy, potato salad, it's all so good. There's a reason this place has been around for so long. If you're in the area, it's worth the visit.

text: Love this place! The buffet is awesome, and then they have those massive cream puffs! Everything is delicious from the green beans to the meatloaf to the bahama mamas. Anything wurst is the best at Schmidt's! We celebrate birthdays and any other day that ends in 'y' at this place!

text:
A great place for hearty and heavy German food!

I went for their all-you-can-eat buffet, which was great.  They had different sausages and meats along with plenty of side dishes and a salad bar.  If you're a big fan of sausage, the buffet is really the best way to do it - for one price (around $14, I think?) you can get a sampling of good, quality food - it's well-worth if you're having sausage since it's just a couple bucks more from the dinner plate.

The d√©cor and setting is very friendly and welcoming - almost as if you're inside an authentic German pub or restaurant in the Alps.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}

text: This is by far the best German food experience I have had outside of Germany. I can't go to Columbus without eating at Schmidt's. Give me a one liter beer and one of their signature sausage platters and I am a happy man. Of course I'll have to have a cream puff, but I'll take it to go because I really want to savor it later. I still haven't happened to be here on a night when they have live music, but that just gives me another reason to visit Columbus and eat at Schmidt's.

text: If you were to pick one place to meet up with a friend who is just in Columbus for a day, then Schmidt's is the place. The anchor of German village, this place is fantastic,  I highly recommend the lunch buffet. Sausage lovers paradise!!  Dont miss the classic German potato salad. At the end, even the you may have stuffed yourself, the cream puff is a must, it's so large, you probably will have to share.

text: So good, so large are the portions for such an incredibly affordable price. The place is hopping! We were seated immediately and the turn over was fantastic! We tried both schnitzels  and the sausage platter. We brought more than 1/2 home with us... we also brought a cream puff home for dessert! OMG cream puff was divine!  The place is the oldest family run business in German Village. It is truly authentic and fun! A bit loud, very  busy... but very good!  Would recommend a lot of tourists, but, hey living in the bay area...that's relative! great to see a family run business thrive for such an extended time.

text:
Mainstay of Columbus.
do you think some things on a taco bell menu are too spicey?
do you settle for burgers sub-par the quality of 5-guys?
the cream-puffs rival anything in the city. anything. the namesake sausages are the way to go, also.
if you're trying to impress someone used to the finer things... it's probably not the way to go, but, say, if pitching a premise to a high-brow board... a tray of cream puffs can rival ANY catering from the city. A-N-Y.

text: My first time eating at an authentic German restaurant and most who know me, know I stick to the basics.  Sandwich, fries, strips or pizza.  Friends are trying to broaden my horizons, so we went for it.  Wow!  I had the Milder Bahama Mama and it was delicious!  The bun was toasted and had a great taste to it also.  Add some kraut and mustard and......sausage heaven.

text:
Two words: autobahn buffet. If you go that route during the week at lunch, it costs $10 per person. When I tried to figure out the cost prior to going, I couldn't find it listed anywhere.. so there it is. Also, if you aren't trying to seat a party over 4, it's very quick to get in and out.

Also, it's delicious. Try the sausage stew.

text:
Schmidt's is well worth the visit. I'm not big into German food but I'm sure somebody who is would find it very appealing. I ordered the chicken sandwich, which was good, but definitely needed the bacon and cheese I added; I had mashed potatoes for a side and they were awesome. I found the cream puff to be just okay, but at $3.75 was worth trying. 

We arrived around 5:30 and were seated quickly but it definitely got packed as we were leaving around 6:45. There is super easy street parking all around the restaurant, which is a huge plus.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text: Finally got to Schmidt's after being gone 35 yrs.  Immediately was disappointed with the service - it took 10 mins. for our waitress to discover us and she made only a couple trips back to the table during dinner.  I was pining for wiener schnitzel and, although the gravy was delicious, the schnitzel was not cooked in the appropriate fat and was a little tough and not really served hot enough.  Had a side of hot sauerkraut with pork that was dryer than dry and tasted like it had been re-heated in the microwave.  Potato pancakes were served lukewarm.  On the other hand, hubby's Bahama Mama was delicious, as well as the vanilla creme puff.  Rather than having a really unique taste to the food, it had a "franchised" feel.

text:
Awesome food and a great atmosphere.  There is a reason this place has been here for over 100 years!

My only complaint is that the portion sizes on the menu-ordered sausage platters aren't very large.  Next time I go back I'll be ordering the buffet without hesitation.

text:
Visited Schmidt's on a game day. Go Bucks!  Love German Village. We arrived at 11a as they opened. Line out the door by 11:30a. Packed. With lots of game fans from our opposition - Penn State.  

Service was good. And they move tables quickly. We had a couple beers from local breweries. We always support local. And they were excellent. 

I had the original sausage platter. My wife had Wiener schnitzel. Both were good. I particularly liked the homemade apple sauce. But the highlight was the cream puffs. Keep room. They are worth it. I had vanilla. My wife had peanut butter. We'll be back.

text:
Never had German food until I went to this place. Never even knew what German food was good to eat until this place. I will always compare any other German place to Schmidt's. 

You cannot, however, make a reservation and they do not give you a wait time over the phone. So, if you go, go earlier in the day. Do not go for dinner, as you will be waiting about 30-45 minutes for a table. It can get pretty busy.

The menu may look small, but everything on it is fantastic. And I've never seen such friendly and welcoming staff in my life. Even the busboys and cleaners are happy to be working there!

And the dessert..... it's not fair of them to put it right up front as soon as you enter. It's delicious and clogs your arteries. The fudge house across the street is also quite awesome. So much chocolate in one place and they have many other candies as well!

text: We were in town for an event at Ohio Theatre and looking for an iconic amazing place to eat dinner before heading home and we found it at Schmidt's Sausage Haus!!! Kids & I had the Autobahn Buffet which was an amazing plethora of delicious food  The German potato salad was best I've ever had; green beans with bacon were super perfect, and red cabbage was fantastic, of course along with the sausage! We were too full to eat dessert, but took home their signature cream puffs (vanilla & cheesecake flavors!) and was delighted at the plentiful, light cream and layered pastry! What a find! We surely will be back again next time we are near Columbus!

text: Outstanding place to bring the entire family for great tasting German food at the right price! This is one of the most family friendly restaurants I have ever been to anywhere. We have taken our four children here from infancy on and always felt right at home. The staff is friendly and the sausages are amazing! This is also a great place to bring visiting out-of-towners.

text: I absolutely LOVED this place and would definitely go again next time I am in Columbus. I was able to park almost right in front of the front door. I went at lunch on a Monday about 1pm. There were plenty people inside, but it was not "packed" and very comfortable. I had a very nice and intelligent waitress who asked me if I have ever been there before and was very helpful with suggestions. I got the Autobahn buffet- all the sausage and German sides you could handle for a bargain price. All the sausage was incredible, including their Bahama Mama and Bratwurst. I loved the sauerkraut, German potato salad, and green beans too. After the huge meal, my waitress suggested some desserts, and I got the peanut butter creme puff with melted hot fudge on top and it was outstanding. It was a bargain. Great atmosphere, nice and friendly staff, and incredible food.

text:
Loved this place!  I was in Ohio for a conference and used yelp (of course) to find a good spot to eat.  I found this little German village with good reviews so I gave it a try! 

I walked in and loved the feel to the place right away.  It was busy, loud, and fun!  There was a charming little bar in the corner, ample seating, and a buffet area in the back.  

Although I came on a busy night, it didn't take too long to be seated.  I started with the pretzel nuggets and sauerkraut balls.  Both appetizers were absolutely delicious!  The pretzels had the perfect softness on the inside and saltiness on the outside.  I dipped them in their mustard sauce and just scarfed them down.  The sauerkraut balls were lightly crunchy on the outside and warm on the inside.  Great start to the meal.  My waitress recommended the Mama Reuben and I'm so glad she did.  This sandwich has the Bahama mama in a Reuben sandwich. All the flavors in the sandwich went together so well.  I had a side of potatoes, and those were also very tasty and different from your typical potatoes from other places.  This meal could not have been any better... Oh wait, it could have been (and it was)...With dessert! I ended my meal with a cream puff. Yum. Light, flavorful, and perfect. I'd eat here again in a heartbeat!

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Reverse Progressive Review!

I was saving all my oohs and ahhs for dessert. I'm currently going through a period of coconut-pie obsession, so when I saw Schmidt's had it, I was a little freaky-elated to chomp down a few bites. 

Sad face. It tasted like sugar with a consistency of pudding/elmers glue. A few flakes of coconut (nothingness) roamed the Crustland. The coconut flavor was nowhere to be found, possibly out for the evening getting drunk at a karaoke bar. Not sure... I was eating a sad sugar pie, and it wasn't even that good at all. 

Note to readers!: A few days after this German-eating escapade, I learned from a lady at another homemade-pie-bakery establishment that Schmidt's uses homemade pudding in their CCPs (coconut cream pies). They make up the pudding on the stove and dump in the coconut shreds while the pudding's still hot. What's wrong with that? The heat essentially draws out the coconut flavor, and your left with, um, not much. You get the gist. 

The meat was good. Well, the plain brat, that is. Coupled that with a scoop of their homemade chunky applesauce (this had a good apple taste, hints of tart confirmed it's made from scratch), and With those two items, my stomach was satisfied. Was I mentally pleased with my dinner decisions? No. The third star is for the ambiance and classic German recreating (i.e., clothes, music, decor). If we had half stars, 2.5 would work just fine.
