text: If you're from Columbus, you know Schmidt's. It's located in German Village in Columbus, Ohio and has an incredible history that dates back to the Great Depression and the Ohio State Fair almost 100 years ago. Besides the rich history, Schmidt's has some of the greatest food I have ever had in my life. My favorite go-to is the Bahama Mama, which is a spicy bratwurst on a toasted bun. I also like to top it with tangy, German mustard. On the side, I like to either get the red mashed potatoes or potato pancakes. I think the value is good for the price (maybe $8-$10 for a full meal including a side dish), and there's nothing like eating in the restaurant and getting a tiny taste of Germany. The ONLY thing I don't like is that Schmidt's is always crowded and a little bit loud, but that's to be expected for one of the top-rated restaurants in the 614.

text: This is a Columbus institution.  If you want German food this is the place to go.  There is usually a wait but we went for lunch and God seated right away.  The waitress was great.  We had the Bahama Mamma's and the milder version.  Both were great and served in yummy toasted buns.  The food deliverer mixed up the mild from the spicy Bahama Mammas.  Luckily it was just my parents so switching around food was no biggie, my dad still eats off my plate anyway! The three of us shared a cream puff, which you have to have!  They are huge and delicious.  I could just eat a bowl of the cream filling.

text:
Mostly we had the buffet which was quite good. Different people had different favorites but mostly everything was solid. 

The only food off the menu was the turkey Reuben which was unique and terrific. 

Potato pancakes were well above average and sauerkraut with pork was okay but not amazing (I think a personal preference). 

We shared a vanilla cream puff which was very good and enough for 5 to all have a few good bites.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
On our trip to German Village we researched and determined that this was a place we had to visit. Boy were the people right. If you ever wanted to visit an authentic German restaurant without going to Germany than this is the place to come. All sorts of German specialties here ranging from sausages, to saurkraut, to cream puffs they have it all. I'll describe my own meal below but one good thing they have is a small buffet if you'd like to sample things by sight rather than by reading the menu. Now then...

Old World Sausage Sampler 

What Is It: The meal comes with four distinctly different sausages, saurkraut, apple sauce, and German Potato Salad. 

Presentation: Very simple presentation with everything on one plate but nothing being crowded. It works.
7 out of 10

Taste: I figured for my first trip in here a sausage sampler was the way to go. The four sausages all had very different flavours yet were all equally delicious. I honestly can't pick one over another as they had such explosive flavour packed into them. No ketchup or dijon mustard required here. Im not into the type of sides they serve  (saurkraut and potato salad) but my wife who is into that sort of thing says you can't get it any better. As for the cream puff it's quite simply the most flavourful pastry I've ever had. It's huge and it tastes epic. What's not to love there? I  can't wait to travel back up here again and try something new and of course get a cream puff. Did I mention the cream puff?

Old World Sausage Sampler: 9.5 out of 10
Cream Puff: Eat it!!!!!!!! out of 10

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
I've been to Schmidt's Sausage Haus twice. Both times were "okay" experiences. Like another reviewer mentioned, I really wanted to love the place. The idea of an old school German restaurant in German Village got me excited to try Schmidt's out.

Unfortunately, reality did not quite meet up to expectations. Food was good, but not great. I think Schmidt has a few solid items, but the majority of the fare is pretty pedestrian. 

Their Autobahn Buffet is popular choice and you can't really beat the value. For $15 you get unlimited sausage, German potato salad, sauerkraut, red cabbage, along with a full salad bar, soup and other bonuses like macaroni & cheese. You also get a discount on dessert. 

I'm not a huge fan of buffets, I tend to overeat and just end up being miserable. I guess it's my own fault. The sausage is just okay. Maybe i'm used to American style sausage served on a bun with condiments. I was looking for a bit more flavor. I've also had their Weiner Schnitzel, which was also pretty average.  

On the other hand, their side German potato salad and red cabbage are delicious. They are probably my favorite thing about the buffet, which is strange, since I like my protein. I don't have much of a sweet tooth, but their cream puff dessert is pretty darn good. 

Overall I think dining at Schmidt's Sausage Haus is a Columbus experience and being over 120 years old is somewhat of a historical site. However, just don't expect amazing German fare. It's somewhat "Americanized" in my opinion. With that said, there are still good dishes and you should definitely try the cream puff.

text: I've taken many laps around the Autobahn.  Each time I find myself drooling like Homer Simpson.  Assuming one actually has room for dessert, the cream puffs are huge.  I've tried cooking the Bahama Mama's at home, and I can't do them justice.  There is a nice variety of original recipe sausages and German foods.

text: All you can eat meat buffet for 15.00! I am not usually a buffet person but would return here in a second. Very yummy, clean and fun. Great beer, and service. The buffet could use more sides like pretzels and potato pancakes but the Potato salad was very good. Don't miss out on dessert, German chocolate cake was a winner! I would skip cream puff next time, it tastes like pudding inside, so unless you have a pudding fetish they look better than they taste.

text:
Visited from out of state in June when I decided to take a day trip from Cleveland to Columbus to try this place out. 

Parking- there is a lot for Schmidt's across the street. Very convenient to find if street parking isn't preferred.
Price - very reasonable at the buffet with similar offerings from the menu. I originally wanted an entree off the menu however the waiter suggested I go for the buffet to get the most bang for my buck. Very glad I listened to him.  
Food- I tried everything but the salad at the buffet. It was okay, nothing too spectacular to rave about which is the removal of one star. I also ordered a cream filled pasty which was unbelievably huge and sweet.
Service- waiter was attentive and helpful in my decision making process. I figured he would have wanted me to order food that will cost me more but he graciously suggested the buffet instead at a cheaper price.
Atmosphere : I dined alone so I sat at the bar. I felt comfortable sitting at the table alone

Nothing amazing, but its pretty damn good still. Worth trying.

text: We had the buffet and dessert. Cream puff was good (but the pastry was a bit overdone/dried out)--cream filling was especially tasty. The buffet was okay...mostly sausage and sauerkraut.  Overall good, but not mind-blowingly good by any stretch of the imagination. I'd say more 3.5 stars, but I rounded up. text:
Yay.......came here around 6:30pm and waited for 40min to get a table for two. 

Worthest.........Excellent service, inside was homey, and food was delish.

Had the Sausage sample and 32oz Schmidt's lager and food came out hot and beer cold. 

Cream puff----yum yum yum yum yum. So they're enormous and almost intimidating to look at, but once you eat it, it's so light and fluffy you can easily eat it whole in one sitting. One of the best things in Columbus and I don't really like sweet.

I also like the neighborhood is fantastic and so well themed remind me of when I went to Stuggart.  Definitely made my trip here.

text:
No reservations and they won't seat you until your entire party is on-site. 

Buffet is $15 a person which includes soup, salad, various sausages, sausage stew, potato salad, red cabbage and other good stuff. 

If you aren't able to make two or more buffet trips you may want to save a few bucks by ordering directly off the menu. 

Cream puffs include the standard vanilla and chocolate but there are seasonal flavors such as cookies 'n cream and pumpkin.

Live music on weekends.

One thing (and only) that I don't like is the insanely long wait...I wish they could expand! But it is popular, and it's popular for good reason.

text: I really enjoyed this fun and inviting place. The food was really good and the service was friendly and efficient. I enjoyed a Ruben sandwich with delicious sauerkraut and a HUGE vanilla cream puff. There is limited parking in the lot but plenty of space on the narrow streets. We got here pretty early because I heard the place gets packed. There are also a few shops on the same street of you want a souvenir or some fudge.

text:
I've been here a few times, half a dozen or so, and have to say it's a pretty good place to be!
Now you need to be warned that the place is always jumping, so if you have a group, make a reservation, or show up early! Expect to wait a bit for a table. It's a small place, and doesn't have seating for 200, so you will be waiting if you show up during rush. However, the food is definitely worth it! 
The value is great, I hear the buffet is pretty good- though I've never been. And you can't leave without getting a cream-puff! Seriously, its like half a pound. Of cream-puff! And they're very well made. 
The food here is German fair, and well made, at least according to friends and family of mine that have actually been to Germany and had the real thing. Of course, even not having had the real thing over-seas I'd have to say it is some very good stuff. The servers are pretty attentive, very helpful if you have any questions, and a bit tourtisty as they're all dressed up in 'traditional' German clothing. 
I'd say try it out, you'll probably enjoy it!

Excellent food. We should have known when it was a 45 minute wait for a table for two. However it was very much worth the wait. Had the sausage which had great flavor. potato pancakes were delicious as well as the applesauce. 

We also ordered the pretzel bites with beer cheese. Fantastic !!! 

Make sure you come and plan a wait!

text: My wife and I just moved to German Village and decided to try this place out.  She ordered off the dinner menu, and I went with the buffet.  I had thought about ordering the sampler dinner platter, but everything on it is on the buffet along with several other items.  We did not repent going here -- the food was fabulous, and the atmosphere was awesome.  I tried all of the sausages on the buffet, and the normal ole brat was the best.  The potato salad was exceptional.  The mac-n-cheese was regular, but I'm guess it's there more for the kids than the adults anyway.  The sauerkraut was exceptionally sour, just as I like it.  I'd love to be a regular here, but I'm afraid I'd grow a few inches of belly if I were.  I will definitely bring the family when they come to visit, and my wife and I will make it a local favorite for when we feel like going out for something special but not fancy.

text: Great veal!  It came with a dark gravy too, on the side, and lemon to squeeze.  Don't listen to the fools who say not to get the buffet.  If you want some very good veal, order the veal.  If you want to try four different kinds of sausages, excellent lightly-breaded fried chicken, corned beef and cabbage, warm potato salad, the scarlet pickled cabbage, bean soup, salad, etc, etc-- Get the buffet for goodness sakes!

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Schmidt's stands as one of my all time favorite restaurants. (Full disclosure: I love German food). We arrived just before opening, at 11 AM on a Saturday and already there was a line in front of the place. No worries, as our party of 7 was easily accommodated.

Because it was Saturday, we had several options. First, the "Autobahn" buffet. If you love sausage, this is for you. Featuring multiple kinds of sausages from spicy to mild, at $15 the all you can eat buffet is a great bargain. It comes with salad and typical German sides such as red skinned mashed potatoes, potato salad (same potatoes but tart with vinegar and flavored with caraway), braised red cabbage, and more. Dessert is not included but provided at a discount, only costing $3.75 vs. the normal $5.25 plus. Most of my party ordered this and declared satisfaction.

The other option was the schweinhaxe, or roasted pork shank, normally served at dinner or all day Saturday and Sunday. One of my friends ordered this and offered to share with me. I'm glad she did. I love this classic German dish and it was the most tender and juicy that I have ever had. It had a good chew, with a delicate texture and a light smokiness that elevated it above the other versions I've had (including the one I made myself). Though virtually free of fat, there was plenty of juice. My only quibble would be that I wanted more crispy skin, but it was so good I only call it a quibble.

I actually ordered the classic Wiener schnitzel. Two medium sized slices of breaded milk-fed veal made for a delicious, savory meal. A cup of mushroom gravy and sliced lemons accompanied the dish. I didn't need the gravy but I loved it when I tried it...using the dinner roll to mop up every last drop. The German potato salad and braised red cabbage were full of flavor, which sometimes is lacking. 

Finally, dessert. We ordered a variety: a couple of Schmidt's famous vanilla cream puffs, one peanut butter and chocolate puff, apple strudel, and - get this - the traditional German coconut cream pie. Kidding on the last one, but we did order a slice of coconut cream pie.

I'm not a dessert eater; normally, I would have loved another schnitzel to end my meal! But the baseball-sized vanilla puff was so good I had seconds. The vanilla cream was cool as a cloud, the flavor sweet but not cloying. A term that came to mind was "clean." The pastry itself was flaky, with clear signs of plenty of butter that split the insides into sheets. The peanut butter chocolate was also good. The light color of the peanut butter cream indicated real peanut butter was used. It was rich, and good.

The streudel was also good, though some of my companions wished it were a bit sweeter. I was perfectly fine with it. The apples were not overwhelmed by sugar and they tasted fresh, almost crisp. Definitely not from a can.

I was very happy to have come to this classic Columbus institution, owned and operated by at least five or six generations of Schmidts. In fact, one of whom greeted us at the door as he opened up the place. The food was delicious. Perhaps the biggest endorsement came from my colleague who is a first generation German American, born, raised, and who lived in D√ºsseldorf. She is very picky about the food of her homeland and she proudly declared this an 8 out of 10. To be frank, she's so picky she'd probably give the best Michelin starred restaurant in Germany a 9. So, yeah. That good.

text: I have been to this place many times and find that each time I visited had a lot of people there. Yet, the staff has been great and always takes their time to talk to you.... the food is great and the buffet is a real bargain..... allowing you to sample all the good home cooking...... the deserts are also great !!!!...... the only problem I have is that I always find my way "waddling"  back to my hotel room...... ate too much because it is so good.......  can not wait to go back to Columbus and have a meal at this place again

The restaurant makes me feel like I am in Germany, and the food is tremendous, I ordered a Hoffman pork chop which tastes great! However, the meal is a bit small in terms of its serving size. categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Let me preface this by saying my Dad grew up with George Schmidt, and my very first job was as a busboy (girl) there in 1965 when I was 16 years old!  I've always loved their simple down home German food and the "old world" atmosphere they bring to their restaurant.  

Recently I attended a rehearsal dinner held upstairs in the party room of their restaurant in German Village.  It was lovely!  The facilities were very nice and welcoming and the bar area quaint with brick floors and a nice old bar.  The dining room was nice sized for this occasion and with it's brick walls and windows it somehow made me nostalgic for the old Mannerchoir (a private German club that is sadly now closed).  

The food was delicious with brats and Bahama Mamas on the buffet!  There was also German Potato salad as well as a tossed salad and several other offerings available.  For dessert everyone was served two mini cream puffs!  Schmidt's cream puffs are renowned for their deliciousness, but the full size version is way too much for one person to handle!  Two minis were nice, I ate one and the other went to a hungrier diner across the table from me who ate his two and one of mine!

Well done, Schmidt's!  Now if you'll just re-create the Sauerbraten and potato pancakes from the Mannerchoir, I'll give you five big stars in the future!

text: I love this place, ate here for the first time recently had the autobahn (their version of an all you can eat).  And for me it's a carnivores haven,  the meat was incredible.  The bahama mama was as good if not better than what I heard about.  I recommend this restaurant to anyone period, especially if you live in town and haven't ate here, run not walk to this place you will not regret it.

text: Absolutely one of the best places to eat in all of Columbus. You have to be a big fan of German food but, it's marvelous. Anything sausage and German potato salad is wonderful. What a lot of people go for, though, is the dessert. You can't go wrong with the giant cream puffs. If you're getting one of these cream puffs then make sure you're not alone because one person can't humanly finish one by themself. Then don't forget the fudge shop next door owned by the same family.

Suitably different in a Germanic way. The menu is German with a few American choices. It was all tasty and well prepared. Save room for desert. The staff were attentive. 

The restaurant was busy so you may need to wait.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
My father used to eat at Schmidt's when he went to OSU in the 70's.  I started eating here when I came to Columbus in 99.  I'm sure that when my kids visit they will eat here as well.  

Schmidt's is one of the jewels of the city.  It's location in the quiet German village, it's history building which is on the National Register, and it's authentic German atmosphere make it a must do for those visiting Columbus.  Anytime we have workers visiting from out of town we take them to Schmidts and when they visit again, they always want to go back.  

Schmidts has an assortment of sandwiches and entree's for lunch and dinner but I think most people choose the buffet.  But don't think that just because this is an all-you can eat buffet that you will be able to put down a bunch of food--this thick heavy tasty food keeps most from going back for seconds because one plate will fill you up.  

If you get the buffet you can get one of Schmidt's legendary giant creme puffs for $2 (It used to be $1 but hey, economic times).  Even if you're stuffed get the creme puff, I prefer the vanilla.  Take it home and eat it later if you have to, you'll be glad you did.

If you are lucky enough to eat here on a Friday or Saturday night be prepared to be entertained by a couple guys playing a set of drums and an accordion...and they can play anything you can think of, I've seen them turn rap songs into polka.  The rock stars as well as all of the waiters and waitresses dress in authentic German traditional clothing to add even more to the atmosphere.  

Be sure to give Schmidts a try if you are in the area, and remember, come hungry because you will leave stuffed.

text: Schmidts is one of the best restaurants in Columbus - great meals at a decent price. The Autobahn Buffet is awesome (lunch). I love going there and I never leave hungry. The brats and schnitzel are great! The beer always good as well - nice variety. Oh yeah cream puffs! I also appreciate their sponsorship of the Columbus Octoberfest - it's a great German themed festival.

text: Laid back atmosphere with authentic yummy German food, awesome dessert, nice friendly staff, even a guy playing an accordion! The buffet didn't look great to me because I'm not a sausage fan, but I got the pork shank and it was roasted delicately with the meat almost falling off to the touch.  Apple strudel was delicious

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
I love Schmidt's bratwurst's.

I'm a Columbus native, buckeye born and bred. My grandmother, on the other hand, is a native German. I'd been to Germany 4 times before I graduated from high school, and lived there for a year after. I have a lot of experience with German cuisine and culture.

I love the bratwursts at Schmidt's. They are the best I've tasted anywhere in America or Germany. I love the bread they are served on! When I go to Comfest, if I am there for lunch or dinner, I get bratwursts - if I am there for both, I get two.

I have never had a bahama mama. My friends, however, are crazy about them. I will say that from the description, they sound like something that you couldn't find in Germany unless you carried it in yourself. But I believe them when they say it's incredible.

Unfortunately, the other items on the menu are less impressive. All of the sides are, compared to what you'd find in Germany, terrible. The sp√§tzle are awful. The rotkraut is tolerable but not very good.

The cream puffs are great. In case you were wondering, no one in Germany (who hasn't been to Columbus, OH) has ever heard of or seen any pastry like a cream puff. That doesn't really diminish the fact that they are delicious.

text: Been there 6 times since I move to Columbus last year. Every time I order a different dish and all of them taste fantastic. I don't usually rate restaurants and put down reviews but I feel like I have to support Schmitdts for my great experience. The service was always nice and quick, the price is good and the food is AMAZING. The first time my sister came visit me from Pittsburgh I took her to this place and it literally became our weird tradition every time she visits. Love this place and I'm 100% sure I'm addicted to the potato salad. Highly recommend downloading the nowait APP and make reservation before leaving your house since the wait time could be horrible on weekends. The APP is very easy to use and it tells you the wait time so I usually make a reservation on the APP and arrive 5 minuets before my turn.

text: I wanted so badly to love this place...I mean, what's not to like about an old German sausage garden that's been around for 125 years? I, unfortunately, was underwhelmed. I ended up doing the autobahn buffet to try and sample a little bit of everything. The sausage was good but not great. The sauerkraut was really good as was the German potato salad. The mashed potatoes tasted as though they were made from a powder mix. The meatloaf didn't have great flavor either and tasted like it was of poor quality.  I finished my meal with a peanut butter cream puff, which was delish!  I couldn't finish it all but it wasn't because I didn't try. I'll definitely go back at some point to give it another shot.

text: I have been here multiple times for dinner and lunch. It is nice to come for the lunch buffet and try multiple dishes. The atmosphere is great! Music and a very German authentic restaurant vibe. The sausage...oh yes have some sausage and cream puffs for desert. Enough said...try is and you will not argue it is tasty. Usually busy and there is a wait in some weeknights and weekends.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
I'm sorry, but once you visit this place - you'll be hooked, especially on the brats and cream puffs! 

If you're not German, you will be after stuffing your face at Schmidt's - one of Columbus' most legendary restaurants. Schmidt's captures and sustains the Germanic heritage of Columbus. Germans were among the first to inhabit Central Ohio back in the 19th century. Fortunately, they brought their old country recipes with them! 

If you haven't been to Schmidt's, you haven't tasted Columbus. Their most famous fare is the "Bahama Mama" - a spicy brat exploding with succulent, juicy flavor. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. The best bet is their buffet. You can choose among any of their wieners, brats or sausages among other sides like sauerkraut and German potatoes. 

This is the real deal! Before you leave or move out of the area - do yourself a HUGE favor - eat at Schmidt's! You'll love it!!!

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
I was very excited to finally check out Schmidt's in German Village,.  When I went, it was about a 25 minute wait, which was fine; I think waiting line is a good sign.  While I was waiting to be called, I couldn't stop drooling over the display of their delicious looking cream puffs and pies... I considered buying one of the cream puffs and picking on it while waiting, but due to the size of the puff, I chickened out (it was almost the size of my head, no joke, will add pic later)  

Anyways, after my name was called we got seated and the waitress took our drink orders and informed us if we'd like to order from the menu or go to the buffet.  I was like, what buffet??!!  Apparently I didn't do my research well enough.  

Normally, I'd pass the buffet (who am I kidding, no I wouldn't), but not knowing when I'd come back, I hopped on the buffet train.  At the buffet section, they had their signature Bahama mama sausages - both regular and mild, and another type of sausage... I can't remember, sorry..  there were like 3-4 different types of sausages, make your own salad bar, chili, rolls, and variety of sides.  One of the sides was macaroni and cheese and I have to say, it was really good (thank you, Lactaid, for being in my purse) - very home-made-ish taste!  

Now back to the cream puff... yes I got one, but I took it to-go so I can eat in comfort at my own place without being judged, hahaha... I couldn't finish it, but it was good.. after a few bites, it was almost overwhelming for me.  The cream was really rich and had a lot of flavor, but the puff was a bit stale, but that's my fault - I left it in the refrigerator a couple of hours after I got it.  There are still few other flavors I'd like to try, but I'd probably want to share 'cause I don't think you can possible eat the whole thing alone o_O;;...

Overall, I had a good time at Schmidt's~  The staff was warm and friendly and the food was good :)

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
Amazing how some places just grow on you with time. I used to hate this place.

I am probably one of the few people in the world who is not impressed with the Bahama Mama, but I am however impressed with their Brats and other various side dishes located on their small, but plentiful buffet.

Things that keep me craving to come back:

*The braats
*The Mac n Cheese
*The German Potato salad
*The chunky apples
*CREAM PUFFS!
Those five simple foods above keep me oh-so happy. 

Schmidt's is definitely not somewhere to go if you are focusing on healthy eating and vanity... this is like a place to gorge yourself into an unconscious state of food euphoria, then after your meal you're rolling out the door going, "WHY GOD!? WHY DID I EAT SO MUCH FOOD!!???". 

There's also plenty of beer here for the thirsty!

It would be so nice if Schmidt's would open a second location due to the sheer chaos of the current one, but I guess that's what they're going for... the thrill of overcrowding and the urgency of human kind to pack themselves and wait for hours to get a table. 

The touristy german music gets to me after a while, and makes the place two times more annoying-touristy than it should be, but it goes along with all the hype that is Schmidt's.

text: Good and not so good at Schmidts. Sausage was amazing. Worth the trip at least once to try the sausage, and enjoy the down home atmosphere and German comfort food. That being said the service was average at best. The place is total chaos with its layout, and the servers/bussers almost seem put out if you get in there way as they are running to their tables. The alpine chicken dish was quite bland with very average spetzels. German potatoe salad was meh...and the overhyped puff pastries are just that, overhyped and soggy. Probably won't head back to this place unless a friend twists our arms...or we're in the neighborhood for sausage to go.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text: Every time I come home to Columbus I have to go to Schmidt's. They are seriously so delicious!!! The service is always great as well. I definitely recommend the sauerkraut balls, I could honestly eat 5 orders of it and be completely happy. If you are a beer person, get the dunkle to go with your meal. You won't be disappointed. I've probably tried everything on the menu and have never been let down. My favorites are the bratwurst sandwich, all the schnitzels and sausage platter. Make sure you save room for dessert though, The cream puffs are enormous and are an absolute must have. I suggest that you don't make plans after eating here because you'll be in a food coma afterwards. For a German restaurant they are reasonably priced. I would say expect to pay about 10-15 per person. There is almost always a wait no matter what time of day it is but they have plenty of cute local shops you can look at while you wait. They offer texting/calling when your table is ready. Make sure you arrive with all of your party or they won't seat you. Honestly, just go it'll be worth it.

text: Quaint restaurant tucked back in an older section of town. Great authentic German food and craft beer. You'll love the atmosphere! Known for their giant cream puffs, you won't be disappointed! That is for certain! Can't wait to make it back again!

text: Food was great as well as the portions. Thought all the food was made in house...come to find out it isn't.  We tried the sampler platter with the 4 different sausages. The desserts looked good. The German chocolate cake was made there. The buffet had a wide variety of food.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
The only reason I give one star is because their food is delicious and priced well.  Otherwise I would give zero stars.  

One of the biggest issues I took with my most recent and LAST EVER visit is the waiter bringing me a bill for $35, me handing him my credit card, and then him bringing me a receipt to sign for $64 without ordering anything else.  Is that even legal????

This is hands down the RUDEST staff I've ever had the displeasure of meeting.  I even spoke with one of the owners/managers once (Kyle Schmidt) and had to use every ounce of restraint in me to not just leave without paying.  I would rather be stuck dealing with the manager at a McDonald's on the graveyard shift.  Schmidt's has a policy against boxing up anything from the buffet apparently; a policy which we were informed of when Kyle saw my daughter put a piece of sausage in my to go box (I couldn't finish my sandwich) and he came to our table, yelled at my daughter, and TOOK HER FOOD AS WELL AS MY TO GO BOX AWAY FROM US.  I have never seen such horrible customer service in my life.  

I'd be willing to consider him just an ass and this an isolated incident, but of all the times my family has gone, we have had the worst service hands down of any restaurant we dine at.

This treatment on top of never being seated in shorter than an hour make Schmidt's just not worth it.  There are plenty of other great places to eat in the city, where they will bend over backwards to make their customers happy.

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text:
First time EVER at the Schmidt's Sausage Haus was on Saturday. Was extremely crowded and hectic. To be expected. We put our name in (was just a party of 2). Wait time was about 15 minutes. They have texting and calling to let you know your wait time, super convenient. And you can also download the app to track your place in line. Cool! More restaurants need this. 

So we were seated in the way back, kinda crammed next to another family. Ordered drinks and the buffet for both. The buffet is great for those who have never been. They have a mix of sausages/brats, potato salad, regular salad bar, Mac n cheese, green beans, and I can go on.

Service is fast, too. Especially considering the chaos inside. Our drinks were always filled. We ordered 2 cream puffs to go (I mean we HAD to try them!) he got vanilla, I got chocolate. Very very good. 

Overall we had a great time there. We definitely plan to revisit. Saturday nights are crazy busy but the music and ambiance add to the experience in my opinion.

text:
What the draw and appeal is of this place escapes me.  I understand it was featured on a TV show, but the sausages were nothing special.

It was oily and flavorless.  I've found more taste in the disgusting Eckrich Polish sausage than their "famous" bahama mama sausage.

Either Columbus has a black hole in its culinary offerings for Eastern European food, or the masses have been fooled by the fat man on TV again.

text:
I've visited the Haus 3 times and have been very happy each time. The buffet is a great deal for filling up and having an array of sausage.
Customer service has always been on point as well!

categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text: We had an enjoyable visit to Schmidt's last week. It was very crowded, but that should be expected for dinner time on a weekend. We had a friendly, but somewhat inattentive waiter. I wanted to try a beer, which was forgotten about until the end of dinner service. We did however get the rest of our orders, which included a turkey reuben for my wife and a bahama mama reuben. Both were well made reuben sandwiches. The Schmidt's sauerkraut adds a nice twist to the reuben sandwich and the bahama mama patty was an added flavor twist. I was still a little disappointed about the non-existent beer, but the to go cream puffs we ordered made up for it in the end. Overall, good place to visit.

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus

text: I believe this is a gem of the city, Ive been there a number of times and the food is consistent and very good.  The restaurant itself clean and gives the historic feel.  I always get a buffet because it allows me to take care of my large appetite.  Ive taken a few clients to this place and they have all been very impressed with the food and beer selection.

text: I'm not one for waiting in lines, and it was a long wait to get in as I was there for lunch on a saturday.....but it was worth it.  My only problem is that my stomach isn't large enough to hold all the food I wanted to eat.  Our server really gave it her 110% to handle all her customers.  I'd suggest ordering a dinner as opposed to the buffet.  Have your pie or cream puff as an appetizer, that way you're sure to have room for it!!!

name: Schmidt's Sausage Haus
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BYOBCorkage': "'no'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': None, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'None'}
categories: Caterers, Bars, Sandwiches, Pubs, Restaurants, Nightlife, German, Desserts, Food Trucks, Venues & Event Spaces, Food, Event Planning & Services
text: Schmidt's is the place to be if you like good beer and decent sausage. I'm not a huge fan of eating swine, but the buffet has some decent stuff and the appetizers are great. I love the pretzel nuggets, and the desserts look good too but I'm usually too stuffed for a cream puff after a meal there. Actually I usually leave Schmidt's ready for a nap, either due to too much heavy food or too much German beer. I prefer sitting at the bar and have met several interesting people through impromptu happy hours while the over 60 crowd rushes in for dinner. Their draft selections are tasty, and the bartenders are knowledgeable and great with recommendations. They also have a beer sampler, and the waiters wear kilts. Good stuff.

text: My wife and I have been coming here for several years--bought two bikes, and a bunch of gear. Advice and assistance is tremendous (I have been into bikes for many decades and do know my stuff).

text: If I could give this store more stars I would!!! My son has special needs and the owner worked with my son for 2 hours to make sure he had the perfect bike for his needs and abilities. The owner even got it right with the color!!! Great treatment warranty. Did not feel pushed to buy the most expensive bike.

name: Bicycle One
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False'}
categories: Bikes, Shopping, Bike Repair/Maintenance, Local Services, Sporting Goods
text: Been to a couple bike stores in my life and they all frustrated me to the point of just going to walmart. Needless to say after that comment im new to the cycling world. I came here and told the owner Troy that this was indeed my first rodeo. I told him my price range and what i thought would be my needs for a bike. He showed me vast amount of options always telling the price before he even began to explain the bike to me. This lead to a narrowing down process that brought me to three bikes to test drive. The one that i ended up with was actually the lowest priced bike just because it checked all my boxes.. Put 20 miles on that bike that afternoon and am already excited about my next bike purchase. which i know will be from this fantastic shop.

name: Bicycle One

text: Great experience. My bike hadn't been serviced in at least 10 years. They were incredibly knowledgeable and provided excellent advice for what service it would need. They even took extra time to show me a feature I wasn't even aware my bike had. Great turn around time and price was very reasonable! Great establishment-highly recommend. I will be back!

text: I've had a similar experience as R.M. I entered the shop regarding a potential quote on a service I needed and all I got was the cold shoulder. Not sure if it was because of my race, but the salespeople were not helpful and it took around 5 minutes or so for someone to actually answer my pretty simple question.

name: Bicycle One
attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False'}
categories: Bikes, Shopping, Bike Repair/Maintenance, Local Services, Sporting Goods
text:
Though there are new shops popping up along the Big Walnut Creek in downtown Gahanna, there are a few places that have been there seemingly from the get go.  Bicycle One has actually been there for 36 years.  

They sell bikes for fitness and for leisure, as well as hybrids which are both fitness and leisure.  Prices start in the $200s.  A great asset is you can get a free major tune up from Bicycle One for three years if you buy one of their bikes.  That includes:  adjusting brakes and gears, adjusting bearing preloads, true wheels, inflating tires, lubing the cables and drivetrain, and tightening all other components.  Along with bicycles, they sell bike gear like jackets and biking shorts, grip gloves and of course helmets.  Fitness snacks and drinks are also available at the checkout counter.

name: Bicycle One

text: This place is fantastic. My wife and I stopped by earlier today wanting to pick up some bikes. We haven't rode in a very long time and were hoping to use cycling to get some much needed exercise. The associate was extraordinarily helpful (young guy - but sorry, I can't remember his name), made suggestions based on what we thought our uses would be, as well as price. We got to take a number of models out for a spin, and walked away with two new bikes that seem just right for us! A++ Extremely happy with our visit, purchase, and entire experience. Thank you.

text: Elephant's contacted me the same day I posted my original review to follow up on my experience.  Wow!  They left a very nice message verifying that the PDX location does participate in ALL of their punch cards, including coffee and cookies.  Also, they said that they're reviewing this with all of their staff, so something like this doesn't happen in the future.  Thanks Elephant's!

categories: Salad, Soup, Sandwiches, Delis, Restaurants, Cafes, Vegetarian
text: I'm not usually a fan of airport food. I usually like to arrive and get to where I need to go. However, I had no choice this past weekend on our first trip to Portland but to stay at the airport for four hours and wait for my boyfriend's flight to arrive. I was hungry and this place seemed popular compared to the other surrounding food areas. I got their weekly special french dip sandwich, not really expecting much except to fuel my stomach but was surprised how good it was! It had the meat with au ju, mayo, chipotle, and blue cheese. Wish I had time to get a sandwich before we headed home.

name: Flying Elephants at PDX

text: If one must have breakfast at the airport, perhaps due to hangover reasons, Flying Elephants makes a pretty good breakfast burrito. I felt that their beans were, for lack of a better word, pleasingly beany (legumy?) which helped settle my stomach on a rough morning.

name: Flying Elephants at PDX
attributes: {'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'Alcohol': "u'beer_and_wine'", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': True}"}
categories: Salad, Soup, Sandwiches, Delis, Restaurants, Cafes, Vegetarian
text: Reasonably priced, tasty local joint. Lots of goodies you would see at the Flying Elephants downtown as well as the original Elephant's Deli. Beers for pretty cheap compared to a typical restaurant. Food is fresh. Probably one of the best places you can get non-airport food in an airport!

name: Flying Elephants at PDX
attributes: {'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'Alcohol': "u'beer_and_wine'", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': True}"}
categories: Salad, Soup, Sandwiches, Delis, Restaurants, Cafes, Vegetarian
text:
Other than my own store, this is my go-to airport restaurant over the last four years. Fresh food, lots of allergy-friendly options, and a really kind staff. Their soup is amazing, particularly the Elephant Cure, the  Nigerian Peanut Soup, and the Dill Pickle Soup. Also, a full wall of delicious drinks ranging from kombucha to soda to alcohol.

Other foods to look for: their curry, Ratatouille, and the pastrami sandwich.

text: The worst experience at Flying Elephant ever.  The "hot breakfast" food was mediocre, at best. Burnt; dry; bland and it took forever to get.  I'm hugely disappointed.  I've been to this location before as well as other and used to love it and arrived at the airport early just to eat here.  Boo. :(

text: It isn't often I praise airport food, but Flying Elephants is so good I wish there was one locally so I could lunch there all the time. I had the BEST ham and swiss baguette there this trip: smoky, salty ham, strong swiss, a brush of dijon and mayo on fresh chewy bread.  I agree with other reviewers that the place needs to be on the other side of Security. Even a sandwich/soup kiosk there would be great.

text: We went to Flying Elephant in Portland and in the airport.  The breakfast burrito is delicious and they serve stumptown coffee! Can't beat that for breakfast :)

attributes: {'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'Alcohol': "u'beer_and_wine'", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': True}"}
categories: Salad, Soup, Sandwiches, Delis, Restaurants, Cafes, Vegetarian
text:
The food here is very good, but the service is very off. I ordered a sandwich to be grilled and it took 20 minutes before the guy called me up. When he did I noticed my burnt sandwich waiting to be wrapped. The associate had started to wrap it and then continued to take another customers order. The other employee, who must have been a manager, told me he'd take care of it, but upon seeing my burnt sandwich that the first guy neglected to take care of told me it would be some more time unless I'd like a burnt sandwich. After some time my food was brought to me along with a free coffee. The manager defiantly stepped it up to make me a happy customer, but the other associate acted like nothing happened. 
But really what can you expect from an on the go airport restaurant?

text: If the security guard didn't recommend that we go down to the other security line we wouldn't have known this was here. Much better option to get a quick meal that isn't fast food in the airport. Good sandwiches and decent prices for the airport. Oh yeah and a very good chocolate chip cookie! The chocolate mousse looked tasty but I was out voted, didn't seem practical for the plane.

name: Flying Elephants at PDX
attributes: {'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'Alcohol': "u'beer_and_wine'", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': True}"}
categories: Salad, Soup, Sandwiches, Delis, Restaurants, Cafes, Vegetarian
text:
So delicious and well-priced for breakfast. We arrived in PDX for a layover on the way to Hawaii. 

We found this really cute deli/cafe in the airport and are so glad we stopped here. The food was delicious. 

I really wanted a breakfast BLT, since I love hollandaise sauce, but we went healthier and got a bagel with cream cheese, sausage and potato frittata, and a big piece of blueberry coffeecake. It was all so good, and the whole thing came out to about $9, and there was enough for 2 people. 

I love that almost everything is homemade. The soups seemed really good. I was intrigued by the orange tomato soup, but we needed some eggs and protein in the morning. Many of the baked goods, including the blueberry coffeecake was fresh from that morning, and it was about 8:30 in the morning, sooooooooooooo delicious and a much-needed picker-upper in the morning. 

The people behind the counter seem all very hipster-y and Urban Outfitters-y. Nice place. Hope we get one down in California sometime soon.

name: Flying Elephants at PDX

text: What?  Good airport food?  When I flew into Portland (PDX), I needed lunch before traveling on.  I noticed that there were a lot of airport workers in line so I figured they knew something I didn't.  And, they did. I travel a lot for a living and I think of airport food as usually made for people who are desperately hungry or bored.  The food at the Flying Elephant was a very welcome surprise. Everything was better than good, it was delicious.  I am already looking forward to the Mama Leone's soup when I return home.

name: Flying Elephants at PDX
attributes: {'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'Alcohol': "u'beer_and_wine'", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': True}"}

text: The breakfast quiche was really dry. Bummer because it was winking at me in the early morning making me think, "well hello there little bacon egg pie!"  Did not live up to expectations. Staff is extremely friendly, as everyone in Portland is required to be. Love it.  They redeemed themselves with their tasty little macaroons!  I'm not a big sweet tooth, but the different textures and mild sugaryneous(sure, lets make that one work) really made it a nice dessert. Even at 8 am.  Real shame about the quiche though....never really had a fair shake at the world.

categories: Salad, Soup, Sandwiches, Delis, Restaurants, Cafes, Vegetarian
text: I'll admit it---I'm a Portland airport fan. My grandfather was a pilot by profession, and he used to bring me and my little brother to the airport to have lunch and watch the planes take off and land. Almost three decades later, I still come here sometimes to walk down memory lane. I'm not sure where we got all of our food when I was a kid, but in the last few years, Flying Elephants has become my go-to place for food at the airport. The offerings are always fresh, attractive, and delicious, and the employees are friendly. It's also very clean and peaceful when I go in. All I bought today was Valentine's Day candy, but the guy was so nice and personable I threw in a small tip. Basically, I now tip the employees here just for existing. It's a quality dining experience.

text: On the way to my flight I stopped here for breakfast, by far the best option around, while I was here I decided to grab food for the flight, about the same cost but soooo much better then airline food.

categories: Salad, Soup, Sandwiches, Delis, Restaurants, Cafes, Vegetarian
text:
I usually have low expectations regarding Airport food, and as such am rarely disappointed.  PDX has been an exception, starting with their promise that prices are same at the Airport or off.

I arrived this morning from SFO at around 11 AM and immediately took the Shuttle to my Hotwire Hotel Surprise. This time it's the Country Suites and my good luck streak continues. However, this Hotel is off Airport (and Max), so I ended up taking the Shuttle back to PDX, so that I could catch the TriMet. By that time it was Noon-ish and decided that Lunch here was a better option than taking my chances on 82nd Avenue (AKA - The Avenue of the Roses). 

Flying Elephants immediately caught me attention, especially since I wanted to order and sit myself, and enjoy a draft beer as a bonus. Their Roast Beef Sandwich (with blue cheese, sweet onions, and other good stuff on fresh bread), along with a bag of chips, and a Porter hit on all cylinders. The red seats were also comfortable and this place seemed very popular, especially among folks who actually worked at PDX. There are also other options, including "grab and go", inviting soups, and hot dishes. I'm sure I'll be back regardless of which side of Security I need to be.

text: This is my morning pit stop before I catch my way too early flight into Long Beach. They have the best veggie frittata around. Their food here is exactly like their other little neighborhood food which is so great especially for the airport.

text:
This is airport eating at its best! 

Catching a flight at 6 am is never fun but the food and staff made my breakfast dining experience one to write about. As I stumbled into this somewhat nondescript delicatessen burdened by an assortment of travel bags and a week of fatigue I was greeted by the rich aroma of savory breakfast treats and warm smiles.  The wide variety culinary choices left me temporality stunned! I finally settled on some of the free tata and it was incredible. . The latte I ordered was prefect and the brawny guy who made it was as easy to talk to as he was to look at! Great food, great staff this place is a no brainer!

categories: Salad, Soup, Sandwiches, Delis, Restaurants, Cafes, Vegetarian
text:
Summary:  Go to Stanford's - it's way better and worth the effort.

Recently, in connecting through PDX with a two+ hour layover, I was faced with the dilemma of finding food.  Good food.  So, I took to my trusty Yelp app and searched for something good, and Flying Elephants came up as the highest rated place.  When I discovered it was on the wrong (read:other) side of security, I hesitated.  Did I want to deal with running the gauntlet of terrorist-inspired nasty governmental drones to get good food?  Did I want to waste my chance to eat at a GREAT restaurant that is a known quantity (Stanford's) in order to take a chance on a place so many Yelpers raved about?  Hell yes, Yelp has never steered me wrong...so off I went.

True to the other reviews, Flying Elephants had a menu that looked healthy and interesting.  Since it was about 6:30 PM, some of the entr√©e's were already consumed, so I went with a tuna melt and some Mac & Cheese.  Immediately after ordering, the friendly counter guy reached into a refrigerator below the counter and pulled out a cellophane-wrapped, pre-made, flat and ugly sandwich thing that made the sandwiches Starbucks makes look positively decadent.  Yuck!  When I mentioned to the counter guy "I thought you made these when they were ordered", he told me they were made earlier.  I've posted a picture of the sign outside Flying Elephants that clearly states "Great Local Foods From Scratch...".  From scratch implies they make some stuff now.  By their definition, they could sell Twinkies under the same claim!

When I got my SMALL sandwich, it wasn't bad.  The Mac & Cheese wasn't bad either.  But I had walked right past Stanford's to come here...and they have a Mac & Cheese that will blow your mind and rocket you into outer space - it's that good.  I felt let down.  I had skipped a chance to have a truly outstanding meal for this.  All things considered, I don't think I'll be back.  If I want a pre-made sandwich, I'll just spend the same amount and get something that looks better and is bigger at Starbucks (and not have to deal with the associated security hassles).  And if I want to spin the roulette wheel and deal with institutional security or run the risk of an invasive cavity search, I'll go to Stanford's.  It's easily worth the hassle  Sadly, this is the first time Yelp has led me astray.

name: Flying Elephants at PDX

categories: Salad, Soup, Sandwiches, Delis, Restaurants, Cafes, Vegetarian
text: The service is prompt here which makes it ideal for PDX employees who need to grab food quick on the run during meal breaks. I have come here on countless lunch breaks to enjoy the airport employee discount and the quality food. My colleagues really enjoy it as well and on occasion I have spoiled them with treats from this location. The Mac and cheese is great here, in my eyes. My manager really enjoys the frittata and I tried it the other day. I must agree with him that the frittata is of exceptional quality. The great quality of the food is equally matched by the great customer service. They always take good care of me. I have yet to have a poor experience thus far in my time as a customer here and that's saying a lot as I am in the customer service industry.

name: Flying Elephants at PDX

text: Great airport cafe choice! Wide variety of pre-made snacks, sandwiches, and salads. Everything is very well labeled with ingredients and allergens, and I had an awesome gluten-free snickerdoodle cookie. My partner enjoyed his (gluten-containing) egg salad sandwich. Ratatouille was on point. Tempted by the coffee but unfortunately it's on the wrong side of the security checkpoint.

text:
Well, I finally found good Airport food in Portland. The Flying Elephant has actually taken their concept outside the airport and managed to bring it into the airport and maintain great quality. How about that!

Killer grilled Breakfast BLT with Hollandaise sauce. Great tasting coffee and pastries.

Very cool concept, excellent service, really nice staff. Very large selection of food product in a compact space.

Oustanding price/value.

name: Flying Elephants at PDX
attributes: {'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'Alcohol': "u'beer_and_wine'", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': True}"}

text:
I mean, I wouldn't go out of my way to drive out to PDX for Flying Elephants or anything, but when you're leaving on a flight, it's a great place to stop for lunch. 
They have a subset of the grab-and-go and hot foods that Elephants Delicatessen sells.
It's outside of security so it's a nice place to chill with my family before saying goodbye and going through security.
At this location, I've had their vegan wrap, which is messy but tasty and vegan.

name: Flying Elephants at PDX

text: amazing food lots of healthy options you can tell the staff actually take food standards seriously it's very well kept, employees are polite. Very good variety for any kind of dietary restriction. Elephants's a great company with local fresh food i recommend it to everyone. Also love that they donate left overs to food banks and try to be as waste free as possible! Wish more businesses were like that!!

text: Fantastic eats with some of the best staff ever. Some of it is a little on the pricy side but it's well worth it with good varying dishes that change from day to day, so you'll never have a repeat experience. The mac n cheese with pork is to die for.

text: Great salads / sandwiches / scones to take on your flight. Do NOT get oatmeal if you are flying out, it will not pass through security!

name: Flying Elephants at PDX
attributes: {'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'Alcohol': "u'beer_and_wine'", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': True}"}
categories: Salad, Soup, Sandwiches, Delis, Restaurants, Cafes, Vegetarian
text:
This is a very open cafe at the airport that's perfect to stop by before going through security. They have cold items like sandwiches and salads in a fridge area, a huge candy display in front, and hot meal items available. There is a lot of seating around the cafe with easy access while you're dragging your carry ons!

The tomato basil soup had chicken and vegetables in it, and was overall pretty good and light. They even gave us free samples! The kale and chicken salad from the fridge was surprisingly tasty, probably because there was a lot of parmesan in it. There was also meatloaf that had a sweeter taste to it from pineapple or apple that was in it. The scalloped potatoes were decent, and a little on the greasy side as expected.

TLDR: decent stop if you want cafe food at the airport before security!

text: Always a great friendly staff with awesome hot and cold selections. I must have for my flights. Ham n Gruyere sandwich is my fav!

name: Flying Elephants at PDX
attributes: {'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'Alcohol': "u'beer_and_wine'", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': True}"}
categories: Salad, Soup, Sandwiches, Delis, Restaurants, Cafes, Vegetarian
text: This is the place to eat at the Portland Airport.  The food is fresh, cheap and delicious. I had a salad with mozzarella, a baguette and an espresso.  My husband had an espresso and ham & cheese.  Our total was just over $10 -- the price of a single rotten salad at SFO.  This was amazing and delicious and helped with our long-delayed flight.  So glad they are there.

name: Flying Elephants at PDX
attributes: {'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'Alcohol': "u'beer_and_wine'", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': True}"}
categories: Salad, Soup, Sandwiches, Delis, Restaurants, Cafes, Vegetarian
text:
I was very excited to see a Flying Elephants at PDX since I love this place! But I must admit that this time I was quite disappointed :/ The veggie scrambler tasted frumpy... Very bland, honestly the worst scrambled eggs I have ever had--even worse than airplane eggs... eeek!  They had a horrible dry texture and strange flavor.  I couldn't even finish the food.  So so disappointed. Not the best service here either.

I'll still give em another shot since I know Flying Elephants food is usually pretty tasty... I probably just picked the one bad dish on the menu... I seem to have a knack at doing that :/

text: A really good option for early flyers! They open at 5am, when other options are typically bad, and serve fresh warm food as well as cold sandwich. And, healthy options!!

text: AWESOME Airport eats!  Had the veggie wrap, YUMMY!!! and the mac and cheese was so perfectly epic. A must if you need a snack after or before your flight.  We snaked there while waiting to pick up our party who joined us for vacation. We were quite impressed with the quality .

text: Great place to stop and get a fresh sandwich made inside the Portland airport. I had a turkey breakfast sandwich that had a generous amount of egg and turkey. Also had a coffee. Overall good quality airport food. Service was also great.

name: Flying Elephants at PDX
attributes: {'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'Alcohol': "u'beer_and_wine'", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': True}"}
categories: Salad, Soup, Sandwiches, Delis, Restaurants, Cafes, Vegetarian
text: I have found Flying Elephants to be about as good as it gets in a airport terminal for delicious healthy food.  There is a great selection of premade sandwiches, salads, soups, etc.  The sandwiches and soups I have had were delicious.  A wide selection of beverages are available including local coffee, wine and beer.  Like other establishments in PDX, the prices are very reasonable.  The staff have been consistently friendly.

text: Quaint eatery in the Portland airport. Prices are typical for airports. A lot of microwaving, but the pickup and go food is plentiful.

name: Flying Elephants at PDX
attributes: {'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'Alcohol': "u'beer_and_wine'", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': True}"}

text: Great breakfast options. The egg dishes are really good and they have several options which is super. They also have bagels, coffee & tea and yogurts. Their food tastes good - fresh and flavored well. It's nice to have some non-pastry options for breakfast. They have lots of little snacks and treats that you can pick up for your travels. It's a great place in PDX - quality and not full of quick greasy junk. Don't miss it!

text: ordered a tuna melt sandwich at flying elephants at PDX, quite disappointing. Very stingy. Overcooked as well. The orange tomato soup was quite good as always though

categories: Salad, Soup, Sandwiches, Delis, Restaurants, Cafes, Vegetarian
text:
my only complaint is a fairly big one - Elephants is on the wrong side of security. I am one of those frequent travelers who wants to get through security and THEN find my coffee and snacks.

That said, Elephants Deli always holds up it's high quality rep for tasty eats made from real food. no, "scratch made" does not mean made right there as you order it, but everything IS made same day at their main location (Portland local). scratch means made from real food, unprocessed, and here you definitely get that. 

also VERY pleased to see they offer vegan options now - as a Portland institution that is a good idea. No

attributes: {'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'Alcohol': "u'beer_and_wine'", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': True}"}

text: Seriously awesome this place delivers at the airport. When I'm about to fly later in the day I know I can stop buy for all sorts of great treats and beer. They have amazing soups and nice people working here. When I come in I always grab a snack here to eat whilst on the Max.  If you have any sort of craving they can crush it and usually in a healthy way. I'm all about this place!

name: Flying Elephants at PDX
attributes: {'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'Alcohol': "u'beer_and_wine'", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': True}"}
categories: Salad, Soup, Sandwiches, Delis, Restaurants, Cafes, Vegetarian
text:
There are many reasons why Portland International Airport receives such lofty accolades, one is that retailers are restricted from charging higher prices than at their other locations.

This make already cool Flying Elephants such an attractive draw.  The breakfast burrito is a healthy and value deal (especially at an airport) for $5, you can opt for veggie or sausage.  They have such a wide, creative array of food and drink offerings.; many hits and a few misses.  One favorite is the Bruce Cost unfiltered Ginger Ale, a great refresher before flying.

The staff is usually very friendly and accomadating.

name: Flying Elephants at PDX
