text: Drive all the way up to the top and there is parking, though some times its full. If you have time, the inside of the house itself is amazing, but if you don't have time or are there when the inside is closed, just walk around the house to see the amazing view of Portland and Mt. Hood.  Take lots of pictures.  There are walking paths to take for a nice walk in Forest Park.  One of them is in the back of the parking lot.

name: Pittock Mansion

text: I think this place is just awesome although we didn't go into the mansion itself. We could enjoy and appreciate the building. It was very grand and nested in high top on a hill, so when you go to the back yard of the mansion, you could see the view of the city... which I think pretty amazing, especially on a bright sunny day. It is priceless.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text: The view from Pittock Mansion is free & breathtaking! Definitely worth checking out! In fact, I would've preferred to have paid for the view than the tour of the mansion. I took a friend who was visiting Portland for the first time & the mansion was decorated for Christmas. The decorations were tacky & it was not done tastefully at all. Most of the furniture & things I would have wanted to see were covered up with the gaudy decor. Might bring another out of town visitor if they insist, but I won't spend the money for the tour again otherwise.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text: Just finished touring the Pittock Mansion and the place is amazing with great views of downtown Portland. It was very interesting to see the state of the art technology they had back then such as putting intercoms in the rooms, showers with multiple jet sprays and how you would mix water temperatures to get it just right. Amazing place that still has great curb appeal. Hope they put it back on the market so I can put a bid in on the place.

name: Pittock Mansion

text: Pretty and interesting. We went a few years ago when Santa was there and got some nice pictures. Kids and adults enjoy checking out the mansion, which is still furnished as though it is lived in.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
This review is solely based on the view of Portland. (Unfortunately I didn't have enough time to tour the actual mansion!) But - with the time I did have - I wanted to enjoy the beautiful layout of the city below. And the spotting of the magnificent Mount Hood, of course. The lawn area beside the mansion was ideal for laying out a blanket, laying out and soaking in the glorious panoramic of Portland. Free? You betcha. (The best types of visits!) I was told of this lookout from someone I randomly met on my first day in the city. He said it was a must-stop, and he was right. 

I suggest driving to this location if you're staying downtown. But, if you're craving a workout and are ok with walking 2 miles uphill, then go for it!

name: Pittock Mansion

text: Neato! P-town history! Awesome views, beautiful home, cool bits of history and story of Portland and the valley... had a blast! Fun staff!!!

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text: Really enjoyed my visit to the Pittock Mansion. Parking was a little tight, but it was a nice day and it's summer. We utilized the overflow parking and it was just fine. The grounds a very well kept and the view of Portland and Mt. Hood was amazing. We took part in the self guided tour of the Mansion and it was fantastic. The Pittock family and the Mansion have an interesting history and we spent about a hour wandering through the rooms and absorbing all the details. We also toured the Gate Lodge, which is smaller and more quaint, but still very lovely. Price was $11 for an adult and well worth it for the 2 buildings we toured. The museum store was full of super interesting gifts and books. We loved the Pittock Mansion!

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
Love this place! A true piece of Portland history, right straight from the turn of the century 1914 to be exact. They have small events where you can tour the inside. Fabulous view that is absolutely beautiful, because you can see Mt. Hood
and Helens at the same time!! Not to mention, it was on the show America's Most Haunted as well...

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
We took the tour from this nice lady that seemed very happy that we were actually interested in the history of the mansion and the Pittocks. The house is beautiful, but not over the top in any way. It's a little disappointing that most of the furniture isn't original, but I understand that the Pittocks might have wanted to take their furniture when they moved out. =)

I especially loved the staircase, kitchen, and the "tester" in the shower that sprays water on your foot before starting the shower so you know the temperature. 

The best part is the spectacular views you can get on a clear day of Mt. Rainer, Mt. St. Helen's, Mt. Hood, Portland, and the Columbia and Willamette Rivers. I personally think it beats the views from the Japanese and Rose Gardens.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text: An amazing spot to see a whole view of beautiful Portland city! Should definitely go on your list of places to show your fellow tourist friends/family. They will love it! We just did a few weekends ago and our crew enjoyed every second of it. The tour of the actual Pittock Mansion is also worth seeing. Its pretty cool to see how small everything was back then - anywhere from plates to beds, to bathtubs and so on. :)

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text: Beautiful location.  Cannot take a bad picture here, especially on a sunny day.  Great hiking trails and overall a really neat historic location.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text: Admission price was $9 per person in July 2015.  We got $1 off for AAA Membership, so we paid $8 each.  Arrived too late for the guided tour, so we self-toured.  Signage in house was EXCELLENT, so we learned a lot about the mansion and its original owners.  Fascinating look back to how the wealthy lived.  Wonderful old furniture and furnishing.  I particularly liked the old showers.  Great view of the Portland skyline from the hill on which the mansion sits.  Free parking in the parking lot. Bathrooms adjacent to the ticket purchase area and also inside the mansion on the bottom floor.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
If you're a tourist and want to check out something historical about Portland, Oregon, I would come here. Beyond the scenery and brief history, there isn't much to do here. 

You can see Mount hood and the skyline from this location. You can also briefly read on the history of the Pittocks and the beginnings of industrial Portland. 

Now let's talk prices. You can also walk around the house and its surroundings for free. Parking is also free. The tour is $12 dollars, which I don't think it's worth it considering you can get everything else for free. Want a picture to commemorate the moment, take a picture in front of the house. You would think it would be huge, but it isn't. 

Definitely a place to go to, but there are a lot of places to go to near there as well. It isn't worth paying for the tour.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
There is something really romantic about a restored mansion full of history and elegance. I had visited the grounds many, many times but never felt like paying the fee to go inside. The property itself has some of the most amazing views in Portland, which can be accessed by car or hike (I prefer hike). Apparently admission is free the first full weekend of the month with a Bank of America card so my friend and I gleefully checked out the interior. 

Ohmygoodness, gorgeous! The marble stairs, the architecture, the art, the fashion, the furniture, everything! I highly, highly recommend seeing it all with the assistance of a knowledgeable tour guide. Normally I dismiss such tourist perks but hearing such wonderful stories of the Pittock family in relation to everything I was seeing certainly enriched the already impressive experience. 

It's easy to overlook the 'tourist' attractions in Portland and assume we're too cool for them. The mansion offers us a way to appreciate some of our local history and enjoy breathtaking views of the city. How can you be too cool for that?

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
A must see place for anyone visiting Portland. Absolutely loved this Mansion and hearing the stories of the Pittocks. I was just amazed with how the family lived in the 1900, the history is beyond amazing. 

The price for the tour was $12 per adult which was reasonable for the amount of time you can be there and the option to get a tour guide. You are free to take as many pictures as you like, unlike most museums or historical places which cameras are not allowed.

I will post some of the pictures as words not always describe just how amazing this place is.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text: This is a great place to bring visitors to Portland.  The mansion itself is interesting - lots to look at and it's laid out well.  The holiday decorations are also fun - apparently, they change every year.  Leave extra time to take in the view of the city and maybe even hike in the area surrounding.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
Well, what to say. $10 seems steep but I understand the reasoning behind the outrageous cost....the grounds.

The mansion is beautiful but it was very disappointing to find out that it's been restored with furniture and artifacts not even representing what was there originally. It's really a holding ground for donated stuff. 

Looked nice but not what I thought. 

The grounds are great and you don't need to pay for them.

You should visit once for the views and mansion but go back for the trails

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
Was here last week on a clear afternoon.  You can get the views without having to pay to go into the mansion.  There is a teeny tiny gift shop and bathroom on the grounds as well.  

We could see Mt St Helen's, Mt Rainier and Mt Hood on this day. 

We decided to go ahead and pay to walk around the mansion.  They are currently working on the backside so there is quite a bit of schaffholding (sp?) around the building.  I enjoyed walking around the different rooms on the main and 2nd floors of the mansion.  There are some original items from the family that used to live here and the rest are period pieces to match the same time period.  You can complete walking the inside in less than an hour.  It's self directed.  Restrooms and addtl displays on the lower level.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
Very beautiful here, we really enjoyed walked around the outside area. So relaxing and serene. Plenty of picnic area and such a great view. Wonderful photo ops! It a definite must see.
  However,  I'm taking one star off though because I went to the gift shop to purchase a few things about $35 in merchandise.  Well, the cashier was standing there talking to someone and not cashiering so after standing there 10 minutes I just put down my stuff and left, I'm pretty sure she didn't notice. Might want to skip the gift shop.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text: We've been to Portland a couple of times and never stopped in to Pittock Mansion. Our visit coincided with a huge rainstorm, though that is not surprising in Portland I would imagine. We had a fantastic guided tour through the entire mansion and learned all about the original family, the architecture, and the happenings surrounded the surrender of the building to the city. All super interesting, and the interior is gorgeous. This is well worth your time when visiting in Portland.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text: We hiked from Lower Macleay Park to and from the Pittock Mansion.  The hike takes about an hour out and less back.  We purchased the mansion tickets which include a group tour guide.  The tours run back to back and are worth it.  You can use the grounds and restrooms without the tickets.  The garden views are panoramic.   The house itself is interesting though they have little historical information on construction and renovation costs and how the house was used.  Other than nuts, pretzels sms such snacks there is no food.  There were people that brought lunch and had it on the grounds.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text: Great views on an overcast day, imagine if it was sunny out. But that didn't happen until 2pm after we were long gone. It's a nice little hike to get there, great exercise. Can't wait to get back. Cool history, great architecture and if you are one of those Geocacher types, there's one or two around.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
Aside from multnomah falls this place has a spectacular view of portland as well as mount hood. The best part of it is that you can roam around for free. 

Entering the mansion itself requires a fee, but if you're not worried about a possible paranormal experience, do it! Leave your bible and holy water at the door.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text: My visit here was nice. It is a great place to wander around aimlessly or get swept away for an hour or two.  If you need a place to go to and escape for the day, this place will fit the bill.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
My babygirl had this place bookmarked and wanted to stop here after our visit to the rose garden. I wasn't sure what all the fuss was about until we arrived after winding our way through the hilly streets, lined with fancy houses.

Once we arrived I was impressed with the size of it as I'm sure most other people that have seen it are. Mr. Pittock must be VERY large in order to justify this enormous mansion...

Even more impressive is the massive undertaking it must have been to build this mansion high atop the hill back in the early 1900's.   

The view has to be one of the most expansive in the city of Portland. You can pretty much see the entire city from the Pittock lawn. Which of course is all we got to see while we were there as the interior of the mansion was closed. I was just happy strolling the grounds with my honey, checking out the views and reading the plaques with tidbits of history.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text: We added this excursion to our list last-minute to-do. Sure glad we did. The mansion is spectacular in both beauty and the technology of the day. (think of the US version of Downton Abbey, except far more advanced). You will see telephones, an interior vacuum system and a body spray shower that was ( and is) state of the art. The construction materials are exquisite and the Beaux Arts emphasis particularly beautiful. Another contributor mentioned the price of admission being expensive. I thought it was very reasonable, especially when you read the story of how it rose from neglect to the restoration to it's former glory with the help of so many volunteers. This was definitely a labor of love in terms of restoration with so many people contributing to the restoration. Our only regret? We did not have time for a garden tour to walk the gorgeous 46 tailored acres. We also did not have a chance to take part in the "backstairs story", the tour highlighting the life of the servants. Next time! Oh - and did I mention the views of Portland from the property? Breathtaking.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
The first thing that came to mind when I saw the view was, "I wonder what it would've been like before Portland was there". My friends apparently had the same thing on their minds.

It's a good view. Not a 360 degree panoramic and quite a few areas blocked by trees, yet one of the best places to see Mt Hood and parts of Portland. There are places to sit and a big lawn to veg out on if you so choose to do so.

The house? No clue. We didn't drop the $7 to peak inside. From the website it looks like it's got a nice staircase. From the outside it looks pretty good. Although it doesn't seem very big since you can walk all the around it quickly.

The parking lot was fairly close and seemed big enough since we went on a fairly busy weekend and there was lots of parking. You will likely have to walk uphill to get to your car and if you've just burned out your legs hiking in the gorge you'll swear a bit.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
I love it. Since I'm sort of in love with history, I loved this place. It's gorgeous. There's so much to see and read about. The Pittock Mansion is a valuable piece of Oregon's history and success. Henry Pittock was the epitome of a true Oregonian. After spending years working his way up to become a Portland icon, he built this mansion. And while building, he went local, spending more money by using local resources to help boost Oregon's economy. 

We visited the mansion in late spring, during one of the rainy Oregon weeks so we didn't explore the grounds as much as I would have liked, but we did go through every room in the mansion. I hope to go back during Christmas because I've heard it's an entirely different and wonderful experience. 

Definitely come here. We don't have enough of these sort of places in Oregon. It's definitely worth your time and money.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
I'm too cheap to actually pay to go into the mansion itself (but Bank of America card holders get free admission on museum weekends; check the website), so I came up here just to enjoy the view. And what a view it is! The gardens of the mansion are well-tended and beautiful too (scent-sational), and it seems like a great place to just have a little picnic.

If you're cheap like me and don't mind looking like a creeper, you can peek into the mansion through the large windows in the back...it's pretty spectacular inside. ;)

Note: the telescope pointing at Mt. Hood doesn't work as of this review writing...it'll just eat your quarters. The public restroom only has one stall per gender too.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text: If you are in Portland and have time be sure to see the Pittick Mansion. It's only $10.00 to go on a tour. The view are incredible. From all the windows you can the city of Portland. It is three stories and up on the top of a hill. The mansion has twenty three rooms and is just beautiful. It's hard to believe this house was finished in 1914 and had a central vacuum system in that era. The Mansion is on 46 acres of beautiful land. It's nice the city of Portland bought it and restored it so all of us can enjoy it.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
The Pittock Mansion is an iconic landmark in Portland boasting a panoramic view of the city below, not to mention Mount Hood. While I have never taken the interior tour of the mansion, I have walked the grounds and have taken photos of the cityscape from this lovely vantage point. If you grew up in the Portland area, you may know some of the history behind the Pittock family and this home, and if you're a visitor you'll learn some of the background behind one of the founding members of Portland.

The green lawn and gardens are a nice place to unwind after a day of sight-seeing, and there are benches and tables near the edge of the grounds to take in the view. This is an ideal place to take people visiting the city who want to see the majestic beauty of the trees, mountain range, bridges, and buildings that make Portland. 

There is free parking right next to the mansion. To enter the area, you take a kind of dangerous single lane road with a blind curve, so if there is a car coming you may need to back up to let them pass. It then turns into two lanes, but exercise caution.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
Beautiful grounds and a fantastic view of the city!!
Five stars are for the gardens! The house was amazing, but if I went again I would skip the house and just tour the grounds.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text: This was a fun trip with the family on a gorgeous day in Portland. Not a cloud in the sky, and the views were amazing! The mansion, itself, is so cool, like a step back in time. I love older architecture, and it truly is amazing to see how much detail goes into the building of homes then. The fact that they had methods of extracting sandstone, transporting it, making it into this mansion in the early 1900s is amazing in itself. The only thing I wish I had was more time to explore the rooms and floors. But with 2 young kids and lunch time rapidly approaching, I couldn't. Parking can be tight, especially after 11am. The outdoor bathrooms are definitely less desirable than the indoor ones. The garden is amazing, and the views too from each bedroom. Cost is also very low for a family of four.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
This place is many things. Let's start with the most superficial.

As of right now, historical significance aside, this is an imposing, rather pretty (if not beautiful or lovely) and perfectly gigantic old home you can walk around in for less than the cost of a movie. The gardens are thoughtfully planned, well-tended, and planted with colorful and interesting specimens. You get a breathtaking view of Mt Hood and downtown from across the front yard.

It's easy to find parking once you're here, the staff is nice, the prices are fair, and the drive in is very scenic. I can personally vouch for the reality of it being a great tour of fine west hills homes if you're chatting away in the truck and not paying attention on your way into town and end up zig-zagging across the Tualatin Mountains trying to find a back way in. 

Moving on to the symbol of civic pride that a place like this can represent, it's really cool how real estate developers were thwarted by public fund-raising 50 years ago. The Columbus Day Storm crushed the whole town, but the headlines about the damage to this place spurred a wave of donation that put together the $225K ($1.6M today) to snap this place up off the market. In Seattle (where I live), the real estate developer wins this fight every. Single. Time. PDX did it right saving this grand old manse from the bulldozer. It's been a park for generations now, so this feels like a given but that moment of collective consciousness speaks well of this town. Sorry, developers.

Historically, there's great significance here. 16,000 square feet of sandstone, marble, steamed and shaped oak flooring, and countless dozens of other interesting materials went into it, and the results are stylish and striking in many ways. There's central heat, central vacuum (in the 1910s? really?), an intercom, an elevator, and lots of other stuff you would 't expected to find as original fixtures in many houses a century old. 

The designs here are gorgeous, flowing curved and straight halls together through oval, circular, square and rectangular rooms that build out of each other like fractals. The music room, past the 1880s Steinway and the old harp, has a mesmerizing Mt Hood view. The turkish smoking room has unbelievably ornate ceilings. The built-in service areas and cupboards in the dining room are nicer than most freestanding furniture I've seen. The kitchen floor is like nothing else I've ever seen. The furniture is a bit on the fussy side for the most part, but the thorough details of innovation here are amazing--the 100-year-old master shower has 8 shower heads. These people really knew how to live. Or at least they really knew how to hire people who could show them how to live.

Finally, this house represents a manifestation of a lifetime's work. The printed materials available here make it clear that Henry Pittock made a ton of money helping out the community (they briefly mention that he owned many businesses). He was spry and fit until late in life, but still lived only five years here after it was completed. Still, it's hard to imagine many finer houses anywhere in 1914. The legacy of the self-made man who carved out a life for himself and his family in the west can't be expressed any more opulently than it is here. You get a sense of the home life lived, you get a sense of life for the other half, you get a sense of the times, the design, the style, the architecture.

And most of all you get a sense of what gets built when someone builds whatever he wants wherever he wants. And it's here for you to enjoy. It's amazing. Just go.

text: Great view of Mt Hood, very nice drive up to the Mansion. It was decorated for XMas from all over the world ,very pretty!

text:
I decided to walk up the hill and it was all worth it when I got to the Pittock Mansion.
There are great views of Portland and the house grounds contain lots of flowers and plants. The tour inside the mansion is a must and the staff are helpful and friendly.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
So I took my roomie up here for her first time.....new to Portland and it was a perfect Fall day for it! It was clear and the sun was out. 

If you are visiting in town, this is a must do. You can either take one of the many hikes up or drive to the top, depending who is with you.

Enjoy!

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
Great place with a fan-frickin-tastic view of Portland and Hood/St. Helens in the summer time. I have picnicked there on dates before. And, no, I haven't gone on the tour yet, but maybe someday. I love the fact that this huge mansion went so far downhill it became a squat for homeless people in the 80's. 

That just sums up the 80's for me. In some ways, I hated the 80's. You listen to NRK these days and DJs play all the best indie songs from the 80's and then tell you they were on the radio. Wrong. Radio stations played crap like Huie Lewis and the News in the 80's. You had to really hunt to find good music. I ended up becoming a DJ just to learn about cool bands in a sea of musical swill that was accepted as good music. Even back then, I knew the majority of music in the 80's would be disposable. I mean, how many Phil Collins songs can you take? Yes, he was okay in Genesis, but he turned into a corporatized jag ovv. 

Anyhow, how did I get off on that bizarre trajectory of revolting nostalgia? The Pittock mansion rules even if the original owners (duh, the Pittocks) were annoying tools as human beings that thought they were better than most of humanity aside from their annoying tool/friends. They had an army of carpenters and masons build one helluva cool mansion on a truly awe inspiring plot of land overlooking Portland and the mountains beyond. Heh, heh, I said "masons." Speaking of which, 33 is the loneliest number that you'll ever do, not 1.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text: The mansion itself is beautiful, but he staff are uppity snobs. I found out they had an old working elevator and I wanted to go for a ride in it. They told me NO bc they don't want to use it unless they have to-which is understandable. HOWEVER apparently a lady on the second floor needed a lift down (medical reasons) and since the elevator was going up i don't see why I couldn't go with the lady operating it. The same lady that JUST told me no- trotted over and hopped inside the thing closing the door with me standing on the other side of the door. And WENT UP. But I wasn't aloud to go too?? Sorry but I don't look like a terrorist nor am I scraggly or overweight. I don't understand their opposition to me riding it. That really turned me off of the place and my overall opinion is not a good one OF the staff. The mansions cool, not as big as you would think, and the views from inside looking out are amazing. No photography with flash aloud inside.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text: As a local, I don't feel like a mansion TOUR is necessary if you're visiting. But boosting the local economy and putting money towards a historical property is a really good thing...so if you're visiting, then please pay to visit. However, if you are a local. HIKE it, walk it, look at these beautiful city views and the stunning garden. Pittock Mansion is a must see for anyone visiting Portland. It is near Washington Square Park, The Rose Garden & Japanese Garden, so you can do all 3 in one day and really see some stunning places. I love how parking is easy and free and how you can get some of the best views of the city here. Absolutely love it!

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text: Super cool spot to spend some time and definitely worth the small fee to do a self guided tour through the mansion. The views are free outside of the building but I do recommend getting an Uber to and from if you're visiting and don't have a rental. They do have water fountains outside of the building but food and drinks are not allowed inside so plan accordingly.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text: The mansion itself is truly amazing, the view is nothing short of spectacular, one of Portland's most beautiful treasures. We'll be back again.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
If you're in Portland this is a must!  Don't miss out on this really cool place to visit, check out and admire.  The views are spectacular and of the whole city!

Bring a jacket since it gets really windy/cold outside!  

The house is so amazing, you've got to see this yourself.  It has such an interesting feel and the beauty of it is beyond words!

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
If you like history and enjoy going to historic places, I'd say this is the place for you.  This house actually reminded me of the mansions located in Newport, Rhode Island.  The mansion was very extravagant and I enjoyed looking around at the decor and outside architecture.  

You can walk around the gardens for free and it overlooks Portland.  Tickets to visit inside the house is about $9.  I highly recommend that you stop by.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
I didn't really get to see the mansion but I was able to see the grounds around it and the view of Portland from the hill. It's amazingly beautiful and spectacular. 

I came to visit the grounds on a rare and sunny day in Portland. It was quite a romantic view. Just seeing the greenery and what Portland is about. A thriving city surrounded by the beauty of nature. The air is so fresh and garden was as lush as ever. 

It was worth a drive just to take pictures of the exterior of the mansion, as well as the views of Portland from high up. I can't describe the serene and calm vibe from the gardens. I still have the pictures framed in my room and people always give me compliments on how beautiful the pictures are. Imagine how beautiful it is in real life if it looks that great in photos.

A must see if you're visiting Portland. Also, quite romantic when you are there with a significant other.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text: I visited Pittock Mansion about 20 years ago. So much has been improved since then. I would highly recommend visiting the mansion. If you cannot afford the admission to see the interior then feel free to walk the grounds and see the beautiful landscaping and the wonderful view of Portland.

name: Pittock Mansion

text: I enjoyed my visit during the 2016 holidays. The mansion is beautifully decorated, and a pianist was playing Christmas music. I enjoyed the hike to the mansion on the Wildwood Trail from Lower Macleay Park - a great workout and a lovely stroll.

name: Pittock Mansion

text: This place is pretty awesome.  Beautiful building and landscape, and have a view of Mt Hood that will make you mesmerized .  Come with a blanket and some wine & snacks and enjoy a beautiful picnic while staring out to the city and mt hood.  Life is good!

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}

text:
So glad we stopped by.  The views are spectacular. We came on a beautifully clear day and could see Mt Hood, downtown, and the river. 
The mansion is a self guided tour and worth the $10 admission price.  It is nicely restored and signage is informative. 
The grounds are beautifully maintained.  This was a highlight of our Portland visit.

text: Mansion was amazing. But to be honest my favorite part is the view of mount hood. The tour is free and the lady who gave it was actually very knowledgeable. I would recommend to others.

text: Full disclosure, I did not actually go into the mansion itself but I walked around the surrounding and vista points. I loved the Forest Park, it was a shaded hiking trail type of area where I could get away from the heat wave for a bit. The garden and patio areas were also very clean and well maintained. Be sure to check out the view overlooking Portland!

name: Pittock Mansion

text:
Great view of the city - FREE
Hour tour - $10
I definitely could have done without the tour. $10 to see architecture and opulence I've seen in any number of mansions for the early 20th century - only half as large.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text: I went on two separate occasions. The main part deserves more stars as I took a guided tour of the mansion itself and it was great. The docent had a lot of good information and I loved getting all the details about the rooms. I especially loved the old fashioned kitchen. BUT a friend from out of town just took the tour UNGUIDED. What? Same price! Not nearly as valuable. So, my advice would be to ask when you book whether it will be docent led, and don't go if they can't confirm that it will be. This last time I sprang for the $19 (whopping) Behind the Scenes tour. This was NOT worth the money. You go in a circle underneath the house and you get to see the background operational part of the business (whoop-te-do) complete with messy desks and many messy storage rooms. The guide pointed out boxes of xmas ornaments and all the fake trees lined up for the upcoming decorations for xmas. Oh, and you witness the mega old boiler and old internal vacuum system. The guy we had was long winded on not-so-interesting anecdotes. Then we went up to the top floors and got to see... wait for it... more storage rooms! And, ugly offices, and "under the rug where you can't see are old roller skating tracks from the kids of the time". An empty outdoor patio with old patinaed metal trim and roofing tiles. Really? $19 I wish I had spent somewhere else.

name: Pittock Mansion

text: Having been on different house tours, I enjoy the self tour look and dawdle type, which fits the Pittock Mansion to a tee.  The grounds are gorgeous and there was an interesting glimpse to the history of Portland because of the background given on the family.

name: Pittock Mansion

text: This place is just beautiful! The exterior and interior of the house are impressive, and you can't beat the breathtaking views from the majority of the rooms. You can see the Portland downtown skyline from this house.  It is definitely worth a short drive from Portland. The grounds are gorgeous with all of the plants and flowers labeled.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
Visited this historical mansion a few times, but the last time i opted to relax under the sun on the Mansion's rear grounds where one of the best views of Portland awaits you. 

You can be done touring the mansion yourself for an hour to 1.5 hr, it's not super big but it is quite interesting. You will have to pay 

$8.50 Adult fee 
$5.50 Youth fee (ages 6-18)
$7.50 Seniors (65+)

to go INSIDE the mansion itself, but wandering the outside grounds of the mansion is FREE and easily accessible to anyone.

I happen to go during a sunny warm spring day and I saw a lot of families sitting on the green grass having picnics near the blossoming cherry blossom tree, their backs to the grand mansion and gazing at front at the amazing view of Portland and Mt. Hood. Here's a pic http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pittock-mansion-portland?select=dJg1HxWejgU90NSFyhhr0g#91ic6xYu_IE4ztzHSgxVeQ I would have put a pic of the portland view but their are much clearer pictures here of the city than what I got on my phone. Lol! Anyways, I opted for one of the several benches planted around the grounds of the mansion, reading a book while I wait for my sister and friend finish touring the inside of the mansion.

So, I suggest grabbing a sandwich from a yummy sandwich shop like Kenny & Zukes downtown or Lardo and head up to the Mansion (about 15-18min drive from downtown) and enjoy your lunch up there with a view. I definitely plan to take Portland newbies up there next time I visit the city. 

*For hours and other info go here http://pittockmansion.org/visit-the-mansion/
*They have restrooms inside and outside of the mansion
*The mansion's gift shop is quite small and pricey. 
*Parking is free but could be a pain in the weekends

text: Really beautiful. How they keep it up the way they do, I have no idea, because it truly is something to see. And spotless. The walk-in shower, the ceiling radiator. All of it was pristine and worth the visit, and so close to Downtown Portland.

name: Pittock Mansion

text:
Nested just to the west of downtown Portland, this mansion and the grounds are a perfect spot to get a birds eye view of the city and the picturesque Mount Hood in the background. 

Even though it is a bit off the beaten path, the gps easily got us up to the mansion. 

The best part about this place is that with the exception of the mansion tour, the grounds are free to walk around and explore. They even have a few hiking trails for those who want to dig deeper. Parking was also free. 

This is a good option if you want to take an hour out of your time in the city to catch a very unique perspective.

text: Wonderful  piece of Portland history! The mansion built long ago but well maintained, you can take a tour inside to find out about people and their lifestyle who lived here. The lawn area has fantastic views of Portland city with Mt Hood ahead. A nice place for small picnics, hikes and walk. Serenity defines the place very well.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}

text: I/we loved this place inside and out. We spent about 1.5 hours. Inexpensive admission. Got lots of information about the Pittock family, the house and the items inside, and their contributions to Portland. The views as everyone else has said are beautiful/amazing. Definitely, worth stopping by. Staff was very nice also. The shop had some cute items too.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}

text: A fun thing to do while in Portland. It's close enough to the city on beautiful grounds and the tour was so interesting. Edi ,our tour guide, did a fantastic job of providing the history of the home and founding family as well as the broader scope of what was happening in Portland at the time and in the nation. A+

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}

text:
This isn't my normal type of tourist attraction but we were really glad we went.  Actually we ended up there because we were driving up the road looking for a good view of the city, who knew we would find the best spot.  

We opted for the self guided tour and had a good time peaking around corners and checking out the bizarre bathrooms.  At first I wondered why 360 degree showers didn't catch on but after some speculation at the pipes, I think there is probably good reason.  

The best part is clearly the view.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
Built by Mr. Pittock, the originator of the Oregonian newspaper, for his family, the mansion is beautifully restored and a fascinating slice of turn-of-the-century life. The tour of the mansion was interesting and laced with all sorts of little anecdotes about the family that made their presence seem real and almost tangible in their family home.

Furthermore, I was unprepared for how beautiful the grounds and view of this mansion would be. The view has to be one of the best of the city, with foliage, water and buildings taking your breath away. We went around 11am and the morning light seemed to light up the whole landscape. It's a must see in Portland!

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text: The view is FREE.  The back lawn of Pittock Mansion provides the absolute best panoramic view possible of downtown Portland with Mt. Hood behind.  Donate to the mansion by touring it if you have the $$ and time but, if not, DO take a camera or telescope.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
My wife and I were on vacation in Portland and this mansion is a MUST SEE!

Pittock was a newspaper publisher and built this house in his later years of life overlooking Portland. If you don't go inside the house, go up to the location just for the overlook of the city. Amazing! We were there at first when it was misty and it was pretty, but when we exited the house, it cleared up and it was AMAZING!

The self guided tour in the house was about an easy 45 minutes, since they have lots of plaques describing each of the rooms. My wife and I love these old houses, so we were in bliss.

It is about 15 rooms in total (A major guess) but it would have been fun being a kid in there with all the forest and landscape to explore.

A real treasure.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}

text: A must see spot if visiting the area, with some of the most breathtaking views of the city you can find.  Gorgeous lush gardens surround the estate and you can even take in a picnic on the back lawn after touring the historic house and it's museum quality art and lush interiors and antiques.  Very interesting and informational too!

In the property. A small fee to get in for a self guided or guided tour. 
The house is huge and well maintained. Although there' s only a few pieces of original furniture and fixtures. It is nice to know the history of the Pitttock generation.

name: Pittock Mansion

text: Amazing views and trails around the mansion, not sure if it was worth the tour inside the mansion. I'm not a huge history dude, but I was with my mom and we thought we'd check out the the inside during our one day visit. It was quite interesting to see the history of the place, and how people lived back then. If you have free time, I'd check it out, but definitely go out back for the amazing view of Portland.

name: Pittock Mansion
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}
categories: Tours, Museums, Architectural Tours, Venues & Event Spaces, Landmarks & Historical Buildings, Hotels & Travel, Arts & Entertainment, Community Service/Non-Profit, Local Services, Event Planning & Services, Public Services & Government, Historical Tours
text:
I have lived in the Portland area for most of my life, but I had never been to the Pittcok Mansion.  My husband and I went for the behind the scenes tour and our guide was G√∫y.  He was amazing.  He, himself, had been coming to the Pittock since he was a child and he is an expert about this house and a historian in general.  After our behind the scenes tour, G√∫y discovered the regular tour would not happen for a couple of hours, and he was finishing his shift, so he offered to take us on a private tour.  We felt very fortunate for that.

As for the house itself, It is beautiful and quite grand.  We also loved the grounds.  We want to come back when the mansion is decorated for Christmas too.

I would love to see a haunted tour.  I think Portlander's would dig that.  We came for the tour because of the ghost stories and the date being so close to Halloween.

text:
So hubby and I wanted a mini date night but we're on a budget and decided on this place because it's close. We were very surprised by the quality and size of the shrimp dinner that we ordered to share. It came with about 9 shrimp,  fries salad and garlic toast and there was plenty not only for us but we had some to take home too. So two drinks and dinner later we were out only $17 for date night because we allow ourselves $5 each for video poker and I made enough to cover tip and one drink. 
Not only that but our wait person was Vicki and she really delivered on personality and service

This will be a go to place going forward.

name: Cleary's Restaurant & Spirits
attributes: {'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'HasTV': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': True, 'breakfast': True}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False'}
categories: Nightlife, Sandwiches, Seafood, Restaurants
text:
Why would anyone keep going to a restaurant  that they clearly don't like?  Force of habit, apparently...  I , on the other hand, actually do go there for the food - simple fare, but plenty of it, and a 'spaghetti special' that would easily feed two folks of normal appetite.  I normally take half of it home - two meals for the price of one!

Cleary's is the 'go-to' choice for my wife and I when we want a night out, close-in, no-hassle parking and available seating - rarely have to wait to be seated.  The fact that it is right up the street from our business, CrowningLori Hats (product placement!) is a major plus, too.  

Most of all, however - and more frequently - I enjoy their breakfasts.  Quick service (normally), good selection, crisp hashbrowns (a must for me), and low-priced Specials.  If 'oldies' backgrouind music at low volume doesn't bother you, you just might find the clean, low-key atmosphere of Cleary's to be to your liking... just tell Julia (with an 'a') that Kevin sent you...

name: Cleary's Restaurant & Spirits
attributes: {'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'HasTV': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': True, 'breakfast': True}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False'}
categories: Nightlife, Sandwiches, Seafood, Restaurants
text:
When it comes to eating, napkins are probably not something that most people think much into; but as a child, they were my saving grace.  For YEARS I use to line my pockets with napkins and nonchalantly slip all the food I didn't like into them, only to promptly flush it down the toilet or stuff it to the bottom of the trash can after meals (Shh...don't tell the starving kids in Africa!).   I had this process down to an art, and for all my parents knew...I was eating my dinner like a good little girl.  

This lovely memory crosses my mind whenever I have to go to Cleary's.  As I glance over the menu (praying that it changed), I wish nothing more than being able to revert back to my younger days  and bring back the ol' napkin trick.  

I am trying my hardest to find something positive to say about this place, but it is proving to be difficult.   If my memory serves me right, the chicken strip salad was tolerable (meaning no napkins were involved)...but seeing as I have been a vegetarian for 9 years, I am kind of S.O.L. on that option.  I suppose their plain salad is pretty safe, but a plate of lettuce is really nothing to write home about.  Everything else semi vegetarian friendly is deep fried and/or pocket shove-able. 

Overall, something about this place really creeps me out.  Maybe it is the bazaar decorations that range in themes from Sesame Street to Elvis Presley, or maybe it's the freaky Cher albums I somehow always get stuck sitting by.  Whatever it may be, I didn't like it as a child and I really don't like it now.  

If you like gross grease food...ignore my bias ways and see my sister's review below.  If not, have a napkin handy if you ever find yourself stuck here!

name: Cleary's Restaurant & Spirits

text: Great breakfast, big and not too expensive. Spot on service and nice spicy Bloody Mary's for 3.50 on Saturday and Sunday. They have album covers on the walls and we enjoyed the nostalgia of seeing which ones we'd owned. Looking forward to coming back!!

name: USA Performance Auto
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True'}
categories: Oil Change Stations, Auto Repair, Tires, Automotive
text: Reliable and honest. I've been here many times, but recently I had what I considered an emergency. Turns out it really wasn't, but Brett didn't demean my panic or treat me like a girl who doesn't know anything about cars (I don't, but that's beside the point).They took me as a walk-in and the cost was WAY less than I anticipated. A good reminder why I continue to come back.

name: USA Performance Auto
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True'}
categories: Oil Change Stations, Auto Repair, Tires, Automotive
text:
These guys are great. From the owner, GM, and all the mechanics. Drew and Tony know their autos. I have been bringing my families vehicles to them for over a year. They are upfront with cost and what they could find once they start the project. I am told what they recommend on future maintenance up front and in my budget. 

Example was my daughters car. They did what I asked them to do for a fair price. When we picked it up I was told that that they had done also changed a couple minor parts while they were doing the project to save on labor cost and future problems. That is why i continue top go back and send friends to them.

I have never wrote a review before today. However this is how highly i think of Drew and all the guys at the shop. Customer for life.

name: USA Performance Auto
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True'}
categories: Oil Change Stations, Auto Repair, Tires, Automotive
text:
USA Performance Auto is an auto service repair shop you can trust with mechanics that are knowledgeable, professional and friendly. As long as I live in Portland, I am never taking my cars anywhere else.

I have learned indispensable knowledge from Brett at USA Performance Auto after he has serviced both my 1999 Jetta and 2005 Vibe.  It's reassuring when your mechanic can explain the issues happening with your car in a way that a non-mechanic can understand. I am very grateful for his honest advice and am looking forward to only "healthy" cars in my future!

name: USA Performance Auto
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True'}
categories: Oil Change Stations, Auto Repair, Tires, Automotive
text: Honest Mechanic, quick and affordable!  Our Toyota broke down while visiting Portland. We checked Yelp for mechanics and got a few quotes for price and estimated time to complete the job. (We were checking out of the hotel that morning). Drew was friendly and helped us get back on the road in record time and 1/3 the cost quoted by others. He could have taken advantage of our desperation and instead he treated us like family. I wish we lived in Portland so we could have a trustworthy mechanic like this! Thank you Drew and USA Performance Auto!

text: Very mediocre. The Yumm sauce was whatever and the prices were not that great. I ordered the "Original" and there was nothing original about it...Just a bunch of salty rice in a bowl with avocado, tomato and beans. Meh. Next time in in a pinch for lunch I'll walk to one of the better, cheaper food carts up or down a few blocks.

name: Cafe Yumm!
attributes: {'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'Caters': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': None, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': None, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'None', 'Alcohol': "u'beer_and_wine'"}

text: Stoked when I started working downtown so I could snag my favorite bowls for lunch. This place has been a constant disappointment and most recently sent me back to work with a bowl of half rotten vegetables with a bug in it. They are out of condiments half the time and this whole place is disgusting in general. Overpriced trash compared to their other locations. No one in the entire Standard Insurance building office eats there.

name: Cafe Yumm!
attributes: {'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'Caters': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': None, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': None, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'None', 'Alcohol': "u'beer_and_wine'"}
categories: Vegetarian, Vegan, Sandwiches, Soup, American (New), Fast Food, Restaurants, Wraps, American (Traditional)
text: I just went in for an early lunch. There was one other person in the entire restaurant. I looked at the menu and went over to order. The cashier NEVER even looked at me. She proceeded to ask her coworker to help her enter a grub hub order, asked the lady waiting to sign a receipt. I waited. No acknowledgement- not even a glance from either employee. They continued stocking items, grabbing vats of beans etc. I just stood there. It was literally bizarre. They avoided even looking my direction. After an awkward amount of time I left. I'm not asking for immediate service - but even a glance to acknowledge the human being standing right in front of you and an "I'll be with you in a moment" and I would have waited patiently for quite awhile. I'm writing this from the Chipotle a block away.

name: Cafe Yumm!

text: I have always had great food and great service! They are super fast but most importantly delicious! Thank you Cafe Yumm for being so amazing. P.s I love that you can buy the yumm sauce to take home. Super good on vegies!

name: Cafe Yumm!
attributes: {'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'Caters': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': None, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': None, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'None', 'Alcohol': "u'beer_and_wine'"}
categories: Vegetarian, Vegan, Sandwiches, Soup, American (New), Fast Food, Restaurants, Wraps, American (Traditional)
text:
Uniquely, I have been to the Seattle, beaverton, and this location on morrison, all within about 2 weeks. The first two rocked.  (Seattle was perfect. ) today my wife and I stopped in and ordered the veggie burger and some sides.  After paying, they told me that there was only one veggie burger left, which obviously became my wife's.  After going through the line again to figure out what I wanted I ordered a veggie sandwich and a tofu skewer - and had to pay an extra 2 dollars.  I don't usually need something for free, but at this point my family was waiting at the table wondering where I was - maybe just comping me the difference at this point would have been appropriate? The veggie sandwich was thin, filled with dry wilty field greens and julienned carrots. No slices of avocado, and the bread was basic orowheat. The tofu was very dry and underwhelming compared to the skewer in Seattle (which was awesome.) About 6 off duty employees hung at a table and gossiped and sang to music, which was fine but maybe there could be another employee at another register to expedite things?

The whole thing was mediocre. Veggie food and service in this town can't be mediocre. There are too many options.  - And you just can't run out of veggie burgers. - Mike.

name: Cafe Yumm!
attributes: {'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'Caters': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'WiFi': "u'no'", 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': None, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': None, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'None', 'Alcohol': "u'beer_and_wine'"}
categories: Vegetarian, Vegan, Sandwiches, Soup, American (New), Fast Food, Restaurants, Wraps, American (Traditional)
text: I didn't expect to like this place so much because it's a chain and so many of the pictures look relatively unappetizing. I was pleasantly surprised. Not only is the food wholesome, tasty, and vegan-friendly, it's also very affordable. The service is amazing too--how quickly and efficiently they churn out orders during the busy lunch rush. The jazzy bowl is by no means a culinary masterpiece, but it hits the spot and I even find myself craving it. If you order vegan, they give you extra avocado and veggies to make up for the cheese and sour cream! It's the little things. Yay, Cafe Yumm!

name: Cafe Yumm!

text: I've gone into Cafe Yumm! several times since the location near me opened, and always ended up turning back after having a look at the options. Finally gave it a try today though! It ah... Exceeded my expectations for disappointment considerably. At least someone else was buying so I didn't waste my own money on this.
