name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: Scenic Courtyard. Great Service. Wonderful Experience.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
I am in town visiting friends and needed one night in a hotel.  I picked this one solely because my credit union gives 10% cash back for staying here so I figured, why not?  

I needed to check in a couple hours before actual time so I stopped by just to see if it would be possible and sure enough they had a couple rooms (slightly different than my original reservation, but it's just me so anything with a bed and desk was just as good) available so I was able to check in when I needed.  The front desk staff was very nice, check in was super fast and easy. 

Kind of a bummer and frankly, ridiculous that they charge you $10 to park, but maybe its an Austin thing, I don't know... 

My room is clean and I have a desk to work on everything I need to so its sufficient.  Its definitely worth the stay for my cash back rewards I get for using my card.  I probably would have stayed somewhere that is more on my go-to list though if it wasn't for that.

It's sufficient for someone just needing a bed and not all the amenities and fancy attention.  There's easy access to I-35 and easy to get anywhere from here.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: Worst stay won't be staying again..If you stay make sure don't book room 424 it's next to exit door..noise is awful could not sleep at all..it's not worth 124 hard earned dollars to pay for this..I will be definitely letting management know about level of noise I had to go through..also room has no view but on garage..aghh not a good stay here guys if you book make sure your room is facing court yards it pretty looking inside then out..so disappointed !:(

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
Overall, I had a great stay. Next time I'll request a king bed instead, my bed was extremely uncomfortable making my 3 night stay seem more like 7. The grounds were kept clean, room was spotless when arrived and housekeeping did an amazing job keeping it up. 

Service was prompt and very professional. Their restaurant on site has a decent food and beverage menu. There are a few restaurants within walking distance too if you need to switch it up. The costs between the 3 were about the same.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
Upon arrival there was a dispute between the southwest airlines crew and the front desk. I was really uncomfortable. Basically, a crew member (who wasn't working a flight) wanted to ride the airport shuttle. The hotel told her that she would have to pay ten dollars. She asked, "So you're not going to let me onto the shuttle?" The front desk guy replied, "You can get on the shuttle, but it'll be $10." She just stood there, mouth wide open, and I couldn't blame her. I'm sure southwest airlines gives the hotel enough business so that a flight attendant can ride for free anytime.

The housekeepers leave opened soap on the shower, not in the box, which I find unhygenic. I realize the bar of soap is new, but I prefer to open my own box. I also find it a waste to have a new bar of soap every night.

The hotel is like a maze, centered around a courtyard, and on the bottom level is a pool. You can hear EVERYTHING going on at the pool because windowed doors face the inside courtyard. This also means anyone walking by can peep into your room. I kept my curtains shut the entire time. Of course the nights I stayed there were loud children playing in the pool past 10PM. I don't know if the pool ever closes, but screaming past 10PM seems a bit late. I cranked the fan up to drown the noise.

Getting to this hotel can be tricky. Google maps will tell you to exit (forgot the name) so that there really isn't enough time to get over. You should really take the 290 exit to give yourself enough time. If you miss the street to the hotel, you'll have to go around all the way again. The restaurants next door do not share a parking lot or have a way to cut through to a back road to get back to the hotel.

There is only one parking garage elevator and the tiny room in which you wait is HOT without air conditioning. I have lived in Texas all my life, and any hotel that does not have air conditioning inside, no matter where you are, is blasphemous. I kept the door to the hallway open until the elevator arrived. Since there's only one garage elevator for the whole hotel, good luck.

And speaking of the parking garage, make sure you ask where it is. Since my front desk guy was probably still perturbed by the flight attendant, he didn't tell me where it was. I ended up in the hotel employee lot, so I had to go to the check-in counter again and ask directions.

The WiFi didn't really work well the first night, and I had to have IT give special permission on all my devices. The phone call probably took about 30 minutes. You have been warned.

There's no Hilton Honors Lounge like the Columbia, SC location. The two free bottles of water for diamond members weren't in the fridge, so I requested delivery. I've probably stayed at 30+ Doubletree locations, and this was one of the worst. The only good thing about this location compared to others was that there was a fridge (but no microwave). But other than that, there's really not any incentive to stay here.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: The bar needs help.  The bartenders don't even know where anything is.  My husband order a Jager and Red Bull and the bartender pulled out fireball.  I told her no that's not Jager and everyone started looking for it.  They decided they didn't have it.  I order a glass of wine and she started to pour it in a glass that had lip stick stains all over it, she notice it and started to wipe them off with the wine in the glass, eventually she poured the wine into another glass because the stain would not come off. A new manager was trying to teach them how to do things, but they really didn't want to listens to him. Sorry Doubletree, but this is not the quality is staff I expected

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: Staying here at the Doubletree for work! The food was great and the room was very clean. The bartender J was fantastic. She was so friendly and personable! I would definitely come back to see J.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: Shouldn't be considered a 'Hilton' property... Lobby is super nice but the let down comes when you get into your room.  1960s carpet, 1960s couch, 1995 tube tv...  Have to pay for wireless Internet and no option for wired free Internet.  I'd do 1.5 stars if I could but I'm dishing out 2 because check-in was fast and the gentleman checking me in was from Wisconsin!

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
The room was OK, and the staff was friendly however the service couldn't have put us in a more awful position. We came back to our room after one day of our two day stay and our door was locked and we were unable to get in. We went to the front desk where they informed us we had been checked out. They had a erroneously booked our reservation for one day instead of two. 

After arguing with the front desk we were able to get our keys back and go to bed. After the trip was over they charged us $192 to check us back in to the room we had already paid for. When I called and attempted to get a refund, I was told I would have to call their accountant tomorrow to see about "possibly" getting a refund. I'm not an angry man, but this has me fuming. This hotel was not worth this kind of hassle. Avoid at all cost.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
I came here for the Texas School Social Work conference. When I went to check in the line had over 10 people in it. When I finally got to the front desk the staff told me that they didn't have rooms available. Their excuse was they have a lot of conferences going on and rooms are not clean yet. They gave me an estimate of 20 minutes to have my room ready. I am still waiting for my room 1 hour later. 

Poor service!!!!

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: Check in started off pretty rough without our room being ready but they did fix it after some wait time. They are overall friendly, clean & helpful.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: What a complete WASTE of money.  This hotel is OLD and crickety.  Popcorn walls on the 6th floor.  A/C unit that is so loud that it will keep you awake all night.  OLD SCHOOL HOTEL and OLD finish-outs (like a $79/night hotel at most)...the 6th floor rooms look NOTHING like the photos online.  Our room was borderline GHETTO.   Definitely FOR CERTAIN not at all worth the almost $300/night premium we were charged.  The ONLY reason we were forced to stay here was because the entire town of Austin was booked up for ongoing weekend events.  Otherwise, we would have left immediately.   The room that we were cursed with (room 678 on the 6th floor) wasn't worth a lick.  We even had to call downstairs to ask for an alarm clock that wasn't broken.  Total nightmare of a hotel.   The bathroom was no better.   Low-grade finish outs, and high grade PRICE.   Will NEVER stay here again.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: Unfortunately, I did not stay here so my review is a bit different. Upon driving to get food, I passed Doubletree. I've stayed at a couple before and never had a complaint, but my favorite part will always be their famous cookies. The front desk staff greeted me warmly and guided me in the right direction towards their restaurant. They even granted me additional free cookies for the visit. They were all warm, fresh, chocolatey, and one of the best cookies I've had. Worth the price. Right off the freeway. Clean bathrooms. Helpful and smiling front desk.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: Generally ok experience. Check in was a little slow. But the front desk is very friendly. A little smell in the corridor and the room though.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: We had a great stay at this location! The staff was very attentive and welcoming! Although it is one of the older locations, it is just as pretty! The rooms are spacious and clean. It is located 15 to 20 from just about everything!

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: My wife and I decided to take a long weekend down to Austin to see the sites. Booked this hotel a week earlier using HotelTonight. It was a decent drive and we didn't get in until around 9PM. Sadly the hotel had accidentally? not booked our room when HotelTonight sent them our information....The city seemed pretty booked up for the Austin Marathon so they ended up finding us a room at the Fairfield Inn about 7 miles north on 35. They ended up refunding our money (refund currently pending...) and paid for our stay at the Fairfield Inn..I would probably have given them 3 stars but the Fairfield wasn't very comparable to a Doubletree and all they had were rooms with double beds.  Although DoubleTree did remedy the situation, I would hesitate with booking with them again through a secondary booking site as they do not seem to follow through with those reservations.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
The hotel is in a convenient location if you have a car. Parking however is $8 and you can go in and out as you please. Valet is $14. 
The room is very spacious, the bathroom is alright. A little bit on the older side though. There are some good restaurants within 5 minutes driving. Overall it's a good stay but that's it, it won't blow your mind.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
I went here for a convention of zine writers and I had a brilliant time. We stayed up late, chattering to one another. I was pretty much the youngest guy there and that was strange, but entertaining. We talked and enjoyed ourselves all night. 

And the hotel was only OK when I think back on it. 

The rooms weren't big by many standards, but they would probably qualify as standard to some. I didn't bring a computer, so no testing the WiFi, but the beds were comfortable, which was a nice plus. THe meeting space at the bottom was very basic, and there wasn't a lot of staff around to help us out. 

The restaurant thing is expensive and has weird hours. We had a banquet in there and the fixins were OK, a Mexican Breakfast they called it. I think it was their regular breakfast with tortillas, but I can't be sure. 

There's not a lot around. There's the Fuddruckers behind the hotel, the Pappadeaux across the street, a Denny's down the way and that's about it. There are other hotels, for some reason, but mostly it's a wasteland. 

Would I stay here again? For a convention, yes, but otherwise I'd probably choose one of the cheaper ones around.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
I attended a 3-day conference here, but had no need to stay overnight since I live in the ATX, so this review is hotel as meeting venue. 

Ick. 

For one thing, finding the place is ridiculously confusing, even for someone who has lived here for ten years. Take the wrong turn and you're doomed to be stuck in the horror of south I-35 parking lot traffic, as there is no way to turn around for another long, crawling mile or so. Yeah, taking the wrong turn was my fault, but, well, anyway. 

I finally got there, late, on the first day. After finally finding a parking spot in the garage, which was free (good for 1 star), I found the meeting room, but was confused, since there was a large contingency of TX DOT folks milling around the area, yakking and visiting vendor's booths. I had to go back to the lobby and ask the concierge where our meeting was. Oh. right smack dab in the middle of all this. 

So the meeting room. Large, nice, cold air-conditioning (a good thing this hideous desert fall), but windowless, drab, and really in need of a makeover. Our purpose was to read, read, read and review testing items for the new state exam (high school reading) coming up. So reading for hours and hours in a room with no natural light and nothing but fluorescent lights glaring down upon us makes for tired eyes (and cranky educators). 

Meh. 

Day 1: I was pumped that breakfast and lunch would be provided for us, but disappointed at the results. On that first day, they served roast beef with brown gravy, baked potatoes with all the trimmings, and a mediocre salad. Really? A super heavy lunch for people who are sitting around all day? I opted for the roast beef, which was cold (why??bring it out hot, folks, and the chafing dishes might keep it warm) and pretty much flavorless, and the salad, which was just OK. 

Day 2: I came in early for breakfast, which consisted of (cold) scrambled eggs, flour tortillas, roasted potatoes and onions (good!), and some grated cheese and lame salsa. Wow. Around 11 a.m., I snuck out of the room and took a peek at the lunch offerings - barbecue chicken, mushy potato salad, liquid cole slaw, white bread-and decided on my escape plan: walk next door and have some fish at Pappadeux. Good decision. 

Day 3: I tried the breakfast again with the same result. The meeting was over by noon, so I didn't sample the hamburgers that were available. 

After reading the other reviews, all I can add is, WAKE UP, DOUBLETREE! You're keeping Austin Icky.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
Called to let them know I would be late and they took ten minutes to pull up my reservation and put in a note. The person on the phone seemed really out of it. Not a good start.

But, the hotel was beautiful and breakfast was good, even though hotel breakfasts are always overpriced. Not a fan of the location--impossible to walk anywhere but the Pappadeux's next door. People at the front desk weren't super knowledgable about my event travel, which I needed a schedule of, but since it was organized through the hotel I can't fault them for that.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: Doubletree by Hilton is a good hotel for the price. Only complaint is that when my friends and I checked into our suite, there were gnats flying around. Other than that, my stay here was good. Staff was super friendly.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: Location is good, but it's a good thing they are starting a renovation because this place really needs it.  I like the room size and the front desk staff are helpful and friendly.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
I don't know where to start. They really make it look good on Expedia but when you get there it's a sham. the lobby is nice but that's all there is to it. First place where I've been where they give you warm cookies and a liter of water when you check in.

Anyways, walking through the hallways to your room looks like going to a run down motel. We got the King sized bed with the tub. The online pictures again made it look fancy. the fixtures in the room was nice but you can't get over the fact that it's an old like old hotel. i mean com'on they couldn't afford to put in a counter to put your toiletries in the very large bathroom. It was literally a sink and a mirror, a toilet and a tub. Yes it's re-modeled it nicely but new parts doesn't make it functional. 

The Shower curtain maybe fancy but again, not very functional. it's tiny and even if you're careful you'll get the floor wet making it slippery.

Next, the area where the have the ironing board is just leaning against the shelf in a tiny cove in the wall next to the bathroom. There isn't even a door to enclose it. The 70s style shelf had the iron some hangers and a hair dryer that was stowed in a bag.

I'm disappointed that it's even associated as Doubletree property. I've been to many that displays an luxury style hotel that's moderately priced.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: I absolutely love this hotel. It is beautiful and clean. The entire decor, floors and high ceilings just make it better. Our suite was spotless,cool and with a nice view. The Cookies are hot and yummy. My honey loves this place as well. We have hosted two major events here and have turned out beautiful. The staff are polite and courteous. I am surprised to see the reviews stating this place is "a dump and such" but I suppose the people writting the reviews are used to staying in the same high priced exclusive hotels were royalty stays..lol...I love the Double Tree and recomend it to everyone. Toodles!

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: Worst hotel experience in my life very rude staff and not a very good stay. Will not recommend to anyone.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
This is a very nice hotel and I would definitely here again when in the Austin area. The hotel is well kept and the staff members are courteous and helpful. The rooms was spacious and updated. It included a newer showerhead and flat screen tv. These are two items that I consider to be icing on the cake and value added beyond a comfy bed and good insulation (as not to hear the conversation in the room next door). 

The only drawback to this location is parking. While the gate is broken and no monitors your entry or exit, you are asked upon check in if you have a vehicle on property. If you say yes, you are charged the $10 daily rate if you self park. So, plan accordingly.

It's next door to Pappadeauxs and Pappasitos. Both are within walking distance to the hotel.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
This hotel is very nice. It's cheaper than other Doubletree hotels just a few minutes closer to downtown. For a weeknight, we were able to get a rate right at $100/night after tax. If you have a car, you might as well drive an extra 5 minutes here and save yourself $20 or more per night.

We arrived and wished to check in and nap about 15 minutes prior to check in, which they were more than happy to accommodate. They also gave us cookies, which is just awesome. There were 3 dispensers in the lobby with citrus infused water (orange, lemon and lime) and I went back to these frequently during my stay. The lobby is very nice and spacious, though a little far from the garage. 

If you park in the garage, as far as we could figure out, you have to go down to the first floor of the garage, walk outside for about 20 feet, go in a side door and walk past the bar and restaurant, go through the lobby and then to the bank of elevators in the lobby to get to your room. During our stay, the gates were up in the garage and parking was free the whole time, so I can't complain too much.

We had a courtyard view room with 2 queen beds and it was large enough for 3 of us to spread out comfortably and have our own corner. The staff was very accommodating in replacing the feather pillows and comforter on one bed with hypoallergenic linens. The bathroom was a good size but the sink (yes, only one sink) is behind the same door as the toilet and shower, so sharing that space with family, mixed gender friends or non-significant others is a little tricky. The towels were plentiful and seemed larger than most hotel towels.

I didn't have cell service in the room, but I think that's a lack of T-Moblie service in Austin more than the hotel's fault. WiFi was decent. I was finally able to connect with the code "lobby" after a few tries on their confusing WiFi log-in page. 

I enjoyed the courtyard and pool area a lot. I spent a few hours relaxing in the hot tub and lounging in a comfy chair by the pool -- and this was in mid-December, mind you, so these facilities are kept open and clean year round. The courtyard area is huge and there is a lower level with some nice seating areas and then the upper pool area. It's completely enclosed by the hotel (which is in a nice Spanish style), so I didn't have to worry about seeing or hearing traffic.

We had a few drinks at the bar, and surprisingly, the drinks were reasonably priced and tasty. There was a menu on a chalkboard when you walk in with nightly specials. This included a $6 martini and a $5 cocktail and perhaps $4 beer. There are a few cozy little seating areas -- the couches around the working fireplace were very comfy. It is open until 2 AM on weeknights, which was great for our group. 

Checkout was easy -- just drop your key in the box by the elevator. I swung by the front desk on my way out and asked for more cookies, and they gave me some, which was a nice note to finish on.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
I would like to give this place a 3.5 stars, because for what it was, it was great. I stayed at this hotel  for 4 days on business travel and I really enjoyed myself. My room was huge, it felt cozy, the hotel was never really loud or crazy, and overall the staff was very pleasant. There was even a loungey singer and 2 piece band playing on Thursday night to go right along with the chill vibe.

The old spanish decor was right up my alley, with a touch of historic grandeur.  I also could tell the place has undergone some major renovations, but preserved the old look. My room was completely renovated, and my classmate confirmed she saw some construction workers down the hall in another room.

The parking garage was somewhat easy to navigate, they offered complimentary wifi with the code 'lobby.' and there were tons of little nooks to sneak in some web surfing, almost felt like I was in a stately library. I loved that part! If you order room service, splurge on the blackened red fish with creamy avocado sauce and you wont be disappointed! Its seriously a crime that I don't have a picture to show you... but it was amazing. take my word for it! 

Overall, good job to the Hilton for renovating a hotel while preserving the character, and bravo to the nice, unintrusive staff.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
Yowsers...this place needs a cosmetic and management makeover!!!

The outside of the building is gorgeous and interesting.  The inside looks like it is straight out of the 80's!!!  The rooms/suites are nice and spacious, however, there is so much wasted space in the rooms.  The furniture in the rooms is worn out and the layouts just don't make a whole lot of sense.  The hallways are beyond hot and there is only 1 bank of elevators in the hotel.  The hotel is set up like a square with the middle cut out.  If you are not staying near the elevator bank then you have to walk the length of the "square" to get to the elevator.  

The employees were just...odd.  I can't say they weren't nice...just odd.  For example:  One morning we walked down to breakfast and told the host "2 please".  He responded with "You want a table?".  We responded with "Uh, yes, for 2 please.".   He says nothing further to us and waives for us to follow him.  He walks us to a table and points to it.  The waitress says something to him and he waives his hand at us as if saying no and points to another table.  We ask him "You want us to sit here?".  He points again to the table and walks off.  OKEY DOKEY...very strange.  Our odd encounters at this place are just too numerous to mention in this review.  However, the waitress at breakfast...I believe her name was Mary Lee or Mary Lou???...heard our complaints and did her best to make up for the strange customer service we had been receiving.  She mentioned they were overbooked, undertrained, and busy.  

I don't think I will be returning to this hotel, even if the staff gets retrained and the interior receives a makeover!!!

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
Pros: the staff when we left was very polite and pleasant as well as the gentleman that brought us extra pillows in the middle of the night and the gentlemen at valet.
Cons: the lady that checked us in did not seem like she felt like working and we definitely felt it. We usually stay at Marriott hotels and enjoy the warm personalities every time we come and go, this hotel had a hotel that was so big that it seemed to lack that comforting feel of personal service.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
What a hidden gem in Central Austin!  We recently had our intimate brunch wedding here and we couldn't have chosen a more perfect venue for what we wanted.  We used their lovely room that holds about 100 people (called the Dover's Room) that is attached to a romantic courtyard.

The Wedding/Catering Manager (Hannah Watkins) made this such a breeze for us!  I could seriously gush on and on.  There was never a moment that I had to question her or the team's expertise!  They were always on it!

Pros:
Pricing
In house catering (RIDICULOUSLY GOOD)
Gluten free options (They provided gluten free options for our brunch)
Intimate setting
Centrally located (Not downtown, but close enough for guests to uber it over)
Lots of free/included decor options available
Free goodies (go to their wedding open houses!)

With weddings becoming more and more expensive (especially in Austin) I wish more people knew about this venue and all of its fabulousness.  Great option if you want something intimate or medium sized and don't want to spend all of your soon-to-be married money on your wedding. ;)

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
Nowhere near SXSW, if that is what you are in Austin for.  You can't escape horrifying traffic on Interstate-35 if you have to get downtown.

Rooms are dumpy and in need of an update.  Rooms have a hallway door and window/door that opens to interior walkway and courtyard -- meaning you can't open a window or your curtains because people are walking by.  Newspapers left at the doors in the interior courtyard walkway blew around all night, making a ton of noise.

Food for lunch yesterday and breakfast this morning was uninspired.

Free Wi-fi is a plus but there's not much else to recommend this hotel.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
Horrible. Why?

Mediocrity at its best...sorry customer service....bugs everywhere in our room...from the bed to the restroom. Communicated the issue and we were given a tin of cookies!?! I'm done! Oh! Housekeeping...HA! Like non-existent! Had to call sooo many times regarding this! Not worth it...if you don't believe go and see! But if you have sense...please go somewhere else...

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: What a horrible place to stay. The elevators are so wonky, I thought they were going to break every time we got in them. Parking garage is terrible. The parking spaces are so freaking tiny that there is no room to get out of your car. Someone was having sex in the garage today...wtf? Like girl you really need that "d" so bad you couldn't wait until you got to the room...eww. We were supposed to get 2 queen beds in our room, but got full size beds. So we couldn't sleep in the same bed for 4 nights. What the hell Hilton? You are supposed to be a hotel of luxury and that is what what we got. I doubt I will ever stay at another Hilton.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: very clean place, very friendly staff. stayed overnight and had a wonderful experience. close to papadeaux and papasitos

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
I came to this property for a business conference for a couple of days. this is one of the older properties that must have been acquired by double tree at one point or another.  The location of this place is actually pretty good. Off 35 and 183. Less than 10 minutes to downtown without traffic but busy enough to take 25 during rush hour. There is no free parking but 10 dollars a day is actually not a bad deal at all.
The room was nice. It even had that fresh clean smell to it. Being in the travel industry makes me suspicious of that but ehh I made do. The Internet inside the room wasn't too bad. Don't expect super fast either though.  The bed was comfy and toiletries were not cheap. So not a bad deal at all.
The conference room was actually always cold so not bad. The food was your usual and nothing to write home about. The restrooms were clean and working so that's a plus.
The hotel had a nice veranda area where we had our reception. It was nice, open and drinks were pretty strong. All in all a good time indeed.
Didn't get to spend much time at the pool. It was a nice cozy area and seemed like fun. The breezeway that lead to the pool were a nice surprise as well.
Overall a good property for the price and location.  Will come back if I find a good deal here.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
Plus:  Quiet AC, clean rooms

:  Far from the airport and downtown, staff seems unhappy, confusing room signage.    

Pool area is intelligently located in the courtyard-which helps you to forget you're on the freeway.

I didn't eat this time around, I'll update next overnight.

It'd be 4 stars if it weren't for the repeated avoidance of employees today.  I just needed to drop something at the post around the block and the bellman seemed stressed and defensively told me off about not having time.  After asking a series of questions, I finally found out that I could just leave it at the front desk---but I had to push against a lot of resistance and when I went to drop it, the desk staff allowed other patrons to cut in front of me even after seeing I was there.  

In the hall, I politely said hello and held the door for a cleaning employee whom ignored me.

Now, my crew and I are in the van on the way to the airport.  For the first time in 8 years of flying, were being completely ignored and unacknowledged by our (young female) van driver.  I mean, to the point of extreme awkwardness.  She stood in the entrance way looking impatient.  My crewmate, "time to go?" She says nothing and stares outside blankly, walking away.  She grabs the bags.  I say, "thank you", she won't even look at me. She had the windows down and AC off and pretended not to hear the pilots ask if it wasn't working and if she could help.  (meanwhile were all roasting in uniform as she gets the window breeze). Finally the captain leaned forward to ask, she turns it on without looking at him or saying a word. The other asks if it works better with the windows up, she silently rolls the passenger window up.  

I didn't pay for this stay, (my company did), but if I had---I'd dispute my payment.  I don't know if it's circumstantial, management issues or what, but this stay has involved too many negative encounters to pay good $ for.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: No doubt the hotel is beautiful with that comes inconvenience. The garage is a huge hassle if you don't take valet. Program for parking gate didn't work for 2 entire days, it was quite an inconvenience every morning. The curtain and lamp were broken, glad they fixed it after complaining. Then the elevator to the garage was broke and under maintenance. 3rd day the restaurant's credit card machine was broken. Everything broken at this place. 2nd day I couldn't sleep because of some on and off noise. Being a diamond member- I'll never return to this property.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
We stayed here in December 2011 for a wedding and booked via Priceline. Overall it was a great experience. The lobby is nice and well-appointed. The staff were very courteous and helpful, my sons enjoyed the free cookies!  The rooms are a little outdated but ours was clean and comfortable and we had no problems with it at all. The parking garage is dark and creepy but other than that it isn't an issue. 

It's not a 5-star resort but if your looking for that then clearly you are looking at the wrong hotel. However, if you're looking for a moderately-priced, clean hotel with great staff then this is your place. It's conveniently located to 35 & 290 so it makes getting around the area easy.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: Extremely disappointed with this Double Tree. The price I paid and the room I was given was not equivalent at all. There was no microwave or fridge. The carpet had a very old smell. This was an older hotel but charging new hotel rates. The staff was good. But the actually room itself was not up to standard. I have stayed at 4-5 star Hotels and this was definitely  not a 4/5 star hotel. I will not visit again#disappointed

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: This place is old but nice the outside room furniture is worn and out dated. The in room furniture is a little more modern but the bed is hard. The best thing about this place is the free cookies. And it sits right next to pappadeax's

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
I stayed at a couple different rooms in this hotel It was hit/miss. The entire place could use a remodel, but I guess it is fitting for the 290/35 area. Just an older hotel. 

Food was mediocre. For breakfast I ordered sliced fruit, it looked like it was left overs from Walmart Produce. In room Wolfgang Puck coffee was excellent, but the maids often forget to leave creamer.  I also ordered fish tacos with shredded cabbage. The cabbage must have been left over from the last week's business conference, because it was flimsy and looked like it was dehydrated purposely. The fish tacos should have been called "overcooked breaded fish flake tacos with too much pepper". they were nice to bring me some jawbreaker onion rings with it though.

Rooms were boring. TV was limited. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room service was only available until 11pm, and then they recommend you call "Pizzaland" (yuck, review to come).

Parking garage is reminiscent of a 1980's B Horror Film setting. 

I almost want to give it a 2 star rating, but I will reserve that for my review of Pizzaland, which sucked much more, but it was better than getting jabbed in the eye with a stick.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
As an airline employee, I have stayed at this hotel several times before. However, after this last stay, I am reconsidering my choices. The check-in was great as was the food and the female bartender. They (both females( were professional and polite.

The cons: The bald valet male employee should be replaced and/or suspended for his actions. I was not scheduled to leave the hotel (what we call our lobby time) until 3:50 PM. However, I had told my crew that I would leave for the airport at an earlier time and meet them there. I arrived in the hotel lobby at 3:15 and asked the hotel desk employee (female) if there was a earlier van that I could take to the airport. She stated that one had already left at 3:10 and that the next airport shuttle was at 3:50. There was a van parked in front of the hotel entrance. She said that I could ask the valet drivers. I thanked her and told her that my crew had previously been informed of my decision to leave earlier if I could. I exited the hotel and was met by a hotel van driver who said that he could drive me to the airport. I informed him that I was scheduled to leave at 3:50 and that MY 2 OTHER CREW MEMBERS WERE ALREADY MADE AWARE OF MY DECISION. He loaded my luggage and then entered the van. He hesitated and asked if the rest of my crew was joining me. I responded that they would not be leaving the hotel until 3:50 and that I had chosen to leave at an earlier time. He exited the van and said that he had to make sure that no one was left. Keep in mind that the only other van was scheduled to leave the hotel at 3:10 and that the 2 PEOPLE WHO WERE SCHEDULED ON THAT VAN HAD LEFT WITH THAT VAN! NO OTHER VANS WERE SCHEDULED BETWEEN 3:10 AND THE NEXT VAN WHICH WAS 3:50! I waited in the van. Suddenly, the bald male valet employee opened the van door and asked me where the rest of my crew was and if they were going with me. I responded that they were not scheduled to leave the hotel until 3:50 and that I had told them yesterday that I would be leaving earlier. He responded, "are you sure?". he stated that he was going to check to make sure that the rest of my crew was not being left behind. I waited a few more minutes in the van while three valet employees discussed the van times. I exited the van and entered the hotel. At this point, I could see that I was dealing with the Three Stooges. I asked to have my luggage removed from the van and explained to them that if my wanting to leave earlier was so confusing to them that I would take my scheduled van. They continued to state that they were only making sure that none of my crew members were being left behind. THEY WAS NO OTHER SCHEDULED VAN!!! As they continued talking, the bald male employee began laughing at me as he was talking to the first van driver who was going to take me to the airport. He told him not to pay me any attention and that I was just being rude. very professional attitude to one of your hotel guest! I spoke with his Manager but no apologies were offered.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
Annoyance #1: this is not central Austin, despite the booking service (and the front desk) insisting that it's "north central." North central to the freeway, but not even close to central.

Annoyance #2: limited TV service on an old CRT television. Do they really make that much money on the silly game console attached? No Tour de France, no Women's Soccer, the two biggest sports events this week, but you can see adult channels. What century are they in?

Give them points for a beautiful pool. At over 100F outside, however, I'll enjoy viewing it from my airconditioned room. And I liked the cookies. Won't make me less annoyed when I get up tomorrow morning and can't watch cycling and have to find the bar and hope I can see the USA soccer team.

I'm not sure they can even call this Austin. Maybe "Freewayville"....

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
You can't prove to me that your staff exists. I was there two days and didn't see a damn uniformed soul except for all the terrifying cosplayers.

It's okay, I wanted to hide too.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
This Doubletree location had a wonderful staff.  They were very helpful and kept offering cookies!  I was so addicted to the cookies...

If you are towing a vehicle...this is not the place for you.  Ended up parking in the back of the hotel with the truck and trailer.  If you don't tow something, there is plenty of parking in the parking garage though.  Alot of friends were staying at a neighboring hotel which is why we stayed here...didn't want people annoying me all night! lol

The rooms are nice and elegant. Lots of room and that makes it definitely more comfortable!

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
Stayed here for 3 days and I have nothing but good things to say.
The hotel lobby is beautifully furnished and upon arrival we were greeted by very friendly and helpful staff.  
The breakfast buffet was awesome, and our room was clean with the exception of the toilet. It appeared someone poured some type of liquid in the toilet and it splattered on the seat. Since it was a small matter I cleaned the seat with anti-bacterial cleaner myself.
The location is within walking distance to a row of various restaurants such as Pappadeux (directly across the street), Chili's, Pappasitta's, etc.
My husband and I will definately recommend this hotel to our family and friends coming into town as well as use it for ourselves on a weekend get away.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: I have been to the restaurant/bar in this hotel several times and I always have Hope Small serve me. She goes way over the top and above and beyond! How can a server be this good and nice every time? My food order is always right and my friends are very high maintenance with their drinks! Hope acts like it is fun to serve us, I personally would NEVER want to serve me and my friends! Please go see Hope if you are staying at the hotel or drop by anytime, but ask for Hope!

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: Really great atmosphere and decor, extremely courteous and professional staff. 4 stars would be my actual rating  for this hotel but I'm giving it a 3 for unnecessarily charging for parking. I understand if I'm downtown and real-estate is premium but...clearly this isn't the case here. Not a big deal and probably a corporate thing but it's clearly a deliberately misleading revenue generator. Would still recommend to anyone looking for an affordable option in the Austin area for business or pleasure. Great value and I would have happily paid $12 more for a room without them slyly slipping it in as you're checking in...

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
On the positive side the courtyard is pretty.

Hotel is dated and the floors seem to have been redone at different stages with the upper floors being the last. My parents room on the 3rd floor was much nicer than mine on the 5th with its mold in the bathroom. 

They charge for parking although there are ample spots. It's a bit of a maze finding your way from the garage to the front desk. 

Breakfast is wholly lacking. Our waters were forgotten. The food took over a half hour and it was not that crowded when we arrived. When the food did come it was lukewarm from sitting under hot lamps. I ordered chocolate chip pancakes. Instead of being told they were out of chocolate chips and asked if I wanted something else, I was given a plate of dried out pancakes w a dried out strawberry and a side cup of Hershey's syrup. Right.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
Overall, this hotel isn't bad.  Room was nice and the bed was comfy.   Main complaint was with the wifi.   You can get the free wifi in 8 hour blocks or you can buy "premium" wifi.  Don't know what the exact difference is.  But the free version was not good.  It was okay for surfing but don't expect to stream any Netflix on you laptop or iPad.  
Also, make sure you get your warm chocolate chip cookie when you check in!

text: Horribly over rated. Made reservation for a 'king size' bed at $200+ and got a fucking whore slouchy queen. Ripped off

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text:
This place is easy to get to from the airport. The hotel itself is quite pretty but like many hotels in TX, they blast the AC at an ungodly rate. I'm freezing and it's close to 100 degrees outside.

The meeting rooms are fine. The food is fine - nothing stand out but certainly good at feeding a crowd. Customer service is very good. Heaven forbid you are hungry between 2 and 4 pm as there are no options except crossing the road to Pappadeaux.

There is a small gym which works for a quick work out but no spa options for nails or massage.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: Came here for a conference (1 night), and stayed in one of the "renovated rooms."  Front desk professional was very nice and accommodating.  However, I would hate to see the unreno rooms.  OMGosh.  This place is raggedy.  panels of wall buckling outside the bathroom.  paint chips and cobwebs in the corners.  Big bulky TV that does not swivel easily to be viewed throughout the room.  A/C was set to 50 upon my arrival!!  50.  I turned it up to 72.  Give me a break.  Outside is cute, but that's where the delight ends.  It is a room, but not one I would 'choose' to stay in again.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin
attributes: {'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Hotels, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services
text: I had a bad experience here. So many things were not acceptable. The credit card machine reader at the cafe was broken, so you couldn't eat without cash. The elevator was broken. The front desk had zero process for getting guests for cabs. I called a cab and someone else took it because they didn't give the driver the correct name. This happened to me twice and I was an hour late for work! There are only 2 places to eat within walking distance, Cptn. Benny's is fried disgusting fish and stuff. My room was right off the one working elevator and it made terrible noise all night and kept me awake. What a bad first trip to Austin!

name: McKinley Chiropractic
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'AcceptsInsurance': 'True', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True'}

text: I really do not go to a chiropractor on any regular basis, but when I hurt, and to prevent taking pain medicine if possible, this is the man I see. He is not the cheapest in town, but in my opinion one of the best! When had twisted my hip and back, this is the man I turned to so I could get back on the taco and Q circle quickly and not starve to death!  Fantastic staff!

text: I don't like the closeness to the road or the east side vibe in general, but that IS THE ONLY NEGATIVE TO El Tio Chicken(pollo). Nice and friendly staff, very helpful, and they care about their customers. They gave me free chips so I could sample the salsas to make sure I like one or the other. The wait is as you would expect for a made to order place, but the wait is well with it.

text: Pretty solid food truck. I tried the Chicken Torta. I definitely want to go back and try the Carne Asada. The dude working was very pleasant and made my order very quickly. I would definitely recommend this place.

name: El Pollo Rey
attributes: {'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "'loud'", 'WiFi': "'no'", 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Specialty Food, Food, Mexican, Ethnic Food
text:
This is another trailer within about a mile of my apartment. I've been here twice over the past week and the food has been great both times.

When you pull up to the trailer there's a giant sign advertising "CHARCOAL GRILLED CHICKEN" that made the ordering process pretty easy for me. I got a half grilled chicken which came with red and green salsa, rice, container or red and green salsa, and charro beans, which looks like some kind of combination of pinto beans, bacon, onions, and what I assume is some chorizo for a grand total of $8. The chicken was absolutely delicious, lots of grilled chicken I've had in the past suffers from excessive burning or charring of the skin, but this wasn't the case here: the meat was cooked and seasoned exceptionally well. The skin wasn't super crispy, but it also avoided being gummy or chewy. As far as I could tell the half chicken was a breast, wing, and drum stick. The charro beans were delicious in their own right, and definitely added to the meal. The rice was pretty bland and a bit mealy, however depending on how you eat it: I made a bunch of tiny chicken tacos, you can almost forgive the mealy rice and it'll serve mostly as filler and what's left can be mixed with the charro beans to make some tasty beans and rice. If I hadn't decided to skip breakfast, this would've been enough to a meal and a half or two meals. Rice aside, for $8 this is steal for some seriously tasty chicken and beans.

I went back there tonight (01/31/13) and got the Tacos al Pastor. It was $7 for four tacos brimming with pork, onions and cilantro. The lady working the window asked if I wanted cilantro or onions as well as what kind of tortillas I wanted. So if you're not an onion or cilantro fan, I guess you can get your pastor tacos without them. Again, like the chicken above, the meat was well seasoned and well-cooked and onions and cilantro were fresh and tasty as well.  The salsa verde was hot and well flavored, but not as hot as I've had at a few other trailers, this may or may not be a good thing for you, depending on how blazingly hot you like your salsas.  My only real gripe with the tacos was that there was some grizzle kicking around on a few pieces of meat. Not enough to spit it out, but enough to give you a slight pause while chewing, which kind of detracted from an otherwise delicious experience.

I actually ran into Raul, who owns the trailer while I was leaving. He seems like a nice dude and remembered me from the other day, which is always nice thing. From what he said it sounds like he's only been in his current location for about ten days or so. The trailer itself is in the parking lot of a Mexican grocer and across the street from Jiffy Lube, and has a couple of covered metal picnic tables in front of it. The area is as clean as it can be, being stuck in the middle of a parking lot, I get my food to go, so I haven't sat there to eat. They take cash, and credit/debit cards, except for AmEx and maybe Discover (don't really remember as I don't use it). The ambience around it isn't that great, but the food is excellent and the staff and owner are friendly, and frankly, that's what matters.

name: El Pollo Rey
attributes: {'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "'loud'", 'WiFi': "'no'", 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Specialty Food, Food, Mexican, Ethnic Food
text: I love this stand and eat here frequently. The char cooked chicken is as good as you could hoped, the beans, rice and tortilla are wonderful and then the whole grilled onion is like a cherry on top, only it's not a cherry, it's an onion.  For under $10, you get a great meal which is enough for 2 and you're usually served and eating within 3 minutes. Why eat a McMeal, when you could eat at El Pollo Rey just as quick and better in every way.

name: El Pollo Rey
attributes: {'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "'loud'", 'WiFi': "'no'", 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}

text: While doing the touristy thing we happened upon this hidden gem. The portions are generous, the food was fast and fresh. The staff was friendly. The owner came out and visited with us. I had the half chicken and my husband had the carne asada and with 2 bottles of water our total was $18. Some of the best Mexican food we have had but the salsa was by and far top notch. It was spicy and a good consistency. Before we leave Austin we plan on stopping by El Pollo Rey again.

Went here with a friend today for lunch and was extremely impressed. The chicken was perfectly roasted and seasoned, served with hot tortillas, beans and rice. Very simple and perfectly prepared. In addition, the guys cooking for us were especially friendly. 

Looking forward to coming here much more often.

text: Decided to stop by and try the chicken.  It was delish. I'm usually not a big fan of Spanish rice and pinto beans, but El Pollo Rey's was sooo good. I only wish they gave a bigger portion when u order the whole chicken. The chicken is well seasoned and flamed grilled to perfection.  I will definitely be back. The spicy green salsa is nice and hot. If you can't handle the heat, I would suggest you avoid it, but I loved it.

text: El Pollo Rey is great.  I got hooked on Rey de Pollo at Pollo Brujo in Oaxaca and have struggled to find a replacement in the states.  This was the best I've had.  Good food,  Cheap ($16 to feed 3 adult men), and fast.  I will be back.

text: The best of these places I have had so far. Ive been to Pollo Rico, and others but this one really is the tops. I think a half chicken plus beans, rice, grilled whole yellow onion and two salsas plus tortillas was $8. Crazy cheap for good food. The beans rock. They were a charro treatment with chunks of fresh tomato and slices of jalapeno. Es muy rico! Its a trailer, just park where you can. The also have bottled Mexican cokes plus some other sodas (US and Mexican), plus bottled water.

text: we have been bringing our kids to this location for 4 years, since we had our first baby. even after we moved about 20 minutes away, we still bring our kids here! we absolutely love dr. prochnow! he is a wonderfully kind man who truly cares about his patients. the staff at the front desk and the nurses are also friendly and helpful, including the nurse you can call with questions anytime (love that feature!).

name: Austin Regional Clinic: ARC Quarry Lake
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True', 'AcceptsInsurance': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Diagnostic Services, Doctors, Internal Medicine, Pediatricians, Laboratory Testing, Health & Medical, Family Practice, Surgeons
text: Dr. Joseph Garcia is a Godsend. I recently had to have my gall bladder removed and he was completely professional, on-point with information, and advised exactly what to expect before, during, and after my surgery. I am eternally grateful to his expertise and knowledge. He got me through some of the WORST pain I have ever had in my life. (I've had some doozies.) This guy is my hero and I recommend him for your surgeon. My surgery on average would have taken 45 minutes. He used a robot and I only had one incision through my navel to have my gall bladder taken out. Healing time was much shorter than the average gall bladder removal and my surgery was only 35 minutes long. I was done before I knew I was in. FANTASTIC!!! I feel great! I gave him a huge hug and let him know this was going on YELP.

name: Austin Regional Clinic: ARC Quarry Lake
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True', 'AcceptsInsurance': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Diagnostic Services, Doctors, Internal Medicine, Pediatricians, Laboratory Testing, Health & Medical, Family Practice, Surgeons
text: I really cannot say enough about ARC. I have an absolute phobia of going to the doctor. I hadn't been for a physical in so long I was embarrassed to finally go. I have Dr. Brasher Giles as my OBGYN, and she is so cool, so relaxed. I am so devoted to her, I will never see anyone else for regular care as long as she is practicing. She really does make me feel empowered about my health rather than shamed that I had been so neglectful for so long. I look forward to seeing her every year. A few months ago I got food poisoning and had to go to the urgent care at Far West. That experience in and of itself deserves a five star review. I was sicker than I had been in years, and Dr. Bolton was so sweet, trying to get me in and out as fast as possible while still really trying to talk to me about my symptoms. Today I woke up knowing that I had strep. I called and was seen a few hours later. No matter which ARC I end up at, I always have such a good experience.

name: Austin Regional Clinic: ARC Quarry Lake

text: Dr. Date (pronounced Dotty) is wonderful. She takes her time, is friendly and thorough. I really enjoy having her as my doc!

attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True', 'AcceptsInsurance': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}

text:
On the plus side the staff and doctor were super kind, but that might have been because the patient got very sick after taking the medication they prescribed.
I had to bring my friend to her doctor, because one of the doctors prescribed Xanax and told them to take it to help sleep. It turns out my friend took too many, because she couldn't sleep, and she ended up having no memory of taking the pills, and took too many of them. The doctor ended up sending us to the ER for further evaluation/observation.

name: Austin Regional Clinic: ARC Quarry Lake
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True', 'AcceptsInsurance': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Diagnostic Services, Doctors, Internal Medicine, Pediatricians, Laboratory Testing, Health & Medical, Family Practice, Surgeons
text: I have a nasty upper respiratory infection, have been trying to handle it with multiple OTC medications to no avail. Finally I called this morning at 8 am hoping I could get seen today. I was scheduled an apt for 8:45!  Upon arriving, I checked in and only had to wait a couple of minutes to be seen. Dr Glaze was welcoming, friendly, and listened to me. I was out the door within 15 minutes, with my prescriptions called in!  Definitely recommend this clinic!!!

name: Austin Regional Clinic: ARC Quarry Lake
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True', 'AcceptsInsurance': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Diagnostic Services, Doctors, Internal Medicine, Pediatricians, Laboratory Testing, Health & Medical, Family Practice, Surgeons
text:
As a recent transplant (aren't most of us?!) to Austin in 2013 I opted for a primary care doctor at ARC Quarry location. Rather than a long review, which ARC deserves but I don't think you will read, I can say that everything about ARC is excellent; the care, customer service communications and patient information via online charts, referrals, ease of making appointments and outstanding quality of the doctors and medical staff! I have been to two locations - Quarry Lake and Far West - and both are excellent facilities.

Now for a stunner - I left a manila folder with personal information at a drs. office and it was forwarded to their medical records staff/office. I believe it would have had a 99.99% chance of being tossed out - not at ARC!!! Their records staff figured out it belonged to me and mailed it to me!!! Awesome!

I may be moving soon and will be VERY disappointed to leave ARC - one of the best medical care options I have ever had!  Bottom line, you can't go wrong with ARC!

name: Austin Regional Clinic: ARC Quarry Lake
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True', 'AcceptsInsurance': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Diagnostic Services, Doctors, Internal Medicine, Pediatricians, Laboratory Testing, Health & Medical, Family Practice, Surgeons
text:
Great location, great staff and office is very clean and comfortable.  I love that I can see my doctor and get my labs in the same office.  I have Blue Cross Blue Shield PPO and I haven't had any problems with my insurance.  

It's located in the Plaza side of the Seton NW hospital building.

name: Austin Regional Clinic: ARC Quarry Lake
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True', 'AcceptsInsurance': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Diagnostic Services, Doctors, Internal Medicine, Pediatricians, Laboratory Testing, Health & Medical, Family Practice, Surgeons
text:
OUTSTANDING Service!!!
I had an issue that needed immediate attention and Dr. Kravitz came through! I was able to get an appointment to see him the same day and then, he and his nurse spent a lot of time with me going over my issues, testing, and options. I was then able to get in to see a specialist the same day. Then, after 6:00 the same day I received a call from Dr. Kravitz himself to let me know about the results of my testing. I couldn't be happier with the service that I received from the staff at Austin Regional Clinic.

name: Austin Regional Clinic: ARC Quarry Lake
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True', 'AcceptsInsurance': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}

text:
I must review this place because I have been four times now! 

The staff--in person and on the phone--are extraordinary. I know that new medical assistants/check-in staff are being hired on a rolling basis but everyone I interact with is absolutely professional and helpful. 

My doctor is consistent and precise with his work and my nurse always knows how to make me feel like I'm not actually at the doctor.

name: Austin Regional Clinic: ARC Quarry Lake
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True', 'AcceptsInsurance': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Diagnostic Services, Doctors, Internal Medicine, Pediatricians, Laboratory Testing, Health & Medical, Family Practice, Surgeons
text: This is one of the best ARC locations in town. Staff here are very courteous and helpful and the wait times are always reasonable which I appreciate a lot. We drive close to an hour with our newborn to see Dr.Genrich because of the pleasant experience we had at this location.  He takes the time to listen to us and is very down to earth as friendly.  It's hard to find doctors these days that are genuine and patient to listen to our concerns. Will definitely recommend this location to anyone.

name: Austin Regional Clinic: ARC Quarry Lake
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True', 'AcceptsInsurance': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True'}
categories: Diagnostic Services, Doctors, Internal Medicine, Pediatricians, Laboratory Testing, Health & Medical, Family Practice, Surgeons
text: Dr. Dollar and the nurse, Anne, are amazing. I made a sick appointment in no time - except when I walked into the office I was in unexpected respiratory distress. The receptionist immediately recognized something was wrong and called the doctor & nurse. I ended up having a collapsed lung, and they called over to the ER to let them know I was coming. They were great at making sure I stayed calm - I know they don't usually see "emergent" cases but they did a really good job! I went back after I was discharged from the hospital and they did a very thorough exam.

text: I've been Dr. Bledsoe's patient for 10 years and she's been wonderful.  Her staff had always been great as well.  I'm usually in and out quicker than anticipated.

text: This place is totally delicious and reasonably priced, especially the happy hour prices. My girlfriend and I come here fairly regularly and keep coming back for a reason! We love that it's open late and has really tasty and innovative sushi rolls, in addition to an expansive and unique blend of menu items from many regions. I'm pretty sure there's nowhere else can you get this kind of quality dining after 10pm in Austin!

text: My husband and I came opening weekend and loved it. We were so excited because we finally had good sushi near us. Unfortunately, our last three visits have steadily gone down hill from the overall service to the quality of the food. We decided to give it one last try for happy hour yesterday and we will never return. My favorite thing on the menu the cherry blossom was not only underwhelming in the presentation, there was a huge shell that was only 1/4 filled with ingredients, but the taste was awful! The tuna was such poor quality that I couldn't even eat it.  No amount of sauce on that thing could save  it! We finished our drinks asked for our check and left completely disappointed.

categories: Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, Seafood, Restaurants, Sushi Bars
text: Complete surprise to notice this new restaurant in the strip mall that used to house Big Lot's in Oak Hill. Really liked the food-I had a red snapper special and my dining companion had  Ikan Bawal Bakar Pedas-spicy Indonesian pompano fish. We also had a monster sized spicy tuna crispy rice sushi appetizer. The dinner came out before the sushi so by the time it came, we were already stuffed. It didn't stop us from eating the sushi, though. Menu was a bit overwhelming but everything we ate was delicious. Service was knowledgeable and friendly. My only complaint was that on Saturday night, the live music was a bit deafening. Next time I will probably come back when there is no music. But I WILL come back! I love finding a great restaurant that is outside the overpriced overly precious Austin 'scene'.

text: I just moved to Austin from Southern California and it's hard to find a good sushi place here in Texas. I'm glad Eurasia exceeded my experience here in Texas. This place is so good, fresh, friendly service, clean, reasonable price & love their Hi 5'Sushi Roll  I recommend you to bring your friends and family here for sushi!

text:
3rd time here and food consistently excellent. Brought visitors from Taiwan, CA and local Austin coworkers today. 10 of us loves their foods and service.  Cali friends said one of best even compared to Cali restos. Sushi and Sashimi very fresh and just the right cut. Local Austinite loves the Kobe Beef Burger. Pempek, Calamari and sushi Rolls are everybody favorites.  Obama fav dish Baso is a hit.  Delish fried banana and ice cream dessert.  

Excellent. Keep it up. Will keep coming back.

text:
This is probably one of the most authentic Indonesian dishes I have tried overseas. Best of Indonesian modern dishes served here, for you to experiment and try. I was mentioning habanero during my visit to Hopdoddy, now I met its Indonesian sibling, here, in Austin. It is gooood

I ordered its' Nasi Bakar, Indonesian rice w/beef stew, vegetables of the day and wrapped in banana leaf grilled to perfection. And also Bakso Sapi Special, special beef meatball, an Indonesian style pho served with meatballs, tofu, scallions, shallots, roasted garlic, bean sprouts, celery, rice noodles and egg noodle. 

They are all good and worth trying.

text: Today we stumbled upon this Sushi restaurant. Oh my gosh! It was so delicious. We were in the mood for sushi but next time we will come for their Indonesian offerings also. The service from the sushi chef was great. The waiter was attentive. The sushi and it's presentation was amazing. See my picture. Also, at the sushi bar there is a "Live Sushi Cam" so you can see the chef prepare. Very fun! (I took a video too because the glass on the sushi display subtly flashed with different colors, very fun! But Yelp wouldn't let me post it!) Go try it!

categories: Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, Seafood, Restaurants, Sushi Bars
text: We ate at this place by pure coincidence today as we were in the area and were starving.  With that being said, glad we took the chance.   They boast an impressive menu of Japanese dishes, sushi galore, and seafood dishes as well.  The staff were friendly and it's really cool how they have a sushi cam on what they're making.   We ordered a sunomono salad with  meat and seaweed salad, both very tasty!   The sunomono was the best I've had. Ever.  So that was something unexpected.    We then ordered a weekend special roll that was baked.  Only one as we didn't want to eat too heavy due to lateness.  Sorry, the name escapes me but it was crab and crawfish.  It was good but too much sauces.   The place looked nice and modern, but I was underwhelmed with their restroom which seemed to not match the rest of the place in cleanliness and upkeep.  Overal, I'd try it again.

My wife had the sesame chicken.  It was the best sesame chicken I have ever had.

The spicy edamame was awesome and the so was the miso soup

text: This place is a hidden pearl! I hope it stays hidden because I want it all to myself lol. Awesome, awesome food. Pricey, but hefty portions and absolutely beautiful in presentation. My mother and I sat at the bar and enjoyed our experience thoroughly. We WILL be coming back! We had the spicy garlic edamame, ika san sai (squid salad), rainbow roll, and heaven & earth roll. You MUST order the heaven and earth roll, my god! Gorgeous and delicious!

text: This place seriously has the freshest most delicious sushi ever! We moved here 7 years ago from Southern California, and It truly has been one of the things we missed most until now!!  From the Salmon sashimi to the yellowtail to the tuna... it is absolutely amazing!!! The people who work here are super friendly, courteous , the same waiter has served us every time and is always attentive, fast, outgoing and kind.  The rolls are creative and just luscious. I can not recommend this place more! Seriously best sushi in Southwest Austin! Hands down!!

text:
We came to try out some Indonesian dishes here. We ordered ikan bawal bakar pedas and pempek ikan. It was just OK... price point is at the higher end for a smaller portion. Lots of room to improve on service quality. But they just opened so I think it is kind of understandable.
I can't help but to compare this restaurant to Twin Panda, another Indonesian restaurant up north. I still prefer Twin Panda to this because it is cheaper and has more variety.
