text:
Finally got around to trying this place after hearing nothing but great things over the past few weeks. We went Sunday night (Father's day) and half expected to wait but luckily we were seated right away. Eve. Though it was slightly busy the server got to us relatively quickly. 

Started with the Gyoza dumplings which were lightly battered and fried to perfection. For the main course we split 4 specialty rolls: Volcano, Heaven & Earth, Shaggy King, and the cream cheese crawfish hand roll. All of them were delicious but the Heaven & Earth was by far the best, with the volcano coming in a close 2nd place. 

Normally I can put down a good deal by myself but my date and I ended up leaving a few pieces on the table. Will definitely be back to try again. 

Side note: they have tv screens setup around the restaurant which allow you to watch the sushi being made even though you aren't at the bar. That was an interesting touch

categories: Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, Seafood, Restaurants, Sushi Bars
text:
I've dined at Eurasia three times. First couple of time even though the food being outstanding I was a bit confused. Perhaps the kitchen taking the name/initial vision too literally. You order an entree and get your choice of miso soup or potato chowder....or tomato basil. Your also ordering sushi at the same time. The pairings were too forced unable to blend seamlessly.

That leads to me to a comparison of Eurasia versus Elizabeth Street Cafe. Their menu is a play on France's occupation of Vietnam dating back to the late 1800's ending in 1954. Hence, French / Vietnamese fusion and ESC does it wonderfully. It's one of my all time favorites by the  powerhouse team at McGuire Moorman Hospitality.

Well, the soup debacle was resolved on a recent visit with my wife. Sadly, some opening lunch favorites were missing from the menu like the potato chip crusted crab cake sandwich. Also missing was the spicy tuna burger on the same bun cooked to perfection. Maybe those lunch options didn't sell that well? New menu has similar sushi options and playfully named entrees.

This visit started with the wagyu beef empanadas. Small portion (2 per order) with delicately baked exterior. We also had a sushi combo with spicy tuna and Cali rolls with Eurasia's artistic presentation. Speaking of, wife's flying noodles was about the most ridiculous waterfall of carbs stuck on a fork...then elevated again with two chopsticks. Obviously the noodles were a bit cold with the hot broth underneath as a remedy. Def a canidate for Reddit's "we want plates" thread. 

My dish (Mandarin Spicy Shrimp) was also good bites. Frankly, the old Asian restaurant (Dynasty Buffet) that used to occupy this space was so bad we called it the die nasty buffet. Eurasia is beyond a step above the previous tenants. Food is creative, sometimes over the top especially in the presentation category, and the interior is bangin' except for the broken bubble wall. Good service, sometimes a sushi cam, and this place is headed in the right direction.

text: First of all, thank you for moving into our neighborhood. It's wonderful to have a great Sushi and Indonesian place so close to home. The Sushi is on par in terms of freshness and flavor with the best places I've eaten. My only complaint about the Sushi (and the reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5) is that the rolls are kind of loose and tend to fall apart. This is the only thing this place has a little room to improve on. That said, I don't really care that much when everything tastes so good. They did a great job with decorating and seating. The atmosphere is really nice. The staff is so friendly and helpful, and I love the "live sushi cam" that allows you to watch them making your food. All around a fantastic place that we plan to make our new go to Sushi spot.

categories: Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, Seafood, Restaurants, Sushi Bars
text:
Major fan of this place. I've dined there three times during my trek to Austin, and each time I've had fantastic, fresh sushi and great service.

My friend and I normally sit at the sushi bar to talk with the staff, watch sports, and converse with perfect strangers. But there is a bar area and plenty of seating in the dining area. However, weekends you'll likely encounter a wait. 

My go to is usually their sashimi plate or the chirashi bowl - both filling. Don't skip out on their uni if they have it. 

For those not in the mood for sushi, they have other items on the menu: pork chops, chicken, Indonesian dishes, Greek salad... I even saw bolognese. Random, I know, but apparently my dining companion is a fan of the pork chop with fig sauce. 

Other reasons to visit:
They have reverse happy hour.
Currently, they offer Yelp Cash Back.

text:
The Indonesian foods at this place is dope!! Delicious and very authentic. I would say the best in Texas. The Pempek Ikan is the best!!! The down side is there is not that many options when it comes to the Indonesian food option. (Well this is not an Indonesian restaurant so I guess i cant really complain about it)

Note for owner/management: please give more training to the server and the busboy. They are pretty friendly, but seems like lack of training. Also, when i was there the place a little dirty. So probably work on this too. Other than that, I would be back!

text: HIDDEN GEM!   Awesome food and service.  We had a flaming sushi dish that might be the best in town.  Good saki menu also -   Had the mussels appetizer and it was also really good.  I live in Lakeway and it's about a 10 minute drive that was well worth it.  Don't let the strip mall location influence you.  No waiting - don't miss this one !  We will be back for sure many times

text:
My husband and I just tried to come for a late lunch and we were seated in a booth right away. We had a gentlemen come fill up our water after about a minute when we arrived, however did not say hi or ask about appetizers. Another couple came in, sat and was greeted by a waitress with short hair right away. We sat at our booth for over 15 minutes and were not greeted or received any service. Considering the prices of the specialty rolls as well as the alcohol, we would have easily spent over $50. It is extremely frustrating sitting in a restaurant for that long and not being greeted or given any acknowledgement. We ended up leaving, while all the servers standing around in the back saying "bye!" 
We ended up at Jack Allens down the road where the service is always amazing.

text: We take our sons out for sushi alot and had heard great things about this place and were  excited to try. There were several people working and 7 tables. We got there 10 minutes before happy hour ended. Watched waiters walking by. Finally, went to bar to order our happy hour items and told have to stay at table. Ordered at 632. I know this because watched my drinks sit at bar until 6:55. My son's girlfriend walked to bar and asked if she could just pick them up. Waiter told her "not in hateful manner. We didn't get but 2 of the 3 appetizers we ordered and the wrong drink. Oh well. We also got our miso soup 45 min later after sushi. Great food, really good, but be won't get exactly what you ordered and be prepared to WAIT and WAIT.

name: Eurasia Sushi Bar & Seafood

text:
Hidden in SW Austin is one of THE best restaurants and sushi bars in this city. It is a must visit place for all sushi and sashimi, as well as Indonesian and interesting twists on some American cuisine,

Sit at the sushi bar itself and watch the master's create their beautiful plates of incredible food. It is worth every penny, because the food is well-sourced and perfectly prepared.

text:
We dined at the sushi bar last weekend and it was fantastic! The sushi rolls and sashimi was fresh and flavorful. My 6 year old daughter gobbled up the raw calamari! The sushi chef was very nice and even made her a carrot butterfly oragami- which she actually ate on our way out!
Wine was pretty affordable and they told us after the grand opening this weekend they will implement happy hour. During soft opening they are offering 20% off entire meal including alcohol. Grand opening will be 30% off but not including alcohol. 
I'm excited for a new great place to Oak Hill!

categories: Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, Seafood, Restaurants, Sushi Bars
text:
My wife and I dropped by this place by random. We both know and enjoy sushi and wanted something light - because it was late. This place had a nice vibe and was pretty loaded. A lot of Sushi options - seafood anyone?  The staff were friendly and it's really cool how they have a sushi cam at the bar. You can see what they were making.   We ordered a sunomono salad which came with crab meat and seaweed, both very tasty!   The sunomono was different than most sushi places. It was a loaded with cucumber, and was cut; which gave a noodle like texture. It was good! We then ordered a weekend special roll that was baked.  However, only one - as we didn't want to eat too heavy due to the time.  We also had a baked crawfish roll - It was good too except, it came with too much sauce.   The place looked nice and modern, but the "too much sauce" is a near no no for me. Also, I had reasons to believe it was not to sanitary and this is why... Albeit they had a sushi bar cam, I notice the chefs didn't wash their hands in between ea. roll making and wore a thin transparent glove or no gloves.  I have family in the Sushi biz and I can say, that is a HUGE no no - so just for that... I have to rate it down from a 4 to a 3 star.

Overall, I would consider eating there again - IF I was in that area and craved a drink or Sushi roll.

text: Get the green mussel appetizer!  So saucy and delicious.  The ambiance is great.  Looking forward to next time.  Tonight we sat at the bar.  The drinks are well poured, the menu is not cheap but it is fresh and classy!  You get 100% what you pay for.  When you meet other restaurant owners here, you know this is a good spot.

text:
I'd been want nah to try this place out since hearing it was going in.   Went on a Sunday and the service and food was excellent.

Our group had a combination of appetizers, sushi and rolls.   The sushi was super fresh and delicious with some large pieces.  The spicy tuna roll and spider roll were delicious too.  We had some of the dumplings and spring rolls which were also excellent. 

So happy this place is on SW Austin.  Will definitely be back.

categories: Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, Seafood, Restaurants, Sushi Bars
text: By far the best sushi that I've had in Austin. Wish their customer service was a little better though. I ordered for pickup and they got the order wrong and so then I had to wait an hour at the restaurant for them to remake one of the rolls while another hot roll that I ordered that was made correctly was getting cold. The whole point of calling in was to avoid a wait and not only did I have to wait an hour to pick it up, I also had to wait an extra hour to get my correct order. There was no compensation for the inconvenience, even though the staff said they would discount the next order when I come in and would call me after getting that approved by the manager, but I guess the manager didn't approve it? It definitely made me never want to order for pickup again. Also, when my friends and I dined in, the server took a long time to take our order and provide us with our checks at the end of the meal. I would understand if it was a busy night but we came during the weekday during happy hour and there weren't many people inside. When I've mentioned getting dinner at Eurasia to my friends at random times their response has been "oh no not that place they have terrible service" which is a bummer because the food is fantastic.

text: We just left here and we really enjoyed our dinner. It was our first time in and the ambiance is great, upscale with a casual vibe. Sushi bar experience was great. Felix and others behind the bar were wonderful to talk to and the sushi was creative and delicious. The signature Eurasia roll was great. Can't say enough good things about the restaurant, it was a fun birthday dinner and we will definitely be back many times. Thanks so much! ~ Melissa and Mike (thanks Andre! We found you on yelp.;))

text: Great sushi and service.  Try the Tuna on Fire roll if you like it spicy.  Also, seaweed saladwas a generous portion.  I'll be back!

text: We tried this place for the first time last week.  The menu is extensive so there's lots of choices.   Everyone in our group ordered something different and nobody was disappointed.  The staff was so friendly!  Parking is easy and plentiful.   The Happy Hour looks great.  We will be back for sure!

text:
was there on a saturday at 5pm. I sat at the sushi bar. Great Happy hour sushi prices.
the bad: the mussels diablo were 1/5
the good: service very attentive
the 2 rolls i ordered phila roll and another were pretty true with not a lot of americanish add ons....good amount of fish, well balanced.
the excellent: ordered a house tuna appetizeer (for 20 bucks), excellent flavor and cut, beautiful presentation.
the tako (octopus) was excellent.
the seaweed salad was good with a strong sesame flavor, good amount.
i didn't order fancy rolls  the mussels, were not worth the price and 2 didn't open.  the flavor was NOT there. they were frozen anyways.

text:
The Saketoro was so buttery reminded me of my fav sushi spot in Cali on the peir.  All the food was suggested by my bartender named "RED" I told her what I was in the mood for and she took care of the rest.  It was all perfect. 

The ambience was a mix between classy in the main dining and contemporary cool in the bar area that was blocked off in a cool way from the fine dining section. 

I will be back again... this "the cool sushi spot" thats like a hidden secret.

text: Coming to an Indonesian restaurant and eating sushi? Prob not the best idea. Rolls where at a premium price along with the nigiri. Rice was falling off pieces and the flavor was lacking. At $90 for two people I was deeply disappointed. I can't speak for the Indo food but I would not recommend the sushi. Again it's a risk to eat sushi anywhere other then a Japanese or Korean establishment but the lack of quality at the price we payed was just inexcusable.

text: Large restaurant, with a full bar and large screen TVs. Great decor, friendly attentive wait staff. This restaurant offers more than sushi; Indonesian dishes, and even ramen. Interesting chef and daily specials. Quiet, with seating for groups. We arrived here for lunch and chose the lunch special roll choice A that includes two rolls each. Green Tea is nice, but filtered water would brighten its flavor. Tasty miso soup and generous portion of edamame. The Boston, spicy tuna, cucumber and "All in one" rolls very very well presented and very tasty. The owner came around to check on our experience too. Definitely coming back. Give it a try. In shopping center at the intersection of the 71 and 290.

categories: Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, Seafood, Restaurants, Sushi Bars
text:
I came for the Indonesian food which is hard to find in Austin (hard to find anywhere).  Give it a try!  Don't overlook the Indonesian food (makanan Indonesia) at this sushi place!  Each dish came with a different spicy sauce.  Great for spicy (pedas) food lovers!

AYAM BAKAR PEDAS - Great fried chicken!

BAKSO SAPI SPECIAL - Love pho but want a change?  Meatballs, something similar to a spicy Thai chili pepper sauce on the side, sweet soy sauce, and LEMON? fantastic.

NASI BAKAR PEDAS - Beef and rice wrapped in a banana leaf!

Going to go back and order every Indo dish on the menu by weeks end.

I'm glad there's a slightly more upscale Asian place with this ambiance outside Houston or Dallas.  I can't wait to come here for some drinks and sushi, too!

text: Had 2 types of sushi rolls, White Mountain and Firecracker, for my daughter and I, and my husband got the crab cakes breaded with potato chips, side of mango sauteed in some magic sweet sauce and mashed potatoes with asparagus.  We really loved our sushi but his meal was even better.  Our youngest got a Caesar salad and pork dumplings (named something else).  The miso soup is pretty darn good...what miso is suppose to look and taste like.  A little too fancy of a set up for us inside but we forgot all that cause too busy enjoying our food.

text:
First time to try this place, will come back and try one of the Indonesian dishes. The one dish that I tried was tasty but also pricy for what you got.

I sat at the sushi bar and despite them being a couple of feet away, I watched them work on the in-house TV!

The place has potential, and will try again.

text: Eurasia is a wonderful new addition to the Oak Hill area!! The staff is always very friendly and provides great service. They have a great happy hour everyday from 4:30-6:30, even weekends! The fish is always very fresh and delicious! We have been eating sushi for over 25 years and this is our new favorite spot because of the quality of the food.

text:
I ordered 2 choices of their Indonesian menu. Nasi Bakar and Ayam Kremes and those food have great flavor. I just wish they did not use the sushi rice for those dishes, however the other components were spot on. My husband ordered assorted of sushi, he likes the fatty salmon since it was tender and full of flavor though spicy scallop was the least favorite sushi he ordered since they put some sort of sauce on top of it that he did not enjoy too much.
The service was top notch, food presentation was beautiful! They even have a live cam of the sushi preparation table so that you can ensure your sushi is cut correctly and properly (ex : fatty salmon should be the best part of the salmon meat). 5 star for the diversity and quality of the food in this restaurant!

text: We had dinner for 15 people at Eurasia on December 16, 2017, following my son's graduation from college.  I could not have been more pleased with our experience.  I am fairly picky regarding my sushi, and this was superb.  The menu is extensive and has a variety of both Japanese and Indonesian food.  The Flaming Tiger roll was one of the best things that I have ever had.  The service was attentive and courteous.  I also found the prices to be reasonable for sushi and Japanese food.  I will definitely be going back.

text:
This is the worst sushi I've ever eaten. The hamachi roll was sour and spoiled, not traditional and had old and crusty wasabi with it. Other food: The salmon cake was swimming in a pool of sauce, making it soggy and gross. The spring rolls were old, frozen and I would bet purchased from their food supplier pre-rolled, served on a piece of brown lettuce. What a joke. I feel like I was robbed and am hoping I don't get sick from the spoiled piece of sushi roll.

I can only guess that the high reviews are coming from people who know nothing about quality food.

categories: Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, Seafood, Restaurants, Sushi Bars
text:
Food: 4
Service: 5
Ambiance: 5

Been driving by for over a year.  Have heard good things through some neighbors and stuff.  The unfortunate thing is the wifey is allergic to shell fish and frankly, I cannot even remember the last time we went out for Sushi.  Several years for sure.  It was a Saturday night, we were just hanging and running through ideas to eat out.  And boom, we just decided to wander over.  

Upon entering, it was surreal.  The place is much larger than I would of ever anticipated.  Well appointed, small waiting area, large busy neighborhood.  They have a Sushi Bar and a regular bar area.  We were greeted promptly and asked how many and I mentioned two and noticed no room at Sushi Bar.  We were directed to the main bar area, which was perfect.  Aqua blues throughout the bar, bubbling water walls and large open bar.  We sat ourselves down and were handed the book.  Or I should say the menu.  Special's were on presented and we whipped out the old flashlight phone app and went through them.  We ordered some Sake and started reading the encyclopedia which was the menu.  Our bartender was very helpful and suggested a few items, we let him know the wife is allergic to shell fish and we ordered a couple of rolls. Sofia, High Five and a California.  We thought everything was fine, a little heavy on the sauce for the High Five drowned out the flavors a tad, but nothing that I wouldn't order again.  Wifey was a still a little peckish and wanted to have some calamari.  Bartender mentioned that it was deep fried in the same oil as their shrimp, excellent catch sir, so he recommended the Spicy Jumbo Squid.  Very good suggestion and equally shared.

text:
This place is a hidden gem inside an old strip mall. I came here a few months ago, so this review may be a bit outdated. The food was good, especially the sushi. We ordered some Indonesian dishes, but they were not as good as the sushi. The mix of European, Japanese, and Indonesian food in an upscale environment is an interesting concept. 

There were some service mishaps, but I think that was because the place was new. I'd come back for sushi.

text: So Oak Hill is leveling up and has added new restaurants and stores to the shopping center at the Y. Eurasia is one of them. This may be my new favorite sushi restaurant. I posted a picture and the rolls we ordered. All three were spicy, and all three were delicious. My favorite was the Hottie roll. They have a bar. They also have what I will call a "sushi cam". So you can watch the sushi chef behind the bar on the TV's. The staff was very nice, and definitely took good care of us. It's very nice, so it'd be a good place to take a date to.

text: My favorite is the flaming tiger roll, served on fire. The interior decoration is nicely done, good vibes. I also enjoyed the Indonesian pho. I think this may be the only Indonesian restaurant in Austin maybe. Friendly professional servers..open till 12am in oak hill, which is awesome. Oak hill needed a place open late besides dominos. Will be back and definitely recommend!!!!!

text: I'm just so happy to have a new place down here that has great food, music, and friendly service!  Right now they're giving 30% off of the bill thru May 7.  The menu is quite large and if you have some picky eaters (kids or adults) have no fear they have all kinds of options!  I would list everything I ate but that was a lot and therefore a little embarrassing.   I will say everything was delicious and we will be back.

categories: Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, Seafood, Restaurants, Sushi Bars
text:
First visit with my honey and we where impressed by the interior appointment of this restaurant, definitely a good place to take your date. We like to compliment Andre the owner of Eurasia for a very classy place. This restaurant is located in the junction of State Highway 71 & 290, very accessible and easy to go to and lots of parking. 

We came to this restaurant because we peruse the menu over the internet and found that they serve Indonesian cuisine. We were just hoping to eat some nasi goreng but they did not have it on their specials.

Ah, so let's get to the food. Being an islander I started of with the grilled squid (this is a big squid) which was fresh and done to my liking. I ordered the sauce on the side because I don't like my food sopped over in sauce. Please note that most of the sauces here are very, very spicy holding up to the Indonesian way of preparing their native dishes. My honey ordered their game hen (AYAM BAKAR PEDAS) and she said it was very good. We also tried the Chinese water spinach which was excellent. For my main course I ordered the fried grouper and I found that I would have liked it to be more crispier (personal taste) and maybe served as a whole fish and not a fillet. My honey capped off her dinner with fried plantains and ice cream which she thoroughly enjoyed. We like to thank Johni who was our server and also Eurasia's sushi master Felix ( don't let the name fool you' he has worked in Nobu's in L.A.). We are returning tonight to try the sushi side of this fine restaurant.

I would also like to add that hey have an ample selections of wine beer & cocktails. The bar is very well appointed also and Hanna who's is the bartender is very friendly. This bar and the restaurant is open until midnight, if you want some great food before heading home.

text:
Stopes by for sushi was amazed about the selections that this place offered. Other than the regular sushi dishes, they also had unique Indonesian dishes with one one (Bakso Sapi Special) of them as Obama's favorite dish. 
I was sitting by the Sushi Bar, and the Sushi Chef Felix offered me a Bluefin tuna sushi as a sampler, and it was great. I ordered Waco Crudo, a seared Ono with a touch of Habanero oil. My other selection was Cumi Bakar Pedas, an Indonesian style grilled squid with spicy Indonesian sauce. If you like spicy food, this sauce will not disappoint you. 
The store is offer 20% off Soft Opening discount until May. Cannot miss this great deal.

text: My husband and I go to Eurasia for our Friday night date night and love it!  We sit at the bar and Chris serves us quickly even when it's busy.  My favorite is the Red Dragon roll.  We were disappointed this past Friday to see that the live music had been cancelled.  I'm sorry, but the fellow playing guitar was far better to listen to than Enya and spa music.  Bring him back!!!

categories: Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, Seafood, Restaurants, Sushi Bars
text:
Worth a drive!

I took a special lady who enjoys sushi out for a surprise birthday sushi dinner. We drove from Temple south to Austin and chose Eurasia off of a map of sushi bars, sight unseen.

Upon entering the restaurant the ambiance hit us; relaxing, casually elegant and it promised an adventure within. There was no wait for the sushi bar which surprised me. I explained to the host that I was a sushi snob and asked if they had a classicly trained Japanese sushi chef behind the bar. As luck had it, they sat us down in front of an older Japanese gentleman who they stated was classically trained in the Japanese style. When I greeted him in Japanese he was very surprised. 

At this sushi bar, you can order directly from the atamaesan or a server. We chose to order the classic way, from the chef. There was no hint of fish odor from the cases and I could see that they were clean and well stocked. I asked for a sashimi dinner assortment and told him to serve whatever he wanted. I told him some of the more potent dishes I liked so he would get a sense that there would be no mayonnaise, spicy sauce, California rolls or cream cheese allowed on our plates. We wanted authentic sashimi. He did not disappoint.

They have an ice crusher there at the bar that he used to fill a long dish with crushed ice with colored LED lights under the ice diffusing upwards to make the presentation excellent. The sashimi was placed in front of us artfully arranged, colorful, appealing, and very fresh. My date had never had the SABA before so I warned her it could be a little fishy. It was very nicely flavored in a vinegar-based marinade and the fishiness was not overpowering. She loved it, as did I. The food was truly excellent. All of the pieces were uniform and of just the right size. We ordered ponzu for dipping as most of the fish, except the SABA, had a delicate flavor. (Anyone who reads my reviews knows that when you dip everything in soy and wasabi, gee, for some reason everything tastes like soy and wasabi and I like variety!). The chef handed us little tidbits that he created on the spot that were wonderful (subarashi). The head atamaesan even had the kitchen tempura some shiso leaf (6 pieces) and charged a minimal price. They seemed interested and amused at the novel dish the gaijin asked for.

The bathrooms were elegant and spotless. Live entertainment in the form of an acoustic duet started at 6 and conversation was still possible as they were not too loud.

The GOOD - Just about everything. The chef explained that their restaurant had very few ethnic Asian diners and the tables were much more popular than the bar so there is almost always a seat available. The atamae bragged that the toro they served was always 100% bluefin tuna with no yellowfin or bigeye to be found.

The BAD - There were two of us and all the sashimi was served in threes; three saba, three sake, three toro, and three of everything else. Me being a gentleman as always made sure my date got to eat two of the pieces she liked and I hoovered up the rest. The assortment was basic with nothing to be found to duel with my taste buds, but since their clientel was not Asian, I can forgive that. No one would order the jellyfish or squid guts anyway, except me.

The UGLY - I honestly cannot think of a single deal-breaker at Eurasia. They were pretty good. For my tastes their assortment was a little un-challenging, but what do you expect in Central Texas where 98% of the people consider sushi a waste of good bait!

text:
Okay, this is a plea to this restaurant to fix something, figure something out, about your ventilation/exhaust system! I am a huge fan of the food and service, but oh my god you guys have to fix the air in this place. 

The first few times I visited I thought; "Wow, it really smell liked fried food, deep fryer type smell. I must have been sitting close to the kitchen." I got home, clothes wreaked of oil/fried smell. Had to hang them outside until I could wash them the smell was so strong.

Tonight, I stopped in and just placed a to-go order! I was in there maybe all of 5 minutes, 10 tops, and my clothes wreak again! The air in this place is not being circulated properly or the fryer for their fried food is exhausting straight into the interior air with no duct or external vent to the outside. SOMETHING is not working correctly or not setup correctly in order to not have this issue. I suspect it is something right around the sushi bar area. There are several small stoves and a fryer area (for tempura etc...) and that hot oil might be exhausting into the open air of the restaurant if it does not have adequate ventilation.

Please, please, please, get this fixed because everything else about your restaurant is great. I just can't come in there anymore until you fix the oil/fryer exhaust or air circulation issue, whatever we're calling it.

I've worked in restaurants and I've come home smelling like a restaurant. That's fine for your employees. Your customers should not have that experience.

text: Today we stumbled upon this Sushi restaurant. Oh my gosh! It was so delicious. We were in the mood for sushi but next time we will come for their Indonesian offerings also. The service from the sushi chef was great. The waiter was attentive. The sushi and it's presentation was amazing. See my picture. Also, at the sushi bar there is a "Live Sushi Cam" so you can see the chef prepare. Very fun! (I took a video too because the glass on the sushi display subtly flashed with different colors, very fun! But Yelp wouldn't let me post it!) Go try it

name: Eurasia Sushi Bar & Seafood
attributes: {'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': True, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'classy': True, 'casual': True}", 'CoatCheck': 'False', 'GoodForDancing': 'False', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTableService': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'HappyHour': 'True', 'Music': "{'dj': False, 'background_music': False, 'no_music': False, 'jukebox': False, 'live': True, 'video': False, 'karaoke': False}", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'True', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Alcohol': "u'full_bar'", 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': None, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': None, 'breakfast': False}", 'HasTV': 'True', 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'Smoking': "u'no'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'OutdoorSeating': 'None', 'BestNights': "{'monday': False, 'tuesday': False, 'friday': True, 'wednesday': True, 'thursday': False, 'sunday': False, 'saturday': True}", 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}"}
categories: Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, Seafood, Restaurants, Sushi Bars
text: It was my first time eating at Eurasia last friday, and i have to say I was really impressed. The facility is beautiful and has very good vibes. The young male host was very welcoming, and enthusiastic about the food. I was instantly greeted with a smile and an encouraging run down of the menu. He brought us to our table and handed us menus. 5 star host. The wait staff came swiftly and served us waters. Our server (sony) was very welcoming as well. When the sushi came out it was plated BEAUTIFULLY, and tasted even better. My only concern would be that it took a little while for us to get our check. My husband and i were confused as to whether we pay at the front. Other than that, the service was great, the food was great, and the live music was enticing! Great place! Highly suggested to any sushi and seafood lovers! Diverse menu, fresh fish, good vibes.

name: Austin Community College - Rio Grande Campus
categories: Adult Education, Education, Colleges & Universities
text: I think  this campus is awesome reminds me of high school, mixed with the crazy hospital off Terminator 2 lol. Lots and lots of hot woman everywhere.

name: Austin Community College - Rio Grande Campus
categories: Adult Education, Education, Colleges & Universities
text:
If you plan on taking classes here definitely strive to get classes before 9 AM if you want a parking spot! When the garage says "Lot full" they are being serious! 

They do have the best professors and amount of classes here, but it can definitely get crowded. 

Aside from the amount of people, I have come to like this campus.

name: Austin Community College - Rio Grande Campus
categories: Adult Education, Education, Colleges & Universities
text: Beautiful outside of building ... where my friend goes to college. I dropped her off the other day and was highly impressed. Easy to find location and central. Close to Clarksville

name: Austin Community College - Rio Grande Campus
categories: Adult Education, Education, Colleges & Universities
text: I have always liked Rio Grande Campus however, I am no longer a student.  I voted for the upgrade for the campus November 2014 even though the language in the ballot was confusing.  I have written another yelp review on ACC.  I will say that I find it mind bogging that ACC in their promotions state that they are in business for employers instead of students.  I guess that it splitting hairs but I think that this is pretty much the case.  It is interesting to me that I can no longer find ACC promotions. after I wrote this review.  The reason I stated this was because all of these agencies in power like TWFC and ACC brag about helping the employers instead of student/jobseekers. I did find the promotion on the page by ACC Highland Business Center.  So it is there.  I think when the college started out they were more interested in helping students make it instead of viewing them just as future employees. They especially talked about this when they were trying to get their property tax base approved

name: Austin Community College - Rio Grande Campus
categories: Adult Education, Education, Colleges & Universities
text:
Overall I have been part of the ACC machine (random student) for almost 10 years off and on. I've taken classes for xfer credit to big-boy universities and classes simply for the joy of being part of a class and learning something new. I've stayed on three campuses, and Rio is probably my favorite.

For Rio, the things I love most about this place are the professors I've had. Particularly in their History and English departments. In the past, I would skip closer universities to take these classes here I feel that strongly about what these faculty bring compared to the guys at other campuses.

What Rio struggles with are things like study areas, computer availability. The library is super cramped and if you need to jump onto a computer for something...good luck. It's a total free-for-all.

I've also had wretched times trying to get any solid advice or information catered to my needs from the counselors or financial aid advisers. HIGHLY recommend skipping Rio and go to another campus like Pinnacle or South Austin to discuss anything related to administration...Rio just does not have the space, and their people always give cookie cutter answers to your questions. In contrast, Pinnacle saved me a lot of money when I went to discuss my financial aid status with them, sat me down in an office and listened to my issues.

if your class is on the bottom floor, no matter the weather, have a sweater.

Oh, and (i hate to say this) but don't bother with the theatre plays unless you get some sort of extra credit. I love the arts, and even did some theatre back in highschool, but the department's shows are a never-ending face-palm every time I roll the dice and try and give them the benefit of the doubt.

name: Austin Community College - Rio Grande Campus
categories: Adult Education, Education, Colleges & Universities
text: I go to ACC. I don't have issues with it at all. The people that have issues with certain professors are kids (being kids). Professors are awesome, and I have a long list of professors that I keep in touch with even if I'm not taking one of their classes. I've never had issues with counselors or other staff.  Although, students just out of high school are irritating. Some campuses are better than others, due to students. It's all about the students. But you do meet students who are there for the purpose of learning. Most students there are single serving friends though.

name: Austin Community College - Rio Grande Campus
categories: Adult Education, Education, Colleges & Universities
text:
I woud give it 5 stars, but you will get NO help from the advisors. They tell you one thing but mean the other. No help at all. 
On the otherside, the classes are pretty nice, and I have yet to have a bad professor

name: Austin Community College - Rio Grande Campus
categories: Adult Education, Education, Colleges & Universities
text: Met with an advisor at Rio Grande Campus whom might arguably be the least helpful human being alive... Did not even know my selected degree plan existed, much less anything else about it, entered wrong major in system, tried to tell me I would need TSI when I am clearly exempt, couldn't tell me which of my previous courses from another college would transfer, and did not change me from applicant to student in the system so was still unable to register after meeting him, and meeting took well over an hour. Um, seriously?!  Spent 2 hours over next 4 days on the phone with various people to get everything corrected, and finally went to see an advisor at Pinnacle whom was just lovely- infinitely more helpful, knowledgable, and informative. If this is the campus of your choice, I highly recommend going elsewhere for at least the advisement portion.

name: Austin Community College - Rio Grande Campus
categories: Adult Education, Education, Colleges & Universities
text: The PARKING NEEDS TO BE FIXED YESTERDAY! There needs to be a second parking garage, this is absolutely ridiculous it takes me a minimum of 20 minutes (that's if I'm very lucky) to get parking.

name: Austin Community College - Rio Grande Campus
categories: Adult Education, Education, Colleges & Universities
text:
I'm a fan mostly because of the outstanding instructors I have had over the years here.  Plus after a zillion years of trying I finally got a college degree.  And with my age that's a BIG DEAL!  I love all the instructors I've have at ACC in general but the art people at the RIO GRANDE site are totally the best!  They make do on very little - need bigger and better facilities but manage to come out with the best additude and the strongest desire to teach me art!  I love the diversity, the people who teach and the people who are administrative staff and who are over worked and underpaid. Gretchen Harries, my speech instructor totally rocked!  And I love the art department (I cannot say that enough!)

The buildings are old, which is part charming and part frustrating - the parking sucks but the site has good links to public transport.  The students are diverse and that adds to the enjoyment of the classes!

Thank you for being a great Community College!

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: This place is the best kept secret!  Do NOT try to do this at the Post Office.  The people here are super helpful and I literally didn't even sit down.  A huge thanks to the workers here.  Everyone is friendly and they do it with a smile.

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: Passport services are on the 2nd floor. You can take the stairs just to the right of the main entrance to the International Office or take the elevator from inside. I arrived at 8:10am to have passport photos taken. I was out of there within 10 minutes with photos in hand. There were two families queued up for actual passport services. Since I just needed passport photos, the receptionist took the photo and processed my payment. There is a separate counter for processing passports and ESL services. Great experience!!

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: We needed passport renewals for our 13,11 year olds as well as a new passport for our 3 year old.  Came with everything filled out. We were a little worried since we were arriving at 3:20 (they close at 4) We were out of there in 45 min. They were kind and the service was great.  I would highly recommend.

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: Fantastic, friendly service. Everything was taken care of with a smile. Make sure to bring check/ money order to pay. We just happened to have a check book in us by chance! We can now look forward to our trip to Europe with our daughters:-)

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: The reviews are all legit.  There was parking that was easy to get to, folks were friendly and I was in and out in no time flat.  I love people who love their jobs and everyone here seems legitimately happy.  It's contagious.  Bring your necessary documents and a smile.  My biggest complaint?  I could have slept in more.  I did NOT need to show up first thing in the morning!!

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: This the the most painless passport experience I've ever had!  Having to renew passports for our kids every 5 years, we've been to different post offices and agencies. This is the first time we were able to get it done in under 20 minutes.  How did I not find out about this place sooner? The staff was friendly, organized, and very professional.  Highly recommended.

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: I needed to renew and change my name on my passport. Went to this office expecting to wait over an hour but was in and out in less than than 15 minutes. They were very organized and professional, great experience!

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: All the reviews are right. This is THE place to go for all passport services. My husband and I both renewed our passports and got a passport for our son in less than 30 minutes. We were in and out so fast that we didn't even have to pay for parking. We arrived with our DS-11 forms filled out, and that saved us some time. Still! I was stunned how easy it was!

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: Yep--awesome. 3 new passports, with pictures, including a minor, done within 45 minutes. Bonus: Somehow, the photos came out awesome. This from the family with chronic resting bitch face and child with manic over-smile tendencies. Go here--just make sure you have everything you need and that you get there early.

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: As amazing as everyone says. Arrived around 8:30, NO wait, super pleasant, helpful, knowledgeable staff. In and out in less than 30 min.

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: Wow! Fast, easy, friendly service to get new passports. As others have noted, the wait for the post office appointments was six weeks. We were in and out of the International Office in under 30 minutes. The staff was welcoming and put us at ease.

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: For passports, 300% better than the post office. After three futile attempts at different post offices, trying to get a passport for my daughter, walked into the University of Texas International Office passport section and was done in 20 minutes. The staff (especially Tom) were courteous, knowledgeable, and efficient. No idea why someone would go anywhere else. Two thumbs way up!! This just shows there can be ordered of magnitude difference between the best and worst implementation of services. It is a wonder the US post office still exists. The USPS is stunningly incompetent at handling passport applications.

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text:
I went here yesterday to get a passport.  Although, I really have nothing to compare the process to (as this was my first time getting a passport), the process was so quick and simple -- I was very relieved & impressed!  

I walked in and the friendly guy at the front desk immediately began to help me.  He went over all of the things I would need, I then gave him those things, he took my picture, then I waited maybe 7-8 minutes, paid him, signed my application and I was out of there!!  I don't think I was there longer than 15 minutes from the time I walked in the door to the time I left.

The only *slight* downside is that there isn't any parking right at the building (or at least I didn't see any).  There is plenty of street parking though and there is also a UT Parking garage across the street (No charge if you're there under 30 minutes, $3 if under an hour).  The garage is open to the public -- you just need to get a ticket when entering & make sure you pay @ a kiosk or at the office before leaving.

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: Absolutely the best experience if you are trying to get or renew your passport. The staff was super friendly and customer service was the best. Walk in without an appointment. There was no line and it process was super easy and well explained. The whole process to apply for passport took about 30 mins. That was filling out the form, taking pic and payments. Best place in Austin to do all your passport needs.

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: Skip the post office, go to The International Office at UT!  One stop for everything! They are fast and efficient! We applied for two passports and were done, start to finish, in less than 15 minutes.

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: Wow. Came to get my Passport photo and I was in and out within 10 mins. Tom was extremely helpful and helped my verify my application. He says it's a great place to work and I agree!! We need more Tom's in the world.

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text:
I went in and submitted my application on Tuesday, May 19th and got my new passport in the mail today, Friday, May 29th. 10 days. (It might've even come yesterday, but I didn't check my mailbox yesterday.)

This office was quick and easy. I had my paperwork filled out, they checked my ID, etc., someone took my photo for $10 (this saved me a trip to CVS or Walgreens, which typically charge $11 or $12 anyway), someone looked over my paperwork to make sure everything was accurate, I paid $184.85 by check to the U.S. Dept, and $35 by card to the office for processing and my picture.

I chose expedited processing AND overnight  shipping (even though I had a month until my trip, better safe than sorry). This ensured 2-3 delivery. I got it in LESS than 2 weeks (oh, and Monday was a federal holiday!)

When I went in, there were 3 people ahead of me. It was 45 minutes between walking in and walking out. Not bad for what I was expecting to be a bureaucratic hot mess.

TL;DR

Go here. Especially if you need it done well and done fast!

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: What a find!  They have excellent service  and the location is very convenient.  There is a parking garage attached and they will validate your parking ticket for you.  They are open to the general public, which is awesome.  They assist you with all the paperwork to apply for a new passport or for a renewal.  They also offer passport photo services.  I would highly recommend this place if you need a passport or need to renew.  I was in and out of there in 25 minutes tops!

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: Easiest passport process ever! I had a meeting at work at 1pm and came here at 10am hoping it would allow me enough time. I was in and out in less than 20 minutes. Go online before and fill out  your paperwork, make sure you have everything, and it's easy peasy. Super friendly staff to boot!

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: We were just about ready to make the dreaded trip to the post office to get our passports when I did a last minute search and found this slice of heaven.  You take your forms to them, they check them and then take your picture (you can take your own picture with you, but why bother).  You give them a money order or check for each passport, sign a few times and your done.  The total time from when we entered to when we left was 5 minutes.  Try that at any post office!  We did this on a Monday afternoon in July/2013, no-one in front of us and one guy came in just as we were leaving.  Just a note: they are moving to a new location Mid July 2013.  Their new location is at 2400 Nueces.

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: Soooo happy to stumble upon this gem - after going to the Airport Blvd. location to renew my kids' passports and seeing the stuffed room and over 2 hour wait time - I knew I had to find a better way... enter google, where I found these Yelp reviews and this wealth of information. The UT International office was amazing. Parking garage directly across the street (make sure you go to their Nueces location), super friendly staff and did I mention NO WAIT! Wow. Very thorough review of the applications, professional, same price as the gov. passport offices but without that miserable feeling wafting around the room. Great, great find! Thanks for hooking up the gen pop UT!

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: Have been through two passport application processes... This one blows them away.. had a line and still out in less than 45 minutes start to finish... including pictures.   Very fast and efficient!  Highly recommend this place.

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text:
Positive experience for passport renewal for myself & son. Staff friendly & helpful. 
Had horrible experience on govt airport location with rude, mean staff; have seen others have similar negative experiences at post offices. 
Will use the international office again in the future. Less stressful and way better place for passport needs. Highly recommend this place.

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: If you need to get your passport, this is the place to go. Went on a Friday, early afternoon, no wait, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I showed up with all my paperwork filled out, and my money orders (I recommend you do that as well). They were able to take my picture there, and get it sent off. I seriously spent maybe 15 minutes at most in the office. I had heard horror stories of the wait of getting a passport. So glad I decided to come to this place.

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text:
I highly recommend skipping the Post Office and coming here instead for your passport needs.  I walked right in with no appointment and was in and out in about 10 minutes.  Staff was friendly and office was neat and organized.

I originally looked up my local post office on Manchaca, and the web stated I need to call them for an appt.  I tried over the course of a week to call and schedule, trying at different times of the day, and they never ever picked up the phone.  Finally I drove there and waited in line 20 minutes to make an appt for the following day.  The next day I arrived for my appt, and after waiting 10 minutes past my scheduled time,  I was told I was missing page 2 of the application.  I asked if I could just fill out page 2 really quickly (which would have taken about 90 seconds to fill out)  and was informed that they were out of page 2 and didn't have any more copies.  Really?  So I asked when I could come back, and the next available appt was more than 5 days later.  Hey, how about going to the website, Post Office, and printing off some extra forms?  Anyway, that same day I just drove down to the office at UT and was in and done super fast.  You suck, Post Office.

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: I am glad I went here instead of the post office. Short line, kind and helpful staff, organized and nicely decorated place. Great service to the community from UT.

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: SSSSSHHHHHH! Fantastic! The online notice for the county office said 300+ minutes wait. I needed to renew the passports for my 3 kids, two of them are minors, so on this no-school day, coordinated with my husband to take time off of work to go with us, and was in and out in about 20 mins. I had filled out and printed my forms before hand. While my dh took the other kids back home, I waited to meet my 18 yo son, and back up we went, it had gotten busier by then, but still just 30 mins and back on the street. All set! Nice peeps, very small, but pleasant and organized. What a relief!

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text:
Wow!
Parking? Perfect!
Customer service? Unequaled anywhere!
Great staff. Down to business. Very helpful and professional. I was in and out in 15 minutes!
Thank you so much !

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: Friendly staff.  Walk-in service.  Went in to get passport photos and had them back within 10 minutes.   Free parking across the street if you are 30 minutes or less.

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: We showed up at 8:20 and left at 8:45.. Got two passports done one for me and one for my boyfriend! This experience was quick, easy and painless! The people working there were also really nice and friendly!

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: Wonderfully efficient and yet laid back. Highly recommended. They will point you to a nearby store where you can get a money order made to pay your State Dept. fees and they will take a credit card for their own modest service fee. I was done in a jiffy and the SD was very quick after that. Just park in the UT parking garage around the corner. I was done in less than 30 minutes so the garage did not even charge me.

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: We had a very good experience at the International Office. John came outside his counter to check our forms and collect documents as we had our baby with us.  We did not have to wait even for a minute. Everything was processed on the spot and then we were called to sign the forms. I strongly recommend going there.

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: We went to our local post office and they said we had to get there at 7:30 am to sign up to "maybe" get an appointment. Our friend had just told us about this place and said they were fast. So we drove 30 minutes south to get here. They have a parking lot right across the street so that was easy. As soon as we got in, it was super fast and easy. I had already looked up on the website what I needed so it went smooth. Just had to go get a money order from the bank. Luckily I'm with Wells Fargo and there was one up the block. After we went back the process was easy and painless.  They even do your photos for $12.  Turnover time is pretty fast as well. They did amazing and the customer service was great!

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: In and out in less than 30. Totally nice and patient for a spacey lady first thing in the morning. Filling applications beforehand is the best way to go, but you can do it at the office also

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: Lisa is awesome... Her favorite color is blue n loves long walks on the beach preferably in Hawaii!! Jk, not kidding the experience here was great!! I suggest to anyone.. No line if you get here early.. N I smiled for my photo!! A good photo at that!! Thanks again Lisa!!

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: So glad I found this place on YELP! I tried to call the post office to set up an appointment and got forwarded to all the wrong people. I went to the international office today and was in and out in literally 15 minutes. I had my paperwork already filled out so I believe that helped! I got my picture taken there and I am a very happy customer! This was my first time getting my passport but they took care of everything!

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text:
I don't know what everyone is talking about here.

I drove down there and this place is SLOW and clueless.  Worse than Post Office.

Took FOREVER just to get a ticket and they had ONE person working the counter.  You have people in there with 3-4 little screaming brats running around and it's a nightmare.  30 minutes later I said screw this place.  

Would NOT recommend this place at all.

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: Got my daughter's passport in about 10 minutes with no appointment. Staff are friendly and helpful. They even take passport photos on-site. Was considering paying for it to be expedited, since the trip was spur-of-the moment, but they advised against it. It was January, and they said it should only take a few weeks that time of year. Sure enough, it arrived 7 days later.

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text:
This place may be perfectly fine for US passport applications, but they are clueless when it comes to conforming to the requirements of other governments.  I came here for British passport photos.  I brought with me the guidelines for the photographs and provided it to the staff.  

They use what looks like a decent enough camera but they have you stand in front of a bare column as the backdrop for your photos rather than a proper screen.  They presented the photo they were going to use and, deferring to their "expertise" I simply observed that I wasn't smiling, that my eyes were not shut and it wasn't blurry and gave it the "OK."  

The photos they made did not contain my upper shoulders, per the guidelines (again that I provided).  I had them redo the photographs, and, upon closer inspection, the photos they were taking contained noticeable shadows under my ears.  Per the guidelines (again that I provided) the photos cannot have shadows.  They were never able to address this issue.  Additionally, the final product was not cut to square so they were jagged and irregularly shaped.  Per the guidelines (again that I provided) the photos cannot appear to have been cut down from a larger photograph.  The photos they produced did not inspire confidence in meeting this requirement.  

If you have foreign needs, be sure to bring the guidelines and thoroughly review them because the staff here cannot be bothered to review them and will place the burden on you to make sure they are meeting the guidelines.  

In the end I didn't feel comfortable using their photos, so I went to a different place who did a brilliant job perfectly on the first try without my tutelage.

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text:
The way to go! Super time efficient & amazing people.
Hassle free! We took the entire fam and we walked out within 15 minutes. They take passport pictures too!

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: Awesome experience today! No wait and great employees. While we had self inflicted issues with our paperwork and NOT having a check or money order which is necessary to get a passport, they gave us options and quick solutions to fix our problems. Great experience!

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: This is the third time my family has gone to this office to obtain a passport.  This office is fantastic!  So much easier than the BS at the post office.  The staff is professional, efficient and polite.

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: This location is fantastic! Absolutely no wait early in the morning! We drove from Round Rock, just to get  our daughter her passport! This is after going to 3 post offices letting us know to get there early and "attempt" for an appt slot. No thank you, will absolutely come here for hassle free service!   Parked across the street in the San Antonio parking garage. First 30 mins free! We were in and out in 20 minutes! Thank you staff! They even gave my daughter a monkey to play with in the meantime!

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: I was so impressed with their great service! I went to get my passport and was very surprised to see there was no wait!!!  Everyone that works there is so kind and helpful.  Thank you for making it an easy experience!!!

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: Come prepared and you're in and out in less than 20 minutes.  Not sure what the negative reviews are about..  perhaps some staff was on lunch?..  just went today and super fast and friendly for my 4 month olds passport.  Took 12 mins in and out :).  Definitely recommend!!

name: Texas Global Passport Services
categories: Colleges & Universities, Education, Hotels & Travel, Public Services & Government, Passport & Visa Services, Travel Services
text: This is the best passport office ever! No stuffy, crabby government employees to be seen; this place is staffed by UT students with youthful enthusiasm. I was waited on quickly and taken through the passport process in only 20 minutes, with photos included. I have been here when it is busier, but the service is still friendly and efficient. Office decorations a plus!

name: Shirley's Tape And Shears
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'False', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False'}
categories: Local Services, Sewing & Alterations
text: This place is amazing! Judy is very efficient, is  an expert tailor, and communication on what I wanted done to the dress I had and when appointments were was spot on.  I had a difficult dress that had to be taken up and she knew exactly what to do, not only that she gave some of her own ideas for the piece (like pinning the underskirt so it was more full) which was super helpful! The prices are very reasonable as well.

name: Shirley's Tape And Shears
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'False', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False'}
categories: Local Services, Sewing & Alterations
text: If you need alterations, LOOK NO FURTHER! Judy really makes you feel at home and is probably the sweetest lady I've met in Vancouver since moving here. I needed my blankie of almost 17 years to be stitched back together and she even let me stay there and watch since I was so paranoid about handing it over and leaving. She told me stories about the shop and her life, it really made me feel so at ease when she was working on it and it only costed us whatever we could afford, she initially was going to do it for free but needed gas money so had to charge. I wasn't even expecting it to be free and her just saying that blew my mind so we paid her 12 dollars and made sure she didn't need more since she was such a nice lady. Please don't go anywhere else for alterations, this is an old local business that really deserves more clients.

name: Shirley's Tape And Shears
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'False', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False'}
categories: Local Services, Sewing & Alterations
text: Excellent service and super fast turnaround time. Even took me in without an appointment. Thanks so much!!!!

name: Shirley's Tape And Shears
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'False', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False'}
categories: Local Services, Sewing & Alterations
text: I called Judy from Alaska telling her I needed my wedding dress altered quite a bit as I purchased a dress that was way too big off the shelf.  She agreed to meet with me early in the morning on my way to work in Angola, Africa with the agreement that I would only be in Vancouver for 5 days when I arrived back from Angola.  She was very good about returning my messages even when overseas. Judy got all the alterations I needed complete prior to flying to Montana for my wedding. There was quite a bit of work to get done and she was kind enough to suggest some other nice add on's to make the dress a one of a kind.  Even the bustle stayed put the entire wedding day/night.  I was surprised that she did not charge more for all the work she did.  I will go back to her if needed.

name: Shirley's Tape And Shears
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'False', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False'}
categories: Local Services, Sewing & Alterations
text: Very lucky I was able to work with Judy, she is an absolute expert in this industry.  I had a difficult job and she was not afraid to try.  Extremely reasonable pricing, timely, friendly, and even gave me some fishing recommendations.  She has/currently works with some big name outdoor athletes on perfecting current and old outdoor clothing designs.  Have a jacket you wish had a pocket or feature that didn't come from the factory?  No problem, take it to Judy.  Will be going to her from now on!

name: The Golden Dog
categories: Pet Groomers, Pets, Pet Services
text: Brought our tiny 4lb yorkie for a much needed grooming last week and the groomer did a great job with her. It took about 4 hours because there was only one person working because of the snow storm, but we didn't care, basically free dog sitting . Will definitely come back for future grooming.

name: Ocean King Market
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BikeParking': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2'}
categories: Food, Seafood Markets, International Grocery, Specialty Food, Ethnic Food
text:
I was very pleased with Ocean King.  We stopped in today for the first time to check it out, since I am trying to learn my way around my new hometown Vancouver.   They have live crabs, clams, shrimps and lobster, and what looked like tilapia all swimming in tanks!  We didn't get any seafood (just had a crab feast and have salmon in the fridge).  But it looks like a great resource, the prices were very reasonable and live is the way to go with seafood.  

The veggie section, while small, was full of fresh good-looking produce.  I picked up some beautiful, absolutely perfect bean sprouts, bitter melon ($1.99/lb, not bad!), a huge and juicy ginger root, basil and mint.   They also stock Bui tofu puffs, which are a local product from Portland, so I got a package of these as well.  Bitter melon and tofu soup for dinner tonight!  Glad I checked Ocean King Market out, it's going to be on the regular grocery rotation I think.

name: Ocean King Market
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BikeParking': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2'}
categories: Food, Seafood Markets, International Grocery, Specialty Food, Ethnic Food
text: Stopped in there today after reading reviews on Yelp.  I ended up buying live steamer clams and scallops. Brought them home and am now sitting here a very full happy camper.  Nice selection of items.  Whenever I'm in Vancouver I'll be shopping here again.  Turned my parents on to it too.

name: Ocean King Market
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BikeParking': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2'}
categories: Food, Seafood Markets, International Grocery, Specialty Food, Ethnic Food
text: It is wonderful to have a live seafood market in Vancouver and not having to travel to Portland to buy.  We have purchased crab here several times and have been delighted.  I would recommend this market to anyone who loves fresh seafood and is willing to cook it themselves.  I am anxious to try their live lobster as well.  Their prices are extremely reasonable, much cheaper than the large chain stores or seafood markets at the coast.  Go figure.

name: Ocean King Market
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BikeParking': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2'}
categories: Food, Seafood Markets, International Grocery, Specialty Food, Ethnic Food
text:
Once again I have come here, this is my favorite seafood market :-) today my husband and I bought 25 lbs of Manila Clams ( they gave us a discount for buying a 25 lb bag ) we bought 2 dozen oysters, and 1 lb of LIVE shrimp, some green onion, and a ginger root.
   Oh yeah starting this labor day off right, its a seafood feast to go with the Halibut, Salmon, and Swordfish I bought in Seattle :-)
   I love the Ocean King Market, the people are super nice and very helpful, I was kind of leary about buying live shrimp because I've never cooked them before, but the woman there told me how to make them so I am really amped to give this a try. You cannot go wrong coming here their prices are very fair :-)

name: Ocean King Market
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'BikeParking': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2'}
categories: Food, Seafood Markets, International Grocery, Specialty Food, Ethnic Food
text:
They sell live dungeness crab which is my most favorite thing in the world, and a lot of yummy Asian groceries. Sadly, they don't sell plain tapicoa pearls (only the pre-flavored, instant cook kind). 

I got seafood flavored seaweed snacks. Nomnomnom.

text:
The food was very bland for Indian cuisine, watery and undercooked.
The variety was disappointing compared to other basic Indian restaurants.
The ambiance was pretty basic...nothing special about it. 
I even found a long women's hair in my rice dish! 
And the price was higher than any other Indian restaurant in town for food quality significantly lower than the competition. This was my first and last time here.

text: This place ran down and there are no paper towels and gas is a bit on the high side. Do not use you credit card outside I did once and a month later I had 700 dollars in charges. Other than that good mart.

name: US Post Office
categories: Local Services, Shipping Centers, Public Services & Government, Post Offices
text: This post office is always busy and the staff seems unhappy and there is hardly every parking here.  I get mail that belongs to other people all the time and have had my forwarding address messed up with other family members that don't live with me and live in a completely other state.  I'm not blaming all of this on this one location, I'm just saying I've have had hassle every time I have had to deal with something.  Next time you make it through the line there, be sure to tell your local postal worker to smile because smiles are contagious.

name: US Post Office
categories: Local Services, Shipping Centers, Public Services & Government, Post Offices
text: There are too many people in the world who need jobs for people like who I just encountered to still be employed. I get that it's a government facility. But there's better people out there. Kelly, find your calling and put in your resignation for USPS. You ruined my mood today. Unhelpful. Condescending. Rude. Just because you say the same thing 60 times a day doesn't mean I know what you're talking about. I'll find my next nearest USPS or just use another company as often as possible. Bye!

name: US Post Office
categories: Local Services, Shipping Centers, Public Services & Government, Post Offices
text:
My PO Box is here.

They're friendly to me, at least, and they don't put the wrong mail in my box. Yeah, they could use another automated mailing machine thingy, and the parking lot is wack, but what post office has a GOOD parking lot?

They also have a decent range of spoken languages and one ASL-competent employee. 

So, yeah, as good as a PO can be. It's like the dentist...necessary evil.

name: Master Eye Associates
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '3', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'False'}
categories: Shopping, Optometrists, Laser Eye Surgery/Lasik, Eyewear & Opticians, Health & Medical
text: Dr Stine is ok, but the front desk staff is less than helpful. They had not verified my insurance in the week between my making the appointment and the actual appointment. After we had checked in, I was notified that my insurance had changed and would no longer cover near as much as it had in the past. Staff was not helpful at all when I told her I had other insurance as well. I cancelled my appointment and will not be going back. They are also not very good with children, I'm not confident that my child understood the questions that were being asked or that her prescription is right because of the way (or lack thereof) that the communicated with her.
